Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Join Marveltest as a Data Analyst!¬†




About Us:¬†At Marveltest, we‚Äôre at the forefront of data-driven business solutions. Our mission is to help businesses unlock the power of their data to drive growth and efficiency. As we continue to expand, we‚Äôre looking for a talented and motivated Data Analyst to join our dynamic team. If you‚Äôre passionate about data and love turning numbers into actionable insights, we want to hear from you!We‚Äôre looking for a Medior Data Analyst to join our team and help our clients reach the next digital level. You‚Äôll be working with our Data Analysts, Growth Marketers, Client Managers, and Data-driven Designers to build data related products and services such as Data Warehousing and Pixel Tracking TechnologyYour Role:¬†As a Medior Data Analyst at Marveltest, you‚Äôll be a key player in transforming complex data into valuable business insights. Your responsibilities will include:




Data Warehousing:¬†Manage data warehouses, focusing on data quality and validity.
Tableau Workbooks:¬†Create and update Tableau dashboards, implementing changes based on internal and external requests.
Analytical Structures:¬†Collaborate on designing modular and reusable analysis structures in Tableau.
Ad hoc Analyses:¬†Conduct tailored analyses to answer business questions from both internal and external stakeholders.
Client Communication:¬†Work closely with internal teams and clients to understand their data requirements and provide insights through dashboards and analyses.
Documentation:¬†Maintain organized records of your analyses, ensuring they are accessible for future reference.




Collaboration within the Data Team:¬†You‚Äôll work closely with:

Business Analyst:¬†Fine-tune business analyses to meet client needs.
Data Science/Engineering:¬†Ensure seamless data flow from BigQuery to Tableau, troubleshoot issues, and improve data structure and quality.




Required Skillset:

Python:¬†Proficient in using Python for data analysis and automation.
Excel:¬†Comfortable with Excel, particularly for data manipulation and reporting.
Tableau (Advanced):¬†1+ years of experience with Tableau or a similar data visualization tool.
SQL:¬†Strong SQL skills, with experience navigating Google BigQuery or other cloud data warehouses.
Business Acumen:¬†Ability to connect data insights with business objectives, making recommendations that drive value.
Knowledge about online marketing metrics and business performance metrics.




Nice-to-Have Skills:

Data Simplification:¬†Ability to explain complex analyses to non-data-savvy stakeholders.
Proactive Mindset:¬†Eager to take initiative in a fast-paced startup environment.
Client Communication:¬†Willingness to participate in client meetings and explain data insights clearly.




What do I get in return?¬†

Above market salary: we believe your superpowers should be well compensated.
A culture where growth, freedom, and innovation are key.
Working in an ambitious but close team: together we pull out all the stops when duty calls, but as it goes with superheroes, in real life we‚Äôre just a bunch of normal people who like to have a lot of fun together.
Help build the company: together we are always busy creating and testing new business frameworks, processes, and products.
The chance to be part of a fast-growing scale-up where you make a real impact on all clients.
The ability to work from our office in the center of Amsterdam, but also the flexibility to work from the comfort of your own home.
Bi-monthly team bonding events, weekly drinks, and daily get-togethers during (by Marveltest provided) lunch.
Your personal development is important! We have a personal budget for YOUR development.
An employee benefit to spend freely each month on a wide range of treats, powered by YourCampus.
26 paid holidays a year.
A MacBook Pro M-Chip laptop
Show more
HTML:
Join Marveltest as a Data Analyst! 


About Us: At Marveltest, we‚Äôre at the forefront of data-driven business solutions. Our mission is to help businesses unlock the power of their data to drive growth and efficiency. As we continue to expand, we‚Äôre looking for a talented and motivated Data Analyst to join our dynamic team. If you‚Äôre passionate about data and love turning numbers into actionable insights, we want to hear from you!We‚Äôre looking for a Medior Data Analyst to join our team and help our clients reach the next digital level. You‚Äôll be working with our Data Analysts, Growth Marketers, Client Managers, and Data-driven Designers to build data related products and services such as Data Warehousing and Pixel Tracking TechnologyYour Role: As a Medior Data Analyst at Marveltest, you‚Äôll be a key player in transforming complex data into valuable business insights. Your responsibilities will include:


  • Data Warehousing: Manage data warehouses, focusing on data quality and validity.
  • Tableau Workbooks: Create and update Tableau dashboards, implementing changes based on internal and external requests.
  • Analytical Structures: Collaborate on designing modular and reusable analysis structures in Tableau.
  • Ad hoc Analyses: Conduct tailored analyses to answer business questions from both internal and external stakeholders.
  • Client Communication: Work closely with internal teams and clients to understand their data requirements and provide insights through dashboards and analyses.
  • Documentation: Maintain organized records of your analyses, ensuring they are accessible for future reference.


Collaboration within the Data Team: You‚Äôll work closely with:

  • Business Analyst: Fine-tune business analyses to meet client needs.
  • Data Science/Engineering: Ensure seamless data flow from BigQuery to Tableau, troubleshoot issues, and improve data structure and quality.


Required Skillset:

  • Python: Proficient in using Python for data analysis and automation.
  • Excel: Comfortable with Excel, particularly for data manipulation and reporting.
  • Tableau (Advanced): 1+ years of experience with Tableau or a similar data visualization tool.
  • SQL: Strong SQL skills, with experience navigating Google BigQuery or other cloud data warehouses.
  • Business Acumen: Ability to connect data insights with business objectives, making recommendations that drive value.
  • Knowledge about online marketing metrics and business performance metrics.


Nice-to-Have Skills:

  • Data Simplification: Ability to explain complex analyses to non-data-savvy stakeholders.
  • Proactive Mindset: Eager to take initiative in a fast-paced startup environment.
  • Client Communication: Willingness to participate in client meetings and explain data insights clearly.


What do I get in return? 

  • Above market salary: we believe your superpowers should be well compensated.
  • A culture where growth, freedom, and innovation are key.
  • Working in an ambitious but close team: together we pull out all the stops when duty calls, but as it goes with superheroes, in real life we‚Äôre just a bunch of normal people who like to have a lot of fun together.
  • Help build the company: together we are always busy creating and testing new business frameworks, processes, and products.
  • The chance to be part of a fast-growing scale-up where you make a real impact on all clients.
  • The ability to work from our office in the center of Amsterdam, but also the flexibility to work from the comfort of your own home.
  • Bi-monthly team bonding events, weekly drinks, and daily get-togethers during (by Marveltest provided) lunch.
  • Your personal development is important! We have a personal budget for YOUR development.
  • An employee benefit to spend freely each month on a wide range of treats, powered by YourCampus.
  • 26 paid holidays a year.
  • A MacBook Pro M-Chip laptop

Title: Data Analyst (Freelance)
Description:
About the role:

As a Data Analyst, you will have the exciting opportunity to collaborate closely with our dynamic teams and working on multiple tasks. You will play an important role in creating engaging and insightful data visualizations using Tableau, using advanced data analysis and modelling techniques to find valuable trends and patterns within our datasets. Your involvement in developing and maintaining data models, reports, and workflows will be crucial to our success. Furthermore, you will actively engage with various business units, gaining a deep understanding of their unique needs and creating customized dashboards and solutions to meet and exceed their expectations.




About the project:

Duration: 2-3 months

The project contains 2 parts of development:

The backend (data warehouse ) using the in-house data centre to develop a solution from data collocation to structured database (in storge ) ,
The frontend (visualisation ) : using the structured database in storge with the Tableau we cerate advance models flows in addition to build the dashboard visualizations.




What are the expectations/requirements?

You are already based in the Netherlands

Re-creation of existing dashboard and visualizations from PowerBI to tableau.

Creating data models from database using tableau Prep for visualizations

Creating new deep dives upon request

Interacting with multiple stakeholders to understand their requirements and implementing them in their dashboards

Gaid and support the stakeholders to understand and unlock the potential dashboard

Creating appealing dashboards and visualization, knowledge of UXUI would be nice




Key Responsibilities:

Collaborate with the data solutions team to design, develop, and implement data-driven solutions
Create interactive and insightful data visualizations using Tableau
Perform complex data analysis and modelling to uncover trends, patterns, and insights using Tableau prep and SQL.
Assist in the development and maintenance of data pipelines and workflows
Discuss with business units (clients) to understand their needs and create dashboards tailored to their expectations
Contribute to the documentation of processes, methodologies, and best practices
Participate in team meetings, brainstorming sessions, and project planning activities




Want to know more about us?

We are serving the Swiss market as Switzerland‚Äôs leading IT & Telecom company. Thus, we are actively driving digitalization and networking, and tapping new paths for our customers and our employees. We do not know what the future is going to look like, but we definitely have the opportunity to shape it. To do so we are and act trustworthy, committed and curious.

Since 2019, we have been building up the coolest DevOps Center with a wonderful office at the World Trade Center in the heart of Rotterdam. We are currently recruiting IT passionate professionals who are keen on developing high-quality software, have an agile mindset and appreciate collaboration with motivated colleagues from all over the world.

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
About Us
Founded in 1999 and listed on NASDAQ in 2003 and HKEX in 2021, Trip.com Group is a leading global travel service provider comprising of Trip.com, Ctrip, Skyscanner, and Qunar.

Across its platforms, Trip.com Group integrates travel resources from industry partners and helps travellers worldwide pursue the perfect trip with exceptional travel products and services.

We have four Customer Service Centres for Trip.com established in Japan, Korea, the UK, and the Philippines, providing 24/7 customer service in 19 different languages.

We have more than 30,000 employees scattered across 30 countries in Asia, Europe, the Americas, and Oceania, striving to expand our global markets and aiming to be the world‚Äôs leading and most trusted family of online travel brands that aspire to deliver the perfect trip at the best price for every traveller.

The Role:
As a Junior Data Analyst on our Partnerships and Affiliate Marketing team, you will play a critical role in supporting the success of our affiliate programs and partnerships. We are looking for someone who takes initiative, actively seeks out opportunities for improvement, and is eager to contribute to our team‚Äôs success.

In this Role, your responsibilities will include:

* Monitor and Analyze Performance: Track key performance indicators (KPIs) across various channels, identifying trends, and communicating to the team any anomalies, and opportunities for optimization.
* Generate Insights for Campaign Optimization: Assist in analyzing data to provide insights that help improve campaign performance, ROI, and overall marketing effectiveness.
* Develop and Maintain Dashboards: Contribute to the creation and maintenance of dashboards that provide real-time insights into program performance, making it easy for stakeholders to understand key metrics and trends.
* Support Partnership Strategies: Work with business developers and learn about the effectiveness of different partnerships, contributing data-driven recommendations for future collaborations.
* Take Initiative in Problem-Solving: Proactively identify issues or opportunities for optimization and develop strategies that improve overall performance.
* Collaborate Internationally: Work alongside marketing teams based in Shanghai and other global locations, ensuring that efforts align with broader marketing strategies and global business goals.
* Assist in Conducting Experiments: Support the design and analysis of experiments to test new strategies, creatives, or partnership models, contributing to data-driven decisions.

What you'll Need to Succeed:

* Strong Analytical Skills: Ability to interpret data, identify trends, and provide actionable insights.
* Communication Skills: Ability to translate data findings into clear, actionable insights for both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
* Basic SQL Knowledge: Familiarity with SQL for querying and managing datasets is preferred, with a willingness to develop these skills further.
* Experience with Data Analysis Tools: Strong skills in Excel or Google Sheets, including functions, data manipulation, and pivot tables. Experience with tools like Python, R, or BigQuery is a plus, offering opportunities to engage in more complex data analysis and automation.
* Basic Data Visualization Experience: Familiarity with tools like Tableau, Power BI, or similar for creating dashboards and visual reports, with opportunities to develop proficiency.
* Interest in Partnerships and Affiliates: A strong curiosity and willingness to learn about affiliate marketing and partnership strategies, and how different factors affect our KPIs.
* Proactive, Collaborative, and Solution-Oriented: A self-starter who takes initiative in identifying opportunities for improvement and optimization. You enjoy developing solutions and contributing to projects, while also working collaboratively with cross-functional teams across different regions to achieve shared goals.

Why Trip.com Group
We offer a stage to unleash your full potential and drive global impact. As an international team, we embrace an open and inclusive culture that supports and respect team members in and out of the workplace. Everyone is on a trip, whether it's a career trip or a life trip. At Trip.com Group, you can define your own trip by setting a goal and celebrate your success by recognizing the progress you have made.
What‚Äôs more?

* Our rapid business growth in global offers abundant career opportunities at various levels and in multiple functions

* Internal transfer is encouraged, and global job rotation program enable you to pursue a global career path and make global impact

* We provide learning opportunities to further your career in areas of leadership capability, soft skill and professional expertise.

* We encourage flexible work arrangement

* Have fun with company-sponsored greetings and activities at holidays, birthdays, and colorful team events.

Click[1] the link to learn more about What makes Trip.com Group a leading global travel service provider?

Click [2] the link to learn more about This is a Trip Where Both Your Career and Life Can Flourish!

Find out more job opportunities at https://careers.trip.com

Have a good trip, and see you soon!


References

Visible links
1. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=w4D31J3atps
2. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KQSUxvFTyqM

Title: Data Analist
Description:
Data-analist




Ready to break boundaries in the analytical world? Accelerate your further Analytics engineering career with our advanced training program while working for our partner organization. We fully pay this program as well as your salary.




‚úÖ Help a data driven team and their business by developing data-driven business solutions

‚úÖ Working on the data modelling and creating relevant data sets and dashboard

‚úÖ Build data pipelines to facilitate reporting

‚úÖ Improving and automating data flows and processes




The role itself

¬∑ 2 fulltime weeks of hands-on bootcamp training where you‚Äôll focus on writing deployable code, containerization, Analytics engineering & data engineering fundamentals

¬∑ Work 4 days a week as an Analytics engineer at one of our clients

¬∑ Join us every Wednesday at the Xccelerated office in Amsterdam. Here you will get ongoing training and project support from our technical leads

¬∑ At the end of your first year, you get the opportunity to join the partner organization directly




As an Analytics engineer you will work together with Data engineer & BI developers, whereby you will contribute on developing data-driven business solutions. You will do this in the form of machine learning models, strategic analyses and a self-service data model.

A big focus of your role will be data modelling and creating relevant data sets and dashboards. You will also be the one that transforms raw data to structured data files. To achieve this, you will build data pipelines to fully automate the availability of data for reporting.




About Xccelerated

Xccelerated is an initiative within the Xebia Group, accelerating growth of Data, Cloud & AI competence. Our 13-month advanced training programs integrate hands-on learning and skill development with working at one of our partner companies. It is an intense learning journey for who have proven their potential and are ready for the next step in their career.

Are you one of them? Join our dream team of 45 great people. Each member of our team brings a unique specialty and passion to our shared mission: eliminate the shortage of highly skilled Data & AI professionals. To achieve our goal, we empower each other to reach their full potential and inspire others to do the same.




This is you

From a personal perspective, you are customer focused and have a strong can-do mentality.

We are looking for a communicatively strong and enthusiastic colleague with a passion for data. Next to this, you have:

‚úÖ A bachelor‚Äôs or master‚Äôs degree

‚úÖ 1-4 years of work experience as an Analytics engineer/BI Developer/Data analyst

‚úÖ Experience with data modelling, dashboarding and visualization (PowerBI)

‚úÖ Experience with SQL; preferably also Python

‚úÖ Experience with Cloud components




What Xccelerated offers




üí∞ Good salary

üõ´ 25 vacation days

üìô Kick off with 2 full-time weeks of hands-on bootcamp training

üìä Technical trainings & Innovation days for a full year (every week)

‚úÖ Challenging assignments

üíª Macbook and Iphone

üçé Lunches, amazing coffee and snack bar

üéíFlexibility in working from home & at the office

Interested? We‚Äôd love to meet you!




Please get in touch! Contact Jessie Loogman at jloogman@xccelerated.io or by phone at +31650999663.




Application Process

¬∑ First interview with one of our recruitment consultants

¬∑ Making a technical assessment (from home) you will present to one of or Tech Leads (home/on remote)

**We aim to complete an application process (from application to offer) within 1-3 weeks. As you will understand, this also depends on your own availability.

Title: Reporting Data Analyst
Description:
About The Role

We are seeking a dedicated and detail-oriented Reporting Data Analyst to join our dynamic team. You will be responsible for collecting, cleaning, checking, and transforming data from various sources, maintaining data pipelines for automated reporting, and ensuring the timely and consistent delivery of accurate reports. You will collaborate with stakeholders across the data organization, business, and finance sides to meet reporting needs and enhance data-driven decision-making processes.

The Impact You‚Äôll Make


Collect, clean, check, and transform data from various sources to ensure data integrity and accuracy.
Maintain data pipelines for automated reporting, ensuring seamless data flow and integration.
Maintain accurate monthly reporting schedules to ensure timely and consistent report generation and delivery to stakeholders.
Collaborate with a wide range of stakeholders in the data organization, business, and finance teams to understand reporting requirements and deliver insights.
Design, develop, and optimize reports to support business needs and provide actionable insights.
Monitor and troubleshoot data quality issues, implementing corrective measures to ensure high data standards.
Assist in the development and maintenance of documentation for data processes, pipelines, and reporting standards.
Perform data analysis to identify trends, patterns, and insights to support business decision-making.
Ensure compliance with data governance and security policies.
Continuously seek opportunities to improve reporting processes and tools, leveraging best practices and industry standards.


The Skills And Knowledge You‚Äôll Bring


Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Business, Statistics, or economics related field.
2-4 years of experience in data analysis, reporting, project management or a related role.
Proficiency with data visualization tools (Power BI, Quick Sight, SAC).
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with attention to detail.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively with stakeholders at all levels.
Highly organized, with the ability to manage multiple tasks and projects simultaneously.
Knowledge of data governance and data security principles.
Ability to adapt to a fast-paced, dynamic work environment and embrace continuous learning.


What We Offer


Internationally competitive base salary | benchmarked against global industry and market leaders
Performance-based Annual Incentive Program | rewarding those who dare and achieve more
Top of the market pension scheme | with higher-than-average company contributions
Work from home, commuting and phone allowances | to support your daily commute, home office setup & business connectivity
Hybrid working model | effectively combining working from the office & home, depending on team dynamics and personal needs
Working from abroad | for up to 30 days per year, supporting our many international colleagues as well as travel enthusiasts
Extensive holiday package | additional care and development days, extensive maternity / paternity leave & possibility to purchase days
Bicycle Plan | possibility to select a company bicycle for daily commute along with accessories & insurance
Health Insurance Discount | when signing up with our partner insurance
Gym Membership Discount | to support your focus on health and wellbeing
Product Discounts | on all Versuni products which are sold under the Philips brand and our other brands
An office that feels like home | easily accessible and modern office location in Amsterdam with lots of tasty lunch choices around
High growth environment | offering exciting learning and career development perspectives beyond your first role
Inclusive working culture and family spirit | we embrace our international community & diversity as competitive advantage


About Us

Versuni designs, manufactures and sells market leading products under the well-known brands Philips, Saeco, Gaggia, Preethi, Philips Walita, L'OR Barista and Senseo. We do this with the simple yet powerful purpose of turning houses into homes.

We are proud of the products we make. As a leading player in domestic appliances, we offer sustainable products across kitchen appliances, coffee, air, garment, and home care. Our company is headquartered in The Netherlands, and has innovation, manufacturing, and commercial centers across the globe, with presence in over 100 countries. We employ 7,000 talented people who bring innovation to our customers.

We create a great place to work for those who share our passion, with high-performing teams as diverse as the homes we care for. We have big plans for 2024 and beyond, further driving innovation and growth within our global markets. What we need to achieve this are like-minded individuals who are determined to take their careers to the next level.

We have been 100% carbon neutral in our operations since 2020, but this is just the start of our plan. We know everything we use today will affect the planet tomorrow. For the past century, we've innovated to make products faster, better, and more energy efficient. A better future is possible with a plan that‚Äôs built to last.

We have been 100% carbon neutral in our operations since 2020, but this is just the start of our plan. We know everything we use today.

HTML:
About The Role

We are seeking a dedicated and detail-oriented Reporting Data Analyst to join our dynamic team. You will be responsible for collecting, cleaning, checking, and transforming data from various sources, maintaining data pipelines for automated reporting, and ensuring the timely and consistent delivery of accurate reports. You will collaborate with stakeholders across the data organization, business, and finance sides to meet reporting needs and enhance data-driven decision-making processes.

The Impact You‚Äôll Make

  • Collect, clean, check, and transform data from various sources to ensure data integrity and accuracy.
  • Maintain data pipelines for automated reporting, ensuring seamless data flow and integration.
  • Maintain accurate monthly reporting schedules to ensure timely and consistent report generation and delivery to stakeholders.
  • Collaborate with a wide range of stakeholders in the data organization, business, and finance teams to understand reporting requirements and deliver insights.
  • Design, develop, and optimize reports to support business needs and provide actionable insights.
  • Monitor and troubleshoot data quality issues, implementing corrective measures to ensure high data standards.
  • Assist in the development and maintenance of documentation for data processes, pipelines, and reporting standards.
  • Perform data analysis to identify trends, patterns, and insights to support business decision-making.
  • Ensure compliance with data governance and security policies.
  • Continuously seek opportunities to improve reporting processes and tools, leveraging best practices and industry standards.

The Skills And Knowledge You‚Äôll Bring

  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Business, Statistics, or economics related field.
  • 2-4 years of experience in data analysis, reporting, project management or a related role.
  • Proficiency with data visualization tools (Power BI, Quick Sight, SAC).
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with attention to detail.
  • Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively with stakeholders at all levels.
  • Highly organized, with the ability to manage multiple tasks and projects simultaneously.
  • Knowledge of data governance and data security principles.
  • Ability to adapt to a fast-paced, dynamic work environment and embrace continuous learning.

What We Offer

  • Internationally competitive base salary | benchmarked against global industry and market leaders
  • Performance-based Annual Incentive Program | rewarding those who dare and achieve more
  • Top of the market pension scheme | with higher-than-average company contributions
  • Work from home, commuting and phone allowances | to support your daily commute, home office setup & business connectivity
  • Hybrid working model | effectively combining working from the office & home, depending on team dynamics and personal needs
  • Working from abroad | for up to 30 days per year, supporting our many international colleagues as well as travel enthusiasts
  • Extensive holiday package | additional care and development days, extensive maternity / paternity leave & possibility to purchase days
  • Bicycle Plan | possibility to select a company bicycle for daily commute along with accessories & insurance
  • Health Insurance Discount | when signing up with our partner insurance
  • Gym Membership Discount | to support your focus on health and wellbeing
  • Product Discounts | on all Versuni products which are sold under the Philips brand and our other brands
  • An office that feels like home | easily accessible and modern office location in Amsterdam with lots of tasty lunch choices around
  • High growth environment | offering exciting learning and career development perspectives beyond your first role
  • Inclusive working culture and family spirit | we embrace our international community & diversity as competitive advantage

About Us

Versuni designs, manufactures and sells market leading products under the well-known brands Philips, Saeco, Gaggia, Preethi, Philips Walita, L'OR Barista and Senseo. We do this with the simple yet powerful purpose of turning houses into homes.

We are proud of the products we make. As a leading player in domestic appliances, we offer sustainable products across kitchen appliances, coffee, air, garment, and home care. Our company is headquartered in The Netherlands, and has innovation, manufacturing, and commercial centers across the globe, with presence in over 100 countries. We employ 7,000 talented people who bring innovation to our customers.

We create a great place to work for those who share our passion, with high-performing teams as diverse as the homes we care for. We have big plans for 2024 and beyond, further driving innovation and growth within our global markets. What we need to achieve this are like-minded individuals who are determined to take their careers to the next level.

We have been 100% carbon neutral in our operations since 2020, but this is just the start of our plan. We know everything we use today will affect the planet tomorrow. For the past century, we've innovated to make products faster, better, and more energy efficient. A better future is possible with a plan that‚Äôs built to last.

We have been 100% carbon neutral in our operations since 2020, but this is just the start of our plan. We know everything we use today.

Title: Data Analyst - INTERNSHIP
Description:
51,000 people. 49 countries. Over 120 office locations.

We‚Äôre not just engineers. We‚Äôre a global team of data scientists, consultants, construction workers and innovators all working to create a better tomorrow. Every day, we help customers in energy, chemicals and resources get one step closer to solving our planet‚Äôs toughest issues. Climate change, the energy transition, digital transformation and how we can deliver a more sustainable world.?

Whatever your ambition, there‚Äôs a path for you here. And there‚Äôs no barrier to your potential career success. For more information, visit Worley.com.

About Worley

Worley has made a firm commitment to support the energy transition, and central to this is ensuring Project Delivery adheres to cost, schedule and quality and meets appropriate legislation and standards. We are rapidly expanding our capabilities within the low carbon and Energy Transition sectors and our Project Delivery team will bring experience and track record from a range of industry sectors to ensure similar standards are maintained as we assist our clients, partners, and projects in transitioning to a more sustainable world.

Our commitment to People, Planet and Sustainability is demonstrated in Worley‚Äôs broader ambitions in the energy transition space, from early-stage concept and feasibility through to delivering full EPC and EPCM packages.

Project Controls / Data Analyst Internship

We‚Äôre looking for an ambitious and intellectually curious student to join our team on an internship to learn, grow and contribute to our goal of a better tomorrow.

This will be based within our Project Controls department.

In this position, you will be requested to analyse and compare data to come to general conclusions and establish benchmarks.

The internship will have to gather information from several sources & Worley systems, bring it together, analyse & review the data and derive benchmarks which we can use internally.

There are several project controls fields in which this needs to happen:


Estimating, both professional services and capital cost: comparison of estimates against one another and comparison of estimates against actuals
We want to gain knowledge of the level of consistency between estimates (in terms of hours and cost)
We want to understand final actuals against estimates to improve future estimates
Scheduling:
Knowledge of consistency across schedules (in terms of durations)
We want to understand final actuals against baselines to improve future schedules

Important to mention is that data is not necessarily organized in a consistent way. As part of data gathering, scrutinizing data to come to comparable data sets will be very important. Therefore, having a basic understanding of engineering, estimating and scheduling and having a technical background is considered as a plus.

You will

Be working directly with project controls management team (department managers cost, estimating and scheduling and Director, project controls)

Be Involved In


Extensive data analysis
Development of benchmarks to improve quality of future estimates & schedules


Be Exposed To


Different project controls aspects, tools & systems
Detailed project knowledge in terms of cost and schedule
International working environment
Diverse & high professional teams
Opportunities to demonstrate your skill set: technical, but also communication and presentation skills


We need you to





Demonstrate excellent knowledge of excel


Demonstrate data analysis skills
Database (management) knowledge is considered a plus
Demonstrate the ability to learn quickly and pick up different tool
Demonstrate the ability to convert complex data sets into useful and easy to understand outcomes
Technical background and basic knowledge of engineering is a plus ‚Äì as this will help to understand the data the need to be analysed and reviewed.
If you feel you do not meet the full criteria, we encourage you to still apply. When reviewing applications, we look at all experiences, whether that‚Äôs in-industry (paid work experience), at university (e.g. your course, society membership, events etc) or even in personal study (any experiences you have outside of university or paid employment)


What We Offer You


The opportunity to work in an international environment with very diverse teams
The opportunity to learn about the most important metrics of projects: cost & schedule
Hybrid Working (where the role allows for this)
& Much more!


Moving forward together

We want our people to be energized and empowered to drive sustainable impact. So, our focus is on a values-inspired culture that unlocks brilliance through belonging, connection and innovation.

We‚Äôre building a diverse, inclusive and respectful workplace. Creating a space where everyone feels they belong, can be themselves, and are heard.

And we're not just talking about it; we're doing it. We're reskilling our people, leveraging transferable skills, and supporting the transition of our workforce to become experts in today's low carbon energy infrastructure and technology.

Whatever your ambition, there‚Äôs a path for you here. And there‚Äôs no barrier to your potential career success. Join us to broaden your horizons, explore diverse opportunities, and be part of delivering sustainable change.

Worley

Employment Type

Employee

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
BI expert

Als BI expert help je bedrijven voor te bereiden op een data gedreven toekomst. Dit klinkt vast herkenbaar. Hieronder wat je gaat doen:

Ontwikkelen en onderhouden van datamodellen, dashboards en rapportages.
Analyseren van bedrijfsdata om waardevolle inzichten te genereren.
Samenwerken met stakeholders om hun informatiebehoeften te begrijpen en te vertalen naar data-oplossingen.
Waarborgen van de integriteit, kwaliteit en veiligheid van data.
Optimaliseren van bestaande data-analyse processen en het implementeren van best practices.




Je hebt bij voorkeur meer dan 4 jaar ervaring als BI expert of data analist en weet daarom zelf wel welke tools en technieken belangrijk zijn om te beheersen. Wat wij belangrijker vinden, ben jij als persoon. Wij zoeken iemand die een fijne toevoeging is aan ons team. Dat betekent dat je op ten minste √©√©n van de onderstaande vragen ‚ÄòJA‚Äô kunt antwoorden.

Schud jij zo een grap uit je mouw?
Of lach jij snel om andermans flauwe grappen?
Houd je van intensief sporten of misschien nog beter; het drankje achteraf?
Vind jij eerlijkheid en transparantie belangrijk?
Zoek je betrokkenheid, maar wil je niet aan het lijntje gehouden worden?




Wat we je bieden

75% van jouw omzet (7 ‚Äì 11k per maand)
Een basissalaris van ‚Ç¨2750 per maand
Een vast contract na een twee maanden proeftijd
Vakantie wanneer jij wilt, een NS-Business Card en een persoonlijke pensioenregeling.
Een team waarin iedereen een data-expert is
Veel ruimte voor eigen inbreng
Elke maand een leuke activiteit
Gelijkwaardigheid, vertrouwen en waardering

Title: Marketing Data Analyst
Description:
How do you delight our customers?

Bol continuously advances its platform to create a better tomorrow for over 13 million customers and over 50,000 trading partners. Our Advertising via bol (Avb) propositions, which help shoppers discover products and help advertisers reach shoppers, play an important role in bol‚Äôs ambitions ‚Äì and this is where you‚Äôll make the difference. As Avb Marketing, we help and engage thousands of our advertisers. Marketing Analytics plays an instrumental role here by creating building blocks for Marketing Automation. Our goal is to enable ‚ÄòEngagement at Scale‚Äô through data by fine-tuning queries, developing data models, and ensuring that our campaigns reach the right audience at the right time.

The biggest challenge

Advertising via Bol is growing fast and becoming increasingly important for bol. The number of colleagues, the complexity of the tech, and the breadth of initiatives are rapidly expanding. Data needs and requests for more insights are no exception. At the same time, we‚Äôre implementing Marketing Automation tools to improve our capabilities. This requires us to work pragmatically and focus on achieving the required outcomes. You rise to the occasion to ensure that our data is robust, can be used effectively and responsibly and iterate quickly.

What You‚Äôll Do As An Marketing Data Analyst

You‚Äôll join a team of marketing data analysts in bol‚Äôs Avb Marketing Analytics team, which aims to help the marketing teams to create more engaging and impactful campaigns through data.

Your Workload Covers Three Main Areas


You build, maintain and simplify our data model ‚Äì reducing complexity, making our pipelines more cost-effective and exploiting synergies between various projects. You ensure data transformations are tested, documented, monitored, performant and adhere to our security & privacy policies.
You help our marketeers by creating insights to understand customer behavior, optimize campaigns, and drive data-driven decisions. All with the goal of optimizing campaigns to help and engage advertisers.
You analyze our campaigns, all with the goal of getting a clear picture of the impact we‚Äôre making as a department.


We‚Äôre Looking For Someone Who


Can implement best practice around tools and concepts like: Git, SQL, Dbt, data testing, monitoring, and alerting, to create a state-of-the-art analytics environment that enforces quality standards.
Uses their strong communication skills to bridge the gap between Marketeers, Analysts and Product Engineers.
Doesn‚Äôt want to work alone. You help model pipelines, optimize queries, and apply best practices. You also actively collaborate within bol‚Äôs wider analytics engineering and data engineering community to improve our data stack at scale.
Practices and preaches Clean Code principles such as DRY and Clean, Clear and Concise.


3 reasons why this is (not) for you Switch to find out


No, if you‚Äôre uncomfortable with ambiguity Our data landscape evolves, and you‚Äôll need to navigate it confidently. The complexity of our organization requires you to pro-actively involve colleagues throughout our Product & Tech organization to find solutions.
No, if you prefer output over outcome If your work ends when you complete a feature ‚Äì who cares how users experience it ‚Äì than this job is not for you. You‚Äôre looking to find real solutions for our marketing teams to build solid campaigns.
No, if you‚Äôre not interested in continuous improvement We‚Äôre always learning from our analyses and work to improve our ways-of-working.
Yes, if you‚Äôve built up hands-on experience in analytics and love to share it If you have 5+ relevant experience in marketing analytics (as a data analyst, advanced analyst, or related role) and like to share your knowledge and experience with others. Experience with data engineering, analytics engineering or business intelligence engineering or experience with marketing automation tooling (such as Marigold Engage) is a plus.
Yes, if you produce high quality code & data Yes, if you have a deep interest in analytics and get excited by finetuning queries, data models, and coding principles. SQL and Git are your home away from home. Experience with Dbt is a plus.
Yes, if you can translate data to opportunity and opportunity to campaign building block Our role is multi-faceted so you‚Äôre not a one trick pony. It starts with extracting campaign opportunities from data and ends with realizing the data foundation for scalable marketing campaigns.


This is where you‚Äôll work

You‚Äôll join a team of four Marketing Data Analysts which supports our broader Avb Marketing team. Sparring with strategic and communication oriented marketeers happens on a daily basis. We work in collaborative spaces where you‚Äôll work alongside other data enthusiasts, enjoying a mix of open areas and quiet corners. Our most important stakeholders in Marketing, Sales and Product are just a stroll away.

It is our responsibility to enable an environment that unleashes the power of diversity.

Our most important stakeholders in Marketing, Sales and Product are just a stroll away.

It is our responsibility to enable an environment that unleashes the power of diversity.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Chooose builds software to enable the lower carbon fuel value chains in hard-to-abate sectors.




Companies like Alaska Airlines, Air Canada, Delta Airlines, and Flexport use the Chooose platform to build, operate and scale their SAF programs, and to advance voluntary and compliance carbon initiatives.




With offices in Oslo and Miami, and remote employees across the US and Europe, we are a mission-oriented team that is scaling our business and climate impact in tandem. The company has raised $50M from leading venture capital and strategic investors.




The Data team is responsible for transforming and maintaining quality of external and system data, external facing analytical visualizations and providing insights and business intelligence to internal teams at CHOOOSE. This role will focus primarily on Business intelligence with the goal to empower our internal teams to perform better and the build of external facing visualizations.




What you'll do

Collaborate with internal stakeholders to streamline data-driven performance management.
Enabling self-serve metrics and empowering internal teams such as Account Management, Finance, Implementation, Product and Carbon Operations to leverage data to answer their questions.
Collaborate with the Product team to incorporate external facing visualizations into the CHOOOSE platform.




What you'll bring to the table

An understanding of querying languages (KQL and SQL)
An understanding of key data manipulation concepts
2-5 years of experience using data visualization tools and performing analysis in tools such as Google Suite and Microsoft Office
Ability to answer questions and problem-solve through data manipulation and visualizations deriving value for our internal organization
Solution-oriented mindset, leveraging data to problem solve
Ability to prioritize and manage multiple stakeholders




The interview process

The interview process will include a series of interviews with CHOOOSE Data team members and internal stakeholders. There will be a case study exercise that will be presented to the CHOOOSE Data team.




Pay, perks, & more

We offer a competitive salary, the option to participate in our employee equity program, flexible work hours, and access to 'Spaces' coworking space. Come join a fun and supportive team dedicated to advancing climate solutions and tackling significant challenges.




We value diversity and believe forming teams in which everyone can be their authentic self is key to our success. We encourage people from underrepresented backgrounds and different industries to apply.

Compensation will be based on experience and skill, commensurate with market rates, and will include both salary and equity in CHOOOSE.




CHOOOSE is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate based on race, color, religion (creed), gender, gender expression, age, national origin (ancestry), disability, marital status, sexual orientation, or military status. We are committed to providing an inclusive and welcoming environment to our employees and welcome input from candidates and employees on how we can enhance our inclusiveness.




Prerequisite for Employment: CHOOOSE may request to conduct background checks on prospective applicants to verify the information provided in the CV, transcripts, and other documentation. This background check may be carried out by our partner and will not be conducted without the applicant's prior consent. Prospective applicants will receive more information about this.

Title: Business Intelligence Consultant
Description:
Freelance Power BI Consultant




Location: Utrecht/Remote

Type: Freelance/Contract

Daily Rate: DOE




Position Overview:

We are seeking a Freelance Power BI Developer based in Utrecht, Netherlands, to create impactful data visualizations and dashboards.
This role is ideal for someone with strong expertise in Power BI, capable of turning complex data into clear, actionable insights.
Additional skills in data modelling, SQL, or cloud platforms like Azure are highly valued but not mandatory.




Key Responsibilities:

Design and develop custom Power BI reports and interactive dashboards.
Work closely with clients to understand their data needs and translate them into effective visual solutions.
Optimize Power BI models for performance and usability.
Integrate Power BI with various data sources, including databases and cloud services.




Bonus Skills:

Experience with SQL and data modelling.
Familiarity with ETL processes.
Knowledge of cloud platforms like Azure.




If interested please send your most recent CV to Rami.James@source-technology.com

Title: Transportation Data Analyst (Citymapper)
Description:
At Citymapper (powered by Via), we‚Äôre on a mission to help make complex cities more accessible to everyday users. Our application transports millions of people in hundreds of cities around the world by giving them access to the most current and sophisticated transportation options available. We make getting around your favorite city easy, so that you can enjoy the ride.

As a Transportation Data Analyst (French-speaking) at Citymapper, you will be managing the data that is the backbone of our application‚Äôs success. Y our work directly impacts our user experience, and is the difference between a user seeing a bus drive away, or reaching it just in time. Millions of users around the world trust our application to be on time for work, a job interview, or a date - and we take great responsibility in fulfilling that need.

This job can be done remotely if you're based in England, the Netherlands, Germany or Bulgaria. If you prefer hybrid, we have offices in London, Berlin, Paris, Amsterdam, and Sofia.

What You'll Do:


You will help to manage the timetable data that powers the Citymapper application. Using proprietary tools and methods, you will transform often messy transit schedules into shiny and reliable user information.
You will build, validate and ship data to production on a daily basis.
You will manage data in a range of cities and across different formats.
You will work with our engineers to build for scale by improving tools and automating tasks.
You will ensure data quality in our web and mobile products so that users continue to love and trust Citymapper.


Who You Are:


Fluent French speaker (C1 and above)
You have a passion for public transportation and cities, and an interest in how public transportation networks operate.
You are comfortable dealing with large data sets, and have an eagerness to learn new data skills.
You take a hands-on, practical, pragmatic attitude to your work.
You have exceptional attention to detail, and an ability to communicate those details to other collaborators.
You have up to 3 years of experience working with data, Python and/or common transit data formats (GTFS, TransXChange, Siri, Hafas, etc).


What We Offer:


Becoming part of Via, a company that was awarded for its commitment to social good
Joining the team working on the industry-leading mobile app that is loved and trusted by millions of users
State of the art hardware for you to perform your work worry free
Ongoing support and training to ensure you have the resources you need to thrive and progress in your career
A hybrid or remote work model. Remote work is possible if you're based in one of these countries: England, Germany or Netherlands
Competitive compensation
Monthly health stipend
25 vacation days


We‚Äôre Via, and we build technology that changes the way the world moves. We pioneered the TransitTech category to ensure that the future of transportation is shared, dynamic public mobility ‚Äî the kind that reduces carbon emissions across congested cities, minimizes reliance on private cars, and provides everyone with accessible, efficient, and affordable ways of getting around.

We created the first end-to-end TransitTech solution for cities and transit agencies, offering world-class software, service design, and operational expertise to fundamentally improve the way the world moves.

Via was founded with the guiding principle that we go further when we go together. We are dedicated to building a diverse, inclusive and authentic workplace. If you‚Äôre excited about this role but your past experience doesn‚Äôt align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyways. You may be just the right candidate for this or other roles. All backgrounds, identities, and voices are welcomed and celebrated at Via.

Ready to join the ride?

Via is an equal opportunity employer.

Title: Senior Marketing Data Analyst
Description:
Join the strategic marketing team, a highly transversal team interacting with various stakeholders within Orange Business: Strategy, Business Lines, Strategic Value Propositions (SVP) Leaders, Zones, Finance etc.




About the role




The team‚Äôs main ambitions are:

To lead and/or contribute to understanding our markets, our competition, and the evolution of our customer's expectations to analyze our key challenges and opportunities
To measure our customers‚Äô satisfaction (NPS), analyze results, and provide recommendations for action plans driving their improvement
To construct our marketing plan, providing a 2-year compass for our execution plans
To analyze our products & services portfolio and consolidate our roadmaps across Orange Business, to optimize our commercial catalog
To provide guidance on the products & services development process and support the transformation of our ways of working towards more agile methodologies
To enable the monitoring of our performance through a unique tool developed for value management across Orange Business




The position we‚Äôre looking for will be part of the Strategic Marketing plan team, which is responsible for the first 3 pillars of the above (market understanding, voice of customers & marketing plan).




Missions




Strategic & Customer Marketing of Orange Business is recruiting a Senior Marketing Data Analyst.

The position reports to the Director of Strategic Marketing plan.

The Senior Marketing Data Analyst is a key asset to foster data-driven analysis and Go-to-Market strategies, in line with the strategy and business priorities of Orange Business.




Main activities are:




Co-lead a project called market referential, that has recently been kicked off. The project is owned by both Strategy & Strategic Marketing teams. Its ambition is to create a single market data referential to feed the development of strategic plan, marketing plan, and Zone GTM plans. The project involves defining the sources of truth for market sizing & market growth on our scopes of activities in our addressable markets per Zone. The projects embeds both alignment on key data sources between strategy, business lines and zones and tooling development to make it available across the company
Coordinate our annual French survey (Novascope) with the channels (DEF DGC) and Business Lines
Analyze our current positioning & potential gaps or opportunities for growth (with a specific focus on our strategic priorities such as strategic value propositions)
Leverage data to propose segmentation criteria on our strategic priorities: which target audience, which vertical, for which purpose, with which offer‚Ä¶
Liaise with SVP leaders, Business Lines & zones to ensure we have trajectories that are consistent with the market and our ambitions
Feed our marketing plan with key recommendations for action plans: target audiences to address, offers to develop, communication to be done‚Ä¶
Lead analysts‚Äô contracts negotiation & manage associated budget




The role is global, addressing all of our market segments (Orange Business France and International + Direction Enterprises (France) and requires interactions with a wide range of stakeholders from several entities (Products & Marketing, Zones, Finance, HR, Strategy‚Ä¶)




About you:




Advanced degree (Master's or MBA) in Business, Marketing, Economics, Finance or Computer Science
10+ years of professional experience in market research or strategy, data analysis, or market insights roles
Strong analytical skills with a data-driven mindset, leveraging primary and syndicated research, market and competitive analysis to inform strategic decision
Proficient in developing data reporting infrastructures and producing insightful reports for senior stakeholders to support decision-making
Extensive hands-on experience with data analysis techniques, including ETL processes, data modeling/management, and data visualization
In-depth knowledge of data analytical tools, techniques, and languages such as SQL, Power BI/Tableau, Knime/Dataiku/Alteryx, SSAS
Ability to give meaning, and understanding of the strategy and challenges of its entity
Team spirit, transversality, coordination, and lead of stakeholders around a project, even remotely
Results-oriented related to business objectives
Leadership, ability to convince, great interpersonal skills, listening
Strong project management skills
Autonomy and ability to quickly adapt to organizational changes, to react and find quick solutions
Strength of proposal and creativity
Mastery of data tools and strong analytical skills
Fluent in English & French

Title: Commercial Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description

This is B&S

B&S exists to make premium consumer goods available to everyone, anywhere. We believe that getting access to consumer products that bring joy and comfort into everyday lives, should be easy around the globe.

We are proud to see B&S featured in the latest edition of the #MT500 by MT/Sprout, which lists the 500 most reputable companies in the Netherlands. We rank #9 most attractive employer and #6 most sustainable company.

Are you curious about who we are as an employer and our thoughts on diversity and inclusion?Click here to find more information!

Job Description

Are you ready to give your career a flying start? As a Data Analyst, you‚Äôre not afraid to take the lead, you quickly master systems, and you have a keen eye for detail. This is your chance to develop and challenge yourself while playing a crucial role in the development of our procurement applications. Together, as a team, we continuously improve and streamline our processes. Are you ready to take the initiative?

Reach your full potential as a Data Analyst

The first year is all about learning and growing. You will get to know our company, our suppliers, and our processes by working with the support team. This will give you a good understanding of how we handle our orders and how purchase orders are created. In addition, you will join all developments related to our procurement application.

Our current application is used extensively by our buyers, but we see room for improvement. This is where you come in:


With support from the manager and your new colleagues, you will bring new and existing projects to fruition
Besides this, you implement them with current users, and become a key-user for the procurement application.
In addition, you collect and interpret information from these purchasing applications, such as quotes, supplier performance and other internal or external sources. In this role, you take charge of your own procurement and move within set frameworks, giving you the space to make decisions independently.


You measure your success by controlling the daily procurement processes, ensuring both quality and quantity. Based on existing deadlines and objectives for the projects, you try to complete them on time or inform the stakeholders of any delays.

Qualifications

This Is You

You have a sharp analytical mind and are incredibly quick at processing and analysing commercial data. Additionally, you are a pro at deciphering and automating complex systems and processes. With your keen eye, no detail escapes you. You take the lead in projects with great enthusiasm and ensure smooth coordination with all involved.

You


Have a bachelor's degree in a data-related field
Have affinity for data visualization
Are proficientin using data analysis tools and software


Additional Information

We offer you


A maximum salary ofup to ‚Ç¨2800,- in line with your experience, plus a yearly fixed Christmas gratuityand a performance dependent bonus
Initially, a one-year contract with the prospect of permanent employment
25 vacation days, with the possibility to purchase additional days
A travel allowance of up to 75 km on single trip travel when working at the office, or an allowance if you‚Äôre working remotely (from home)
The flexibility to work 1 day a week from home
A pension scheme where 2/3rd of the pension costs are paid by us
The possibility to take courses related to your growth ambitions and function
A coaching program focused on your mental health (non-binding)
Participation in group insurance such as disability insurance and survivor‚Äôs insurance
Free use of our company gym and possibility to purchase fresh meals at our company restaurant
Show more

Title: Data Analist
HTML:
Data Analist 


Wil jij je richten op het monitoren en analyseren van trends en ontwikkelingen? Ben je op zoek naar een positie waarin je contact hebt met stakeholders op verschillende niveaus? Ben je innovatief en heb je een passie voor data? Als Data Analist identificeer je trends, patronen en afwijkingen in data en presenteer je aanbevelingen om de besluitvorming te ondersteunen. Je cre√´ert en onderhoudt nieuwe dashboards, rapporten, visualisaties en datasets. Als ideale kandidaat heb jij een afgeronde master Business Analytics, Data Science of vergelijkbare richting, enige ervaring met data analyse en visualisatietools en kennis van Python en SQL. 


Over onze opdrachtgever


Onze opdrachtgever is een toonaangevende internationale organisatie, bekend om zijn toewijding aan kwaliteit, innovatie en duurzaamheid. Duurzaamheid staat centraal in de bedrijfsfilosofie, waarbij er voortdurend wordt gezocht naar manieren om de ecologische voetafdruk te minimaliseren, zowel in het productieproces als in de levenscyclus van de producten. Daarnaast zet het bedrijf zich actief in voor maatschappelijke projecten die gericht zijn op het promoten van gezonde en actieve levensstijlen. 


Brightminds ontwikkelprogramma


In een wereld die constant verandert moet je op verschillende manieren slim zijn. In ons tweejarig ontwikkelprogramma ontwikkel je vier niveaus van intelligentie. Wij geloven dat het vinden van balans in emoties, relaties, gezondheid en denkvermogen leidt tot groei en persoonlijk leiderschap. 


Je krijgt 2 trainingen per maand over een periode van 2 jaar. De begeleiding is intensief. Elke 2 tot 3 weken heb je een coachgesprek over je persoonlijke en professionele groei. We lopen letterlijk de eerste 2 jaar met je mee en je krijgt coaching bij alles wat je nodig hebt om goed in je vel te zitten. 


Het programma doorloop je met 8 tot 10 andere young professionals. Met elkaar bouw je een hechte band op! We vertellen je graag meer over ons unieke programma en wat de verschillende niveaus van intelligentie inhouden:  


IQ is je vermogen om kennis en cognitieve vaardigheden toe te passen. We gaan aan de slag met Excel, Power BI (binnen 3 maanden behaal je het PL 300 certificaat), Data Storytelling & Visualization, SQL en Python op professioneel niveau, Machinelearning & AI en meer! 


EQ helpt je gevoelens bij jezelf en anderen te herkennen, te begrijpen en ermee om te gaan. Je krijgt onder andere presentatietraining van de meest bekeken TED talk spreker van Nederland, je gaat aan de slag met je eigen gedragspatronen en mindset. Alles erop gericht om samenwerken te bevorderen.   


SQ geeft inzicht in wat jou als persoon drijft en hoe je handelt. Het stelt je in staat om dicht bij jezelf te blijven. Ontdekken van jouw interesse en drijfveren is de eerste stap naar zinvol werk. Daar gaan we jou bij helpen. Na deze trainingen sta jij sterker in je schoenen, ben je in staat bewust keuzes te maken en weet je hoe je impact kan maken.


FQ gaat over vitaal en in balans zijn, zodat je kan blijven presteren. Hoe zorg je nou eigenlijk voor een goede werk-priv√© balans? Hoe ga je om met stress? En aan welke signalen kan je stress herkennen? We gaan aan de slag met vitaliteit, ademwerk, mindfulness en meer. Ook krijg je training van een AI-lover die jou alle tools gaat leren toepassen in je dagelijkse werk, zodat je meer tijd over houdt voor andere zaken. 


Wat wij jou bieden 


  • Geweldige baan als Data Analist bij een internationale organisatie;
  • Na 2 jaar treed je in vaste dienst bij de opdrachtgever;
  • Startdatum uiterlijk 1 oktober 2024;
  • Bruto salaris van ‚Ç¨ 3.200, - bruto per maand o.b.v. 40 uur per week. Na 1 jaar maak je een stap naar ‚Ç¨ 3.500, - bruto per maand o.b.v. 40 uur per week;
  • Plus 8% vakantiegeld;
  • Goede pensioenregeling;
  • Reiskostenvergoeding van 0,23 cent per kilometer (optie tot huurauto);
  • Telefoon- en internetvergoeding van ‚Ç¨ 40,- per maand;
  • Deelname aan ons vitaliteitsprogramma;
  • 25 vakantiedagen en 1 betaalde vrijwilligersdag per jaar;
  • Uniek ontwikkelprogramma met doorlopend trainingen en coaching;
  • Word onderdeel van een groep jonge mensen met een gelijke studie achtergrond;
  • Een-op-een coaching om jou te helpen optimaal te kunnen presteren.


Dit neem jij mee


  • Een masterdiploma in Data Science, Business Analytics of een vergelijkbare richting;
  • Kennis van programmeertalen zoals Python of R is een pr√©;
  • Ervaring met data analyse en visualisatietools is belangrijk;
  • Je durft vragen te stellen en bent communicatief sterk;
  • Je bent innovatief en hebt een passie voor data;
  • Uitstekende beheersing van de Nederlandse en Engelse taal.


Werken bij Brightminds betekent


Plezier en verbinding: Bij Brightminds willen we plezier maken en brengen we graag een glimlach op het gezicht van anderen. Ook op die van jou! Je wordt onderdeel van een hechte groep young professionals van wie je kan leren en ervaringen kan delen. Iedereen kan zichzelf zijn en we vieren diversiteit en gelijkwaardigheid.


Ondernemerschap en creativiteit: Wij zijn ondernemers. We gaan uit van onze eigen kracht en blijven leren. Jezelf ontwikkelen gaat met vallen en opstaan. Daar gaan wij je bij helpen! Wil je op strategisch niveau meepraten? Dat kan! Neem deel aan onze businessclub en breng je scherpe idee√´n in.


Harmonie en empathie: Brightminds hecht waarde aan een gezonde werk-priv√© balans. We hebben aandacht voor de behoeften en het welzijn van elkaar. Je krijgt de flexibiliteit die jij nodig hebt.


Training en ontwikkeling: Het is onze missie om samen de leiders van morgen te ontwikkelen. We gaan investeren in jouw toekomst en je krijgt de trainingen en persoonlijke begeleiding die jij nodig hebt.


Ben jij enthousiast over deze functie als Data Analist en weet je dat Brightminds precies biedt wat jij nodig hebt om een kickstart te geven aan jouw carri√®re? Stuur dan je CV naar huibjan@brightminds.nl of bel naar 06-27271499.

Title: Data analist, Eindhoven
HTML:
wat ga je doen?

Als Data Analist speel je een cruciale rol binnen het sales team. Je bent verantwoordelijk voor zowel het aanbestedingsproces als het defini√´ren van prijsstrategie√´n voor wegtransportdiensten. Jouw expertise zorgt ervoor dat het bedrijf competitief blijft in internationaal wegtransport.

  • Beheren en co√∂rdineren van aanbestedingsprocessen voor Europese wegtransportopdrachten;
  • Samenstellen, indienen en analyseren van aanbestedingsdocumenten, met zorg voor datakwaliteit en intern beleid;
  • Ontwerpen en voorstellen van logistieke oplossingen, inclusief prijscalculaties en budgetsimulaties;
  • Oprichten en aansturen van projectteams, waarbij je zorgt voor tijdige en correcte informatievoorziening;
  • Proactief communiceren met belanghebbenden binnen en buiten de organisatie ter ondersteuning van tender- en prijsstrategie√´n;
  • Ontwikkelen van alternatieve berekeningsmethoden voor kosteneffectieve logistieke oplossingen.

wie ben jij?

  • Afgeronde HBO/WO opleiding in een economische of logistieke richting;
  • Uitstekende communicatievaardigheden in Engels;
  • Ervaring met Microsoft Office en de vaardigheid om snel nieuwe softwareprogramma‚Äôs eigen te maken

wat krijg je er voor terug?

  • Een dynamische functie binnen een groeiende en innovatieve organisatie;
  • Een competitief salaris met 27 vakantiedagen per jaar;
  • Een WGA-verzekering.

waar ga je werken?

Je gaat aan de slag bij een internationaal opererend logistiek dienstverlener in de regio Noord-Brabant. Dit bedrijf biedt toonaangevende logistieke oplossingen om het concurrentievermogen van klanten wereldwijd te verbeteren, met respect voor mens en milieu. Effici√´nt en optimaal transport staat centraal in hun dienstverlening, ondersteund door een team van gemotiveerde professionals.

Title: BI Consultant
Description:
Word jij onze nieuwe enthousiaste BI-engineer/consultant voor Zig | Insights?




Voor het onboarden en begeleiden van nieuwe klanten op ons BI-platform Zig | Insights zijn wij op zoek naar een enthousiaste BI-engineer/consultant.

Geloof jij net als wij dat de impact van data op organisaties steeds belangrijker wordt voor het vaststellen √©n behalen van doelstellingen en het maken van strategische keuzes? Wil jij met data een verschil maken, onder andere voor de maatschappelijke doelstellingen van onze klanten en hun klanten? Dan zijn wij op zoek naar jou!




Wat ga je doen

Jij speelt een belangrijke rol in het aansluiten van nieuwe klanten op ons BI-platform en het vertalen van hun wensen naar bestaande standaarden of refinements voor nieuwe standaarden. Samen met je collega‚Äôs en de klanten blijf je nieuwe informatieproducten ontwikkelen, zoals KPI‚Äôs en visualisaties in Fabric/PowerBI. Met het team (22 collega‚Äôs) optimaliseer je continu het platform met innovaties en nieuwe functionaliteiten.




Als BI-engineer/consultant ben je dagelijks bezig om samen met de klant het maximale uit de samenwerking en het BI-platform te halen. Een aantal taken en verantwoordelijkheden die bij jouw rol horen zijn:




Het onboarden van nieuwe klanten op het Zig | Insights platform.
Het begeleiden van het projectteam bij de klant in het begrijpen en integreren van definities/indicatoren vanuit de informatieproducten in de organisatieprocessen.
Het begeleiden van de dagstart- en dageinde-sessies met de klant en het beheer van de backlog; samen met de projectleider de voortgang bewaken.
Analyseren en implementeren van oplossingen om klanten te helpen bij het analyseren en rapporteren van hun data, met als doel inzicht te verkrijgen in de bedrijfsprocessen en betere datagedreven strategische beslissingen te nemen.
Analyseren en uitwerken van de informatiebehoefte van klanten op een duidelijke en gestructureerde manier, en deze behoeften vertalen naar gedetailleerde specificaties om oplossingen te ontwikkelen die aansluiten bij de behoeften van de klanten.
Het ontzorgen van de klant in het proces van data ontsluiting, data preparatie en het bouwen aan integrale informatievoorziening.
Fungeren als interne specialist op het gebied van business intelligence, waarbij je voortdurend de nieuwste ontwikkelingen en trends binnen dit vakgebied volgt om je deskundigheid te maximaliseren.




Dit ben jij

Jij vindt het leuk om in een team te werken dat een sterke visie heeft om de vastgoedsector via data te professionaliseren. Je hebt een passie voor data en wilt deze graag delen met klanten. Je wilt hen helpen om meer datagedreven te werken en te groeien naar een datagedreven organisatie. Jij kunt de vertaalslag maken van klantvragen naar te ontwikkelen indicatoren en dashboards.




Als BI-engineer/consultant beschik je over de volgende kennis en ervaring:

HBO- of WO-werk- en denkniveau (bij voorkeur in de richting bedrijfskunde, informatica, data science of toegepaste wiskunde)
Minimaal 3 jaar werkervaring in de richting van Business Intelligence en/of data analytics
Ervaring met data-visualisatie-tooling (bijvoorbeeld Power BI)
Sterke analytische en communicatieve vaardigheden
Vloeiend in Nederlands, zowel mondeling als schriftelijk




Een dikke pr√© is als je een achtergrond of kennis hebt in finance en/of goed bent in het overzien van processen.




Wat is Zig | Insights?

Zig Insights is h√©t innovatieve BI-platform voor de vastgoedsector. We begeleiden organisaties bij het verwerken van data tot waardevolle informatie, op een eenduidige en gestructureerde manier, waarbij we de standaarden van de sector gebruiken. Het BI-team van Zig helpt klanten met de stappen die nodig zijn om een datagedreven cultuur te cre√´ren.




Onze dataspecialisten hebben de drive en ambitie om zichzelf steeds opnieuw uit te vinden en werken continu aan het verbeteren en optimaliseren van producten en diensten. Samen maken we mooie dingen. De collega‚Äôs binnen het team zijn een beetje eigenwijs, hebben humor, maar houden altijd de focus op het resultaat van de klant.




Wie zijn wij?

Wij zijn Zig. We ontwikkelen software voor de vastgoedbranche (woningcorporaties, studentenhuisvesters en commercieel vastgoed) en doen dit met veel plezier.




Wij helpen organisaties om dichter bij hun klanten te komen met slimme processen, innovatieve technologie√´n en data. Onze digitale oplossingen zorgen ervoor dat de focus op de klant zichtbaar en voelbaar is in het complete proces: van een woning zoeken en vinden tot aan bewonen en verhuizen. Wij maken wonen makkelijker.




Dit doen wij al meer dan 14 jaar met een enthousiast team van ruim 300 specialisten die werken in Huizen, Veenendaal en hybride. Meer dan 160 vastgoedorganisaties en 1,6 miljoen mensen maken gebruik van onze software.




Dit krijg je ervoor terug




Wij bespreken graag jouw salariswens tijdens onze eerste kennismaking. Het salaris ligt tussen de ‚Ç¨ 4500 en ‚Ç¨ 5500 op basis van een 40-urige werkweek, afhankelijk van jouw kennis en ervaring.
Ruimte om mee te denken over de doorontwikkeling van onze producten en jouw kennis te delen;
Ruimte om jezelf te ontwikkelen via de Zig Academy;
Werken bij een 'Great place to work', een bedrijf met ambitie en een sterke visie;
Een fijne sfeer binnen een organisatie die altijd in beweging is;
De mogelijkheid om je werkplek en -tijd flexibel in te delen;
26 vakantiedagen (bij een fulltime dienstverband);
Een goede pensioenregeling;
Samenwerken met 300 gemotiveerde en gedreven collega‚Äôs, ze vertellen je graag waarom Zig de juiste keuze is.




Overtuigd? Laat het ons weten!

Ben jij ervan overtuigd dat jij goed past bij de functie en bij ons als organisatie? Dan is het tijd om in actie te komen. Wacht dan niet langer en solliciteer direct met je LinkedIn profiel.




Wil je eerst meer informatie voordat je solliciteert? Geen probleem. Je kunt altijd contact opnemen met Saskia Kronenburg, onze recruiter bij Zig. Ze is telefonisch of via WhatsApp bereikbaar op 06-41611022.

Title: Data Analist
Description:
Een baan als Data Analist bij Digital Power

Als Data Analist bij Digital Power help je verschillende organisaties om beslissingen te maken op basis van data. Het is jouw taak om complexe informatie vanuit verschillende domeinen te vertalen in heldere en concrete actiepunten. Jouw doel is om ervoor te zorgen dat beslissingen niet meer worden genomen ‚Äòop onderbuikgevoel‚Äô maar op basis van feitelijke data.




Je werkt in multi-disciplinaire teams met collega‚Äôs van Digital Power en/of klantteams. Wij vinden het belangrijk om kennis met elkaar te delen. Hierdoor ontwikkel jij je razendsnel. Maar we verwachten ook een actieve bijdrage van jou! Dit doe je op je eigen manier, bijvoorbeeld door training te geven of junior collega‚Äôs te coachen.




Naast je opdracht(en) maak je deel uit van onze interne community. Leer van, en m√©t je collega‚Äôs en help elkaar n√≥g beter te worden! Kom je ergens niet uit? Dan staat ons hele team voor je klaar.




Wie we zoeken

Passie voor data

Je duikt graag in de off- √©n online data van organisaties
Je krijgt energie van het omzetten van data naar bruikbare inzichten
Je kunt data helder analyseren, visualiseren en uitleggen




De nodige ervaring

Je hebt minimaal 1 jaar werkervaring als Data Analist
Je hebt ervaring met visualisatietools zoals PowerBI of Tableau en/of (web)analyse tools zoals Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics
Je bent communicatief vaardig en in staat om organisaties te helpen meer datagedreven te werken




What else?

Je vindt het leuk om bij verschillende opdrachtgevers aan de slag te gaan: van NGO's tot aan marketingbureaus en van banken tot aan overheidsinstanties
Ervaring met SQL is een pr√©
Je bent leergierig en altijd bezig met je eigen ontwikkeling
Je denkt na over wat de vraag √°chter de vraag is
Je vindt een goede sfeer op je werk n√©t zo belangrijk als je vak
Je krijgt goede energie van onze ‚Äòwerken bij‚Äô pagina
Je beheerst de Nederlandse en Engelse taal goed in woord en geschrift
Een afgeronde hbo- of wo-opleiding




Wat we bieden

We bieden een startsalaris van ‚Ç¨ 2800 ‚Äì ‚Ç¨ 6500 bruto per maand, afhankelijk van je kennis en ervaring.

Onbeperkt opleidingsbudget en je eigen werktijden indelen: kijk hier wat we je nog meer allemaal bieden.
