Title: Senior Data Analyst (Business Intelligence)
Description:
Since 2014, Acast has been creating the world‚Äôs most valuable podcast marketplace, building

the technology which connects podcast creators, advertisers and listeners.

Its marketplace spans more than 125,000 podcasts, 2,700 advertisers and c.1 billion quarterly listens.

Crucially, those listens are monetized wherever they happen - across any podcasting app or

other listening platform.

The company operates worldwide and is headquartered in Stockholm, Sweden. Acast is listed on the Nasdaq First North Premier Growth Market.

About The Role

Are you an experienced Data Analyst? Join our dynamic team as we build the premier Ad Marketplace in podcasting! We're currently expanding our product team and seeking individuals who thrive in autonomous, purpose-driven environments. In this role, you'll play a pivotal part in delivering innovative features while enhancing the efficiency, stability, and scalability of our systems. If you're passionate about shaping the future of podcast advertising, we want to hear from you.

What You'll Do

In your day to day work, you will work within a cross functional team, on extending and improving our data handling of millions of daily listeners.

You will be working in a multi-disciplinary environment with agile principles. We'd love it if you had experience in SQL, DBT, Qlik and Looker. Experience in data modelling and ETL processes are also beneficial to the role. Ideally you're an independent, self-starter who doesn't have a problem working individually. You will be responsible for driving initiatives, communicating, collaborating, and working across team boundaries.

Where you will be


Most of our teams are hybrids with some members co-located in offices and some working remote. With a remote first way of working we want you to feel productive regardless of work location!
Working hours? We want to avoid teams distributed over time-zones, so this team will operate within the CET time zone for collaboration. This setup allows us for more flexibility and work-life balance.



Acast is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment regardless of race, gender, sexual orientation, religion, ethnicity, national origin or any of the other wonderful characteristics that make us different.

Culture is our number one priority as a business. We believe people come first, and we work every day to enable autonomy, continuous improvement and bring out the best in people. We‚Äôre global and have remote teams, so it‚Äôs even more important that we strive for an open, inclusive and caring environment where everyone feels visible and welcome. We consider ourselves a modern organization driven by strong values to create the best, most fulfilling and nurturing culture.

We very much look forward to finding the next great person to join our cause!
Show more

Title: Data Analyst | Oracle SQL, PL/SQL | Helinsborg
Description:
Job Description

Role ‚Äì Data Analyst

Technology ‚Äì Oracle SQL, PL/SQL, PowerBI, Jira, NOWIT, Siebel, SAP AIF, Splunk, Grafana, Catchpoint

Location ‚Äì Helsinborg, Sweden

Business Unit ‚Äì CRLADM

Compensation ‚Äì Competitive (including bonus)

Job Description

Today, the corporate landscape is dynamic and the world ahead is full of possibilities! None of the amazing things we do at Infosys would be possible without an equally amazing culture, the environment where ideas can flourish and where you are empowered to move forward as far as your ideas will take you.

At Infosys, we assure that your career will never stand still, we will inspire you to build what‚Äôs next and we will navigate further together. Our journey of learnability, values and trusted relationships with our clients continue to be the cornerstones of our organization and these values are upheld only because of our people.

Your role

As a Senior Associate Consultant, you are an expert at contributing to different phases of the consulting lifecycle. You will be intensely involved in; you will define the problem, propose and refine the solution. You will also play an important role in the development, configuration and deployment of the overall solution. You will guide teams on project processes, deliverables and contribute to the proposal development, client training and internal capability-building and help detail the project scope. You will have the opportunity to shape value-adding consulting solutions that enable our clients to meet the changing needs of the global landscape.

Required


Experienced Data Analyst with proven track record of collecting, cleaning, analyzing, and interpreting large datasets
Expertise in Pipeline designing and Validation
Expertise in statistical methods, machine learning techniques, and data mining techniques
Proficiency in SQL, Splunk, PowerBI, Jira, NOWIT, Grafana, Catchpoint and observability platforms
Experience with data visualization tools such as Grafana and Splunk.
Ability to work independently and as part of a team
Problem-solving and analytical skills to extract meaningful insights from data
Strong business acumen to understand the implications of data findings


Preferred


Logical thinking and problem-solving skills along with an ability to collaborate
Two or three industry domain knowledge
Client Interfacing skills
Knowledge of SDLC and agile methodologies
Experience in digital transformations, modernization and process reengineering


Personal

Besides the professional qualifications of the candidates, we place great importance in addition to various forms personality profile. These include:


High analytical skills
A high degree of initiative and flexibility
High customer orientation
High quality awareness
Excellent verbal and written communication skills


About Infosys

Infosys is a global leader in next-generation digital services and consulting. We enable clients in 56 countries to navigate their digital transformation. With over three decades of experience in managing the systems and workings of global enterprises, we expertly steer our clients through the many next of their digital journey. We do it by enabling the enterprise with an AI-powered core that helps prioritize the execution of change. We also empower the business with agile digital at scale to deliver unprecedented levels of performance and customer delight. Our always-on learning agenda drives their continuous improvement through building and transferring digital skills, expertise and ideas from our innovation ecosystem.

Visit www.infosys.com to see how Infosys can help your enterprise navigate your next.

All aspects of employment at Infosys are based on merit, competence and performance. We are committed to embracing diversity and creating an inclusive environment for all employees. Infosys is proud to be an equal opportunity employer

Title: Energy Data Analyst to Greenely!
Description:
Join Greenely's mission to pioneer Europe's energy transition, where we strive to reduce household energy bills to zero. By optimizing energy consumption and enabling virtual power generation, we're navigating families through the complexities of electricity with our innovative platform. As part of this ambitious journey, we're in search of a Data Analyst to join our Virtual Power Plant team with a passion for data-driven insights and a mastery of Tableau to join our mission-driven team.

Your daily work includes:


Utilize Tableau, Google Analytics, Amplitude, and Mixpanel to develop and maintain insightful dashboards and reports, tracking key performance indicators, and revealing data-driven stories that inform business strategies.
Collaborate with teams across the company to identify their data analysis needs, delivering tailored insights that support diverse objectives, from product development to customer engagement.
Ensure the integrity and accuracy of data through meticulous quality checks, while also championing the adoption of best practices in data management and analytics.
Stay ahead of the curve on the latest analytics trends and technologies, bringing innovative approaches to enhance Greenely's data-driven decision-making processes.


What you'll need to succeed :


Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, or related field.
At least 2+ years of hands-on experience in a data analysis role, with a proven track record of expertise in Tableau and comprehensive knowledge of Google Analytics, Amplitude, and Mixpanel.
Solid understanding of SQL and familiarity with Python or R.
Exceptional analytical, organizational, and communication skills.


We'll be really impressed if you :


You're a data wizard, adept at transforming raw data into clear, actionable insights, with a robust analytical toolkit that includes advanced proficiency in Tableau.
Expert knowledge of Google Analytics, Amplitude, and Mixpanel is crucial, as you'll leverage these platforms for comprehensive event tracking and analytics across our digital products.
Your technical skill set is rounded out with SQL proficiency and experience with data analysis programming languages such as Python or R.
Excellent communication skills define you, enabling you to demystify complex data findings and translate them into strategic insights for both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
You're known for your problem-solving prowess, keen eye for detail, and the ability to juggle multiple projects in a dynamic, fast-paced environment.
Experience with battery storage systems, solar systems, electricity engineering, or similar fields would be a significant advantage.
A genuine interest in the energy sector and a commitment to Greenely's mission to empower households in the energy transition would make you an ideal fit.


By joining Greenely, you'll be at the heart of a team dedicated to creating a sustainable future, leveraging your analytical skills to make a tangible impact on our mission. Here, your work will not only contribute to optimizing energy consumption but also play a crucial role in driving the energy transition forward.

What we can offer you üè¢üë©‚Äçüíª :


Flexibility: We are an office-first company that values in-person collaboration, offering flexible work arrangements to support your work-life balance. Our vibrant office is conveniently located in the heart of Stockholm at Vasagatan 40.
Growth: Elevate your career with opportunities for skill development, challenging projects, and advancement within our forward-thinking organization.
Influence and Impact: Your voice matters. Shape the future of energy by contributing your ideas, expertise, and playing a key role in decision-making.
Innovative Environment: Thrive in an ever-changing industry, working on cutting-edge projects and staying ahead of the curve in a dynamic and pioneering work atmosphere.


We place high emphasis on your interpersonal abilities at Greenely. Greenely's strength is drawn from team members who don't just do their job, but who actively shape the way we work. We seek individuals who naturally take charge, own their responsibilities with pride, and consistently hold themselves accountable. We're searching for someone who can gracefully navigate change, who sees challenges not as obstacles but as puzzles waiting to be solved, and who values the collective success of the team.

About Greenely

Greenely aims to create the best customer experience for the modern energy consumer through technology. Greenely's integrated mobile application enables households to optimize their energy consumption, reduce their electricity costs, and participate in grid balancing services. By connecting various energy assets in the home, Greenely's platform allows consumers to manage their energy usage efficiently while contributing to the stability of the power system. Greenely's solution addresses the challenges of the modern energy landscape and promotes a more efficient, sustainable, and reliable power system. By providing consumers with savings and new revenue streams, Greenely drives the transition to a cleaner and more resilient energy system.

Title: Business Intelligence Specialist
Description:
Join NOBA, a leading financial institution, as a Business Intelligence Specialist within Group Portfolio Analytics. This role provides a unique opportunity to gain comprehensive insights into the entire banking process within a niche-banking environment.

About The Role

As a Business Intelligence Specialist, you will play a crucial role in quantitative credit risk analysis, contributing to the creation of best-in-class credit risk reporting spanning from acquisition to write-off for the entire Group. This includes both Bank Norwegian and Nordax, along with various products. With NOBA's exciting journey ahead, you will have the flexibility to tailor your work according to your interests and level of seniority.

Key Responsibilities


Build best in class reporting infrastructure to monitor credit risk across portfolios and identify gaps in credit underwriting.
Improve the efficiency of data flows from the data warehouse to Tableau
Improve existing and develop new Tableau reports
Work closely with various teams including IFRS9, Credit Risk & Analytics, Collections, Business Development, Finance and Risk Control.
Report to the Group Head of Portfolio Analytics.


Key Requirements


Strong knowledge of SAS or SQL
Proactive with a solution-oriented mindset.
Proficient in business intelligence (BI) tools like; Tableau, Power BI and Qlik
Excellent collaboration and stakeholder management skills.
Proficiency in English is required; Swedish is preferred.
Degree in a quantitative discipline such as engineering, economics, statistics, or similar.


It's a Plus If You Have


Experience in SQL, Python and R.
Experience in Credit Risk within a bank or niche-bank.
Certified Data Analyst in Tableau.


NOBA is an equal opportunity employer. We encourage applications from candidates of all backgrounds and experiences. In addition to this, it is important to us that you recognize yourself in our values: we are wholehearted, we collaborate and we take the lead. NOBA is an inclusive workplace that strives for diversity - we welcome all applicants regardless of who you are!

Practical Information

Start: By agreement

Location: G√§vlegatan 22, Stockholm

Form of Employment: Permanent employment (with a 6-month probationary period)

Extent: Full-time

Working Hours: 08:30-17:00 (June-August: 08:30-16:00)

What happens when you have submitted your application?

The number of steps in the recruitment process may vary depending on the position you are applying for, but we always try to keep the process as short and concise as possible, to protect your application experience. Typically, you can expect two interviews before reference and background checks. You can read more about how our recruitment process works in the FAQ.

If you have any questions or concerns about the position, please contact the responsible recruiter Sarah Wahlstedt Corm√©ry at sarah.wahlstedt.cormery@nordax.se

We look forward to receiving your application! üôè‚ú®

HTML:
Join NOBA, a leading financial institution, as a Business Intelligence Specialist within Group Portfolio Analytics. This role provides a unique opportunity to gain comprehensive insights into the entire banking process within a niche-banking environment.

About The Role

As a Business Intelligence Specialist, you will play a crucial role in quantitative credit risk analysis, contributing to the creation of best-in-class credit risk reporting spanning from acquisition to write-off for the entire Group. This includes both Bank Norwegian and Nordax, along with various products. With NOBA's exciting journey ahead, you will have the flexibility to tailor your work according to your interests and level of seniority.

Key Responsibilities

  • Build best in class reporting infrastructure to monitor credit risk across portfolios and identify gaps in credit underwriting.
  • Improve the efficiency of data flows from the data warehouse to Tableau
  • Improve existing and develop new Tableau reports
  • Work closely with various teams including IFRS9, Credit Risk & Analytics, Collections, Business Development, Finance and Risk Control.
  • Report to the Group Head of Portfolio Analytics.

Key Requirements

  • Strong knowledge of SAS or SQL
  • Proactive with a solution-oriented mindset.
  • Proficient in business intelligence (BI) tools like; Tableau, Power BI and Qlik
  • Excellent collaboration and stakeholder management skills.
  • Proficiency in English is required; Swedish is preferred.
  • Degree in a quantitative discipline such as engineering, economics, statistics, or similar.

It's a Plus If You Have

  • Experience in SQL, Python and R.
  • Experience in Credit Risk within a bank or niche-bank.
  • Certified Data Analyst in Tableau.

NOBA is an equal opportunity employer. We encourage applications from candidates of all backgrounds and experiences. In addition to this, it is important to us that you recognize yourself in our values: we are wholehearted, we collaborate and we take the lead. NOBA is an inclusive workplace that strives for diversity - we welcome all applicants regardless of who you are!

Practical Information

Start: By agreement

Location: G√§vlegatan 22, Stockholm

Form of Employment: Permanent employment (with a 6-month probationary period)

Extent: Full-time

Working Hours: 08:30-17:00 (June-August: 08:30-16:00)

What happens when you have submitted your application?

The number of steps in the recruitment process may vary depending on the position you are applying for, but we always try to keep the process as short and concise as possible, to protect your application experience. Typically, you can expect two interviews before reference and background checks. You can read more about how our recruitment process works in the FAQ.

If you have any questions or concerns about the position, please contact the responsible recruiter Sarah Wahlstedt Corm√©ry at sarah.wahlstedt.cormery@nordax.se

We look forward to receiving your application! üôè‚ú®

Nordax Bank protects your privacy and, with reference to the GDPR, would like to ask you not to include any sensitive personal data in your application. Examples of sensitive personal data can be information about ethnic origin, political opinions, religious beliefs or information about your health, such as sick leave.

Title: Senior Data analyst
Description:
Hej, Truecaller is calling you from Stockholm, Sweden! Ready to pick up?

Our goal is to make communication smarter, safer, and more efficient, all while building trust everywhere. We're all about bringing you smart services with a big social impact, keeping you safe from fraud, harassment, scam calls, or messages, so you can focus on the conversations that matter.


Top 20 most downloaded apps globally, and world‚Äôs #1 caller ID and spam-blocking service for Android and iOS, with extensive AI capabilities, with more than 400 million active users per month.
Founded in 2009 with an impressive year-on-year growth with high profitability, listed on Nasdaq OMX Stockholm, Large Cap.
Founded in 2009, listed on Nasdaq OMX Stockholm and is categorized as a Large Cap. Our focus on innovation, operational excellence, sustainable growth, and collaboration has resulted in consistently high profitability and strong EBITDA margins.
A team of 400 people from ~35 different nationalities spread across our headquarters in Stockholm and offices in Bangalore, Mumbai, Gurgaon, and Tel Aviv with high ambitions.


As a Senior Data Analyst, you will be working with a cross-functional team. You help the team understand user verification trends, analyze usage patterns, and participate in the product discovery process to help build the right features that deliver value.

What Will You Work On


Create and analyze verification and fraud management metrics to identify opportunities for growth and cost optimization.
Utilize data to inform and help direct the product design process by providing a clear data narrative and a deep understanding of user needs.
Design and develop reports and dashboards to track user account verification and fraud management metrics.
Create and manage ETL pipelines.
Analyze the impact of changes to product design and AB tests and communicate results to stakeholders.


What we expect from you:


Natural drive to uncover the ‚Äúwhy‚Äù behind data trends, understand underlying business problems, and find solutions
At least 4 years of experience doing quantitative analysis
Expertise in business intelligence visualization tools, such as Google Data Studio, Looker, QlikSense, Tableau, PowerBI, etc
Experience in using SQL to extract, transform, and analyze data
Experience in CI/CD and Git
Work closely with stakeholders across the business to identify and act on opportunities to generate business value.
Ability to communicate the results of your analysis in a clear and effective manner
Good applied statistics skills, such as distributions, statistical testing, regression, etc.
Ability to initiate and drive projects to completion with minimal guidance
Good communication skills in English


It would be great if you also have:


Good scripting and programming skills
Experience with Python, Spark, and Airflow
Experience with data from mobile applications


Life at Truecaller - Behind the code: https://www.instagram.com/lifeattruecaller/

Sounds like your dream job?

We will fill the position as soon as we find the right candidate, so please send your application as soon as possible. As part of the recruitment process, we will conduct a background check.

This position is based in Stockholm, Sweden.

We only accept applications in English.

What we offer:


A smart, talented, and agile team: An international team where ~35 nationalities are working together in several locations and time zones with a learning, sharing, and fun environment.
A great compensation package: Competitive salary, 30 days of paid vacation, flexible working hours, private health insurance, parental leave top-up, pension contribution, Udemy membership to keep learning and improving, and free gym membership.
Great tech tools: Pick the computer and phone you most fancy within our budget ranges.
Do it your way: We work in the office on Tuesdays, Wednesdays, and Thursdays with flexibility on the other days.
Office life: Enjoy your days with a wide range of yummy snacks and beverages, and have fun in our playroom! As well as in our exciting company parties and team activities such as Lab days, Running team, and Geek lunch!


Come as you are:

Truecaller is diverse, equal, and inclusive. We need a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, beliefs, and experiences to keep building our great products. No matter where you are based, which language you speak, your accent, race, religion, color, nationality, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, etc. All those things make you who you are, and that‚Äôs why we would love to meet you.

Title: Group Insights Analyst
Description:
At Strawberry, we're on a quest to redefine the hospitality experience through innovation & technology. In 2023 we launched our new mother brand, Strawberry, and we are transforming from a traditional hotel company to become a universe of offers and experiences towards our guests and customers. This will result in many new interesting development areas in the upcoming years and an opportunity to influence the company's future.

We are now seeking a dedicated and skilled Group Insights Analyst to join our Insights & Analytics team. You will play a critical role in enhancing our group reporting processes. You will focus on ensuring accurate data collection and analysis, contributing to detailed reports that reflect the overall performance and financial health of the organization.

What You Will Be Doing

Supporting Group Reporting Initiatives

Assisting in the development and maintenance of group reporting systems, ensuring that data from various sources is accurately compiled and presented. This includes working closely with Senior Analysts to deliver timely and accurate reports to stakeholders.

Data Collection and Analysis

Gathering data from multiple departments and external sources, conducting thorough analyses to identify trends, patterns, and insights that support business decisions. The Group Insights Analyst will be responsible for preparing and presenting data in a clear and concise manner.

Collaboration With Cross-Functional Teams

Working with HQ, Hotel and Technology Teams to understand their data needs and ensure that reporting tools and analyses meet those requirements. The Group Insights Analyst will translate these needs into actionable data queries and reports.

Maintenance And Optimization Of Reporting Tools

Supporting the upkeep and improvement of existing reporting tools and dashboards, ensuring they remain user-friendly, accurate, and aligned with the organization‚Äôs goals. This involves routine checks and updates to ensure optimal performance.

Data Quality Assurance

Assisting in the implementation of data quality checks to ensure the accuracy and reliability of the data used in reports. The Group Insights Analyst will help identify and resolve data discrepancies and ensure consistent data usage across the organization.

Learning and Development

Continuously improving technical skills and staying up-to-date with the latest data analysis tools and techniques. The Group Insights Analyst will participate in training sessions and actively seek opportunities to enhance their analytical capabilities.

We Believe You Have Experience With

Data analysis and reporting, with ability to collect, consolidate, and analyze data from multiple sources to create accurate and insightful reports.

Ability to collaborate effectively in cross-functional teams, working closely with different stakeholders (finance, operations, and technology) to understand their data needs and deliver actionable insights.

Cross-functional communication and stakeholder engagement, with ability to effectively communicate complex data insights to non-technical stakeholders can be developed, fostering a more data-informed culture within the organization.

Strong attention to detail and data quality assurance, with an expertise in ensuring data accuracy and reliability through meticulous data validation and quality checks.

We Think That These Qualifications Will Be Important


BSc/BA in Computer Science, Engineering or relevant field
Minimum 4-6 years of experience within relevant field
Proficiency in data visualization tools (e.g. Power BI etc)
Working knowledge of Data Warehouses and SQL (e.g. Snowflake etc)


What We Offer


A truly unique opportunity to be a part of a success story. In five years, you will proudly say ‚Äúwe did that‚Äù.
A flat organization with trust and autonomy in your work. We are rebels that support innovation without imposing strict corporate rules.
Professional development and growth opportunities.
Plenty of social events including smaller gatherings with your team and huge get-togethers with the whole Strawberry family!
Great benefits! In addition to our collective agreement, we also offer staff discounts and friends & family rates at our 200+ hotels.


The office is our primary work location, we offer a hybrid working model for a more flexible working life. The HQ in Stockholm or Oslo will be your base for this position.

Sounds interesting?

Great, because we would love to get to know you too! Bring your individuality and your potential, Strawberry welcomes all!

Interviews will be held on a rolling basis, don‚Äôt wait to submit your application!
Show more
HTML:
At Strawberry, we're on a quest to redefine the hospitality experience through innovation & technology. In 2023 we launched our new mother brand, Strawberry, and we are transforming from a traditional hotel company to become a universe of offers and experiences towards our guests and customers. This will result in many new interesting development areas in the upcoming years and an opportunity to influence the company's future.

We are now seeking a dedicated and skilled Group Insights Analyst to join our Insights & Analytics team. You will play a critical role in enhancing our group reporting processes. You will focus on ensuring accurate data collection and analysis, contributing to detailed reports that reflect the overall performance and financial health of the organization.

What You Will Be Doing

Supporting Group Reporting Initiatives

Assisting in the development and maintenance of group reporting systems, ensuring that data from various sources is accurately compiled and presented. This includes working closely with Senior Analysts to deliver timely and accurate reports to stakeholders.

Data Collection and Analysis

Gathering data from multiple departments and external sources, conducting thorough analyses to identify trends, patterns, and insights that support business decisions. The Group Insights Analyst will be responsible for preparing and presenting data in a clear and concise manner.

Collaboration With Cross-Functional Teams

Working with HQ, Hotel and Technology Teams to understand their data needs and ensure that reporting tools and analyses meet those requirements. The Group Insights Analyst will translate these needs into actionable data queries and reports.

Maintenance And Optimization Of Reporting Tools

Supporting the upkeep and improvement of existing reporting tools and dashboards, ensuring they remain user-friendly, accurate, and aligned with the organization‚Äôs goals. This involves routine checks and updates to ensure optimal performance.

Data Quality Assurance

Assisting in the implementation of data quality checks to ensure the accuracy and reliability of the data used in reports. The Group Insights Analyst will help identify and resolve data discrepancies and ensure consistent data usage across the organization.

Learning and Development

Continuously improving technical skills and staying up-to-date with the latest data analysis tools and techniques. The Group Insights Analyst will participate in training sessions and actively seek opportunities to enhance their analytical capabilities.

We Believe You Have Experience With

Data analysis and reporting, with ability to collect, consolidate, and analyze data from multiple sources to create accurate and insightful reports.

Ability to collaborate effectively in cross-functional teams, working closely with different stakeholders (finance, operations, and technology) to understand their data needs and deliver actionable insights.

Cross-functional communication and stakeholder engagement, with ability to effectively communicate complex data insights to non-technical stakeholders can be developed, fostering a more data-informed culture within the organization.

Strong attention to detail and data quality assurance, with an expertise in ensuring data accuracy and reliability through meticulous data validation and quality checks.

We Think That These Qualifications Will Be Important

  • BSc/BA in Computer Science, Engineering or relevant field
  • Minimum 4-6 years of experience within relevant field
  • Proficiency in data visualization tools (e.g. Power BI etc)
  • Working knowledge of Data Warehouses and SQL (e.g. Snowflake etc)

What We Offer

  • A truly unique opportunity to be a part of a success story. In five years, you will proudly say ‚Äúwe did that‚Äù.
  • A flat organization with trust and autonomy in your work. We are rebels that support innovation without imposing strict corporate rules.
  • Professional development and growth opportunities.
  • Plenty of social events including smaller gatherings with your team and huge get-togethers with the whole Strawberry family!
  • Great benefits! In addition to our collective agreement, we also offer staff discounts and friends & family rates at our 200+ hotels.

The office is our primary work location, we offer a hybrid working model for a more flexible working life. The HQ in Stockholm or Oslo will be your base for this position.

Sounds interesting?

Great, because we would love to get to know you too! Bring your individuality and your potential, Strawberry welcomes all!

Interviews will be held on a rolling basis, don‚Äôt wait to submit your application!

Title: Data Analyst for CBRE Sweden
Description:
Stockholm - Stockholms lan - Sweden

Data Analyst for CBRE Sweden


Are you looking for a position in data analysis and have a connection to the real estate market? Then this could be the job for you! We at CBRE give you a unique opportunity to combine your analytical skills with a meaningful role within a commercial environment!

About The Role


The real estate market is undergoing an exciting and significant change driven by data and technology. We therefore need to expand our research team in Stockholm with a new colleague. The main focus of this role will be to collect, verify and upload data generated within our business areas as well as data collected from other open sources. In the role, you will establish contact with the local team as well as provide support to the continental European (CE) research platform. This is an exciting opportunity for you to gain your expertise about the commercial real estate and how the market trends and economy impact values for properties.

Your Main Responsibilities



Prepare regular and quarterly research reports and presentations for internal and external purposes and further enhancement of these.
Review and evaluate collected Swedish commercial real estate data and secure data quality, consistency, accuracy, and comprehensiveness.
Automate manual tasks and reports by making intelligent use of available ETL and dashboarding software.
Contribute to the rollout of the Core Enablement Platform in Sweden in collaboration with the CE Digital & Technology team.
Provide data-driven input into Thought Leadership program in Sweden.


We believe that you will succeed with us if you have:



A bachelor's degree in Real Estate, Economics, Finance, or Data Analysis.
Relevant professional experience from an analytical, data-driven, or quantitative role.
Basic knowledge of some of the following technologies: Alteryx, Python, R, SQL or similar, as well as a motivation to learn and further develop these skills.
Basic knowledge of reporting tools such as Tableau and Power BI and enjoys transforming data.
Possess strong numerical skills, including the ability to manage and manipulate large amounts of numerical data into clear results based on a project-based approach.
Proactive and innovative approach to problem-solving, ability to be self-oriented, and being able to prioritize workload on own initiative.
Fluent in English and preferably Swedish.


Are you interested?


Then we look forward to your application! Make sure to register your application on our website. Selection and interviews take place continuously.

Do you want to know more about us?


CBRE Group, Inc. (NYSE:CBRE), a Fortune 500 and S&P 500 company headquartered in Dallas, is the world‚Äôs largest commercial real estate services and investment firm (based on 2023 revenue). The company has more than 130,000 employees (including Turner & Townsend employees) serving clients in more than 100 countries.

CBRE offers a diverse range of clients with an integrated suite of services, including facilities, transaction and project management; property management; investment management; appraisal and valuation; property leasing; strategic consulting; property sales; mortgage services and development services. Please visit our website at www.cbre.com.

Service line: Advisory Segment

Title: Business Intelligence Lead
Description:
Company Description

We're proud to be one of the fastest-growing casino groups in Sweden, driven by a tight-knit team of industry veterans. Our success stems from innovative thinking and smart strategies, and we're always looking for new ways to stay ahead in this dynamic industry. As we embark on our next chapter, we're expanding our team and setting the stage for the future. We believe in continuous learning, embracing challenges, and creating a workspace that inspires and excites.




If you're ready to take a chance and be part of an exciting journey, we invite you to join us in shaping the future of gaming!




Role Description

As our Business Intelligence Lead, you won‚Äôt just be creating dashboards and reports on demand‚Äîyou‚Äôll be an integral part of shaping our data-driven culture. You‚Äôll have the autonomy to define what metrics matter most, how they‚Äôre tracked, and why they‚Äôre important. Your insights will directly influence business decisions, and your ideas will help us continuously improve our operations.




You‚Äôll collaborate with various teams across the company, from product development to customer support, to understand their data needs, develop tailored solutions, and dig into data to uncover actionable insights. This role is less about having a particular set of technical skills and more about bringing a fresh perspective, challenging the status quo, and driving innovation.




We prioritize finding the right fit for our team over specific past experiences. While we value what you‚Äôve done before, we‚Äôre more interested in your passion, character, and alignment with our company values‚Äîqualities we believe are crucial to your success in this role.




What You'll Be Doing

Take ownership of problem-solving, data analysis, and answering business questions using tools like Excel/Sheets, SQL, Python, Superset, or any other affordable tools you're skilled with.
Develop and maintain dashboards and reports to monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) and support strategic decision-making.
Partner with cross-functional teams to define business challenges, gather requirements, identify data sources, and select the best tools to address these challenges.
Analyze data to identify patterns and trends, providing insights that optimize business processes and drive efficiency.
Serve as the company‚Äôs go-to expert for data and analytics, becoming the trusted resource for data-driven decision-making.
Design and maintain data models that support both tactical and strategic decision-making across the organization.
Ensure data quality and integrity by implementing and overseeing data governance processes.




Qualifications

At least two years of experience in data analysis, creating visualizations, and leveraging analytics to support business decisions.
Strong interpersonal skills, with the ability to build relationships and communicate effectively with both technical and non-technical colleagues.
Expertise in creating impactful visualizations that clearly communicate insights, whether for presentations, reports, or dashboards.
A proactive approach to your work, taking ownership of processes and outcomes, and using your experience to craft solutions and solve complex problems.




What We Offer

Be part of a forward-thinking, innovative team that‚Äôs setting the pace in the gaming industry.
Work in a collaborative environment where your insights and ideas are valued and have a direct impact on the company‚Äôs success.
Enjoy a vibrant and supportive workplace that fosters growth, creativity, and a shared commitment to excellence.
A competitive salary and incentive program
Frequent and generous company events
Possibility to work abroad (Malta)

Title: Quantitative Researcher
Description:
Entry Level and Senior Quantitative Researchers




Vertex Search are working exclusively with a systematic trading firm with offices in Stockholm, who are looking to hire Quantitative Researchers into the organisation at various experience levels. They offer great starting salaries and a large degree of flexibility in their hybrid work setup, as well as wide exposure to the full research and technology setup.




This role will report to the Head of Research and the successful candidate will work alongside the existing growing team of researchers. They are looking for researchers to help them expand their understanding of market dynamics, and to build quantitative trading systems & strategies.




Their researchers work with large, complex datasets and have the freedom to explore their own ideas. New starters will receive close mentoring and training from world-class Quants as they develop their skills, and they are also looking for experienced Quants to assist with such mentoring.




Required Skills and Experience




The ideal candidate will have the following:




A PhD in a quantitative subject, ideally mathematics, physics, economics or similar
Some fluency in your programming language of choice (they use Python for research)
Ability to apply technical skills in order to understand complex market forces and create robust future predictions
Enthusiasm for working in a growing team with a high level of collaboration across the entire end-to-end trading system
A collaborative mindset with excellent communication & teamwork skills




Nice to haves:




A demonstrable interest in global financial markets, ideally evidenced by internships or career choices
Exposure to systematic or discretionary equities trading
Experience of mentoring or leading a small team or researchers




Benefits




Great starting salaries
Discretionary annual bonus scheme
Private healthcare and dental plan
Critical illness cover
Pension scheme
Cycle to work scheme
Hybrid working with the ability to WFH up to 3 days per week




Vertex Search Ltd is acting as a recruitment agency on this engagement.

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
Scania Trucks - Business Intelligence and Analytics

Do you want to solve complex problems and test bold hypotheses? To you want to be a pioneer, taking Scania Trucks into the age of data? Do you want to further accelerate the solutions journey, completely centering around our customers ‚Äì both in terms of sustainability and profitability? Then you think like us.

Do you also like reaching objectives as a team, having peers to bounce ideas with and a team spirit where we support each other? Then you will enjoy working with us!

Who we are

Scania Trucks is picking up speed in the solution provider journey, customer collaboration journey and data journey, and our team ‚ÄòBusiness Intelligence and Analytics‚Äô is at the fore front. We develop new ways of working and we provide insights to teams around us. We do this by connecting the so far unconnected data and we are slowly moving into the predictive arena. As Scania Trucks is responsible for the whole trucks business, sales volume and profitability of both vehicles and services, the impact of our work is both important and immediate.

About The Role

We are now looking for the successor of one of our consultants who has been the technical backbone in our team. As part of Scania Trucks so we work in the center of the business, in very close cooperation with all business owners. The work mostly aims at getting tools and reports in place building on Power BI and Power Apps, and includes everything from getting the data connections in place to the design of dash boards. It also includes coaching our more business oriented Business Intelligence Analysts in technical questions. The overall objectives are to increase process automation and our ability to make good data driven decisions.

Role summary


Expert developer of Data Models, Power BI reports, Power Apps tools and other process automation tools
Technical expert co-creating Power BI reports, Power Apps tools and other process automation tools
Partner in other analyses, where your knowledge in the available data, data models, APIs and you creative mind will lead to better conclusions and decisions
Active driver of a harmonized and accessible infrastructure, that facilitates connections of data between data sources


Who you are

To be successful, you combine the relevant technical development competencies with personal skills in both coaching business owners to be good stake holders and in co-developing with other Business Intelligence Managers. You are patient, methodological, pedagogical and humble towards the importance of different stakeholders‚Äô areas of competency. Being a team player is central. You probably have experience from the IT landscape of Scania or another big company.

You strive to build wide contact networks with long term relationships through good team work, communication, structure and trust. A great passion for the success of Scania‚Äôs customers and for our ability to meet the Science Based Targets is a plus!

You have skills in Power BI, advanced DAX, Power Query M, SQL and data models and it‚Äôs an advantage if you also know Power Apps, Python, Snowflake/Dremio or similar and Power BI Service.

You have a Master‚Äôs Degree in Data Science or similar education and practical experience. You are more than five years into your career and are looking for your next big challenge.

If you think that you are suitable for this position, we encourage you to apply as soon as possible. At Scania Trucks Business Intelligence and Analytics we celebrate difference and care deeply about diversity and inclusion ‚Äì if you do not match all the requirements, please demonstrate how your passion, attitude and interest in the success of Scania‚Äôs customers and our ability to meet the science based targets might compensate for this!

For any questions, please contact Karl-Johan Priem at karl-johan.priem@scania.com, please apply latest by 18 September.

  • Active driver of a harmonized and accessible infrastructure, that facilitates connections of data between data sources

Who you are

To be successful, you combine the relevant technical development competencies with personal skills in both coaching business owners to be good stake holders and in co-developing with other Business Intelligence Managers. You are patient, methodological, pedagogical and humble towards the importance of different stakeholders‚Äô areas of competency. Being a team player is central. You probably have experience from the IT landscape of Scania or another big company.

You strive to build wide contact networks with long term relationships through good team work, communication, structure and trust. A great passion for the success of Scania‚Äôs customers and for our ability to meet the Science Based Targets is a plus!

You have skills in Power BI, advanced DAX, Power Query M, SQL and data models and it‚Äôs an advantage if you also know Power Apps, Python, Snowflake/Dremio or similar and Power BI Service.

You have a Master‚Äôs Degree in Data Science or similar education and practical experience. You are more than five years into your career and are looking for your next big challenge.

If you think that you are suitable for this position, we encourage you to apply as soon as possible. At Scania Trucks Business Intelligence and Analytics we celebrate difference and care deeply about diversity and inclusion ‚Äì if you do not match all the requirements, please demonstrate how your passion, attitude and interest in the success of Scania‚Äôs customers and our ability to meet the science based targets might compensate for this!

For any questions, please contact Karl-Johan Priem at karl-johan.priem@scania.com, please apply latest by 18 September.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Do you want to work with lots of data, use modern technology and join a passionate and fun team of individuals working in the streaming industry?

Do you want to be part of building a more data-driven and personalised user experience in one of Sweden's and Finland‚Äôs largest commercial media houses?

The TV viewing patterns have changed with the transition from linear channel broadcasts to online streaming consumption, where users have become more active in choosing when, how and what content they watch. We in the data team want to leverage this new type of data to improve the experience of our customers. Some of our interests include


personalised user experiences.
enable targets advertising for online streaming.
provision a centralised and modern data environment for analytics and various intelligence teams.


For achieving this, we work to identify, collect and harmonise vast amounts of data; ranging from user behaviour to content metadata.

Does this sound like an exciting challenge?

We are a Nordic team of data engineers, measurement engineers, ML-engineers and data scientists who have worked to build a rich data platform using modern technologies such as Amazon Web Services, Apache AirFlow, TensorFlow, Snowflake, Terraform, and more! We have freedom and responsibility to choose the solution according to the problem to be solved, such as data cleaning and transformation a vary of different incoming data sources.

We work together and iteratively develop our solutions and openly discuss different alternatives. We need to expand our Nordic data team with a driven data engineer who loves programming and new technology and has a passion for data pipelines. As a data engineer you will assume great ownership of the platform, develop batch and stream pipelines and architect data centric solutions with Amazon state of the art toolbox at your disposal. If you want to be part of our TV journey, come join us!

Who are you?

We believe that you are comfortable in Python and SQL and modern software development methods. You want to stay up to date on how the languages develop, and at the same time want to learn new skills and tools. You like challenges such as loading large amounts of data in a time-optimal and distributed way, handling data of unknown quality in a fail-safe way, secure processing and storage of sensitive data, or clever transformations that make data more useful. You like working in teams, both during the design, development and verification of a solution. If you already have knowledge of amazon web services and Snowflake to building data pipelines, that is a big plus!

Who are we?

TV Media is a business area within Telia Company that runs and develop TV content and the next generation TV solutions. Our consumer brands include TV4 Play, MTV Katsomo, tv4.se, MTV Uutiset, Fotbollskanalen.se and K√∂ket.se. TV Media develops the best features and is an openminded technical organisation, all with full speed ahead.

If you are interested in working with modern technologies, in a product with huge potential and being part of one of our passionate teams, then this is the place to be!

About Us

We bring all of Sweden together with our engaging news, great entertainment, live sports, and high-class drama series. TV4 Play and our other sites are visited by millions of people every day. Our content is the obvious choice both to enjoy on your own and together with others. Wherever and whenever you want.

TV4 stands on a foundation of independent journalism, our focus on our users and giving the whole of Sweden experiences to gather around.

Interested?

If you are interested in joining the team, apply for the job! If you want to learn more or have any questions, please reach out to me at josef.eriksson@tv4.se

Selection is ongoing, so do not hesitate to get in touch.

Required controls will be performed.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Job Description:

Merkle Sweden - a Dentsu company is a consultancy firm with expertise in the areas of digital analytics and conversion optimization. We help large corporations and organizations collect, interpret, and act on data from their digital touchpoints, such as apps and websites, and use the data to make their communications and marketing efforts more hard-hitting.

Our extensive experience and deep proficiency in Google Analytics 360 and Google Optimize mean that our clients rely on us for their most complex, challenging assignments.

Job Description:

Merkle is looking for a driven specialist with a huge interest in data and analytics. You‚Äôll be based in either Gothenburg or Stockholm.


Implement metrics for clients and provide regular analysis.
Give recommendations for measurement solutions for digital services based on clients‚Äô business and activity goals.
Maintain and develop a strong know-how of Google Marketing Platform in general and Google Analytics 360 in particular. Other measurement tools may be used.
Provide insights and recommendations that improve clients‚Äô activities and business.
Develop data-visualization solutions (in dashboards) that make it possible for clients to follow sales and other important performance indicators in real time.



Qualifications:


Minimum of 3 years‚Äô experience in similar role
Experience working with large amounts of data and an understanding of SQL and databases.
In-depth knowledge of working with Google Analytics data, being an advanced user.
Presentation skills to both large and small groups of varying degrees of knowledge, internally within the Group and also with clients.
Ability to manage different work tasks and projects and prioritize accordingly as you will be working with several clients and projects at the same time.
Ability to work with data analysis and provide accurate recommendations based on data.
Knowledge of data-visualization tools, formal statistics training, and experience with Google Cloud (especially BigQuery) are desirable.
Good communication skills in Swedish and English, both in speaking and writing.



Some of the Perks We Offer:


We have a collective agreement and attractive benefits. Several years in a row, we have won the DI Gasell Award, won the M√§stargasellen Award, and been named a ‚ÄúSuperf√∂retag‚Äù (Super Company) by Veckans Aff√§rer and Bisnode.
Friendly, knowledgeable colleagues who like to share their knowledge.
Possibility to work with multinational companies in a number of different industries, meaning you get a wide range of experience and the chance to work with different data sets.
Working for a certified reseller of several Google Marketing Platform products and working closely with Google in Sweden, England, Ireland, and the United States. We are the biggest player in the Nordics when it comes to Google Analytics 360.
Continuous personal development in the form of lab days, groups exchanging experiences, and your own professional development budget.
The chance to grow both within your area of specialty and within Dentsu, the global network Merkle Northern Europe is a part of.



Inclusion and Diversity:

Our diverse and inclusive culture enables our employees to bring their whole selves to work and be proud of doing so. For us, this is the foundation for great innovation which, in turn, generates better outcomes for our people, partners and communities. This is why we encourage applications from people with disabilities, and of all ages, nationalities, backgrounds and cultures.

We are happy to discuss flexible and agile approaches to working for all our roles ‚Äì we can‚Äôt promise we will be able to offer you everything you want or need but we do promise to discuss it with you openly and honestly. If you have any reasonable adjustment needs arising from a disability or medical condition to fully participate in the recruitment process, please discuss this with our recruitment teams.

About dentsu:

Dentsu Group is a global marketing communications company headquartered in Tokyo, Japan. It is one of the largest advertising and media firms in the world. The company offers a wide range of services in advertising, marketing, communication, and digital media, catering to clients across various industries.

We help clients to win, keep, and grow their best customers and achieve meaningful progress for their businesses with the best-in-class services and solutions in media, CXM, and creative. For more information please see: www.dentsu.com.

Working with us:

Joining dentsu, you‚Äôll join a team of 72,000 people. It‚Äôs‚ÄØan‚ÄØopportunity to produce career-defining work. Along the way, you‚Äôll team up with inspiring colleagues and encounter a richness of clients, cultures, and experiences.‚ÄØ We offer exciting challenges, a great working environment, memorable experiences, and opportunities to shape your future.

Contact:

We look forward to receiving your application for any questions, please contact the TA in charge of this role: Thomas Holley, Talent Acquisition Partner, EMEA, NE by email at: Thomas.holley@dentsu.com or by phone at: +45 53 84 75 82

Title: Data Analyst for Ventures and New Business
Description:
About Us

Everyone working at Scania is united by a common purpose: Driving the shift towards a sustainable transport system. We know that the transport industry must change, and it‚Äôs a change we want to lead. Scania‚Äôs continuous transformative work within circularity, electrification and autonomy shows commercial ideas, powerful insights and competencies that make real change happen.

Ventures and New Business at Scania have a key role in driving the shift and contributing to this vision. We develop and deliver new businesses, supporting Scania‚Äôs long-term growth and profitability ambitions. At Ventures and New Business, we develop complementing solutions to our core and build new growth through ventures and investments that strengthen and support our acceleration, driving the shift. We want to engage and inspire our entire organisation to create results together with us, and collaboration and entrepreneurial spirit are part of our culture and what makes us successful.

We are today a team of approximate 45+ people and have five ventures. Our office space is very central at Drottninggatan in Stockholm.

Job Description

As a Venture Data Analyst you will play a crucial role in supporting the growth and success of new business ventures by providing actionable insights through data analysis. By collecting, analysing, and interpreting data you will help guide strategic decisions and optimise business performance.

Reporting to our Tech Domain Manager, you will be aligned with one of our ventures while also working closely with other colleagues within your domain to share expertise and best practices.

Key responsibilities

In the role of Data Analyst for a venture your key responsibilites will be:


Data Collection and Management: Gathering, cleaning, and maintaining data from various sources to ensure accuracy and reliability for analysis.
Data Analysis: Conducting thorough data analysis to identify trends, patterns, and insights that inform business strategies and decision-making.
Reporting and Visualisation: Creating clear and compelling reports, dashboards, and visualisations to communicate analytical findings to stakeholders.
Performance Monitoring: Tracking key performance indicators (KPIs) and metrics to monitor the health and progress of business ventures.
Market Research: Conducting market research and competitor analysis to provide context and support strategic planning.
Collaboration: Working closely with cross-functional teams, including product development, marketing, and finance, to align data insights with business objectives.
Recommendations: Providing actionable recommendations based on data analysis to help optimise operations, improve customer experience, and drive growth.


About You

We seek someone with strong experience within data analytics. It is important that you are a positive influence and a good collaborator as you will interact with a wide array of internal and external stakeholders. Good communication skills are also key since you will be interacting closely with business executives both across the company and externally. You are a goal-oriented doer and a team player that loves to see how our business is growing.

We Also Believe That You (requirements)


Have a master‚Äôs degree in Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics or similar field.
Bring 3+ years of experience in the analytics field, experience within the logistic industry is a plus.
Possess a high degree of autonomy and can work independently on complex analyses.
Have a solid and broad analytical skills-set including the ability to use statistical methods.
Are proficient in using data extraction tools.
Have experience working with BI tools such as QlikSense or Tableau.
Thrive in in a fast-growing company.
Are fluent in English


What We Offer

We offer you the chance to be part of an organisation that is focused on reaching Scania‚Äôs targets and truly driving the shift to a sustainable transport system. Joining our team you will get to enjoy the flexibility and agility of a startup enviroment while benefiting from the stability and security of being employed by one of Sweden's largest companies.‚ÄØ With the opportunities of the current transformative changes within the transport industry, we are on a very exciting journey. This is the right time to join us!

Information and application

Questions about the role? Contact linda.rosenqvist@scania.com

We are working with an ongoing selection; please apply as soon as possible if you are interested, but no later than 2024-10-07.

Kindly note that a background check might be conducted for this position.

Scania is one of Sweden's largest companies and offers trucks and buses for heavy transport in combination with a wide range of product-related services. Our mission is to drive the transition to a sustainable transport system by developing safe, smart and energy-efficient transport solutions that are better for both people and our planet. Today, Scania have around 50,000 employees in around 100 countries. For more information visit Scania.com

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Hej, Truecaller is calling you from Stockholm, Sweden! Ready to pick up?

Our goal is to make communication smarter, safer, and more efficient, all while building trust everywhere. We're all about bringing you smart services with a big social impact, keeping you safe from fraud, harassment, scam calls or messages, so you can focus on the conversations that matter.


Top 20 most downloaded apps globally, and world‚Äôs #1 caller ID and spam-blocking service for Android and iOS, with extensive AI capabilities, with more than 400 million active users per month.
Founded in 2009 with an impressive year-on-year growth with high profitability, listed on Nasdaq OMX Stockholm, Large Cap.
Founded in 2009, listed on Nasdaq OMX Stockholm and is categorized as a Large Cap. Our focus on innovation, operational excellence, sustainable growth, and collaboration has resulted in consistently high profitability and strong EBITDA margins.
A team of 400 people from ~35 different nationalities spread across our headquarters in Stockholm and offices in Bangalore, Mumbai, Gurgaon, and Tel Aviv with high ambitions.


As a Data Engineer, you will play an important role in t which is responsible for building and maintaining a scalable, robust, self-service analytics platform.

What do we expect from you:


Experience working with orchestration tool (ex: Airflow)
Experience working with a large data set
Experience building complex ETL pipelines
Experience working with cloud providers such as GCP, AWS, or Azure
Strong programming skills in Spark with Scala and Python
Experience working with CI/CD tools like Jenkins and Git
Strong understanding of Software Engineering practices and principles
Excellent problem-solving and communication skills
Self-motivated and have a proven ability to take initiative to own the problems that come up and solve them


What Will You Work On


Maintaining and improving the ingestion pipeline to reliably deliver billions of events daily in defined SLA
Provide support for all teams in building and optimizing their complex pipelines
Work closely with other teams to identify pain points and problems around the platform
Develop new tools and frameworks to improve the data platform
Facilitate company-wide to be data-driven
Work in close collaboration with data scientists and data analysts to help support their work in production
Work with vast projects such as building an ML platform and streaming use cases
Setup best practices and processes around software and data development


It would be great if you also have


Working with messaging systems like Kafka
Knowledge in Kubernetes
Hands-on experience with any streaming platform
Experience managing data warehouse in BigQuery or Redshift


Life at Truecaller - Behind the code: https://www.instagram.com/lifeattruecaller/

Sounds like your dream job?

We will fill the position as soon as we find the right candidate, so please send your application as soon as possible. As part of the recruitment process, we will conduct a background check.

This position is based in Stockholm, Sweden.

We only accept applications in English.

What we offer:


A smart, talented, and agile team: An international team where ~35 nationalities are working together in several locations and time zones with a learning, sharing, and fun environment.
A great compensation package: Competitive salary, 30 days of paid vacation, flexible working hours, private health insurance, parental leave top-up, pension contribution, Udemy membership to keep learning and improving, and free gym membership.
Great tech tools: Pick the computer and phone you most fancy within our budget ranges.
Do it your way: We work in the office on Tuesdays, Wednesdays, and Thursdays with flexibility on the other days.
Office life: Enjoy your days with a wide range of yummy snacks and beverages, and have fun in our playroom! As well as in our exciting company parties and team activities such as Lab days, Running team, and Geek lunch!


Come as you are:

Truecaller is diverse, equal, and inclusive. We need a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, beliefs, and experiences to keep building our great products. No matter where you are based, which language you speak, your accent, race, religion, color, nationality, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, etc. All those things make you who you are, and that‚Äôs why we would love to meet you.

Title: Lead Data Engineer
Description:
Company Description

We're an award-winning Google Cloud partner. We're the experts in transforming businesses and shaping the future of cloud technology. Join us and collaborate with top minds, build groundbreaking solutions, and make a real difference for our clients. Enjoy extensive professional development, global reach, and a supportive, Google-inspired culture. If you're passionate about the cloud, this is where you want to be.

With over 13 years of experience in Google Cloud under our belt, offices in 18 countries and more than 600 experts, we have deployed practical innovation alongside Google. We focus on infrastructure modernisation, data management, smart analytics, application modernisation, and AI & machine learning.

Curious about our projects? We got you: Check out our success stories


Job Description

Day-to-day life¬†

Design, develop, and deploy data solutions (think databases, pipelines, and warehouses) ‚Äì tailor-made for clients
Work with team members and Google experts to guide customers to new solutions and through complex data challenges
help junior colleagues become data masters and foster a culture of continuous learning
Work with the latest developments in Google Cloud Platform and continue to develop your expertise
Manage presentations and direct communication with clients, bridging the gap between customers and technical solutions



Want to know more? Check out our people stories on Youtube


Qualifications

We're looking for a data virtuoso with five years of proven experience in designing, developing, and deploying databases, data pipelines, and data warehouses. You'll be a cloud champion who understands data warehousing concepts, setups, and design patterns within the Google Cloud Platform. As a coding mastermind, you'll possess strong SQL and Python or Java skills and a passion for exploring new technologies.¬†



Excellent communication is key ‚Äì you'll build relationships with clients, translate their needs into actionable solutions, and present complex topics with clarity and confidence. Finally, you're a team player at heart, thriving in collaborative environments where you can share knowledge, mentor others, and foster a culture of open communication and support.


Additional Information

Why Choose Devoteam G Cloud?

Own the AI revolution: Dive into the exciting world of Generative AI and ML, playing a pivotal role in shaping projects around Google's groundbreaking Gemini foundation model.
Innovative Impact: Work on the forefront of cloud technology at a globally recognized leader in Google Cloud solutions.
Direct Google Connection: Collaborate closely with Google teams, shaping the future of cloud and AI.

"Partnering with Devoteam has been a highlight of our efforts at Google Cloud. Their dedication and expertise elevate every project we undertake together. It's truly a collaboration that delivers exceptional results." ‚Äî Alexander Percivall, Senior Partner Engineer, Google Cloud Nordics, Stockholm, Sweden.

Company Description

We're an award-winning Google Cloud partner. We're the experts in transforming businesses and shaping the future of cloud technology. Join us and collaborate with top minds, build groundbreaking solutions, and make a real difference for our clients. Enjoy extensive professional development, global reach, and a supportive, Google-inspired culture. If you're passionate about the cloud, this is where you want to be.

With over 13 years of experience in Google Cloud under our belt, offices in 18 countries and more than 600 experts, we have deployed practical innovation alongside Google. We focus on infrastructure modernisation, data management, smart analytics, application modernisation, and AI & machine learning.

Curious about our projects? We got you: Check out our success stories


Job Description

Day-to-day life 
  • Design, develop, and deploy data solutions (think databases, pipelines, and warehouses) ‚Äì tailor-made for clients
  • Work with team members and Google experts to guide customers to new solutions and through complex data challenges
  • help junior colleagues become data masters and foster a culture of continuous learning
  • Work with the latest developments in Google Cloud Platform and continue to develop your expertise
  • Manage presentations and direct communication with clients, bridging the gap between customers and technical solutions


Want to know more? Check out our people stories on Youtube


Qualifications

We're looking for a data virtuoso with five years of proven experience in designing, developing, and deploying databases, data pipelines, and data warehouses. You'll be a cloud champion who understands data warehousing concepts, setups, and design patterns within the Google Cloud Platform. As a coding mastermind, you'll possess strong SQL and Python or Java skills and a passion for exploring new technologies. 



Excellent communication is key ‚Äì you'll build relationships with clients, translate their needs into actionable solutions, and present complex topics with clarity and confidence. Finally, you're a team player at heart, thriving in collaborative environments where you can share knowledge, mentor others, and foster a culture of open communication and support.


Additional Information

Why Choose Devoteam G Cloud?
  • Own the AI revolution: Dive into the exciting world of Generative AI and ML, playing a pivotal role in shaping projects around Google's groundbreaking Gemini foundation model.
  • Innovative Impact: Work on the forefront of cloud technology at a globally recognized leader in Google Cloud solutions.
  • Direct Google Connection: Collaborate closely with Google teams, shaping the future of cloud and AI.
  • Unleash Your Expertise: Thrive in a fast-paced environment where sharing knowledge and success is paramount.
  • End-to-End Impact: Drive complete business transformations, from strategy to implementation and beyond.
  • Accelerate Your Career: Grow within a Google-inspired culture, gaining specialisations and certifications.


"Partnering with Devoteam has been a highlight of our efforts at Google Cloud. Their dedication and expertise elevate every project we undertake together. It's truly a collaboration that delivers exceptional results." ‚Äî Alexander Percivall, Senior Partner Engineer, Google Cloud Nordics, Stockholm, Sweden.

We do plenty of activities, like meet-ups, hackathons, and partnerships. Don‚Äôt lose any of them: follow us on LinkedIn



Benefits
  • Encouragement and support for training and certification, in the form of coaching from other team members, cost coverage, and financial incentives.
  • Challenging and rewarding assignments, many of which are end-to-end.
  • A hybrid work model as standard, with flexible working hours and location to support your work-life balance.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
‚ö°Ô∏è What We Do

Swiftly gaining ground as Sweden‚Äôs industry leader in battery storage and expanding rapidly in selected European markets, Flower is on a mission to enable the energy system of tomorrow.

With industry-leading AI software at its core, our service includes stabilizing the energy system by enhancing predictability and flexibility for both energy producers and consumers. By combining pioneering technology with a portfolio of flexible energy assets, we break new ground towards a fossil-free energy system, allowing clean energy to power society.

üåüThe Team

We're committed to shaping tomorrow's energy system with flexible power at its core. Our ambitious team shares a common goal, working together to create a sustainable future. We are now looking for a passionate and skilled Data Engineer based in Stockholm to fulfill that goal with us.

üë©‚Äçüíª About The Role

We are looking for a passionate, self-driven and dedicated Data Engineer to join our Implementation and Operations team. As a Data Engineer, you will be responsible for designing, building, and maintaining our data pipelines and systems that power our data-driven solutions. You will also work closely with our Data Scientists from the Trading Strategy and Modeling team. Your work will contribute to the development and maintenance of an important stage in our solutions, by making sure that the data travels seamlessly from end to end in our pipelines.

Key Responsibilities


Develop and maintain scalable, robust, and efficient data pipelines
Build and optimize data ingestion and processing systems for structured and unstructured data
Work with the data science team to maintain data models and build and maintain MLOps and ETL pipelines
Implement and maintain data quality checks, validation, and monitoring
Create and maintain CI/CD pipelines in GitHub and AWS
Build and maintain data lake and storage solutions
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define data requirements and develop data-driven solutions
Design and implement data security and privacy controls
Create and maintain documentation of data pipelines, processes, and procedures


Qualifications


3+ years of experience as a Data Engineer or similar role
Strong programming skills in Python and SQL
Familiarity with DevOps practices such as Docker, CI/CD, git, testing
Familiarity with cloud data services, preferably from AWS, such as Lambda
Understanding of data modeling, data storage, and database design
Knowledge of data security and privacy regulations and best practices


üìç Location

We value office collaboration but support some hybrid work. Our office is at S√∂der M√§larstrand, minutes away from Gamla Stan subway station in Stockholm.

üõí Apply

To apply, please submit your resume and a cover letter highlighting your relevant experience and why you feel you would be a great addition to our team. In the recruitment process you will meet with the Talent Acquisition Specialist, Engineering Team, Hiring Manager and the CEO.

Our corporate language is English, as we have over 20 nationalities in the office, so we want you to submit your CV in English.

We look forward to hearing from you!

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
My client is looking for a Data Engineer to help them fully transform their data environment by building out a completely new cloud data platform within Azure. This is an exciting time to join them and lead this project!




The company's main focus is the automotive aftermarket, where they are the partner and distributor of world leading manufacturers of car parts and accessories. Since they've been going for over 70 years and across multiple markets, they're incredibly stable and have a huge amount of data potential at their fingertips; it's all about how they can use modern principals and tools to be become even more data driven and automated.




As the Data Engineer you will play a key role in designing, building and improving/maintaining data flows, while working closely with the business to understand how their data can be used to create genuine business value; both internally and for their customers.




Responsibilities

Design, build and deploy: Develop data solutions that are linked to vehicle and product data, across multiple business units, inc. sales, supply chain, prod management, etc. This looks like robust and efficient data pipelines, working with ETL from various data sources.
Data modelling: Optimizing data structures for effective data management and analysis, while monitoring system performance by identifying and remedying bottlenecks.
Collaboration: Across tech and operations, working closely with stakeholders and other data and tech people who will support in the build of this new data platform.
Keep up to date: Research into and work with the latest trends and best practices, spearheading any new adoption and conversations across the team.




Qualifications

Minimum of 3 years working as a Data Engineer or similar (Software Engineer or ML Engineer) - you should be extremely familiar with data infrastructure (and setting this up in the cloud), data modelling, ETL and how to improve data enviros
Fluency in Python, SQL and Java
Confident working with cloud and most preferably Azure - their tech stack includes Data Factory, Synapse and Fabric, but you will also get a say in any potential new technologies
It's beneficial if you've previously working with ML model production
BSc/MSc in a relevant field
As a person you should be curious, passionate about data and emerging technologies, with great communication skills and the ability to translate business requirements into tech




In this position, you will get a lot of trust to do your own thing and take on a huge amount of responsibility where you can make a lot of your own solutions and have full control over the Data strategy.




Interested in finding out more? Apply with your updated CV.
