Title: Associate Statistics and Data Analysis Officer
Description:
Hardship Level (not applicable for home-based)

H (no hardship)

Family Type (not applicable for home-based)

Family

Staff Member / Affiliate Type

UNOPS IICA1

Target Start Date

2024-10-01

Deadline for Applications

September 16, 2024

Terms of Reference

Title: Associate Statistics and Data Analysis Officer

ICA Level: IICA-1/LICA-9

Duty station: Copenhagen, Denmark

Duration: 01/10/2024 - 31/12/2024 (with possibility of extension)

General Background

UNHCR, the UN Refugee Agency, is a global organization dedicated to saving lives, protecting rights, and building a better future for refugees, forcibly displaced communities, and stateless people.

‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇ

The Statistics, Data Science, and Survey Section (SDSS) located in UNHCR‚Äôs Global Data Service (GDS) in Copenhagen oversees the production of global statistics on forcibly displaced and stateless populations. Access to reliable, timely and accurate data is essential to achieve the aims of the Data Transformation Strategy 2020-2025, that is, to position UNHCR as a trusted leader on data and information related to refugees and other populations of concern. The Section develops external products such as the annual Global Trends report, which analyzes the changes in forced displacement and statelessness and deepens public understanding of ongoing crises, and maintains the Refugee Data Finder, which enables humanitarian workers, decision-makers, researchers, and many more to quickly access data and information on affected populations. The Section ensures that quality and coherent data related to forced displacement is systematically, responsibly, and efficiently collected, analyzed, and presented by UNHCR and its partners.

Increasingly, UNHCR‚Äôs approach to strengthen statistics, data and information systems is based on collaboration and collective efforts with partners and stakeholders, as the optimal way to both ensure the effective use of resources and to achieve outcomes for those affected by forced displacement.

At global level, UNHCR is a member of several multi-stakeholder statistical expert groups, ensuring that forcibly displaced people are visible in global statistical recommendations and reporting, through disaggregation of data by forced displacement status and, through the custodian role of a Sustainable Development Goal (SDG) indicator. SDSS has taken a leading role in the Expert Group on Refugee, IDP and Statelessness Statistics (EGRISS), both as a steering committee member and host of the secretariat. EGRISS is a multistakeholder group, which was established by the UN Statistical Commission in 2016 to develop recommendations to improve official statistics on forced displacement and statelessness. UNHCR coordinates the activities of the group together with other steering committee members, consisting of organizations from country, regional and international levels. In addition, SDSS is co-leading the work of the EGRISS subgroup on capacity building on forced displacement statistics.

The section is a key member of the International Data Alliance for Children on the Move (IDAC), a platform that brings together diverse stakeholders working at the nexus between data and the topics of migration, forced displacement, human mobility, development, and child protection. It is led by a joint Secretariat comprised of UNICEF as Chair, UNHCR, IOM, Eurostat, and OECD. UNHCR is also a member of its capacity building and technical guidance working group.

Through the above-mentioned initiatives, UNHCR works closely with global, regional, and national partners to strengthen capacity on how to collect and compile official statistics on forced displacement and to improve the quality and availability of such statistics. Inclusion of forcibly displaced and stateless people into national, regional, and global statistical production and systems is an important prerequisite for making these groups visible in policy making and programme development and a key component of the Global Compact on Refugees.

Purpose and Scope of Assignment

Working as part of the Statistics, Data Science, and Survey Section, in the Statistical Partnerships and External Engagement team, the Associate Statistics and Data Analysis Officer will focus on the section‚Äôs partnership in IDAC. Through this focus the Associate Statistics and Data Analysis Officer will have a diverse role involving coordination, communication, and capacity building. Main tasks include strengthening national data systems and capabilities, promoting collaborative and innovative data collection and analysis methods, and improving the visibility, availability, accessibility, and usability of statistical data. The incumbent will also be responsible for building strong partnerships and advocating for best practices in data management.

The selected candidate will be responsible for the following tasks and activities:

Coordination and Communication


Support global and regional coordination and communication on IDAC-related activities, in close collaboration with IDAC secretariat members and the UNHCR lead. This includes regular information updates to be shared with UNHCR regional levels through existing channels.
Support the organization of internal and external events focused on data on children and age disaggregation, in collaboration with identified IDAC members. This will include coordination support (e.g. organisation of meetings, documentation of minutes, follow up on workplans), administrative support (e.g. development of TORs, procurement processes, organisation of workshops) and substantive support (e.g. research, writing/editing/presentations) as relevant.
Support in dissemination and publication of IDAC publications, in close collaboration with UNHCR communication team.


Capacity Building


Assist in organizing and delivering training sessions for UNHCR staff, partners, and other stakeholders on age disaggregation and how to improve data on children forced to flee, ensuring linkages with other relevant capacity building initiatives on forced displacement statistics, especially the Expert Group on Refugee, IDP and Statelessness Statistics (EGRISS), Expert Group on Migration Statistics (EGM) and Inter Agency Expert Group on SDG Indicators (IAEG-SDGs).
Support the organization of capacity-building workshops and rollout of capacity-building tools, terminology briefs, and indicator guidance in coordination with other capacity building initiatives, including EGRISS and EGM.
Coordinate national data system strengthening and capacity building work related to age disaggregated displacement data on children, in one selected pilot country, working closely with national statistical partners, other relevant partners and the project team.
Support the development of training materials and tools and as relevant insert age disaggregation language in UNHCR guidance.
Support internal capacity building and information sharing on age disaggregation, relevant terminology, and definitions.


Data Publications


Develop thematic briefings and guidance documents, with a focus on age disaggregation and forced displacement.
Review and provide technical input into relevant publications and other communications and reporting activities, with a focus on innovative and integrated approaches to age disaggregation and data collection on children forced to flee.


Management support


Budget management support, in close collaboration with UNHCR team lead, including creating and maintaining budget planning and management tools, liaising with relevant finance colleagues for expenditure report reviews, and other tasks as relevant.
Act as team-focal point/coordinator for common Microsoft Teams channels and workplanning tools, ensure common workplans are developed and used as agreed by the team.
Contributions monitoring & evaluation activities, with focus on areas of responsibility/expertise.
Active participation in Steering Committee and working group meetings as required.
Other duties as required by the unit.


Travel required


Travel is required both to attend IDAC related events and workshops but also to implement the capacity building data system strengthening pilot work.


Monitoring and Progress Controls

Activity 1: Development of 1 thematic brief based on data from UNHCR Forced Displacement Survey with a focus on children by End of 2024

Deliverable: Thematic brief finalized for dissemination

Activity 2: Coordination of one national data system strengthening and capacity building exercise in a selected country (TBC), working closely with national statistical partners and the project team, particularly UNHCR regional and country level by End of 2024

Deliverable: Development of draft project workplan

Activity 3: Support organization of regional capacity building workshop on forced displacement and age disaggregation by November 2024

Deliverables: Provide (1) support to the overall organization of CB workshop and identified follow up, (2) develop lessons learnt document with focus on innovative and integrated approaches to age disaggregation

Activity 4: Provide technical and financial monitoring support to project lead between 1 October and 31 December

Deliverable: External and internal reports as required

Qualifications And Experience

Education:


University (or Master‚Äôs degree) in statistics, economics, monitoring and evaluation, political science, international policy and development or a relevant field.


Work Experience:


3 years relevant experience in research and data analysis with Undergraduate degree; or 2 years relevant experience with Graduate degree; or 1 year relevant experience with Doctorate degree.
Proven experience in synthetizing complex policy issues and technical writing.
Ability to work in an international environment and under tight deadlines.
Proven experience in capacity building and data system strengthening work with national statistical systems.
Experience working with multi-stakeholder projects with significant coordination needs is an asset.
Experience supporting the organization of professional conferences or workshops is an asset.


Key Competencies


Advanced knowledge about displacement and humanitarian and development work.
Advanced analytical and statistical skills.
Advanced communication skills both orally and in writing.
Ability to take initiatives and work independently within established deadlines.
Ability to work well in a team environment.


Location and Conditions

The successful candidate will be based in Copenhagen, Denmark.

Shortlisted candidates might be required to sit for a written test. Only shortlisted candidates will be notified. No late applications will be accepted.

This vacancy is open to applicants residing in Denmark as well as those residents in other countries. The remuneration level and the applicable entitlements and benefits may differ based on the residence of the most suitable selected candidate.

Please note that the initial contract will run up to 31 December 2024 with possibility of extension. The IDAC is projected to conclude in 2026 whilst funding for this position has been secured until the end of 2025.

Please note that UNHCR does not charge a fee at any stage of its recruitment process (application, interview, meeting, travelling, processing, training or any other fees).

All UNHCR workforce members must individually and collectively, contribute towards a working environment where each person feels safe, and empowered to perform their duties. This includes by demonstrating no tolerance for sexual exploitation and abuse, harassment including sexual harassment, sexism, gender inequality, discrimination, and abuse of power.

As individuals and as managers, all must be proactive in preventing and responding to inappropriate conduct, support ongoing dialogue on these matters and speaking up and seeking guidance and support from relevant UNHCR resources when these issues arise.

Standard Job Description

Required Languages

English

,

,

Desired Languages

,

,

Skills

Terms of Reference

Title: Associate Statistics and Data Analysis Officer

ICA Level: IICA-1/LICA-9

Duty station: Copenhagen, Denmark

Duration: 01/10/2024 - 31/12/2024 (with possibility of extension)

General Background

UNHCR, the UN Refugee Agency, is a global organization dedicated to saving lives, protecting rights, and building a better future for refugees, forcibly displaced communities, and stateless people.

‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇ

The Statistics, Data Science, and Survey Section (SDSS) located in UNHCR‚Äôs Global Data Service (GDS) in Copenhagen oversees the production of global statistics on forcibly displaced and stateless populations. Access to reliable, timely and accurate data is essential to achieve the aims of the Data Transformation Strategy 2020-2025, that is, to position UNHCR as a trusted leader on data and information related to refugees and other populations of concern. The Section develops external products such as the annual Global Trends report, which analyzes the changes in forced displacement and statelessness and deepens public understanding of ongoing crises, and maintains the Refugee Data Finder, which enables humanitarian workers, decision-makers, researchers, and many more to quickly access data and information on affected populations. The Section ensures that quality and coherent data related to forced displacement is systematically, responsibly, and efficiently collected, analyzed, and presented by UNHCR and its partners.

Increasingly, UNHCR‚Äôs approach to strengthen statistics, data and information systems is based on collaboration and collective efforts with partners and stakeholders, as the optimal way to both ensure the effective use of resources and to achieve outcomes for those affected by forced displacement.

At global level, UNHCR is a member of several multi-stakeholder statistical expert groups, ensuring that forcibly displaced people are visible in global statistical recommendations and reporting, through disaggregation of data by forced displacement status and, through the custodian role of a Sustainable Development Goal (SDG) indicator. SDSS has taken a leading role in the Expert Group on Refugee, IDP and Statelessness Statistics (EGRISS), both as a steering committee member and host of the secretariat. EGRISS is a multistakeholder group, which was established by the UN Statistical Commission in 2016 to develop recommendations to improve official statistics on forced displacement and statelessness. UNHCR coordinates the activities of the group together with other steering committee members, consisting of organizations from country, regional and international levels. In addition, SDSS is co-leading the work of the EGRISS subgroup on capacity building on forced displacement statistics.

The section is a key member of the International Data Alliance for Children on the Move (IDAC), a platform that brings together diverse stakeholders working at the nexus between data and the topics of migration, forced displacement, human mobility, development, and child protection. It is led by a joint Secretariat comprised of UNICEF as Chair, UNHCR, IOM, Eurostat, and OECD. UNHCR is also a member of its capacity building and technical guidance working group.

Through the above-mentioned initiatives, UNHCR works closely with global, regional, and national partners to strengthen capacity on how to collect and compile official statistics on forced displacement and to improve the quality and availability of such statistics. Inclusion of forcibly displaced and stateless people into national, regional, and global statistical production and systems is an important prerequisite for making these groups visible in policy making and programme development and a key component of the Global Compact on Refugees.

Purpose and Scope of Assignment

Working as part of the Statistics, Data Science, and Survey Section, in the Statistical Partnerships and External Engagement team, the Associate Statistics and Data Analysis Officer will focus on the section‚Äôs partnership in IDAC. Through this focus the Associate Statistics and Data Analysis Officer will have a diverse role involving coordination, communication, and capacity building. Main tasks include strengthening national data systems and capabilities, promoting collaborative and innovative data collection and analysis methods, and improving the visibility, availability, accessibility, and usability of statistical data. The incumbent will also be responsible for building strong partnerships and advocating for best practices in data management.

The selected candidate will be responsible for the following tasks and activities:

Coordination and Communication

  • Support global and regional coordination and communication on IDAC-related activities, in close collaboration with IDAC secretariat members and the UNHCR lead. This includes regular information updates to be shared with UNHCR regional levels through existing channels.
  • Support the organization of internal and external events focused on data on children and age disaggregation, in collaboration with identified IDAC members. This will include coordination support (e.g. organisation of meetings, documentation of minutes, follow up on workplans), administrative support (e.g. development of TORs, procurement processes, organisation of workshops) and substantive support (e.g. research, writing/editing/presentations) as relevant.
  • Support in dissemination and publication of IDAC publications, in close collaboration with UNHCR communication team.

Capacity Building

  • Assist in organizing and delivering training sessions for UNHCR staff, partners, and other stakeholders on age disaggregation and how to improve data on children forced to flee, ensuring linkages with other relevant capacity building initiatives on forced displacement statistics, especially the Expert Group on Refugee, IDP and Statelessness Statistics (EGRISS), Expert Group on Migration Statistics (EGM) and Inter Agency Expert Group on SDG Indicators (IAEG-SDGs).
  • Support the organization of capacity-building workshops and rollout of capacity-building tools, terminology briefs, and indicator guidance in coordination with other capacity building initiatives, including EGRISS and EGM.
  • Coordinate national data system strengthening and capacity building work related to age disaggregated displacement data on children, in one selected pilot country, working closely with national statistical partners, other relevant partners and the project team.
  • Support the development of training materials and tools and as relevant insert age disaggregation language in UNHCR guidance.
  • Support internal capacity building and information sharing on age disaggregation, relevant terminology, and definitions.

Data Publications

  • Develop thematic briefings and guidance documents, with a focus on age disaggregation and forced displacement.
  • Review and provide technical input into relevant publications and other communications and reporting activities, with a focus on innovative and integrated approaches to age disaggregation and data collection on children forced to flee.

Management support

  • Budget management support, in close collaboration with UNHCR team lead, including creating and maintaining budget planning and management tools, liaising with relevant finance colleagues for expenditure report reviews, and other tasks as relevant.
  • Act as team-focal point/coordinator for common Microsoft Teams channels and workplanning tools, ensure common workplans are developed and used as agreed by the team.
  • Contributions monitoring & evaluation activities, with focus on areas of responsibility/expertise.
  • Active participation in Steering Committee and working group meetings as required.
  • Other duties as required by the unit.

Travel required

  • Travel is required both to attend IDAC related events and workshops but also to implement the capacity building data system strengthening pilot work.

Monitoring and Progress Controls

Activity 1: Development of 1 thematic brief based on data from UNHCR Forced Displacement Survey with a focus on children by End of 2024

Deliverable: Thematic brief finalized for dissemination

Activity 2: Coordination of one national data system strengthening and capacity building exercise in a selected country (TBC), working closely with national statistical partners and the project team, particularly UNHCR regional and country level by End of 2024

Deliverable: Development of draft project workplan

Activity 3: Support organization of regional capacity building workshop on forced displacement and age disaggregation by November 2024

Deliverables: Provide (1) support to the overall organization of CB workshop and identified follow up, (2) develop lessons learnt document with focus on innovative and integrated approaches to age disaggregation

Activity 4: Provide technical and financial monitoring support to project lead between 1 October and 31 December

Deliverable: External and internal reports as required

Qualifications And Experience

Education:

  • University (or Master‚Äôs degree) in statistics, economics, monitoring and evaluation, political science, international policy and development or a relevant field.

Work Experience:

  • 3 years relevant experience in research and data analysis with Undergraduate degree; or 2 years relevant experience with Graduate degree; or 1 year relevant experience with Doctorate degree.
  • Proven experience in synthetizing complex policy issues and technical writing.
  • Ability to work in an international environment and under tight deadlines.
  • Proven experience in capacity building and data system strengthening work with national statistical systems.
  • Experience working with multi-stakeholder projects with significant coordination needs is an asset.
  • Experience supporting the organization of professional conferences or workshops is an asset.

Key Competencies

  • Advanced knowledge about displacement and humanitarian and development work.
  • Advanced analytical and statistical skills.
  • Advanced communication skills both orally and in writing.
  • Ability to take initiatives and work independently within established deadlines.
  • Ability to work well in a team environment.

Location and Conditions

The successful candidate will be based in Copenhagen, Denmark.

Shortlisted candidates might be required to sit for a written test. Only shortlisted candidates will be notified. No late applications will be accepted.

This vacancy is open to applicants residing in Denmark as well as those residents in other countries. The remuneration level and the applicable entitlements and benefits may differ based on the residence of the most suitable selected candidate.

Please note that the initial contract will run up to 31 December 2024 with possibility of extension. The IDAC is projected to conclude in 2026 whilst funding for this position has been secured until the end of 2025.

Please note that UNHCR does not charge a fee at any stage of its recruitment process (application, interview, meeting, travelling, processing, training or any other fees).

All UNHCR workforce members must individually and collectively, contribute towards a working environment where each person feels safe, and empowered to perform their duties. This includes by demonstrating no tolerance for sexual exploitation and abuse, harassment including sexual harassment, sexism, gender inequality, discrimination, and abuse of power.

As individuals and as managers, all must be proactive in preventing and responding to inappropriate conduct, support ongoing dialogue on these matters and speaking up and seeking guidance and support from relevant UNHCR resources when these issues arise.

Title: BI & Analytics Specialist
Description:
Are you looking for a big challenge and opportunity to have a high impact on a startup company? If so, keep on reading!

The Opportunity And What We Offer

Formalize is on a scaling journey with significant traction across Europe. As our new BI and Analytics Specialist, you'll have the opportunity to learn, grow, and tackle significant challenges to make a meaningful impact in our Revenue Operations team. You will be our first specialized BI and Analytics hire, so it comes with great growth opportunities. Seize this distinctive chance to actively contribute to shaping Formalize's products growth narrative.

Responsibilities

Project Leadership:


Lead data projects, ensuring they are delivered on time, within scope, and meet business objectives
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including development, marketing, and sales, to integrate data solutions seamlessly into business processes


Technical Development:


Design, build, and maintain scalable data pipelines and models
Optimize and refine models to improve their performance and accuracy
Integrate various marketing platforms and tools via APIs to create seamless workflows


Communication & Collaboration:


Communicate complex data concepts and results to non-technical stakeholders clearly and concisely
Collaborate with key stakeholders to understand their needs and how data and insights can provide value
Advocate for a data-driven culture within the organization


Business Acumen


Analyze and interpret complex data to provide actionable insights that drive business growth and operational efficiency
Understanding of the SaaS (or similar) business model
Develop and maintain data models, dashboards, and performance metrics that support strategic decision-making


Qualifications And Expectations Towards You:


Proficiency in programming and query languages such as SQL
Proficiency in programming basic Javascript
Minimum of 2 years of experience in data/analytics or a related field
Proven track record of delivering successful data projects
Familiarity with data warehousing: BigQuery preferred
Familiarity with data visualization tools (Looker Studio, Power BI, Tableau etc. applicable)
Strong data integrity, accuracy, and security by implementing robust data governance and management practices
Knowledge of Google Ads, Google Analytics, Google Tag Manager and HubSpot


The Opportunity And What We Offer:


Be part of a fast-growing venture backed SaaS company
Be part of an international culture that invest heavily in their people - from skill development, company trips, to promotion opportunities
High level of trust and autonomy
Possibility of partial work from home or remote work.


Traits That Describe Our Culture And Employees:


We are all very goal oriented and hardworking
We are responsible, and we like accountability - we expect you to take responsibility of your tasks and deadlines
We are connecting, and we like to build meaningful relationships
We are optimistic and like to laugh and have a positive atmosphere
We like to dream big and to have clear visions for the future


Test in the recruitment process

In the recruitment process, we use talent profiles. You will therefore receive a link to the test if you proceed from the first round of interviews.

Experience shows that it provides the best experience for both candidates and us as a company. It's not about answering right or wrong, but whether one's talents match the context you will work in. We want to hire a colleague who really thrives and flourishes with us, and therefore we are looking for the employee who will be a good fit with Whistleblower Software in relation to


Fit between the person and work tasks
Fit between the person and the colleagues in the team
Fit between the person and the role


We know that when this is staged optimally, you thrive and succeed much better in your job.

Recruitment Process

üìÉ Send application and upload relevant information

üöÄ 15 minutes online interview w/ Head of Revenue Operations

üß† Completion of personality test

üìä 30 minutes deep dive of the role w/ Head of Revenue Operations

üìö Case preparation

üåü 60 minutes in-person case interview with our Head of Revenue Operations & our CMO

üèÅ Criminal record check

Apply by attaching your resume and other relevant information and you will hear from us soon!

We will hold interviews and hire on an ongoing basis. For more information or questions please contact the responsible recruiter in the Talent team.

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst ‚Äì Student assistant
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
We're a dynamic and innovative scale-up that is transforming the IoT landscape. At Factbird, we're revolutionizing data collection and production monitoring, and we are dedicated to craft engaging products that boost efficiency and profitability by streamlining production processes.

Join a team that is passionate about providing exceptional experiences, collaboration, and mutual respect. We embrace bold ideas and inject fun into our work while driving impactful innovations. The potential for growth and learning knows no bounds here.

Here's what you'll be up to:

As a Student Assistant in our Business Intelligence/Revenue Operations Team, you'll be a key part of our team, working with different technologies like Power BI, SQL, and Python to provide commercial and financial insights and support to our commercial side of the business. You will report to our Revenue Operations Manager and primarily work alongside our Business Intelligence Analyst. We work with all departments within the company, and as such there is a wide range of opportunities to form connections with other departments.

Key responsibilities will include:


Assist team leadership with reporting, analysis and data management tasks including (but not limited to) sales and marketing performance, financial KPIs, etc.
Data cleaning, transformation and ingestion into our Data Warehouse.
Update Power BI to visualize performance and assist sales and marketing management to make better decisions based on data.
Developing tools and templates for reporting, analysis, and forecasts.
Supporting the organization with ad hoc data analysis and reports on business-related questions.


And here's the best part ‚Äì at Factbird, merit matters more than seniority. Your opinions will be valued, and your contributions will be celebrated. We believe in fostering an inclusive, flexible, and growth-oriented environment right here in vibrant Copenhagen.

Here's what we'd love to see in you:

You will be supporting us part time, ideally between 15 and 20 hours per week, while you continue with your education. As the ideal candidate


You are currently in the last year of your bachelor‚Äôs degree or in your first year of your master‚Äôs degree within the fields of Business analytics, Economics , Computer science or similar.
Experience with Power BI and SQL/ GoogleSQL
You possess excellent skills within Microsoft office, particularly Excel and PowerPoint.
You have great verbal and written English communication as you will be working with international colleagues.
You can take responsibility for your work areas and work independently but also as a part of a team.
You have an eye for detail and strive to complete your tasks in a timely and precise manner.


A Little About Us

Factbird is a game-changing end-to-end manufacturing intelligence solution that simplifies data gathering and analysis for all manufacturers. With this solution at your fingertips, you can finally take charge of your manufacturing efficiency and redefine the boundaries of success. Factbird, in business since 2015, is now used in over 25 countries worldwide and trusted by 300+ manufacturers daily, with offices in Denmark and the US.

Our story is a narrative of ceaseless innovation, collaborative growth, and a resolute commitment to our customers. We've continually evolved, developing our product with our clients' feedback, establishing features and solutions that not only restructure industry operations but cement our position as a trailblazer in manufacturing technology.

We're scaling significantly across the globe after a recent funding round, and we want you to be a part of our exciting journey! Join the Factbird Team, and you'll enjoy


Flexible working hours with hybrid work options, especially around exam periods.
Skills development and growth opportunities.
A central office location in the heart of Copenhagen, next to Vesterport station.
A competitive salary to recognize your valuable contributions.
A warm and structured onboarding.
An international, diverse, and inclusive culture with colleagues from 17 different nationalities!


Ready to embark on an incredible journey and shape the future of data collection and production monitoring?

Don't miss this exciting opportunity ‚Äì join us now by submitting your application! Plus, feel free to share this awesome chance with anyone who'd be a perfect fit!

Our interview process is a breeze ‚Äì it starts with a chat with our recruiter, followed by one technical interview, and culminates with a talk with our leadership team. Got any questions or need more details? Reach out to Khristel Marie Aparicio at khma@factbird.com.

Om vores team

Vi er et ungt og dygtigt team, der trives med samarbejde, innovation og et omskifteligt landskab. Vi omfavner den agile metode og tror p√• at udfordre gr√¶nser, l√¶re af fejl og fejre succeser sammen.

Din profil

Er du proaktiv og ansvarsfuld? Vi s√∏ger en kollega, der ikke er bange for at udfordre normen. Som BI Consultant kombinerer du teknisk viden med forretningsbehov.

  • Ansvar og initiativ: Du tager ansvar for dine opgaver.
  • Nysgerrighed: Du stiller de sv√¶re sp√∏rgsm√•l og udforsker nye l√∏sninger.
  • Formidling af tekniske l√∏sninger: Du kan overs√¶tte komplekse tekniske begreber til forst√•eligt sprog for stakeholders.
  • Samarbejde: Du trives med tv√¶rfagligt samarbejde.
  • Minimum 2 √•rs erfaring

For yderligere detaljer om denne fantastiske mulighed, kontakt vores Business Intelligence Manager, Jeppe G. Duch, p√• telefonnummer 41218931 eller Solution Architect, Victor D. K., p√• telefonnummer 22600424. Denne fuldtidsstilling er baseret hos Kvik A/S, Mosevej 3, 8240 Risskov.

Title: Data Analyst Student Assistant
Description:
Are you a student with a passion for data analysis and business development?

We are looking for a motivated student assistant to join our Strategy & Operations team. Bring your analytical skills to an exciting and challenging student job where you will contribute to developing the Landfolk platform.

Who is Landfolk?

Landfolk is an online marketplace for handpicked holiday homes, Founded in February 2021 by seven ex-Airbnb colleagues. Based in Aarhus, Denmark, we're rapidly expanding across Europe, operating in Denmark, Norway, Germany, and Sweden. Our curated approach ensures that we offer only the most beautiful and unique holiday homes to our community of travellers.

What should I expect to do?

As a student assistant in our Strategy & Operations team, you will play a role in shaping the strategic direction and operational excellence of Landfolk. We are looking for someone with an analytical mindset and a passion for data analysis and problem-solving.

Your Responsibilities Will Include


Continuously updating, maintaining and developing existing data models, such as supply forecasting.
Perform data analysis to identify trends, opportunities and challenges for our business.
Deliver actionable insights and recommendations based on large data sets - communicated and visualised effectively and simply.


Who You Are


You are in the early stage of your master's program, or at the end of your bachelor's degree in a relevant business program, such as cand.merc, cand.oecon, or similar.
You are independent in solving tasks, well-structured, persistent and a systematic thinker.
You are a super user of Excel/Google Sheets. Experience in (or the willingness to learn) SQL, Python or other languages would be a plus.
You are committed and contribute to the good atmosphere in the office.


Why should you choose us?

As an employee at Landfolk, you'll feel the pulse of a great and fast-growing company where you can take on responsibility, contribute with your skills, and gain valuable practical experience.

Essentially, What You Can Expect


Be part of a team of highly skilled people covering technical, business, design, community and communication skills, so there's always someone to learn from.
Enjoy a flexible work environment that values productivity and a positive office culture, e.g. delicious lunches, social events, great coffee, snacks and summer house trips.


The practicalities

The position is based at our office in Aarhus and is part-time role, requiring approximately 15 hours pr. week.

As we want to hire as soon as possible, we interview on an ongoing basis but would like to receive applications no later than September 20, 2024.

Title: Data Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Join us in building the future of Data & AI as a Data Engineer at Accenture Technology Denmark

As a global leader in consulting and technology, Accenture empowers organizations to thrive in a rapidly changing world, and Data & AI is unquestionably at the heart of that, especially with the drive towards AI-powered industries.

At Accenture Denmark, we're on the lookout for passionate minds to join us in creating impactful solutions for our clients and fostering our own community. Joining the Data & AI team means becoming part of a growing and vibrant community of both experienced professionals and young talents in the company‚Äôs fastest growing division.

You will have the chance to shape both the trajectory of the team, as well as your own future & career in technology. Whether through client projects or internal initiatives, you'll have the chance to grow alongside us within the AI sphere. We work with some of the greatest tech stacks out there, and your personal and professional toolkit will be ever expanding as training is an essential perk of the job.

In our projects, you use a range of skills; we design and build data platforms in the cloud using data architecture and software development practices, perform data management and governance tasks, do analytics and apply AI for greater insights and data-driven value creation.

Who are we looking for?

You are solution-oriented, curious and like to familiarize yourself with new issues where you share your knowledge. You must be happy to engage with clients and colleagues, working in a team, while also being able to work and manage tasks independently. You have a desire to engage in Accenture‚Äôs professional and social communities, both locally and globally.

We Are Looking For You Who Have



3+ years of Data Engineering experience; ETL pipelines, data modelling, warehousing etc.


A bachelor's degree or higher in Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics, Mathematics, IT or a related field.


Experience using Cloud Solutions and Modern Data Platforms, in particular Databricks or Snowflake


General knowledge about the Data & AI landscape: Data Science, Data Analysis, Data Visualization, Data Architecture, Data Management, AI concepts and frameworks



Fluency in English is a must, and proficiency in Danish is preferred.

Your Toolkit Would Ideally Contain The Following Skills



Databricks / Snowflake


MS Azure / AWS / GCP


SQL / Python / Scala


Spark / Hadoop / Hive (nice to have)


Power BI / Tableau (nice to have)


CI/CD / DevOps (nice to have)



What can we offer you?



Opportunity to work with frontier technologies on exciting projects with leading companies across various industries


Professional development and training opportunities to enhance your skills and advance your career


A local as well as global network


A competitive salary and benefits



Does this sound interesting?

Then we would like to hear from you, whoever you are! Paradoxically, we prefer application letters not written by ChatGPT

Title: Consumer Insights Specialist
Description:
Are you passionate about working with customer insights, and do you want to be part of an exciting journey where you ensure the voice of the customer across JYSK? Then you might be the new Customer Insight Specialist we are looking for!




WHAT WE OFFER YOU

As a Customer Insight Specialist you will help collect and analyse customer data and communicate customer insights across the organisation. You will work with many different types of projects and stakeholders and help create the foundation for the newly established customer insight function.




Furthermore, we offer you:

To join a newly established function where you can help define the direction for customer insights in JYSK
To play a central role in understanding and communicating our customers‚Äô behavior and preferences as well as overall market trends
To work with a wide range of interesting and challenging customer insights tasks that provide great learning opportunities within an international retail success story
To be part of a small team striving to exceed expectations in everything we do, whilst having fun




WHAT YOUR NEXT JOB WILL BE ABOUT

Your tasks and responsibilities in the job include:

Lead customer insight projects from start to end ‚Äì both qualitative and quantitative - for stakeholders across JYSK to bring customer insights for decision-making
Assess and apply most relevant methods to get valid and applicable insight in cooperation with stakeholders and in some cases external partners
Analyse and interpret customer data to actionable insights by use of both existing and new data sources including our new digital solutions (e.g. CDP)
Communicate actionable customer insights to stakeholders across JYSK
Set up and maintain ongoing reporting on main customer KPIs for top management and relevant stakeholders across the customer journey
Develop the customer insight function together with the rest of the team




You can read more about working at JYSK at https://job.jysk.dk/dk/head-office




WHAT SHOULD YOU BRING

To succeed in this role, you have an analytical and structured mindset. You have a strong understanding of business and great stakeholder management and communication skills. You thrive in a dynamic environment where we help each other to get the best results for our stakeholders. You bring relevant experience to the team and want to contribute to the foundation and development of the function.

In addition, you:




Have +3 years or more experience working with customer insights and customer data in a similar internal role or/and as an external consultant
Have a strong and broad understanding of data sources, tools and survey methods for getting relevant insights
Have worked with projects and project management
Have strong Excel and PowerPoint skills
Can quickly understand new business areas and become a valuable customer insight sparring partner across the organisation




IS THIS YOUR NEXT OPPORTUNITY? Apply today!

If you have any questions regarding the position, please contact Head of Customer Insights, Anita Rytter +45 2266 8801 (on holiday until 6th of August).




Send us a brief application with your CV by clicking ‚ÄúApply‚Äù. We process applications on an ongoing basis and complete the recruitment once we have found the right candidate.

Title: Performance Intelligence Consultant
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Do you have a knack for uncovering game-changing insights from complex data? Can you transform numbers into compelling stories that drive customer behavior for global brands? If so, seize this opportunity to make a significant impact as a Performance Intelligence Consultant at VML MAP!

What will your day look like?

As Performance Intelligence Consultant, you'll be at the forefront of data-driven decision-making and play a vital role in understanding client priorities and objectives. With a foundational understanding of user experience and a strong grasp of data and analytical approaches, you'll be the bridge between data and strategy. Your daily activities will include conducting detailed data analysis to identify performance trends, designing and executing A/B tests and analyzing the results to provide optimization recommendations. You'll also be preparing and presenting performance reports, and your strong communication skills and storytelling abilities will ensure that actionable insights are delivered in an easily understood format, and in a way that motivates and provides a clear direction for various teams.

More Specifically, Your Tasks Include


Conduct detailed data analysis to identify performance trends and insights.
Prepare and present performance reports and translate the insights to client service and other internal teams, with a focus on content, audience, and channels.
Assist in the creation and execution of performance experiments.
Maintain and update performance dashboards and analytics tools.
Collaborate with various teams to ensure data-driven decision-making.
Design and execute A/B tests to identify the most effective strategies and tactics.
Analyze the results of A/B tests and other experiments to provide optimization recommendations.
Approach all task with curiosity and open-mindedness, constantly striving to uncover further insights from the available data.


Who are you going to work with?

You'll join our growing Insights and Intelligence team, reporting to the Performance Intelligence Lead. You'll work closely with various teams, especially data and analytics specialists , and be the bridge between client and technical teams.

What do you bring to the table?

We're looking for curious minds with a strategic outlook and a passion for data. You're not just comfortable with numbers; you're adept at translating them into narratives that resonate with both technical and non-technical audiences, and you have a strong curiosity to discover the 'why' behind the data. Additionally, you are very collaboratively oriented, and you love working with cross-functional teams. Your expertise in detailed analysis and optimization will be instrumental in driving improvements and delivering actionable insights that enhance our daily tasks for clients.

In Addition, You Have


Basic understanding of user experience principles.
Experience working with performance data within marketing.
Strong analytical skills and familiarity with data analysis tools.
Proficiency in Microsoft Excel, including advanced functions and data manipulation.
Knowledge of data visualization tools and SQL (e.g., Tableau, Power BI).
Effective communication and strong storytelling skills.
Strategic mindset with the ability to connect data insights to business objectives.
Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment with an open mind.
Understanding of A/B testing methodologies and tools.
Previous experience in performance analysis or a similar role.
Experience in managing and analyzing large datasets and translating data into actionable insights.


A leader in personalized customer experiences

VML MAP is a world-leading Centre of Excellence that helps businesses humanize the relationship between the brand and the customer through hyper personalization at scale, marketing automation and CRM. With the brain of a consultancy, the heart of an agency and the power of technology and data, we work with some of the world's most admired brands to help them on their transformation journey to becoming truly customer-centric. Together, we are 1000 + technology specialists, data scientists, strategic thinkers, consultants, operations experts, and creative minds from 55+ nationalities.

A global network

We are part of the global VML network that encompasses more than 30,000 employees across 150+ offices in 60+ markets, each contributing to a culture that values connection, belonging, and the power of differences.

At VML, we are committed to fostering an all-inclusive work environment that is both rewarding and career-forward. Our Inclusion, Equity & Belonging initiatives, alongside the VML Foundation, reflect our dedication to giving back and making a positive impact in our communities and beyond. Our people are the heartbeat of our organization-creators, doers, innovators, makers, and thinkers-who drive not just marketing, but meaningful experiences that resonate in every action and interaction.

For more information, please visit our website , and follow us on our social channels via Instagram and LinkedIn .

When you click "Submit Application" your information is sent to VML MAP. To learn more about how we process your personal data when you apply for a role with us, how you can update your information, or have your information removed, please read our Privacy Policy . California residents should read our California Recruitment Privacy Notice .

Title: Lead Quantitative Researcher
Description:
Redstone Commodity Search focus on offering 360¬∞ search solutions to the global commodities markets. With a competitive coverage of Trading Houses, Producers, Majors, Utilities, Merchants, Hedge Funds, Investment Banks and Brokerages; Redstone Commodity Search can confidently offer you an edge in today‚Äôs volatile market.




Redstone Commodity Search are working with an established Danish Commodities Trading House, in their search for a Lead Quantitative Researcher to join the growing Energy team.




Key Responsibilities / Tasks




Focus on EU power and Gas markets, seeking out new opportunities and trends.
Build models to power quantitative strategies.
Conduct research and statistical analysis.
Ensure compliance with regulations and reporting within the Energy Market.
Work with large data sets to predict and test statistical market patterns.
Role reports into the Director of Power Trading.




Key Qualifications / Experience




Having a broad understanding of international power and gas fundamentals.
Analytical mindset and strong ability to navigate the markets.
3+ years of relevant quantitative experience.
Master‚Äôs degree in finance, mathematics, economics, or a relevant field.
Strong attention to detail, and numerical accuracy.
Located in Denmark.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Are you ready to use your data engineering skills to build and maintain a powerful data infrastructure that delivers real business impact?




As a Data Engineer, you will be responsible for building scalable data pipelines and datasets empowering data-driven decision-making that will promote innovation and growth across NORDEN.




You will be directly involved in advancing our data strategy, in an environment where data is a strategic cornerstone to ensure value creation and competitive advantages.




You will be based in Copenhagen, Denmark.







What is in it for you

You will join the Data Engineering Team in Digital Solution and Services department, which has a welcoming and inclusive culture with data and IT-focused colleagues who collaborate closely. The department values personal development and teamwork and promotes a positive environment through an informal, innovative, and diverse approach.




So be ready to inspire others and be inspired by people from different backgrounds. On a day-to-day basis, you will be a key member of the Data Engineering team, working alongside five dedicated colleagues.




On a more practical note, you will as a Data Engineer, access large and diverse datasets generating features and insights that will be of high value to stakeholders when making critical business and trading decisions. Your role will be crucial in transforming data into a competitive advantage.




You will use a modern tech stack, including Python, Prefect, and Azure cloud solutions while gaining a deep understanding of today's shipping market dynamics.







The tasks that await you

To be more specific you will together with the rest of the team, be responsible for tasks such as:

Building and maintaining data pipelines.
Creating meaningful datasets through a combination of internal and external data.
Generating decisive measures from datasets that will be used either directly in decision-making or as features for models.
Working with non-technical stakeholders to derive and implement technical solutions to business challenges.
Leading, organising and executing on data capture, validation, enrichment and support activities.
Developing a systems-based approach to data engineering providing value within the larger organisation.







Your competencies and core qualifications

We are looking for a colleague who is curious and wants to expand their knowledge in a global fast-paced trading environment. To thrive in this position, you should be able to tick off the following:

You hold a master's degree in business administration and information technology, mathematical modeling, statistics, computer science, software engineering, or similar areas.
You already hold programming skills ‚Äì could be in Python and SQL.
You have great English skills.
You are eligible to work in Denmark.




Further, you have to some extent participated in decision-making regarding technical solutions such as technology choice or overall structuring of data.




Application

Please upload your application, resume and relevant diplomas via our website as soon as possible and no later than 2 October 2024. We review applications and interview candidates on an ongoing basis.




NORDEN values diversity in thought, educational background, and professional competencies and therefore encourages all qualified candidates to apply for the position.




Were you missing anything in this job ad? Please share your feedback with us here.







Our company

NORDEN is a global provider of ocean-based freight services for bulk and project cargo of all sizes. We integrate freight solutions with port logistics, helping our customers to optimise and decarbonise supply chains. We provide tailored solutions based on flexibility, reliability and intelligence. Our agile business model ensures stability by continuously adapting our fleet to market developments and customer needs.




Founded in 1871, NORDEN is one of Denmark‚Äôs oldest internationally operating shipping companies. Incorporated in Denmark, we are listed on Nasdaq Copenhagen as a part of the OMX Nordic Large Cap index.




With 15 offices across 6 continents, NORDEN is a truly integrated part of global trade.

Show more

Are you ready to use your data engineering skills to build and maintain a powerful data infrastructure that delivers real business impact?


As a Data Engineer, you will be responsible for building scalable data pipelines and datasets empowering data-driven decision-making that will promote innovation and growth across NORDEN.


You will be directly involved in advancing our data strategy, in an environment where data is a strategic cornerstone to ensure value creation and competitive advantages.


You will be based in Copenhagen, Denmark.



What is in it for you

You will join the Data Engineering Team in Digital Solution and Services department, which has a welcoming and inclusive culture with data and IT-focused colleagues who collaborate closely. The department values personal development and teamwork and promotes a positive environment through an informal, innovative, and diverse approach.


So be ready to inspire others and be inspired by people from different backgrounds. On a day-to-day basis, you will be a key member of the Data Engineering team, working alongside five dedicated colleagues.


On a more practical note, you will as a Data Engineer, access large and diverse datasets generating features and insights that will be of high value to stakeholders when making critical business and trading decisions. Your role will be crucial in transforming data into a competitive advantage.


You will use a modern tech stack, including Python, Prefect, and Azure cloud solutions while gaining a deep understanding of today's shipping market dynamics.



The tasks that await you

To be more specific you will together with the rest of the team, be responsible for tasks such as:

  • Building and maintaining data pipelines.
  • Creating meaningful datasets through a combination of internal and external data.
  • Generating decisive measures from datasets that will be used either directly in decision-making or as features for models.
  • Working with non-technical stakeholders to derive and implement technical solutions to business challenges.
  • Leading, organising and executing on data capture, validation, enrichment and support activities.
  • Developing a systems-based approach to data engineering providing value within the larger organisation.



Your competencies and core qualifications

We are looking for a colleague who is curious and wants to expand their knowledge in a global fast-paced trading environment. To thrive in this position, you should be able to tick off the following:

  • You hold a master's degree in business administration and information technology, mathematical modeling, statistics, computer science, software engineering, or similar areas.
  • You already hold programming skills ‚Äì could be in Python and SQL.
  • You have great English skills.
  • You are eligible to work in Denmark.


Further, you have to some extent participated in decision-making regarding technical solutions such as technology choice or overall structuring of data.


Application

Please upload your application, resume and relevant diplomas via our website as soon as possible and no later than 2 October 2024. We review applications and interview candidates on an ongoing basis.


NORDEN values diversity in thought, educational background, and professional competencies and therefore encourages all qualified candidates to apply for the position.


Were you missing anything in this job ad? Please share your feedback with us here.



Our company

NORDEN is a global provider of ocean-based freight services for bulk and project cargo of all sizes. We integrate freight solutions with port logistics, helping our customers to optimise and decarbonise supply chains. We provide tailored solutions based on flexibility, reliability and intelligence. Our agile business model ensures stability by continuously adapting our fleet to market developments and customer needs.


Founded in 1871, NORDEN is one of Denmark‚Äôs oldest internationally operating shipping companies. Incorporated in Denmark, we are listed on Nasdaq Copenhagen as a part of the OMX Nordic Large Cap index.


With 15 offices across 6 continents, NORDEN is a truly integrated part of global trade.

Title: Data & Quality Specialist (CPS-GfK)
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Country

Denmark

Job Family

Operations

Our Mission

At Consumer Panel Services GfK, our mission is clear: to provide key information on who buys what, where, how much, how often, and most importantly, why (or why not). We take pride in delivering high-quality, uninterrupted data, expert consultancy, and unparalleled expertise to empower our clients to deliver superior customer experiences at every stage of the shopper journey.

Job Description

Our Consumer Panel Services (CPS) team, now part of YouGov, manages a panel of 3.000 families in Denmark. These households continuously register their groceries with the use of our reporting solution, an app called MyScan. Via the data we collect on these daily purchases, we analyze trends on the Danish market and report these to our clients (manufacturers, retailers etc).

In an exciting new initiative, CPS is more than doubling the panel by partnering up with Heco who have developed an app called Optius to passively collect purchase data. By adding those passively collected data to our existing panel, CPS will be able to deliver an unprecedented level of detail to FMCG and retail clients.

The Data & Quality Specialist will support in matching the CPS purchase database to the passively measured data and vice versa, based on an algorithm and improved manually where needed . The Data & Quality Specialist will pair passive data from the Optius app with big data from our CPS database and maintain data quality through rigorous quality checking and adjustment. The Data & Quality Specialist will improve database coding through accurate classification and measurement. The Data & Quality Specialist will regularly analyse their work and identify ways to improve data quality and further evolve classification, collaborating with other Data & Operations colleagues to develop comprehensive processes & techniques to drive best practice.

You Will


Support in matching the CPS purchase database to the passively measured data and vice versa, based on an algorithm and improved manually where needed.
Aim to improve the database and coding quality to ameliorate the matching and classification for both sources (MyScan and Optius) of FMCG data.
Analyze progress and translate those findings into actionable next steps.
Collaborate with local Data & Operations colleagues as well as a broader team of data management colleagues internationally.
Combine working with different stakeholders to keep the project running smoothly.


You Have


A Masters or Bachelors degree in a business or marketing related field.
An analytical approach but with a creative and innovative mindset.
A keen eye for detail in data handling and working with large datasheets, both numeric and character.
Advanced Excel skills.
Solid knowledge of statistical tools (SPSS or R is a plus).
Fluent Danish language skills.
Advanced English language skills.
Proactive, can-do mentality that not only relies on the team but also yourself to overcome the challenges along the way.
A first professional experience in Data Analysis is a plus.


We Offer


Hybrid working model (x2 days p/w in office)
An adventure full of known and unforeseen challenges.
The opportunity to further develop your professional skills and talents and build your career within FMCG and data.
An exciting work environment that brings people together from different nationalities.
A competitive salary & package.
A dynamic and fearless team with space to be who you are, built on trust, respect and the right solutions


Our Nordic office is located in Copenhagen, √òrestad. Easy to travel to by metro or train, also from for example Malm√∂ or Lund, with a very good train connection over the bridge. We aim for the ideal work-life balance and offer a hybrid working environment.

We are an ethical and honest company that is wholly committed to its clients and employees. We are proud to be an inclusive workplace for all and are committed to equal employment opportunity, focusing on all of our employees reaching their full potential.

We respect and value every employee regardless of race, ethnicity, gender, sex, sexual orientation, age, personality, experience, culture, faith, socio-economic status, or physical or mental disabilities.

We endorse the core principles and rights set forth in the United Nations Declaration of Human Rights and the Social Charter of Fundamental Rights of the European Union, promoting the universal values of human dignity, freedom, equality, and solidarity.

Learn more about who we are and everything we do on: https://www.gfk-cps.com/about-gfk-cps

Title: Data Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you passionate about data engineering and do you want to be a part of data driven growth at the world‚Äôs largest jewelry brand?

Build high quality data and Data & Analytic products on our Azure Paas data platform

@Pandora we are growing our Data & Analytics footprint. As our new data engineer you will collaborate with product managers, architects and other key profiles across the global organisation. You will help business verticals and clusters maximising the value of our data and drive business change as an impact of this.

Your primary focus will be building and implementing scalable data products on our global data platform together with other smart engineers in the organization.

Further to this you will:


Work closely with your colleagues within a product team to design scalable, efficient and stable products
Work closely with product owners to build and deliver features designed to support PANDORA to drive the business cases and efficiencies within reporting and analytics & AI and other data driven use cases
Create and maintain high quality data pipeline architecture
Obtain relevant business and system knowledge to convert requirements efficiently to technical design documentation and conceptual data modelling
Ingest large, complex data sets, automate manual processes, optimize data delivery, improve data quality, etc.
Own your data products and track continuous stability and benefits
Live and breathe ‚Äúbuild-once-consume-many‚Äù culture in which we enable others to use our data products for maximum value-add
Work with stakeholders and teams to assist with data-related technical challenges
Follow best practice and existing guidelines but also push the limits
Thrive in a fast paced environment and you get motivated by challenges as a true problem solver.



We are on a journey from IaaS based Microsoft solutions to Azure PaaS with use of well-known tools and solutions like ADF, Data lake, Synapse, Analysis Services and DataBricks.

About

Team player passionate about data and engineering

Some would say that you are a real team player, product oriented, can-do attitude and with good stakeholder management skills. You are structured and analytical, always aiming to achieve great results. Furthermore, you are a confident communicator and have the ability to explain your solution design and tailor the message according to the audience.

You‚Äôre perfect for this role if you have:


Relevant education in within Computer Science, Mathematics, Economics, Information Management, or Statistics.
3+ years of experience as a Data Engineer or in Software engineering role with focus on data.
Proven experience with DataBricks, ADF, Data Lake, Synapse, T/U-SQL, and SQL Server .
Experience with at least one object oriented or functional/scripting languages ‚Äì PySpark, SQL, Python etc.
DevOps and CI/CD focus
Experience in working with relational data sets using SQL
Experience with datawarehousing, dimensional modelling and cubes
Experience in building, and optimizing data pipelines, architectures, and datasets
Experience in working with Azure, AWS or other cloud providers
Experience in working with Kafka or Streaming data processing.
Designed, built and delivered production ready data products at an enterprise level
Good cross-functional communication
Agile mindset and experience of Scrum



It‚Äôs a plus if you have worked with:


Big data: Spark, DataBricks.
Data pipeline and workflow tools: Airflow, ADF
Stream-processing systems: Kafka or Spark Streaming



Your new team

You will be an essential part of the data engineering organization and Pandora‚Äôs extended Data & Analytics community. You will work within the data product engineering team in a virtual and agile based organization.

As we are a growing team, you will have the chance to influence our culture and working tools and work together with other data engineers, Data Visualization Specialists, architects, scrum masters, product managers and much more from Europe, India and Thailand.

Our Pandora Values:

We‚ÄØdream, are visionary and go beyond the obvious.‚ÄØ

We‚ÄØdare‚ÄØto pursue bold ambitions with courage and speed.‚ÄØ

We‚ÄØcare‚ÄØdeeply about each other, our customers and the planet we all share. Every day we strive to be a fulfilling workplace, where each of us can thrive and contribute, where talents can grow, and‚ÄØ

we‚ÄØdeliver‚ÄØon our promises to colleagues, customers, partners and stakeholders.

We are focused on building a diverse and inclusive workforce. If you‚Äôre excited about this role, but do not meet 100% of the qualifications listed above, we encourage you to apply. In compliance with the Colorado Equal Pay for Equal Work Act.

Did we get your attention

If you see yourself in the position and would like to become a part of Pandora‚Äôs future, please do not hesitate to apply. We look forward to hearing from you!

We process applications on a continuous basis, which is why we encourage you to send your application as soon as possible. You can also read more about Pandora on our corporate site www.pandoragroup.com.

Icing on the cake

You will be working out of our beautiful Head Office in Copenhagen V, established in 2016 and designed to unite and inspire our teams. Besides our beautiful interior design we are also proud of our LEED Gold Certification for Energy and Environmental Design. This means that we use as few natural resources as possible and that we use them with respect. The result is a professional and dynamic space that is unique, comfortable and inspirational ‚Äì and delivers a true Pandora experience to anyone who works here or comes to visit.

About Pandora

Established in 1982, Pandora designs, manufactures and markets hand-finished‚ÄØjewellery‚ÄØmade from high-quality materials at affordable prices. Pandora‚Äôs products are available in more than 100 countries on six continents through more than 6,500 points of sale, including around 2,500 concept stores.

Headquartered in Copenhagen, Denmark, Pandora employs 32,000 people worldwide and crafts its‚ÄØjewellery‚ÄØat two LEED certified facilities in Thailand, using mainly recycled silver and gold. The company plans to be carbon neutral by 2025 and has joined the Science Based Targets initiative to reduce emissions across its full value chain. Pandora is listed on the Nasdaq Copenhagen stock exchange and generated a revenue of DKK 28.1 billion in 2023.‚ÄØ

At Pandora, we believe that creating an inclusive and diverse workplace and reflecting societal diversity in our customer engagement is essential to delivering on our company purpose: to give a voice to people‚Äôs loves. We dedicate ourselves to fostering, cultivating and preserving a culture of inclusion and diversity where everyone feels respected and valued.

Title: Lead Data/IT Analyst - Payments Data
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job ID:¬†24876¬†¬†

At Nordea, we know our stakeholder needs are changing ‚Äì and we‚Äôre deeply committed to meeting them with the solutions of tomorrow. We‚Äôre creating a new cloud environment where we‚Äôre harnessing the power of near real time data ‚Äì one where you can make an impact. So bring your skills, ideas and unique background. With us, you‚Äôll find plenty of opportunities to grow and make your mark on something bigger. ¬†About this opportunity¬†To strengthen our team we are looking for an experienced Lead Data/IT Analyst who has skills to do hands-on data and requirement analysis work. The right candidate also understands other aspects of software development: Are we making solid architectural decisions? Are we able to improve our tech stack? Are we focusing on right things?

¬†

As the Lead Data/IT Analyst, you‚Äôll engage with many different stakeholders, so the person we are looking for, is an outgoing individual who is self-motivated and contributes to a good team spirit. You are an experienced and passionate analyst, always seeking the best solution.

¬†

Your main responsibilities will be around the consolidation and harmonization, sourcing, storage and distribution of Payments Data to other solutions. It also includes integrations supporting different End2End payment flows in Nordea¬¥s target payment architecture.¬†¬†What you‚Äôll be doing:

Contributing to solution architecture, design and maintainability of applications
Designing, building and maintaining near real-time data pipelines
Interacting with product owners and stakeholders to clarify, elicit and translate requirements into implementation specifications
Data mapping, data modelling, solution design and working with Information architects
Performing quantitative data analysis with the aim to understand identified issues, and to explain implications and recommend solutions
Collaborating with developers and engineers and properly document your design and solutions
Eliciting requirements (functional and non-functional) by co-operating with different stakeholders in a complex environment
Be responsible for requirements documentation (inc. use cases) and quality improvement
Accessing complex and distributed datasets and perform statistical analysis



The role is based in Copenhagen / Taastrup. ¬†Who you are

Collaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the values that guide us in being at our best ‚Äì and that we imagine you share with us.

To succeed in this role, we believe that you:

Are a team player who takes ownership, builds cross-functional relationships and loves sharing knowledge
Have a consultant mindset ‚Äì actively participate in multiple initiatives at once
Can communicate constructively, and contribute to a productive work environment and good atmosphere in the team



Your experience and background:¬†

Expert in data modelling principles, data architectures and integration patterns
Expert in in requirement elicitation / analysis
Expert in SQL (Oracle, MSSQL or similar RDBMS)
Experience in one or more cloud platforms (AWS/Azure/Google)
Knowledge of the banking sector and payment domain (ISO20022 standard, SEPA and Swift messages)
Hands on knowledge of practices like Domain driven design, Event sourcing architecture patterns, microservices architecture and clean code.
Hands on knowledge of CI/CD, Jenkins, Docker, Kubernetes, REST, Maven and JUnit and also to have experience building distributed, highly available and high throughput applications
Degree in computer science and engineering, mathematical modelling or similar
Excellent written and spoken English communication skills, and familiar with international collaboration with different stakeholder groups



At Nordea, we know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable workplace. We deeply believe that our diverse backgrounds, experiences, characteristics and traits make us better at serving customers and communities. So please come as you are.



If this sounds like you, get in touch!

¬†

Next steps

¬†

Submit your application no later than 26/09/2024. For more information, you‚Äôre welcome to contact Troels Nissen at troels.nissen@nordea.com.

¬†

At Nordea, we know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable workplace. We deeply believe that our diverse backgrounds, experiences, characteristics and traits make us better at serving customers and communities. So please come as you are. ¬†Please be aware that any applications or CVs coming through email or direct messages will not be accepted or considered.

Job ID: 24876  

At Nordea, we know our stakeholder needs are changing ‚Äì and we‚Äôre deeply committed to meeting them with the solutions of tomorrow. We‚Äôre creating a new cloud environment where we‚Äôre harnessing the power of near real time data ‚Äì one where you can make an impact. So bring your skills, ideas and unique background. With us, you‚Äôll find plenty of opportunities to grow and make your mark on something bigger.  About this opportunity To strengthen our team we are looking for an experienced Lead Data/IT Analyst who has skills to do hands-on data and requirement analysis work. The right candidate also understands other aspects of software development: Are we making solid architectural decisions? Are we able to improve our tech stack? Are we focusing on right things?

 

As the Lead Data/IT Analyst, you‚Äôll engage with many different stakeholders, so the person we are looking for, is an outgoing individual who is self-motivated and contributes to a good team spirit. You are an experienced and passionate analyst, always seeking the best solution.

 

Your main responsibilities will be around the consolidation and harmonization, sourcing, storage and distribution of Payments Data to other solutions. It also includes integrations supporting different End2End payment flows in Nordea¬¥s target payment architecture.  What you‚Äôll be doing:

  • Contributing to solution architecture, design and maintainability of applications
  • Designing, building and maintaining near real-time data pipelines
  • Interacting with product owners and stakeholders to clarify, elicit and translate requirements into implementation specifications
  • Data mapping, data modelling, solution design and working with Information architects
  • Performing quantitative data analysis with the aim to understand identified issues, and to explain implications and recommend solutions
  • Collaborating with developers and engineers and properly document your design and solutions
  • Eliciting requirements (functional and non-functional) by co-operating with different stakeholders in a complex environment
  • Be responsible for requirements documentation (inc. use cases) and quality improvement
  • Accessing complex and distributed datasets and perform statistical analysis



The role is based in Copenhagen / Taastrup.  Who you are

Collaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the values that guide us in being at our best ‚Äì and that we imagine you share with us.

To succeed in this role, we believe that you:

  • Are a team player who takes ownership, builds cross-functional relationships and loves sharing knowledge
  • Have a consultant mindset ‚Äì actively participate in multiple initiatives at once
  • Can communicate constructively, and contribute to a productive work environment and good atmosphere in the team

  • Expert in data modelling principles, data architectures and integration patterns
  • Expert in in requirement elicitation / analysis
  • Expert in SQL (Oracle, MSSQL or similar RDBMS)
  • Experience in one or more cloud platforms (AWS/Azure/Google)
  • Knowledge of the banking sector and payment domain (ISO20022 standard, SEPA and Swift messages)
  • Hands on knowledge of practices like Domain driven design, Event sourcing architecture patterns, microservices architecture and clean code.
  • Hands on knowledge of CI/CD, Jenkins, Docker, Kubernetes, REST, Maven and JUnit and also to have experience building distributed, highly available and high throughput applications
  • Degree in computer science and engineering, mathematical modelling or similar
  • Excellent written and spoken English communication skills, and familiar with international collaboration with different stakeholder groups



At Nordea, we know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable workplace. We deeply believe that our diverse backgrounds, experiences, characteristics and traits make us better at serving customers and communities. So please come as you are.



If this sounds like you, get in touch!

 

Next steps

 

Submit your application no later than 26/09/2024. For more information, you‚Äôre welcome to contact Troels Nissen at troels.nissen@nordea.com.

 

At Nordea, we know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable workplace. We deeply believe that our diverse backgrounds, experiences, characteristics and traits make us better at serving customers and communities. So please come as you are.  Please be aware that any applications or CVs coming through email or direct messages will not be accepted or considered.

Title: SQL Database Engineer / SQL und T-SQL
Description:
