Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Are you an experienced Data Engineer looking to have a significant impact on the transformation of the data landscape of a company with more than 20,000 employees worldwide? Then join BESTSELLER ‚Äì an international fashion company with brands like ONLY, JACK & JONES and VERO MODA.

We are looking for a Data Engineer to join our Data & Analytics department in BESTSELLER, working out of either our office in Amsterdam (NL), Aarhus (DK) or Brande (DK). As a department, we are responsible for delivering quality data products and developing the corporate data strategy for BESTSELLER ‚Äì and our field is at the top of our business agenda.

YOUR TEAM & ROLE

With a system landscape typical of a 50-year-old company, BESTSELLER is undergoing a transformation into a modern data mesh architecture. This shift will significantly enhance how our business trusts data and makes data-driven decisions.

As Data Engineer, you will be part of a team of six dedicated colleagues who share a passion for creating great products and improving existing ones. We develop tools that automate and enhance decision-making through data and insights, focusing on e-commerce, master data, product information management, and data products within a data mesh architecture. Furthermore, you will have a sister team of eight colleagues, who work with master data and governance, with whom you will work closely with, when it comes to helping other teams understand and get on board with the data mesh strategy.

More specifically, your tasks include:


Data pipeline development
Modelling and transformation of data
Implementation of data products including data contracts
Engagement of stakeholders to understand the tasks and business requirements


YOUR PROFILE

We expect that you are an outgoing and energetic team player who takes ownership and creates positive results. You have a structured and curious approach to your work. To succeed in the role, you can recognize and apply best practices, methodology, tools, and techniques. This is to meet our partners business requirements, timelines, and budgets.

We are looking for an experienced Data Engineer with a proven track record in the following technologies:


Apache Airflow
Snowflake
dbt / SQL
Kafka
Python
Cloud platforms: AWS, GCP, or Azure
Integration technologies including REST, S3 file storage, Azure Blobs, SFTP.


Your Benefits


You will get a versatile and challenging job in a high-paced company with rapid decision processes.
You will join a team characterised by trust, autonomy, and continuous feedback, contributing to a positive impact.
You will have great opportunities to learn new skills and grow professionally and personally and work in an international environment with different cultures.
Competitive compensation package according to the country you will be based in.


WE LOOK FORWARD TO HEARING FROM YOU

If you have any questions about the position, please contact Manager Christian Thraner at +45 40 92 92 50. Otherwise, please send us your CV and application as soon as possible and no later than 9 October 2024. We review candidates on an ongoing basis and reserve the right to close the application window, when we find the right candidate.

LOCATION: Amsterdam, NL | Aarhus, DK | Brande, DK

About Bestseller

At BESTSELLER, we are more than 20,000 people in 38 different countries working for over 20 fashion brands such as JACK & JONES, SELECTED, VERO MODA, ONLY, PIECES, VILA, OBJECT, MAMALICIOUS, NAME IT, NOISY MAY and Y.A.S. We are a family-owned company with a strong foundation and values to build on, empowering us to pursue the ideas we believe in to take BESTSELLER forward. We are committed to diversity and provide equal opportunities for everyone, irrespective of sex, race, ethnicity, religion or belief, disability, age, sexual orientation or gender identity. We strive to create an empowering environment where people can thrive and develop. For more information, visit www.bestseller.com.

Title: Dataanalytiker
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
I HOFOR er der sat tryk p√• hvordan vi kan f√• data ud og leve i organisationen, og derfor har jeg brug for en dataanalytiker mere til teamet. Det er en stilling, hvor fokus vil v√¶re p√• at f√• struktureret data, samt at f√• udrullet data til forretningen gennem rapporter i Power BI.

Dataanalytiker i √òkonomi

Som Dataanalytiker kommer du i samarbejde med vores anden dataanalytiker til at blive indgangsvinklen for teamets arbejde med Power BI og datah√•ndtering i kuber. Du f√•r en n√∏glerolle i at realisere, at de √∏vrige controllere f√•r v√¶rkt√∏jer, som g√∏r at de kan formidle viden p√• den mest optimale m√•de til forretningen samtidig med, at data bliver udstillet og gjort tilg√¶ngelig for ledere.

Dine prim√¶re arbejdsopgaver omfatter, at du:


Udvikler og kvalitetssikrer BI-platform for HR
Transformerer de nuv√¶rende finansdata og udstiller dem i Power BI
Sikrer at de udstillede rapporter/datakilder til en hver tid er valideret og retvisende
Optimerer og udvikler den nuv√¶rende rapportering visuelt



Dataforst√•else og visualiseringsevner

Vi s√∏ger en dygtig dataanalytiker, fx cand. merc, eller tilsvarende uddannelse. Du skal v√¶re skarp til Excel og helst have kendskab til Business Intelligence og visualiseringsv√¶rkt√∏jer som Power BI. Har du arbejdet med Access og SQL, er det en fordel, men ikke et krav.

Vi er √•bne for b√•de nyuddannede og erfarne kandidater. Det vigtigste for os er, at du har en passion for dataanalyse og har en interesse i at udvikle dine f√¶rdigheder. Hvis du motiveres af at n√∏rde med data, vil l√¶ringen ogs√• komme naturligt.

Vi forventer derudover, at du:


Har en god forst√•else for data ‚Äì struktur, modellering og udstilling
√ònsker at arbejde med best practice for principper for datavisualisering



Som person er du struktureret, selvk√∏rende og kan planl√¶gge din egen tid, s√• du form√•r at sikre fremdrift i dine opgaver og projekter. Du besidder gode analytiske f√¶rdigheder og vil trives med at samarbejde med mange datakilder i forretningen.

Vi ser frem til at byde dig velkommen

Du bliver en del af teamet FP&A, som best√•r af 8 medarbejdere, der gerne vil hinanden. I teamet har vi et stort fokus p√• at have det sjovt, s√•vel p√• arbejdet men ogs√• gennem fejring af succeser ved sociale arrangementer uden for arbejdstiden.

Der er frie rammer og en stor interesse i at st√∏tte hinanden i teamet, samtidig med at vi s√¶tter en stor √¶re i at holde en h√∏j faglighed. Teamet er en del af et velfungerende √∏konomiomr√•de med mere end 60 engagerede medarbejdere.

Vi har et fleksibelt arbejdsmilj√∏ og giver plads og mulighed for hjemmearbejde efter aftale med n√¶rmeste leder. Hos os er der plads til dig, og til at du har et b√¶redygtigt arbejdsliv.

Du kan l√¶se mere om vores medarbejdergoder her

Bliv en del af HOFOR og v√¶r med til at g√∏re en forskel

Er du klar til nye muligheder, s√• ser vi frem til at modtage dit cv p√• 1-2 sider, hvor du blot tilf√∏jer nogle linjer om din motivation for at s√∏ge stillingen. En egentlig ans√∏gning er derfor ikke et krav.

Ans√∏gningsfristen er s√∏dang den 15. september 2024, og vi afholder 1. samtale den 19. september 2024 og 2. samtale den 25.-27. september 2024.

Har du sp√∏rgsm√•l til jobbet, er du velkommen til at kontakte teamleder Michael Lund Sahl p√• tlf. 2795 2146 eller mail mics@hofor.dk.

Send din ans√∏gning ved at klikke p√• ‚ÄùS√∏g stillingen‚Äù i h√∏jre side.

Er jobbet ikke det rette match for dig?

Hvis dette job ikke er det rette match for dig, vil vi opfordre dig til at dele jobannoncen med andre i dit netv√¶rk, der kunne finde stillingen interessant. Tag ogs√• et kig p√• vores andre ledige stillinger her - m√•ske vi har det rette job til dig.

Hos os f√•r du plads

Vand, varme, hverdag. I HOFOR sikrer vi forsyningen i hovedstadsomr√•det. Men vores ansvar r√¶kker l√¶ngere: Vi skaber fremtidens b√¶redygtige byer. Det kr√¶ver overskud, og derfor giver vi dig plads. Plads til at forf√∏lge de store ideer og til at hente de sm√•. Plads til at dyrke de faglige detaljer og til at tegne de store linjer. Plads til at hj√¶lpe hinanden og til at t√¶nke nyt, n√•r der er brug for det. Vi har plads til flere og til, at du kan v√¶re med.

HOFOR. Hos os f√•r du plads. Til f√¶llesskab, udvikling og et b√¶redygtigt arbejdsliv.

Inkluderende kultur og rekruttering

I HOFOR arbejder vi p√• at skabe en inkluderende kultur, og vi leder efter dygtige kollegaer uanset udseende, k√∏n, k√∏nsidentitet, seksuel orientering, etnicitet, religion, handicap, alder osv. Vi vil gerne skabe lige muligheder for alle samt sikre en retf√¶rdig rekrutteringsproces. Undlad venligst at vedh√¶fte et billede.

Title: Analytics Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Join Our Team as an Analytics Engineer at Maersk in Copenhagen!

Are you passionate about incorporating cutting-edge technology like machine learning and mathematical optimization into real-world operations? Do you thrive in collaborative environments where your expertise drives impactful solutions? If so, we have an exciting opportunity for you!

About Us

At Maersk, we are passionate about creating a world where global trade flows seamlessly. We are achieving this by harnessing the power of data and technology and embedding advanced machine learning and mathematical optimization into the core of our operations. As a global expert in container logistics, we are dedicated to building sustainable solutions that benefit our customers, communities, and the planet. Join our Network Strategy team and be part of shaping the future of shipping.

Your Role

As an Analytics Engineer, you will be at the forefront of expanding our advanced analytics capabilities within mathematical optimization, operations research, machine learning and statistics. The position involves close collaboration with cross-functional teams to identify business needs, develop innovative solutions, and implement algorithms that enhance operational efficiency and decision-making processes. Working alongside experts in mathematical optimization, business strategists, and software developers, you will contribute to the innovation of cutting-edge technologies that optimize one of the world‚Äôs largest container vessel networks.

What We Offer


An exciting role in our Network Strategy team, where you will tackle some of Maersk's most challenging optimization problems.
Opportunities to apply innovative scientific solutions to real-world challenges, making a significant impact at Maersk.
Work with a diverse range of tasks, offering opportunities for growth and the ability to take increasingly ownership of your work.
Drive optimization initiatives that advance the decarbonization journey while targeting an addressable cost base of billions annually.
Engage with a broad data science community featuring specialists in machine learning, operations research, deep learning, and many other fields.
Opportunities to contribute to Maersk's long-term strategic planning, focusing on optimizing our global ocean transportation network, but also extending to other transportation modes.
A chance to work in an international environment at our headquarters in Copenhagen.
Collaborate with a dynamic, highly diverse team that values inclusivity and brings a wide range of perspectives to drive innovative solutions.
Flexible work culture with partial remote work options.


Key Responsibilities


Develop tools in collaboration with Maersk's business to facilitate decision-making in network design and ocean product development.
Gather and analyze business requirements, conceptualize solutions, design, test, and refine prototypes and production applications.
Partner with a diverse range of business experts and stakeholders to identify opportunities for creating additional value through prescriptive analytics.
Shape the vision for leveraging software to optimize Maersk business operations.


Who We're Looking For


Strong technical background with a master's or PhD degree in engineering, mathematics, or computer science, focusing on mathematical optimization/operations research or AI/machine learning.
Minimum 2 years of professional experience in software development, particularly in algorithms and optimization tools.
Track record of successfully implementing analytical tools leading to measurable improvements in operational performance and decision-making.
Ability to translate business requirements into mathematical and quantitative models, adhering to best software development practices.
Analytical mindset with a knack for solving complex technical challenges.
Proficiency in Python and familiarity with development, debugging, test, and version control tools.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills for seamless collaboration.
Positive and inclusive mindset that embraces challenges as opportunities for growth and innovation.
Experience in graph theory, database management (preferably MS SQL Server), systems programming languages such as C++, statistical and probability analysis, is a plus.


Maersk is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace, and we embrace different styles of thinking. Maersk is an equal opportunities employer and welcomes applicants without regard to race, colour, gender, sex, age, religion, creed, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, marital status, sexual orientation, physical or mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy or parental leave, veteran status, gender identity, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law. We will consider qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with all legal requirements.

We are happy to support your need for any adjustments during the application and hiring process. If you need special assistance or an accommodation to use our website, apply for a position, or to perform a job, please contact us by emailing accommodationrequests@maersk.com.

Are you passionate about incorporating cutting-edge technology like machine learning and mathematical optimization into real-world operations? Do you thrive in collaborative environments where your expertise drives impactful solutions? If so, we have an exciting opportunity for you!

  • Opportunities to apply innovative scientific solutions to real-world challenges, making a significant impact at Maersk.
  • Work with a diverse range of tasks, offering opportunities for growth and the ability to take increasingly ownership of your work.

  • Opportunities to contribute to Maersk's long-term strategic planning, focusing on optimizing our global ocean transportation network, but also extending to other transportation modes.

  • Experience in graph theory, database management (preferably MS SQL Server), systems programming languages such as C++, statistical and probability analysis, is a plus.

Maersk is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace, and we embrace different styles of thinking. Maersk is an equal opportunities employer and welcomes applicants without regard to race, colour, gender, sex, age, religion, creed, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, marital status, sexual orientation, physical or mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy or parental leave, veteran status, gender identity, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law. We will consider qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with all legal requirements.

We are happy to support your need for any adjustments during the application and hiring process. If you need special assistance or an accommodation to use our website, apply for a position, or to perform a job, please contact us by emailing accommodationrequests@maersk.com.

Title: Data Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you a detail-oriented, curious, and data-driven problem solver who wants to build up and maintain a Data Platform for reporting and analytics in a fast-growing FinTech company? Then you might be the one we are looking for.




Banking Circle is a truly international and vibrant company with more than 550 skilled and dedicated employees worldwide, who are all passionate about creating next-generation mission-critical financial services infrastructure and leading the rise of a super-correspondent banking network.




About the role

We are looking to hire a highly skilled Data Engineer to join our Data Engineering team in Copenhagen, reporting to the Data Engineering Team Lead.




In this role you will get the chance to work on building and maintaining our next generation Data Platform in Azure. The Data Engineering team owns Banking Circle‚Äôs Data Platform, which is closely coupled to our payment processing system. Our tech stack includes Python, Terraform, Microsoft Azure cloud ecosystem, Azure DevOps, and Microsoft Power BI. Furthermore, we also use Databricks SQL warehouses and Astronomer/Airflow to orchestrate our processing pipelines.

What you will be doing

Build and maintain our Data Platform in collaboration with peers
Advocate for software architecture patterns, efficient data processing, modern data integration, and solid data modelling
Collaborate in the continual analysis of project requirements in collaboration with teams across the organization
Participate in Agile team rituals (stand-up, planning, and retrospective)
Contribute to continuous improvements of the team‚Äôs way of working
Take responsibility for own learning and development




What we are looking for

To be the right candidate for this position, we expect you to have an educational background within computer science, software engineering, or other related fields, with a bachelor's degree as a minimum. We expect you to have 3+ years of relevant work experience within pipelines, infrastructure, or the platform world, including strong Python skills. Furthermore, it is a big advantage if you have experience within Microsoft Azure cloud.




As a person we expect you to be open-minded, and willing to learn and further expand your existing experience in Data Engineering. You are curious, communicative, and able to work well on your own as well in a team.




As Banking Circle is an international company it¬¥s a requirement, that you are fluent in English.




What we offer you

We offer a hybrid work model for our employees to allow for flexibility and productivity, however we do also expect you to spend time in the office on a regular basis to build community and efficiency in the team. Furthermore, we offer a competitive salary and a generous benefit package, opportunities for continuous learning, development, and a dynamic and collaborative culture that values personal initiative and professional achievements.




Would you like to join us?

We will be conducting interviews continuously; therefore, we urge interested candidates to apply online as soon as possible. Please note that we do not accept applications by email.




If you have questions do not hesitate to contact Kheira Nougal, Global Recruitment Partner on khno@bankingcircle.com. No agencies, please.




Who we are

Banking Circle is a fully licensed next generation Payments Bank that is designed to meet the global banking and payments needs of Payments businesses, Banks, and Marketplaces. Through our API, we deliver fast, low-cost global payments and banking services by connecting to the world‚Äôs clearing systems ‚Äì enabling our clients to move liquidity in real-time for all major currencies securely and compliantly. To learn more about Banking Circle, visit us at www.bankingcircle.com




We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, age, religion, sexual orientation, national origin or any other characteristic protected under federal, state or local laws, regulations and ordinances.

Show more

Title: Data Engineer to drive our data journey into the future
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job Description

The Personal Customers business unit in Danske Bank is standing in front of a large transformation spanning multiple areas across the business all of which are heavily reliant on a solid, sustainable and secure data foundation. This data foundation will be instrumental for the bank in reaching the strategic Forward‚Äô28 goals promised to the market in 2023 all meant to ensure a better banking experience and better banking products across all of our customers.

The Customer Engagement Individuals tribe exists with the customer at the centre of everything. The tribe has ownership of key customer facing systems spanning across Danske Bank‚Äôs channels and capabilities. The Tribe consists of a wide range of profiles (Data Analysts, Data Engineers, Business Functional Specialists, Architects, UI/UX Designers and much more) and nationalities (Nordics wide, Lithuania, Indian & more.) which we leverage to ensure solutions are the best they can be for our customers.

You will be joining the Customer Engagement Individuals Tribe and gain approximately 140 colleagues where you will be a part one of the data squads in charge of enabling the data across the Personal Customers domain and help enable Danske Bank get ready for the next generation of banking services. This will first and foremost be achieved through creation of the foundational data elements underpinning banking services on our scalable data platform. Data engineering will therefore be a significant enabler of the strategy and allow for commercial teams to develop data products and system owners to trust they receive high quality data enabling their required downstream functionality.

A normal workday for our data engineer will consist of working with your team of data- and business experts ensuring our data are enabled across the bank and adhere to Danske Bank technical frameworks. This will enable us to deliver on high quality customer products as well as enable us to become more digital as considering the Forward ‚Äô28 strategy. Also it will consist of building the back-end pipelines ensuring seamless data transfers through a range of methodologies like event-driven transfer for near real time downstream analytics and functionality and more classical API transfers.

As Data Engineer you will:


Develop data pipelines including collection, ingestion, cleaning, transformation & loading
Ensure data is efficiently moved, stored, organised, accessible & scalable within the group wide technical landscape
Ensure sufficient and coherent documentation and reporting.
Work closely together with system & data owners to enable data
Work with other business areas across Personal Customers to ensure bank wide data availability.
Align data to the bank‚Äôs regulatory, governance, security & management frameworks to ensure E2E compliant data.
Be expected to continuously learn and grow in the role and adopt new technologies as the technical landscape changes.


What we imagine you bring; a Bacholor‚Äôs degree or higher within Computer Science, Information Technology, Engineering or similar. Furthermore you;


Have experience with data pipelining
Have proven proficiencies in database management. Could both be relational like MySQL or PostgreSQL, or NoSQL databases.
Have experience with integration tool is a big plus, examples like Apache Kafka, Apache NiFi or Cloud based solutions like AWS Glue or Azure Data Factory
Have experience & understanding of cloud vendors, data platforms and big data technologies are a plus.
Should have a foundational knowledge of Git for version control and an introductory understanding of DevOps principles to facilitate effective teamwork
Have clear understanding and experience with ETL processes.
Have experience with security, compliance, risk, load & general financial services data are a plus
Are fluent in written and spoken English
Are based in Denmark, as we do not offer re-location package.


What We Offer

As a modern workplace, our employees can use our offers such as canteen, fitness centre, sport club and much more. You will also benefit from a highly attractive benefits package offering health and dental insurance, pension and other benefits. You will have flexible work hours, 6 weeks of vacation and 5 care days to ensure your work-life balance.

Uniqueness is powerful-we welcome everyone in Danske Bank.

Would you like to join us

We will conduct interviews on an ongoing basis, so if this has piqued your interest, don't hesitate to apply as soon as possible.

Should you need more information about the position, please reach out to:

Jan Baungaard, jabau@danskebank.dk - LinkedIn

Mikkel Winther, mikkelw@danskebank.dk - LinkedIn
Show more

Title: Analytics Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
We are looking for an Analytics Engineer to join our fast growing Mobility Team; where we finance progress in mobility, and clean energy adoption.

As an analytics engineer in mobility, you would be working with a cross-functional team both in Mobility and the wider analytics team in the Fintech side of the business. Additionally, you would own analytics datasets and pipelines for the specific product domain and work together with your cross-functional partners to improve our understanding of the area.

About Us

At M-KOPA, applying best practices is important to us in order to build reliable, well tested, efficient and documented data assets.

Your role would be focused on Dimensional Data modelling and visualization, Data Engineering, Business and Product Optimization, Cloud Platform Utilization and Data Management.

You would be building easy to understand and consistently modelled datasets to serve metrics, dashboards and exploratory analysis; including building data transformation pipelines, primarily by using SQL and Python in dbt, and Airflow infrastructure.

You would also be developing semantic models in Looker, build dashboards and coach users on how to use self-serve capabilities of our platform while working together with software engineers to ensure that the data necessary for analysis is captured well in our systems.

This is a fully remote role, within the following time zone (UTC -1 / UTC+3). Our engineers work remotely from locations such as UK, Europe and Africa. You will be reporting to the group Head of Technology - Mobility.

Expertise

Our expectation is that you have extensive experience with Python, Java and proficiency in SQL. Additionally, working with data warehouse technologies, and with BI tools such as Looker or Tableau and dimensional data modelling for analytics / big data infrastructures would make you an ideal candidate for the role.

Experience working with orchestration systems such as airflow working with dbt will equally be essential for this role.

Why M-KOPA?

We are a diverse and inclusive company that empowers our people to own their careers through diverse development programs, coaching partnerships, and on-the-job training. We support individual journeys with family-friendly policies, prioritize well-being, and embrace flexibility.

Join us in shaping the future of M-KOPA as we grow together. Explore more at m-kopa.com.

Recognized thrice by the Financial Times as one Africa's fastest growing company (2022, 2023 and 2024) and by TIME100 Most influential companies in the world 2023 and 2024 , we've served over 4 million customers, unlocking $1 billion in cumulative credit for the unbanked across Africa.
Show more

Title: Virtual Data Coordinator
Description:
Are you feeling ready to fly high? This job lets you fly drones and collect data in a playful way that helps pave the way for a greener tomorrow!




Eurowind Energy is a global and leading developer, owner and operator of wind and solar energy projects. Based in Denmark, we operate in 16 different countries across Europe and in the U.S. and we are continuously growing our project portfolio. We believe in a future of renewable energy, and we have an ambitious plan of becoming the next generations‚Äô ‚ÄúPower Major‚Äù. Based on a full value chain from greenfield project development to energy trading, more than 500+ team members are dedicated to create a greener future fueled with nothing but renewable energy!




Your role

As Virtual Data Coordinator you will be responsible for designing Eurowind‚Äôs drone strategy and doing the daily drone operation. Your main responsibilities include:




Selection/design of industrial drone for use in: Mapping/3D Surveys, Photovoltaic Thermographic Inspections, Wind Turbine inspections, Agricultural, Marketing Pictures and Video.
Cooperation with different departments and building reports.
Establishing setup for automated inspection flights in parks globally.
Being responsible for hardware and data collection via CCTV in parks globally.




The role combines your inner explorer with your fascination of data and takes a certain accuracy and immersion. More specifically, the tasks include:




Daily drone operation and maintenance with safety and compliance.
Surveying of land, and conversion to scalable maps.
Ensuring that data collection is automated, repeatable and directly integrated into the GIS structure.
PV inspections and optimization using drone‚Äôs normal and thermal pictures.
Organizing, managing and reporting on data in a coherent manner.
Preparation of documentation for analysis on a group level.
Assistance in regards to agricultural drones ‚Äì both aerial and on ground level.

Cooperating with data analyst regarding Machine Learning / AI on the drone/camera data




Your profile

To succeed in this role, you must demonstrate your tech skills and be capable of programming the drone so it will produce insightful data at every flight. We imagine that you have a technical background and can agree on the following:




You are educated as Software Engineer, Automation Engineer, Land Surveyor, Drone Pilot/Drone Operator, Geographer, Cartographer or similar.
You are a tech ‚Äúnerd‚Äù with an unquestionable interest in technical data and automatation.
You are organized and good at adapting to the workflow.
You are good at communicating with colleagues and stakeholders and have a proactive approach.




Renewable energy is our future. And so are our people!

At Eurowind Energy we do our best to create a culture where everyone is valued and feels at home. You will notice this in your everyday work life, where you have the freedom to speak up and where your voice does mean something to us. We know that when you grow, we grow. Therefore, we strive to support you in what you think is right and in your personal and professional development. We offer you an exciting job in an energetic and international environment. And we promise you: the wind is never standing still.




Did we capture your attention?

Great! If you see yourself in this role, do not hesitate to apply for the position. Please use the link below.




Should you have any questions before applying, please feel free to contact Mette Birk, Manager Operational Development, on mbs@ewe.dk.




Developing, operating and managing wind and solar parks is not just pure business for us. It is a way to view the world. And with this worldview comes a genuine ambition to be one of the leading developers in Europe. Because creating a future run entirely on green energy matters to us.




We manage our own portfolio of projects and at the same time, we perform technical and financial management of projects. We have throughout many years experienced sustained economic growth in the number of developed projects and companies in management. And we continue to expect this. Simply because it is in our nature to keep developing ‚Äì projects, companies and our people.




Read more about Eurowind Energy on our website or LinkedIn.




Application deadline: 15. September 2024

Title: EDC/Clinical Programmer
Place: Gentofte, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you passionate about Clinical Data? Do you have solid experience building an eCRF in an EDC CDMS and/or clinical programing for complex studies? Are you familiar with clinical data management activities from start-up, conduct to closure?

If so, now is your chance to join Ascendis Pharma as our new EDC Clinical Programmer.

Ascendis Pharma is a fast-growing biopharmaceutical company with locations in Denmark, Germany, and the United States. We are applying our TransCon technology to build a leading, fully integrated biopharmaceutical company with an independent pipeline of long-acting prodrug therapies that address unmet patient needs.

As our new EDC/Clinical Programmer, you have a deep understanding of clinical data, and through your work you will be recognized as an expert. Your way of collaborating with internal and external stakeholders, will help the data management study team to succeed.

In this position you will be given broad responsibility tailored to our studies. You will be involved in data management activities associated with the development, conduct, and management of assigned studies in endocrinology, and future therapeutic areas. You will provide expert knowledge and support across phase 1 to 4 trials serving as the EDC & Clinical Programmer to ensure the success of the trial. You will work independently and collaboratively in a dynamic team environment.

You will work closely with our Data Management team, to ensuring quality study deliverables are met. As a key point of contact for internal stakeholders and Vendors, your will be actively involved together with the Clinical Data Manager on how best data can be captured as well ensuring with oversight of the clinical data both within DM and our stakeholders.

You will be joining the newly established Clinical Data Management team in the Copenhagen office. In this role you have a unique opportunity to be part of shaping the way we work within the Global Clinical Data Management organization. You bring with you a wealth of professional experience, you are passionate and have an eye for frameworks, processes, and best practices. We encourage you to think out of the box supporting the organization in doing an even better job, when preparing for future requirements. For the right candidate you will be given the mandate to participate or manage non-study initiatives and / or projects.

You will be supported by line management, who has in depth clinical data management experience, who can challenge, and spar as needed, and who will pave the way for you to succeed. Throughout the year you and your manager will meet to perform deep dive communication, where well-being, growth and collaboration are on the agenda.

Main areas of responsibility:

Develop and Update Clinical Databases (EDC).
Ensures adherence to clinical database standards, SOPs and Process Guidelines.
Leads and/or participates in the review of eCRFs and validation checks, database development, programming of validation checks in Clinical Data Management System (CDMS).
Interface with members of study teams, including external CROs/Vendors where applicable, to integrate study team requirements into all deliverables.
Participates in extra activities including, but not limited to, evaluation and testing of new systems and helps coordinate CDM Systems technical initiatives. Contributes strategies, innovative and creative solutions to enhance processes and increase productivity of the group.
Contribute to the ongoing development, review, and revisions of Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs), Work Instructions, Training and standard DM templates.¬†¬†
Contribute to the development of CDM and EDC standards.
Generate metric reports and listings to facilitate the management and review of external data, as required.¬†

¬†Your Profile

A minimum of 6 years of clinical programming and/or EDC database development and experience from pharma, biotech or CRO and a relevant academic degree in life sciences (e.g. data science, computer science, pharmacy, biology, statistics).

Furthermore, you have:

Demonstrated technical proficiency in a Clinical Data Management Systems (i.e. Veeva CDMS, Medidata Rave, Oracle Inform etc.).
At least 4 years of EDC database development experience.
At least 2 years of Programming experience preferably in SAS and SQL.
Proficiency in cultivating and sustaining positive collaborative relationships across diverse functional areas.
Keen emphasis on prompt action and prioritizing stakeholder needs.
Project management capabilities encompassing effective group presentation, leadership, verbal and written communication, interpersonal adeptness, and organizational proficiency.
Desire to learn new processes and technologies.
Proficiency in multitasking, independent work, and effective communication.
Well-versed in the drug discovery process, FDA regulations, GxP guidelines, ICH guidelines, clinical database cleaning procedures, and 21 CFR Part 11.

Also, you are proficient in English at a professional level, both written and spoken.

As a person, you are a strong team player, proactive in nature and have a can-do attitude. As we are taking new steps towards developing best-in-class therapeutics for patients with rare diseases we are looking for people who possess an entrepreneurial mindset who can handle ambiguity, analyze, and create clarity and desires to be part of an organization where everything isn't set in stone. We rely on you to help us shape the cement and be part of building the Clinical Data Management team in the Copenhagen office. The person we are looking for thrives in a dynamic environment, short lines of communication and an open and informal working atmosphere.

Travel: Up to 5 - 15 days per year.

Place of work: Ascendis Pharma headquarter resides in a modern and wonderful office facility in Tuborg Havn in Hellerup with a view of the harbor, the canals, and the sea.

For more details¬†about the position or the company, please contact Peter Bayer, Senior Director of Clinical Data Management, Endocrinology, via¬†pbr@ascendispharma.com/ +45 30191920 or visit out website

All applications must be submitted in English and are treated confidentially.

Applications will be evaluated when received, so please apply as soon as possible.

HTML:
Are you passionate about Clinical Data? Do you have solid experience building an eCRF in an EDC CDMS and/or clinical programing for complex studies? Are you familiar with clinical data management activities from start-up, conduct to closure?

If so, now is your chance to join Ascendis Pharma as our new EDC Clinical Programmer.

Ascendis Pharma is a fast-growing biopharmaceutical company with locations in Denmark, Germany, and the United States. We are applying our TransCon technology to build a leading, fully integrated biopharmaceutical company with an independent pipeline of long-acting prodrug therapies that address unmet patient needs.

As our new EDC/Clinical Programmer, you have a deep understanding of clinical data, and through your work you will be recognized as an expert. Your way of collaborating with internal and external stakeholders, will help the data management study team to succeed.

In this position you will be given broad responsibility tailored to our studies. You will be involved in data management activities associated with the development, conduct, and management of assigned studies in endocrinology, and future therapeutic areas. You will provide expert knowledge and support across phase 1 to 4 trials serving as the EDC & Clinical Programmer to ensure the success of the trial. You will work independently and collaboratively in a dynamic team environment.

You will work closely with our Data Management team, to ensuring quality study deliverables are met. As a key point of contact for internal stakeholders and Vendors, your will be actively involved together with the Clinical Data Manager on how best data can be captured as well ensuring with oversight of the clinical data both within DM and our stakeholders.

You will be joining the newly established Clinical Data Management team in the Copenhagen office. In this role you have a unique opportunity to be part of shaping the way we work within the Global Clinical Data Management organization. You bring with you a wealth of professional experience, you are passionate and have an eye for frameworks, processes, and best practices. We encourage you to think out of the box supporting the organization in doing an even better job, when preparing for future requirements. For the right candidate you will be given the mandate to participate or manage non-study initiatives and / or projects.

You will be supported by line management, who has in depth clinical data management experience, who can challenge, and spar as needed, and who will pave the way for you to succeed. Throughout the year you and your manager will meet to perform deep dive communication, where well-being, growth and collaboration are on the agenda.

Main areas of responsibility:

  • Develop and Update Clinical Databases (EDC).
  • Ensures adherence to clinical database standards, SOPs and Process Guidelines.
  • Leads and/or participates in the review of eCRFs and validation checks, database development, programming of validation checks in Clinical Data Management System (CDMS).
  • Interface with members of study teams, including external CROs/Vendors where applicable, to integrate study team requirements into all deliverables.
  • Participates in extra activities including, but not limited to, evaluation and testing of new systems and helps coordinate CDM Systems technical initiatives. Contributes strategies, innovative and creative solutions to enhance processes and increase productivity of the group.
  • Contribute to the ongoing development, review, and revisions of Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs), Work Instructions, Training and standard DM templates.  
  • Contribute to the development of CDM and EDC standards.
  • Generate metric reports and listings to facilitate the management and review of external data, as required. 

 Your Profile

A minimum of 6 years of clinical programming and/or EDC database development and experience from pharma, biotech or CRO and a relevant academic degree in life sciences (e.g. data science, computer science, pharmacy, biology, statistics).

Furthermore, you have:

  • Demonstrated technical proficiency in a Clinical Data Management Systems (i.e. Veeva CDMS, Medidata Rave, Oracle Inform etc.).
  • At least 4 years of EDC database development experience.
  • At least 2 years of Programming experience preferably in SAS and SQL.
  • Proficiency in cultivating and sustaining positive collaborative relationships across diverse functional areas.
  • Keen emphasis on prompt action and prioritizing stakeholder needs.
  • Project management capabilities encompassing effective group presentation, leadership, verbal and written communication, interpersonal adeptness, and organizational proficiency.
  • Desire to learn new processes and technologies.
  • Proficiency in multitasking, independent work, and effective communication.
  • Well-versed in the drug discovery process, FDA regulations, GxP guidelines, ICH guidelines, clinical database cleaning procedures, and 21 CFR Part 11.

Also, you are proficient in English at a professional level, both written and spoken.

As a person, you are a strong team player, proactive in nature and have a can-do attitude. As we are taking new steps towards developing best-in-class therapeutics for patients with rare diseases we are looking for people who possess an entrepreneurial mindset who can handle ambiguity, analyze, and create clarity and desires to be part of an organization where everything isn't set in stone. We rely on you to help us shape the cement and be part of building the Clinical Data Management team in the Copenhagen office. The person we are looking for thrives in a dynamic environment, short lines of communication and an open and informal working atmosphere.

Travel: Up to 5 - 15 days per year.

Place of work: Ascendis Pharma headquarter resides in a modern and wonderful office facility in Tuborg Havn in Hellerup with a view of the harbor, the canals, and the sea.

For more details about the position or the company, please contact Peter Bayer, Senior Director of Clinical Data Management, Endocrinology, via pbr@ascendispharma.com/ +45 30191920 or visit out website

All applications must be submitted in English and are treated confidentially.

Applications will be evaluated when received, so please apply as soon as possible.

Title: Sr. Data Analytics Engineer
Place: Billund, Region of Southern Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job Description

Are you passionate about transforming data into actionable insights?

Join us with your outstanding business intelligence and process mining skills and make an impact within our Procure to Pay process team!

Please note the work location is Billund, Denmark and no relocation assistance is offered for this role.


Core Responsibilities





Create visualisation dashboards in PowerBI for end users to quickly identify areas for further investigation.
Create new reports by handling the full process of identifying data needed, connecting to data sources through Power BI Gateway, structuring data for modelling and building data model in Power BI
Maintain and improve existing reports, driving reporting standardisation and definitions alignment.
Drive automation of both existing and new reports
Perform maintenance, documentation, optimisation & decommissioning of reports.
Participate in projects and workgroups, requiring knowledge of data foundation and Business Intelligence (BI)
Training and daily support of users in BI reporting, governance and data-analysis
Stakeholder management of Global Process Owner, IT & others




Play your part in our team succeeding

Business Processes & Information is part of Business Service Operations. Our responsibilities cover global process ownership of finance transactional and HR processes as well as process support for controlling, training and project portfolio. Our main mission is to develop, maintain and optimise efficient and effective standardised processes and bridge business needs with IT solutions.

The Procure to Pay (P2P) business process team is tasked with establishing a robust reporting framework to enhance decision-making and performance management within our Shared Service Centers. With a focus on process optimization and system integration, we aim to leverage specialized expertise and adopt an end-to-end (E2E) perspective. Your role within the team will be pivotal, as you contribute to defining and facilitating the delivery of reporting needs while actively engaging in projects that demand Business Intelligence proficiency.

Do you have what it takes?





3+ years of experience working with data modelling, data governance and data visualization for decision making.
Advance experience with PowerBI, Power Query (M Query) and DAX (experience with PowerApps / Synapse SQL desired but not essential)
Experience of Process Mining, preferably Celonis
Experience working with SAP HANA Views and COUPA system would have an added advantage.
Excellent communication skills and ability to challenge stakeholders to deliver effective outcomes.
Excellent Presentation skills and experience in performing user training.
Continuous improvement knowledge and mindset
Ability to work with global teams spanning different time zones.




Please note that shortlisted candidates will be required to complete tests and assessments to demonstrate their advanced Power BI skills.

Applications are reviewed on an ongoing basis. However, please note we do amend or withdraw our jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to any advertised closing date. So, if you're interested in this role we encourage you to apply as soon as possible.

What‚Äôs in it for you?

Here is what you can expect

Family Care Leave - We offer enhanced paid leave options for those important times.

Insurances ‚Äì All colleagues are covered by our life and disability insurance which provides protection and peace of mind.

Wellbeing - We want our people to feel well and thrive. We offer resources and benefits to nurture physical and mental wellbeing along with opportunities to build community and inspire creativity.

Colleague Discount ‚Äì We know you'll love to build, so from day 1 you will qualify for our generous colleague discount.

Bonus - We do our best work to succeed together. When goals are reached and if eligible, you'll be rewarded through our bonus scheme.

Workplace - When you join the team you'll be assigned a primary workplace location i.e. one of our Offices, stores or factories. Our hybrid work policy means an average of 3 days per week in the office. The hiring team will discuss the policy and role eligibility with you during the recruitment process.

Children are our role models. Their curiosity, creativity and imagination inspire everything we do. We strive to create a diverse, dynamic and inclusive culture of play at the LEGO Group, where everyone feels safe, valued and they belong.

The LEGO Group is highly committed to equal employment opportunity and equal pay and seeks to encourage applicants from all backgrounds (eg. sex, gender identity or expression, race/ethnicity, national origin, sexual orientation, disability, age and religion) to apply for roles in our team.

Research shows that women and people from different underrepresented backgrounds often only apply for a job if they meet 100% of the listed qualifications. If you dream of being a part of our team and you meet many, but not all of our listed qualifications for this role, please apply.

The LEGO Group is fully committed to Children‚Äôs Rights and Child Wellbeing across the globe. Candidates offered positions with high engagement with children are required to take part in Child Safeguarding Background Screening, as a condition of the offer.

Thank you for sharing our global commitment to Children‚Äôs Rights.

Just imagine building your dream career.

Then make it real.

Join the LEGO¬Æ team today.

Description:
Vi s√∏ger et BI-team best√•ende af to profiler, som skal indg√• i opbyggelse af en Enterprise Business Intelligence enhed hos kunden, samt opbyggelse af knowhow og kompetencer indenfor BI platforme.

Kunden √∏nsker at transformere nuv√¶rende BI enhed fra et spredt landskab af BI platforme til en platform.

Deraf behovet for at gennemf√∏re en st√∏rre POC med udgangspunkt i Oracle Analytics, Cloud samt Fusion Data Intelligence, samt opbyggelse af knowhow indenfor dette omr√•de.

Efterf√∏lgende en dybdeg√•ende sammenligning (b√•de teknisk, funktionelt og arkitektur) af forskellige BI produkter.

Derefter f√∏lger implementering af de v√¶sentligste financielle rapporter samt migration af legacy rapporter og data.

OPGAVEBESKRIVELSE

De to konsulenter indg√•r i kundens eksisternede BI-team som √∏vrige medarbejdere og l√∏ser i f√¶lleskab POC opgaven som skal skabe grundlaget for at sammenligne og evaluere i forhold til kundens √∏vrige BI platforme. Konsulenterne skal kunne bidrage med f√∏lgende viden og erfaring:


Intensiv Oracle
Analytics Cloud og Fusion Data Intelligence viden, arkitektur og udviklingserfaring.
Opgaverne er prim√¶rt udviklingsopgaver, og forvaltes efter agile udviklingsmetoder (Scrum).
Skal kunne fremvise dokumentation for erfaring og mulig certificering eller kurser i ovenst√•ende.

Title: Analytics Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Planday from Xero is a leading digital solution that uncomplicates everyday scheduling and workforce management by making it easier for businesses and shift workers around the world to communicate, collaborate, and get work done.





Powered by a community of local industry experts, Planday provides a best-in-class digital platform that is easy to use, accurate, secure, and compliant with local needs and standards. From payroll to POS and reporting, its open API and tech ecosystem is scalable to fit shifting business needs and to build an engaged, flexible workforce.





Founded in 2004, Planday is headquartered in Copenhagen, Denmark and supports over 400,000 users across Europe and the US. Planday was acquired by Xero in 2021.





How you‚Äôll make an impact


As an Analytics Engineer, you'll revolutionize our data systems, turning raw information into transformative insights that drive innovation and growth. Your expertise will shape data into valuable assets, guiding strategic decision-making and product development. Collaborating closely with cross-functional teams, you'll unveil key metrics and customer insights, empowering us to make data-informed decisions. By activating complex datasets and applying advanced analysis techniques, you'll pave the way for automation and predictive modeling. With your dedication to excellence and problem-solving skills, you'll inspire a culture of data-driven innovation that enables Planday‚Äôs success.







What you‚Äôll do

Design, set up, and maintain technical data infrastructure.
Develop production-ready, scalable data pipelines and lead the life cycle of data-related backend services.
Create and manage data models to transform raw data into valuable assets, ensuring data accuracy and quality.
Utilize Python and SQL for data manipulation, activation, and cleaning, organizing, and ensuring data quality for analytical purposes.
Apply statistical analysis techniques for summarizing, interpreting, and predicting data, alongside basic machine learning concepts to explore predictive modeling techniques.







Success looks like

Seamless technical infrastructure setup and maintenance ensures uninterrupted data flow and accessibility.
Scalable data pipelines and optimized backend services lead to increased efficiency in data processing.
Well-designed and maintained data models that effectively transform raw data into valuable assets, ensuring data accuracy, quality, and lineage.
Consistently delivering accurate and reliable data models through proficient use of programming languages and statistical techniques, facilitating data-driven strategies and initiatives.
Regularly delivering actionable insights and key metrics to commercial and product engineering teams, contributing to informed decision-making and improved business outcomes.
Proactive problem-solving and innovative thinking in addressing data-related challenges, leading to continuous improvement and advancement in analytical capabilities.
Exploration and application of advanced analytical techniques, such as machine learning, to uncover new opportunities and insights for the organization.







What you‚Äôll bring with you

At least three years of experience in software engineering or a technical analytical role.
Ability to design and build data processing, storage, and activation systems for specific projects based on set requirements.
Experienced in SQL for data modeling and analysis.
Experienced in Python for building data pipelines and statistical analyses.
Experience with dbt, GitHub, and data lakehouse solutions (ideally Snowflake).
Able to drive software engineering best practices, such as writing maintainable and testable code.
Efficient execution of data wrangling and cleaning processes for multiple projects.
Ability to activate datasets and insights through reverse ETL jobs to different systems.
Proficiency in descriptive analytics, data visualization, and basic inferential statistics.
Independent problem-solving abilities using analytical reasoning and critical thinking skills.
Understanding of machine learning concepts and predictive modeling techniques.







At Planday, we offer you:





- Benefits like pension, health insurance, inclusive support for new parents and generous vacation


- On top of your annual base salary, you are offered to be part of an Employee Share Plan


- Growth and progression opportunities ‚Äì we want you to grow with us


- Flexible remote work


- Strong social culture with lots of team and company activities


- Meaningful work ‚Äì everyone at Planday contributes to improving the lives of shift workers around the globe


- Healthy work-life balance and autonomous approach to work. We trust in you and your abilities





Finally, our offices are not just workplaces (although they are pretty nice and well-located, we have to say!). Plandayers are open and welcoming and at Planday, everyone has the freedom and support to show their true self at work.





Our tech stack is cutting edge and our engineering work is supported by dedicated in-house scrum masters and agile evangelists.





At Planday, we firmly believe that diversity and inclusion are the cornerstones of innovation and a vibrant workplace culture, and we highly value the strength that diverse backgrounds offer.





As an equal opportunity employer, we strive to create an equitable experience for all our candidates throughout the process. Please let us know if you need reasonable accommodation during the application or interview process.





All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to any personal characteristics.

Title: Data Engineer (BizDevOps) for Decision Modeling
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job Description

Would you like to further develop your data modelling skills as well as using your competences on an area with large impact for our business? Join the Decision Modeling team and become a Nordic frontrunner to automate credit decisions.

As Data Engineer with BizDevOps capabilities (ModelOps) you would be joining a small team responsible for setting up our new infrastructure. Hands on Building, assisting and guiding the data scientists to implement our decision flows in greenfield infrastructure. Also being part of one big team in a non-traditional banking set-up characterized by high pace, agile development, flat hierarchy, and an overarching customer-focused approach!

You will be part of Decision Modeling consisting of 60 employees working from our offices in Copenhagen and Vilnius. We are a team with a flat structure and informal atmosphere. Our focus is to have a good collaboration and enable the best in each other.

‚ÄúWe work in a safe environment where everyone‚Äôs opinion is appreciated. Our team is characterized by high pace and high level collaboration, where we own the tasks as a team, but we rely on you as individual, giving your best shot at the solution. Our job is to collaborate with stakeholders across IT, Business units and management to align the best solutions that will have direct impact on the bank‚Äôs customers.‚Äù‚ÄØsays your future Manager, Aurelija.

Please note that‚ÄØwe are processing applications on a continuous basis, so please apply as soon as possible. Danske Bank supports a high degree of workplace flexibility (our team is currently using a hybrid working model, where we work at least 3 days a week in the office.).

Depending on your experience and knowledge, we may offer you a different seniority for the role.

You will:


Be supporting the team on technical implementations and defining model orchestration in our future micro service model infrastructure
Improve and challenge our automated ADO build pipelines, model orchestration and infrastructure
Take an important role in implementing standards for our technical best practices, pythonic principles and frameworks
Collaborate with product management and business stakeholders to understand company needs and advise on methodical solutions and technical best-practices


About you:


2+ years of relevant experience
Degree in Computer Science, Data Engineering, Mathematics, Physics, Programming, Statistics, or other relevant fields
Experience working with Azure DevOps build pipelines and docker
Experience working with large scale Python projects
Experience working with Micro service architecture
Experience with working with OpenShift would be a bonus
Upper-Intermediate English skills


We offer:

This position can be located both in Lithuania and Denmark. If the position is located in Lithuania the monthly salary range will be from 2640 EUR to 3960 EUR gross (based on your competencies relevant for the job).

Additionally, each Danske Bank employee receives employee benefits package which includes:


Growth opportunities: professional & supportive team, e-learnings, numerous development programs; (incl. professional certificates); 100+ professions for internal mobility opportunities.
Health & Well-being: a diverse, inclusive, work & life balance work environment; additional health insurance; mental well-being practices; partial psychologist counselling compensation; silence and sleep zones at the office; game rooms.
Hybrid working conditions: home office budget (after the probation period); modern Danske Campus workplace developed with anthropologist for the best employee experience.
Additional days of leave: for rest, health, volunteering, exams in higher education institutions, and other important activities. Moreover, for seniority with Danske Bank.
Monetary compensation package: accidents & critical diseases insurance; financial support in case of unfortunate events, travel insurance; IIIrd Pillar Pension Fund contribution.


See all the benefits HERE .

Your title in job contract will be Data Scientist.

If you're interested in this role and joining my team, feel free to contact me - Aurelija Jankauskƒó via LinkedIn , and I will answer your questions!

Title: Data Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
I Arbejdernes Landsbank fokuserer vi p√• at blive endnu mere datadreven, s√• data let kommer ud at leve og giver v√¶rdi for os og kunderne. Har du motivation for at l√¶re og udvikle dig i en voksende dataafdeling? S√• er jobbet som Data Engineer noget for dig.




Jobbet

Som Data Engineer i Dataplatform f√•r du en central rolle i udviklingen og vedligeholdelsen af vores eksisterende dataplatform. Vi har f√•et vores f√∏rste erfaringer med dataarbejde i skyen, og skal videre med udviklingen. Teamet er ansvarligt for vores nuv√¶rende dataplatform (placeret b√•de on-premise og i en Azure cloud), samt at drive og vedligeholde vores SAS-driftsetup.




Dine prim√¶re arbejdsopgaver vil derfor v√¶re:

Vedligeholdelse af data p√• SQL-servere (prim√¶rt Azure)
Optimering og strukturering af data p√• Azure
Datamigrering fra on-prem til Cloud
Drift og sparring til l√∏sninger ift. anvendelse og strukturering af data
Dokumentation af vores platform
Datasparringspartner i projekter




Din profil

Der er mange veje ind til jobbet. Vi forventer, at du er serviceorienteret, har stor interesse for data, samt har lyst til at udfordre nuv√¶rende m√•der at g√∏re tingene p√•. Derudover skal du have lyst til at l√¶re vores eksisterende dataplatform at kende, og tage ansvar for dens anvendelse.

Vi forestiller os, at du gerne har;




Erfaring med SAS
Erfaring med Microsoft SQL
Erfaring i udviklingen af MSSQL Views og Stored Procedures
Erfaring med at arbejde i Azure DevOps




Kendskab til BEC-samarbejdet og bank er kun en fordel. Det ogs√• en fordel hvis du kender andre kodesprog herunder Python eller har arbejdet med snowflake eller Databricks.

Vi forventer desuden at du har gode samarbejds- og kommunikationsevner, da v√¶rdien af data skabes sammen med andre. Derudover forventer vi, at du kan arbejde selvst√¶ndigt og struktureret. Det er et krav, at du behersker dansk i skrift og tale.




Dataplatform

Vi v√¶rds√¶tter din karriereudvikling og tilbyder adgang til en bred vifte af l√¶ringsressourcer. Som en del af vores team vil du have mulighed for at udvikle dine f√¶rdigheder og vokse professionelt i et milj√∏, der st√∏tter innovation og personlig udvikling.

Teamet best√•r af 7 Data Engineers og er en del af bankens Data og Modeller afdeling, som rummer over 30 dataentusiaster. Vi er kendetegnet ved godt samarbejde og sparring i hverdagen. Vi tager tid til f√¶lles opgaveafklaring og opgavem√∏der, har retrospektiv med fokus p√• teaml√¶ring, samt har interne demo og review med fokus at kunne fordybe sig i detaljerne.




Teamet er centralt beliggende i Panoptikonbygningen, Baneg√•rdspladsen 1 ‚Äì lige overfor Tivoli og 2 min. gang fra K√∏benhavns Hovedbaneg√•rd. Der ogs√• mulighed for lejlighedsvis at arbejde hjemmefra. Fra 2025 sidder vi alle samlet i vores helt nye hovedkontor p√• Sluseholmen.




Vi tilbyder en attraktiv arbejdsplads

I Arbejdernes Landsbank bliver du del af en kultur, hvor st√¶rke v√¶rdier som ordentlighed, f√¶llesskab og √•benhed er i fokus. Derudover kan du se frem til at blive del af:

En arbejdsplads hvor arbejdsgl√¶den og medarbejdertilfredsheden er blandt de h√∏jeste i sektoren
En arbejdsplads, som er rangeret #3 ud af Danmarks 25 st√∏rste pengeinstitutter m√•lt p√• det bedste image som arbejdsplads i 2023
En bank som 15 √•r i tr√¶k er k√•ret til danskernes foretrukne bank
En flad organisationsstruktur med hurtige beslutningsprocesser
En v√¶kstorienteret organisation, hvor der er rig mulighed for at udvikle sig b√•de fagligt og personligt




Du f√•r desuden en lang r√¶kke medarbejdergoder, som bl.a. omfatter sundhedsforsikring, tandforsikring og ekstra ferietill√¶g.




Er du interesseret?

Hvis du gerne vil have mere information om stillingen, kan du ringe til leder af Dataplatform Mattias Westergaard Clausen p√• tlf. nr. 2370 1741 eller sende en mail til mawc@al-bank.dk.

Vi ser frem til at modtage din ans√∏gning - deadline er den 8. september.

Title: BI Consultant
Description:
Er du klar til at dykke ned i de nyeste teknologier som Azure Cloud, PowerBI, Fabric, Databricks, ML og AI? Hos Kvik A/S har vi en mission: Vi vil bygge et vindende hold og skabe exceptionelle forretningsindsigter gennem data og applikationer. Vores m√•l er at v√¶kste virksomheden og realisere vores ambiti√∏se digitale rejse.

Hvad tilbyder vi?


Hybrid arbejdsplads (minimum 2 dage p√• kontoret)
Hands-on erfaring med Fabric
Sp√¶ndende projekter samt et sjovt og udfordrende arbejdsmilj√∏
Muligheder for personlig og faglig udvikling
Fokus p√• jobtilfredshed i en √•ben og √¶rlig atmosf√¶re
Ansvar og indflydelse i et selvst√¶ndigt team


Arbejdsomr√•der:

Som BI Consultant hos Kvik A/S vil du have f√∏lgende arbejdsomr√•der:


Analyse og afd√¶kning af forretnings behov
L√∏fte og udvikle eksisterende cloud platform til Fabric setup
Design, udvikling og implementering af BI-l√∏sninger
Sikring af datakvalitet og -sikkerhed
Udarbejde rapporter og dashboards i PowerBI
R√•dgive og underst√∏tte stakeholders i brugen af BI-v√¶rkt√∏jer
Identificere og implementere muligheder for automatisering og optimering
Tv√¶rfagligt samarbejde med andre teams om dataintegration og -analyse projekter
Vedligeholdelse og fejlfinding i eksisterende BI-systemer
Bidrage til at udforme og forbedre BI-strategier og -processer


Om vores team

Vi er et ungt og dygtigt team, der trives med samarbejde, innovation og et omskifteligt landskab. Vi omfavner den agile metode og tror p√• at udfordre gr√¶nser, l√¶re af fejl og fejre succeser sammen.

Din profil

Er du proaktiv og ansvarsfuld? Vi s√∏ger en kollega, der ikke er bange for at udfordre normen. Som BI Consultant kombinerer du teknisk viden med forretningsbehov.


Ansvar og initiativ: Du tager ansvar for dine opgaver.
Nysgerrighed: Du stiller de sv√¶re sp√∏rgsm√•l og udforsker nye l√∏sninger.
Formidling af tekniske l√∏sninger: Du kan overs√¶tte komplekse tekniske begreber til forst√•eligt sprog for stakeholders.
Samarbejde: Du trives med tv√¶rfagligt samarbejde.
Minimum 2 √•rs erfaring


For yderligere detaljer om denne fantastiske mulighed, kontakt vores Business Intelligence Manager, Jeppe G. Duch, p√• telefonnummer 41218931 eller Solution Architect, Victor D. K., p√• telefonnummer 22600424. Denne fuldtidsstilling er baseret hos Kvik A/S, Mosevej 3, 8240 Risskov.

Title: Data Analyst Student Assistant
Description:
Are you a student with a passion for data analysis and business development?

We are looking for a motivated student assistant to join our Strategy & Operations team. Bring your analytical skills to an exciting and challenging student job where you will contribute to developing the Landfolk platform.

Who is Landfolk?

Landfolk is an online marketplace for handpicked holiday homes, Founded in February 2021 by seven ex-Airbnb colleagues. Based in Aarhus, Denmark, we're rapidly expanding across Europe, operating in Denmark, Norway, Germany, and Sweden. Our curated approach ensures that we offer only the most beautiful and unique holiday homes to our community of travellers.

What should I expect to do?

As a student assistant in our Strategy & Operations team, you will play a role in shaping the strategic direction and operational excellence of Landfolk. We are looking for someone with an analytical mindset and a passion for data analysis and problem-solving.

Your Responsibilities Will Include


Continuously updating, maintaining and developing existing data models, such as supply forecasting.
Perform data analysis to identify trends, opportunities and challenges for our business.
Deliver actionable insights and recommendations based on large data sets - communicated and visualised effectively and simply.


Who You Are


You are in the early stage of your master's program, or at the end of your bachelor's degree in a relevant business program, such as cand.merc, cand.oecon, or similar.
You are independent in solving tasks, well-structured, persistent and a systematic thinker.
You are a super user of Excel/Google Sheets. Experience in (or the willingness to learn) SQL, Python or other languages would be a plus.
You are committed and contribute to the good atmosphere in the office.


Why should you choose us?

As an employee at Landfolk, you'll feel the pulse of a great and fast-growing company where you can take on responsibility, contribute with your skills, and gain valuable practical experience.

Essentially, What You Can Expect


Be part of a team of highly skilled people covering technical, business, design, community and communication skills, so there's always someone to learn from.
Enjoy a flexible work environment that values productivity and a positive office culture, e.g. delicious lunches, social events, great coffee, snacks and summer house trips.


The practicalities

The position is based at our office in Aarhus and is part-time role, requiring approximately 15 hours pr. week.

As we want to hire as soon as possible, we interview on an ongoing basis but would like to receive applications no later than September 20, 2024.
Show more

As we want to hire as soon as possible, we interview on an ongoing basis but would like to receive applications no later than September 20, 2024.

Title: Data Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Join us in building the future of Data & AI as a Data Engineer at Accenture Technology Denmark

As a global leader in consulting and technology, Accenture empowers organizations to thrive in a rapidly changing world, and Data & AI is unquestionably at the heart of that, especially with the drive towards AI-powered industries.

At Accenture Denmark, we're on the lookout for passionate minds to join us in creating impactful solutions for our clients and fostering our own community. Joining the Data & AI team means becoming part of a growing and vibrant community of both experienced professionals and young talents in the company‚Äôs fastest growing division.

You will have the chance to shape both the trajectory of the team, as well as your own future & career in technology. Whether through client projects or internal initiatives, you'll have the chance to grow alongside us within the AI sphere. We work with some of the greatest tech stacks out there, and your personal and professional toolkit will be ever expanding as training is an essential perk of the job.

In our projects, you use a range of skills; we design and build data platforms in the cloud using data architecture and software development practices, perform data management and governance tasks, do analytics and apply AI for greater insights and data-driven value creation.

Who are we looking for?

You are solution-oriented, curious and like to familiarize yourself with new issues where you share your knowledge. You must be happy to engage with clients and colleagues, working in a team, while also being able to work and manage tasks independently. You have a desire to engage in Accenture‚Äôs professional and social communities, both locally and globally.

We Are Looking For You Who Have



3+ years of Data Engineering experience; ETL pipelines, data modelling, warehousing etc.


A bachelor's degree or higher in Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics, Mathematics, IT or a related field.


Experience using Cloud Solutions and Modern Data Platforms, in particular Databricks or Snowflake


General knowledge about the Data & AI landscape: Data Science, Data Analysis, Data Visualization, Data Architecture, Data Management, AI concepts and frameworks



Fluency in English is a must, and proficiency in Danish is preferred.

Your Toolkit Would Ideally Contain The Following Skills



Databricks / Snowflake


MS Azure / AWS / GCP


SQL / Python / Scala


Spark / Hadoop / Hive (nice to have)


Power BI / Tableau (nice to have)


CI/CD / DevOps (nice to have)



What can we offer you?



Opportunity to work with frontier technologies on exciting projects with leading companies across various industries


Professional development and training opportunities to enhance your skills and advance your career


A local as well as global network


A competitive salary and benefits



Does this sound interesting?

Then we would like to hear from you, whoever you are! Paradoxically, we prefer application letters not written by ChatGPT

Title: Consumer Insights Specialist
Description:
Are you passionate about working with customer insights, and do you want to be part of an exciting journey where you ensure the voice of the customer across JYSK? Then you might be the new Customer Insight Specialist we are looking for!




WHAT WE OFFER YOU

As a Customer Insight Specialist you will help collect and analyse customer data and communicate customer insights across the organisation. You will work with many different types of projects and stakeholders and help create the foundation for the newly established customer insight function.




Furthermore, we offer you:

To join a newly established function where you can help define the direction for customer insights in JYSK
To play a central role in understanding and communicating our customers‚Äô behavior and preferences as well as overall market trends
To work with a wide range of interesting and challenging customer insights tasks that provide great learning opportunities within an international retail success story
To be part of a small team striving to exceed expectations in everything we do, whilst having fun




WHAT YOUR NEXT JOB WILL BE ABOUT

Your tasks and responsibilities in the job include:

Lead customer insight projects from start to end ‚Äì both qualitative and quantitative - for stakeholders across JYSK to bring customer insights for decision-making
Assess and apply most relevant methods to get valid and applicable insight in cooperation with stakeholders and in some cases external partners
Analyse and interpret customer data to actionable insights by use of both existing and new data sources including our new digital solutions (e.g. CDP)
Communicate actionable customer insights to stakeholders across JYSK
Set up and maintain ongoing reporting on main customer KPIs for top management and relevant stakeholders across the customer journey
Develop the customer insight function together with the rest of the team




You can read more about working at JYSK at https://job.jysk.dk/dk/head-office




WHAT SHOULD YOU BRING

To succeed in this role, you have an analytical and structured mindset. You have a strong understanding of business and great stakeholder management and communication skills. You thrive in a dynamic environment where we help each other to get the best results for our stakeholders. You bring relevant experience to the team and want to contribute to the foundation and development of the function.

In addition, you:




Have +3 years or more experience working with customer insights and customer data in a similar internal role or/and as an external consultant
Have a strong and broad understanding of data sources, tools and survey methods for getting relevant insights
Have worked with projects and project management
Have strong Excel and PowerPoint skills
Can quickly understand new business areas and become a valuable customer insight sparring partner across the organisation




IS THIS YOUR NEXT OPPORTUNITY? Apply today!

If you have any questions regarding the position, please contact Head of Customer Insights, Anita Rytter +45 2266 8801 (on holiday until 6th of August).




Send us a brief application with your CV by clicking ‚ÄúApply‚Äù. We process applications on an ongoing basis and complete the recruitment once we have found the right candidate.
