Title: Performance Intelligence Consultant
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Do you have a knack for uncovering game-changing insights from complex data? Can you transform numbers into compelling stories that drive customer behavior for global brands? If so, seize this opportunity to make a significant impact as a Performance Intelligence Consultant at VML MAP!

What will your day look like?

As Performance Intelligence Consultant, you'll be at the forefront of data-driven decision-making and play a vital role in understanding client priorities and objectives. With a foundational understanding of user experience and a strong grasp of data and analytical approaches, you'll be the bridge between data and strategy. Your daily activities will include conducting detailed data analysis to identify performance trends, designing and executing A/B tests and analyzing the results to provide optimization recommendations. You'll also be preparing and presenting performance reports, and your strong communication skills and storytelling abilities will ensure that actionable insights are delivered in an easily understood format, and in a way that motivates and provides a clear direction for various teams.

More Specifically, Your Tasks Include


Conduct detailed data analysis to identify performance trends and insights.
Prepare and present performance reports and translate the insights to client service and other internal teams, with a focus on content, audience, and channels.
Assist in the creation and execution of performance experiments.
Maintain and update performance dashboards and analytics tools.
Collaborate with various teams to ensure data-driven decision-making.
Design and execute A/B tests to identify the most effective strategies and tactics.
Analyze the results of A/B tests and other experiments to provide optimization recommendations.
Approach all task with curiosity and open-mindedness, constantly striving to uncover further insights from the available data.


Who are you going to work with?

You'll join our growing Insights and Intelligence team, reporting to the Performance Intelligence Lead. You'll work closely with various teams, especially data and analytics specialists , and be the bridge between client and technical teams.

What do you bring to the table?

We're looking for curious minds with a strategic outlook and a passion for data. You're not just comfortable with numbers; you're adept at translating them into narratives that resonate with both technical and non-technical audiences, and you have a strong curiosity to discover the 'why' behind the data. Additionally, you are very collaboratively oriented, and you love working with cross-functional teams. Your expertise in detailed analysis and optimization will be instrumental in driving improvements and delivering actionable insights that enhance our daily tasks for clients.

In Addition, You Have


Basic understanding of user experience principles.
Experience working with performance data within marketing.
Strong analytical skills and familiarity with data analysis tools.
Proficiency in Microsoft Excel, including advanced functions and data manipulation.
Knowledge of data visualization tools and SQL (e.g., Tableau, Power BI).
Effective communication and strong storytelling skills.
Strategic mindset with the ability to connect data insights to business objectives.
Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment with an open mind.
Understanding of A/B testing methodologies and tools.
Previous experience in performance analysis or a similar role.
Experience in managing and analyzing large datasets and translating data into actionable insights.


A leader in personalized customer experiences

VML MAP is a world-leading Centre of Excellence that helps businesses humanize the relationship between the brand and the customer through hyper personalization at scale, marketing automation and CRM. With the brain of a consultancy, the heart of an agency and the power of technology and data, we work with some of the world's most admired brands to help them on their transformation journey to becoming truly customer-centric. Together, we are 1000 + technology specialists, data scientists, strategic thinkers, consultants, operations experts, and creative minds from 55+ nationalities.

A global network

We are part of the global VML network that encompasses more than 30,000 employees across 150+ offices in 60+ markets, each contributing to a culture that values connection, belonging, and the power of differences.

At VML, we are committed to fostering an all-inclusive work environment that is both rewarding and career-forward. Our Inclusion, Equity & Belonging initiatives, alongside the VML Foundation, reflect our dedication to giving back and making a positive impact in our communities and beyond. Our people are the heartbeat of our organization-creators, doers, innovators, makers, and thinkers-who drive not just marketing, but meaningful experiences that resonate in every action and interaction.

For more information, please visit our website , and follow us on our social channels via Instagram and LinkedIn .

When you click "Submit Application" your information is sent to VML MAP. To learn more about how we process your personal data when you apply for a role with us, how you can update your information, or have your information removed, please read our Privacy Policy . California residents should read our California Recruitment Privacy Notice .

Title: Lead Quantitative Researcher
Description:
Redstone Commodity Search focus on offering 360¬∞ search solutions to the global commodities markets. With a competitive coverage of Trading Houses, Producers, Majors, Utilities, Merchants, Hedge Funds, Investment Banks and Brokerages; Redstone Commodity Search can confidently offer you an edge in today‚Äôs volatile market.




Redstone Commodity Search are working with an established Danish Commodities Trading House, in their search for a Lead Quantitative Researcher to join the growing Energy team.




Key Responsibilities / Tasks




Focus on EU power and Gas markets, seeking out new opportunities and trends.
Build models to power quantitative strategies.
Conduct research and statistical analysis.
Ensure compliance with regulations and reporting within the Energy Market.
Work with large data sets to predict and test statistical market patterns.
Role reports into the Director of Power Trading.




Key Qualifications / Experience




Having a broad understanding of international power and gas fundamentals.
Analytical mindset and strong ability to navigate the markets.
3+ years of relevant quantitative experience.
Master‚Äôs degree in finance, mathematics, economics, or a relevant field.
Strong attention to detail, and numerical accuracy.
Located in Denmark.

Besidder st√¶rke analytiske evner og er l√∏sningsorienteret

Evne til at identificere relevante data samt strukturere og pr√¶sentere informationer
Godt kendskab til datamodellering, datakvalitet og datah√•ndtering
Im√∏dekommende, nysgerrig og samarbejdsorienteret

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Are you ready to use your data engineering skills to build and maintain a powerful data infrastructure that delivers real business impact?




As a Data Engineer, you will be responsible for building scalable data pipelines and datasets empowering data-driven decision-making that will promote innovation and growth across NORDEN.




You will be directly involved in advancing our data strategy, in an environment where data is a strategic cornerstone to ensure value creation and competitive advantages.




You will be based in Copenhagen, Denmark.







What is in it for you

You will join the Data Engineering Team in Digital Solution and Services department, which has a welcoming and inclusive culture with data and IT-focused colleagues who collaborate closely. The department values personal development and teamwork and promotes a positive environment through an informal, innovative, and diverse approach.




So be ready to inspire others and be inspired by people from different backgrounds. On a day-to-day basis, you will be a key member of the Data Engineering team, working alongside five dedicated colleagues.




On a more practical note, you will as a Data Engineer, access large and diverse datasets generating features and insights that will be of high value to stakeholders when making critical business and trading decisions. Your role will be crucial in transforming data into a competitive advantage.




You will use a modern tech stack, including Python, Prefect, and Azure cloud solutions while gaining a deep understanding of today's shipping market dynamics.







The tasks that await you

To be more specific you will together with the rest of the team, be responsible for tasks such as:

Building and maintaining data pipelines.
Creating meaningful datasets through a combination of internal and external data.
Generating decisive measures from datasets that will be used either directly in decision-making or as features for models.
Working with non-technical stakeholders to derive and implement technical solutions to business challenges.
Leading, organising and executing on data capture, validation, enrichment and support activities.
Developing a systems-based approach to data engineering providing value within the larger organisation.







Your competencies and core qualifications

We are looking for a colleague who is curious and wants to expand their knowledge in a global fast-paced trading environment. To thrive in this position, you should be able to tick off the following:

You hold a master's degree in business administration and information technology, mathematical modeling, statistics, computer science, software engineering, or similar areas.
You already hold programming skills ‚Äì could be in Python and SQL.
You have great English skills.
You are eligible to work in Denmark.




Further, you have to some extent participated in decision-making regarding technical solutions such as technology choice or overall structuring of data.




Application

Please upload your application, resume and relevant diplomas via our website as soon as possible and no later than 2 October 2024. We review applications and interview candidates on an ongoing basis.




NORDEN values diversity in thought, educational background, and professional competencies and therefore encourages all qualified candidates to apply for the position.




Were you missing anything in this job ad? Please share your feedback with us here.







Our company

NORDEN is a global provider of ocean-based freight services for bulk and project cargo of all sizes. We integrate freight solutions with port logistics, helping our customers to optimise and decarbonise supply chains. We provide tailored solutions based on flexibility, reliability and intelligence. Our agile business model ensures stability by continuously adapting our fleet to market developments and customer needs.




Founded in 1871, NORDEN is one of Denmark‚Äôs oldest internationally operating shipping companies. Incorporated in Denmark, we are listed on Nasdaq Copenhagen as a part of the OMX Nordic Large Cap index.




With 15 offices across 6 continents, NORDEN is a truly integrated part of global trade.

Title: Virtual Data Coordinator
Description:
Are you feeling ready to fly high? This job lets you fly drones and collect data in a playful way that helps pave the way for a greener tomorrow!




Eurowind Energy is a global and leading developer, owner and operator of wind and solar energy projects. Based in Denmark, we operate in 16 different countries across Europe and in the U.S. and we are continuously growing our project portfolio. We believe in a future of renewable energy, and we have an ambitious plan of becoming the next generations‚Äô ‚ÄúPower Major‚Äù. Based on a full value chain from greenfield project development to energy trading, more than 500+ team members are dedicated to create a greener future fueled with nothing but renewable energy!




Your role

As Virtual Data Coordinator you will be responsible for designing Eurowind‚Äôs drone strategy and doing the daily drone operation. Your main responsibilities include:




Selection/design of industrial drone for use in: Mapping/3D Surveys, Photovoltaic Thermographic Inspections, Wind Turbine inspections, Agricultural, Marketing Pictures and Video.
Cooperation with different departments and building reports.
Establishing setup for automated inspection flights in parks globally.
Being responsible for hardware and data collection via CCTV in parks globally.




The role combines your inner explorer with your fascination of data and takes a certain accuracy and immersion. More specifically, the tasks include:




Daily drone operation and maintenance with safety and compliance.
Surveying of land, and conversion to scalable maps.
Ensuring that data collection is automated, repeatable and directly integrated into the GIS structure.
PV inspections and optimization using drone‚Äôs normal and thermal pictures.
Organizing, managing and reporting on data in a coherent manner.
Preparation of documentation for analysis on a group level.
Assistance in regards to agricultural drones ‚Äì both aerial and on ground level.

Cooperating with data analyst regarding Machine Learning / AI on the drone/camera data




Your profile

To succeed in this role, you must demonstrate your tech skills and be capable of programming the drone so it will produce insightful data at every flight. We imagine that you have a technical background and can agree on the following:




You are educated as Software Engineer, Automation Engineer, Land Surveyor, Drone Pilot/Drone Operator, Geographer, Cartographer or similar.
You are a tech ‚Äúnerd‚Äù with an unquestionable interest in technical data and automatation.
You are organized and good at adapting to the workflow.
You are good at communicating with colleagues and stakeholders and have a proactive approach.




Renewable energy is our future. And so are our people!

At Eurowind Energy we do our best to create a culture where everyone is valued and feels at home. You will notice this in your everyday work life, where you have the freedom to speak up and where your voice does mean something to us. We know that when you grow, we grow. Therefore, we strive to support you in what you think is right and in your personal and professional development. We offer you an exciting job in an energetic and international environment. And we promise you: the wind is never standing still.




Did we capture your attention?

Great! If you see yourself in this role, do not hesitate to apply for the position. Please use the link below.




Should you have any questions before applying, please feel free to contact Mette Birk, Manager Operational Development, on mbs@ewe.dk.




Developing, operating and managing wind and solar parks is not just pure business for us. It is a way to view the world. And with this worldview comes a genuine ambition to be one of the leading developers in Europe. Because creating a future run entirely on green energy matters to us.




We manage our own portfolio of projects and at the same time, we perform technical and financial management of projects. We have throughout many years experienced sustained economic growth in the number of developed projects and companies in management. And we continue to expect this. Simply because it is in our nature to keep developing ‚Äì projects, companies and our people.




Read more about Eurowind Energy on our website or LinkedIn.




Application deadline: 15. September 2024

Title: EDC/Clinical Programmer
Place: Gentofte, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you passionate about Clinical Data? Do you have solid experience building an eCRF in an EDC CDMS and/or clinical programing for complex studies? Are you familiar with clinical data management activities from start-up, conduct to closure?

If so, now is your chance to join Ascendis Pharma as our new EDC Clinical Programmer.

Ascendis Pharma is a fast-growing biopharmaceutical company with locations in Denmark, Germany, and the United States. We are applying our TransCon technology to build a leading, fully integrated biopharmaceutical company with an independent pipeline of long-acting prodrug therapies that address unmet patient needs.

As our new EDC/Clinical Programmer, you have a deep understanding of clinical data, and through your work you will be recognized as an expert. Your way of collaborating with internal and external stakeholders, will help the data management study team to succeed.

In this position you will be given broad responsibility tailored to our studies. You will be involved in data management activities associated with the development, conduct, and management of assigned studies in endocrinology, and future therapeutic areas. You will provide expert knowledge and support across phase 1 to 4 trials serving as the EDC & Clinical Programmer to ensure the success of the trial. You will work independently and collaboratively in a dynamic team environment.

You will work closely with our Data Management team, to ensuring quality study deliverables are met. As a key point of contact for internal stakeholders and Vendors, your will be actively involved together with the Clinical Data Manager on how best data can be captured as well ensuring with oversight of the clinical data both within DM and our stakeholders.

You will be joining the newly established Clinical Data Management team in the Copenhagen office. In this role you have a unique opportunity to be part of shaping the way we work within the Global Clinical Data Management organization. You bring with you a wealth of professional experience, you are passionate and have an eye for frameworks, processes, and best practices. We encourage you to think out of the box supporting the organization in doing an even better job, when preparing for future requirements. For the right candidate you will be given the mandate to participate or manage non-study initiatives and / or projects.

You will be supported by line management, who has in depth clinical data management experience, who can challenge, and spar as needed, and who will pave the way for you to succeed. Throughout the year you and your manager will meet to perform deep dive communication, where well-being, growth and collaboration are on the agenda.

Main areas of responsibility:

Develop and Update Clinical Databases (EDC).
Ensures adherence to clinical database standards, SOPs and Process Guidelines.
Leads and/or participates in the review of eCRFs and validation checks, database development, programming of validation checks in Clinical Data Management System (CDMS).
Interface with members of study teams, including external CROs/Vendors where applicable, to integrate study team requirements into all deliverables.
Participates in extra activities including, but not limited to, evaluation and testing of new systems and helps coordinate CDM Systems technical initiatives. Contributes strategies, innovative and creative solutions to enhance processes and increase productivity of the group.
Contribute to the ongoing development, review, and revisions of Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs), Work Instructions, Training and standard DM templates.¬†¬†
Contribute to the development of CDM and EDC standards.
Generate metric reports and listings to facilitate the management and review of external data, as required.¬†

¬†Your Profile

A minimum of 6 years of clinical programming and/or EDC database development and experience from pharma, biotech or CRO and a relevant academic degree in life sciences (e.g. data science, computer science, pharmacy, biology, statistics).

Furthermore, you have:

Demonstrated technical proficiency in a Clinical Data Management Systems (i.e. Veeva CDMS, Medidata Rave, Oracle Inform etc.).
At least 4 years of EDC database development experience.
At least 2 years of Programming experience preferably in SAS and SQL.
Proficiency in cultivating and sustaining positive collaborative relationships across diverse functional areas.
Keen emphasis on prompt action and prioritizing stakeholder needs.
Project management capabilities encompassing effective group presentation, leadership, verbal and written communication, interpersonal adeptness, and organizational proficiency.
Desire to learn new processes and technologies.
Proficiency in multitasking, independent work, and effective communication.
Well-versed in the drug discovery process, FDA regulations, GxP guidelines, ICH guidelines, clinical database cleaning procedures, and 21 CFR Part 11.

Also, you are proficient in English at a professional level, both written and spoken.

As a person, you are a strong team player, proactive in nature and have a can-do attitude. As we are taking new steps towards developing best-in-class therapeutics for patients with rare diseases we are looking for people who possess an entrepreneurial mindset who can handle ambiguity, analyze, and create clarity and desires to be part of an organization where everything isn't set in stone. We rely on you to help us shape the cement and be part of building the Clinical Data Management team in the Copenhagen office. The person we are looking for thrives in a dynamic environment, short lines of communication and an open and informal working atmosphere.

Travel: Up to 5 - 15 days per year.

Place of work: Ascendis Pharma headquarter resides in a modern and wonderful office facility in Tuborg Havn in Hellerup with a view of the harbor, the canals, and the sea.

For more details¬†about the position or the company, please contact Peter Bayer, Senior Director of Clinical Data Management, Endocrinology, via¬†pbr@ascendispharma.com/ +45 30191920 or visit out website

All applications must be submitted in English and are treated confidentially.

Applications will be evaluated when received, so please apply as soon as possible.

Show more
HTML:
Are you passionate about Clinical Data? Do you have solid experience building an eCRF in an EDC CDMS and/or clinical programing for complex studies? Are you familiar with clinical data management activities from start-up, conduct to closure?

If so, now is your chance to join Ascendis Pharma as our new EDC Clinical Programmer.

Ascendis Pharma is a fast-growing biopharmaceutical company with locations in Denmark, Germany, and the United States. We are applying our TransCon technology to build a leading, fully integrated biopharmaceutical company with an independent pipeline of long-acting prodrug therapies that address unmet patient needs.

As our new EDC/Clinical Programmer, you have a deep understanding of clinical data, and through your work you will be recognized as an expert. Your way of collaborating with internal and external stakeholders, will help the data management study team to succeed.

In this position you will be given broad responsibility tailored to our studies. You will be involved in data management activities associated with the development, conduct, and management of assigned studies in endocrinology, and future therapeutic areas. You will provide expert knowledge and support across phase 1 to 4 trials serving as the EDC & Clinical Programmer to ensure the success of the trial. You will work independently and collaboratively in a dynamic team environment.

You will work closely with our Data Management team, to ensuring quality study deliverables are met. As a key point of contact for internal stakeholders and Vendors, your will be actively involved together with the Clinical Data Manager on how best data can be captured as well ensuring with oversight of the clinical data both within DM and our stakeholders.

You will be joining the newly established Clinical Data Management team in the Copenhagen office. In this role you have a unique opportunity to be part of shaping the way we work within the Global Clinical Data Management organization. You bring with you a wealth of professional experience, you are passionate and have an eye for frameworks, processes, and best practices. We encourage you to think out of the box supporting the organization in doing an even better job, when preparing for future requirements. For the right candidate you will be given the mandate to participate or manage non-study initiatives and / or projects.

You will be supported by line management, who has in depth clinical data management experience, who can challenge, and spar as needed, and who will pave the way for you to succeed. Throughout the year you and your manager will meet to perform deep dive communication, where well-being, growth and collaboration are on the agenda.

Main areas of responsibility:

  • Develop and Update Clinical Databases (EDC).
  • Ensures adherence to clinical database standards, SOPs and Process Guidelines.
  • Leads and/or participates in the review of eCRFs and validation checks, database development, programming of validation checks in Clinical Data Management System (CDMS).
  • Interface with members of study teams, including external CROs/Vendors where applicable, to integrate study team requirements into all deliverables.
  • Participates in extra activities including, but not limited to, evaluation and testing of new systems and helps coordinate CDM Systems technical initiatives. Contributes strategies, innovative and creative solutions to enhance processes and increase productivity of the group.
  • Contribute to the ongoing development, review, and revisions of Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs), Work Instructions, Training and standard DM templates.  
  • Contribute to the development of CDM and EDC standards.
  • Generate metric reports and listings to facilitate the management and review of external data, as required. 

 Your Profile

A minimum of 6 years of clinical programming and/or EDC database development and experience from pharma, biotech or CRO and a relevant academic degree in life sciences (e.g. data science, computer science, pharmacy, biology, statistics).

Furthermore, you have:

  • Demonstrated technical proficiency in a Clinical Data Management Systems (i.e. Veeva CDMS, Medidata Rave, Oracle Inform etc.).
  • At least 4 years of EDC database development experience.
  • At least 2 years of Programming experience preferably in SAS and SQL.
  • Proficiency in cultivating and sustaining positive collaborative relationships across diverse functional areas.
  • Keen emphasis on prompt action and prioritizing stakeholder needs.
  • Project management capabilities encompassing effective group presentation, leadership, verbal and written communication, interpersonal adeptness, and organizational proficiency.
  • Desire to learn new processes and technologies.
  • Proficiency in multitasking, independent work, and effective communication.
  • Well-versed in the drug discovery process, FDA regulations, GxP guidelines, ICH guidelines, clinical database cleaning procedures, and 21 CFR Part 11.

Also, you are proficient in English at a professional level, both written and spoken.

As a person, you are a strong team player, proactive in nature and have a can-do attitude. As we are taking new steps towards developing best-in-class therapeutics for patients with rare diseases we are looking for people who possess an entrepreneurial mindset who can handle ambiguity, analyze, and create clarity and desires to be part of an organization where everything isn't set in stone. We rely on you to help us shape the cement and be part of building the Clinical Data Management team in the Copenhagen office. The person we are looking for thrives in a dynamic environment, short lines of communication and an open and informal working atmosphere.

Travel: Up to 5 - 15 days per year.

Place of work: Ascendis Pharma headquarter resides in a modern and wonderful office facility in Tuborg Havn in Hellerup with a view of the harbor, the canals, and the sea.

For more details about the position or the company, please contact Peter Bayer, Senior Director of Clinical Data Management, Endocrinology, via pbr@ascendispharma.com/ +45 30191920 or visit out website

All applications must be submitted in English and are treated confidentially.

Applications will be evaluated when received, so please apply as soon as possible.

Title: Sr. Data Analytics Engineer
Place: Billund, Region of Southern Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job Description

Are you passionate about transforming data into actionable insights?

Join us with your outstanding business intelligence and process mining skills and make an impact within our Procure to Pay process team!

Please note the work location is Billund, Denmark and no relocation assistance is offered for this role.


Core Responsibilities





Create visualisation dashboards in PowerBI for end users to quickly identify areas for further investigation.
Create new reports by handling the full process of identifying data needed, connecting to data sources through Power BI Gateway, structuring data for modelling and building data model in Power BI
Maintain and improve existing reports, driving reporting standardisation and definitions alignment.
Drive automation of both existing and new reports
Perform maintenance, documentation, optimisation & decommissioning of reports.
Participate in projects and workgroups, requiring knowledge of data foundation and Business Intelligence (BI)
Training and daily support of users in BI reporting, governance and data-analysis
Stakeholder management of Global Process Owner, IT & others




Play your part in our team succeeding

Business Processes & Information is part of Business Service Operations. Our responsibilities cover global process ownership of finance transactional and HR processes as well as process support for controlling, training and project portfolio. Our main mission is to develop, maintain and optimise efficient and effective standardised processes and bridge business needs with IT solutions.

The Procure to Pay (P2P) business process team is tasked with establishing a robust reporting framework to enhance decision-making and performance management within our Shared Service Centers. With a focus on process optimization and system integration, we aim to leverage specialized expertise and adopt an end-to-end (E2E) perspective. Your role within the team will be pivotal, as you contribute to defining and facilitating the delivery of reporting needs while actively engaging in projects that demand Business Intelligence proficiency.

Do you have what it takes?





3+ years of experience working with data modelling, data governance and data visualization for decision making.
Advance experience with PowerBI, Power Query (M Query) and DAX (experience with PowerApps / Synapse SQL desired but not essential)
Experience of Process Mining, preferably Celonis
Experience working with SAP HANA Views and COUPA system would have an added advantage.
Excellent communication skills and ability to challenge stakeholders to deliver effective outcomes.
Excellent Presentation skills and experience in performing user training.
Continuous improvement knowledge and mindset
Ability to work with global teams spanning different time zones.




Please note that shortlisted candidates will be required to complete tests and assessments to demonstrate their advanced Power BI skills.

Applications are reviewed on an ongoing basis. However, please note we do amend or withdraw our jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to any advertised closing date. So, if you're interested in this role we encourage you to apply as soon as possible.

What‚Äôs in it for you?

Here is what you can expect

Family Care Leave - We offer enhanced paid leave options for those important times.

Insurances ‚Äì All colleagues are covered by our life and disability insurance which provides protection and peace of mind.

Wellbeing - We want our people to feel well and thrive. We offer resources and benefits to nurture physical and mental wellbeing along with opportunities to build community and inspire creativity.

Colleague Discount ‚Äì We know you'll love to build, so from day 1 you will qualify for our generous colleague discount.

Bonus - We do our best work to succeed together. When goals are reached and if eligible, you'll be rewarded through our bonus scheme.

Workplace - When you join the team you'll be assigned a primary workplace location i.e. one of our Offices, stores or factories. Our hybrid work policy means an average of 3 days per week in the office. The hiring team will discuss the policy and role eligibility with you during the recruitment process.

Children are our role models. Their curiosity, creativity and imagination inspire everything we do. We strive to create a diverse, dynamic and inclusive culture of play at the LEGO Group, where everyone feels safe, valued and they belong.

The LEGO Group is highly committed to equal employment opportunity and equal pay and seeks to encourage applicants from all backgrounds (eg. sex, gender identity or expression, race/ethnicity, national origin, sexual orientation, disability, age and religion) to apply for roles in our team.

Research shows that women and people from different underrepresented backgrounds often only apply for a job if they meet 100% of the listed qualifications. If you dream of being a part of our team and you meet many, but not all of our listed qualifications for this role, please apply.

The LEGO Group is fully committed to Children‚Äôs Rights and Child Wellbeing across the globe. Candidates offered positions with high engagement with children are required to take part in Child Safeguarding Background Screening, as a condition of the offer.

Thank you for sharing our global commitment to Children‚Äôs Rights.

Just imagine building your dream career.

Then make it real.

Join the LEGO¬Æ team today.

Title: Data engineer for the Research Data Management team ‚Äì DTU Biosustain
Place: Kongens Lyngby, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
If you are a skilled and talented data engineer with experience in cloud infrastructure, and you are looking to make a difference working on projects that will have impact on world level challenges, this position is tailored to you!




Your work will be an essential part of multiple initiatives towards the development of new environmentally friendly products, cleaner and more sustainable manufacturing and farming processes, new medical treatments, and richer biodiversity and ecosystems. You will be responsible for designing, developing, and implementing new analytical and machine learning tools that will help to interpret complex multimodal data, and you will do it in collaboration with top research scientist in the field and in an international, motivating, flexible, supportive, and friendly environment at a leading research and education institution in Europe.




The job

You will be engaged in a variety of tasks including, but not limited to:

Design, build, and maintain data pipelines
Develop and optimize ELT (Extract, Load, Transform) processes, and ensure data integrity
Collaborate with the Data Science team and researchers to understand their requirements and translate these into a technical specification and model design
Maintenance for our Azure datalake infrastructure
Providing support for our Azure cloud users
Monitor and promote best practices for Azure resource usage
Documenting infrastructure-related solutions and guidelines
Teach Azure-related courses to our researchers in the CFB




Our expectations of you

We hope that you have several of the following qualifications and willingness to learn more as you go:

A Master‚Äôs or PhD degree within Computer Science, Software Engineering or similar
Some years of relevant work experience
Expertise in cloud environments (we use Microsoft Azure)
Good working knowledge of Python, Jira, Docker, Git, and GitHub.
Database programming (e.g. PostgreSQL, MySQL)
Experience with agile project management.
Familiarity with workflow management systems (we use Nextflow)
Curious, proactive, motivated and able to work independently




What we offer in return

Flexibilityin your working hours and in your tasks
Continuous education and development
Social activities both at center and team level
Being part of a world-class research center focused on tackling sustainability challenges using biology




Salary and appointment terms

The appointment will be based on the collective agreement with the Danish Confederation of Professional Associations or other relevant collective agreement. The salary will be agreed upon with the relevant union.




Application and contact

Please submit your online application no later than 18 September 2024. Open the ‚ÄúApply now‚Äù link, fill out the form and attach your motivated application, CV and exam certificates.

If you have any questions, you are very welcome to contact Konstantinos Tsirigos, Head of the Research Data Management Team at kots@dtu.dk , or +4520916327.




We will review the applications on a rolling basis and might fill the position prior to the deadline'.




Applications received after the deadline will not be considered.




All interested candidates irrespective of age, gender, race, disability, religion or ethnic background are encouraged to apply.




At DTU Biosustain you will be surrounded by a very international group of world-class scientists, subject matter experts and software engineers. We develop the next generation (bio) technology using synthetic biology techniques. We create novel methods and technologies as a foundation for development of new environment friendly products, better and less energy consuming manufacturing processes, new medical treatments, climate friendly farming, etc. In other words, we try to solve some of the biggest challenges in the history of mankind, and you will get the chance to add your personal mark to this.




Technology for people

DTU develops technology for people. With our international elite research and study programmes, we are helping to create a better world and to solve the global challenges formulated in the UN‚Äôs 17 Sustainable Development Goals. Hans Christian √òrsted founded DTU in 1829 with a clear mission to develop and create value using science and engineering to benefit society. That mission lives on today. DTU has 13,500 students and 6,000 employees. We work in an international atmosphere and have an inclusive, evolving, and informal working environment. DTU has campuses in all parts of Denmark and in Greenland, and we collaborate with the best universities around the world.

Title: Business Intelligence (BI) Developer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Do You Thrive Working With Top Data Platforms?

If data platforms are just your thing, and you also have an excellent understanding of SQL, we have an open position as Business Intelligence (BI) Developer on our global IT team that might be perfect for you.

Who Are We?

The RiskPoint Group is a global Managing General Underwriter (MGU) providing best-in-class insurance solutions backed by the insurance companies we act on behalf of.

You will become part of our new, small team of highly skilled BI professionals, who together holds many years of experience in insurance data.

Our BI team is part of our growing IT team, which is part of our Finance & Operations department. In this role, you will be working with other IT colleagues in both Denmark and the UK. But also with the rest of the company.

We operate in an agile organization with close cross-border cooperation across all business lines. And our organizational structure is flat, leaving many opportunities for all employees to make a difference, take responsibility, excel, and grow.

About The Position

As our new BI Developer, you will be responsible for designing, developing, and optimizing our data pipeline architecture, as well as creating insightful reports and dashboards to support data-driven decision-making across the organization.

You will have the opportunity to work with the latest technologies, improve your career, and participate in continuous learning and training initiatives.

This is an onsite role based either in our Copenhagen office or in our London office, with the option to work remotely if approved by your manager. Occasional domestic and international travel may be required.

You will report to our CTO, who is located in Copenhagen, Denmark.

Your key responsibilities will include but not be limited to:


Design, develop, and maintain scalable data pipelines to support various business needs.
Create, maintain, and optimize reports and dashboards to provide actionable insights to stakeholders.
Collaborate with analysts, and other stakeholders to understand data requirements and provide efficient solutions.
Develop and implement data integration solutions using ETL tools.
Ensure data quality and integrity across all data platforms.
Monitor and troubleshoot data pipeline issues to maintain data flow reliability.
Stay up-to-date with the latest industry trends and technologies to continuously improve our data architecture and BI capabilities.


Please note that current residency in either Denmark or the UK with work and residency permit needs to be in place before applying.

A Great Match for Us

The ideal candidate will have completed a degree that provides a solid foundation in computer science principles, programming, data structures, and database management. That could be, for example, a bachelor‚Äôs degree in computer science, information technology, or a related field.

You must have worked professionally for 2-5 years in roles involving business intelligence development, demonstrating the ability to handle job-specific challenges and deliver results in a business environment.

Moreover you need to have:


Excellent understanding of SQL language and commercial experience with any of the top data platforms (e.g., PostgreSQL, Microsoft SQL, Snowflake, etc.) and extensive experience writing complex SQL queries and managing databases on one or more major SQL platforms, proving your ability to manipulate and retrieve data efficiently.
Proficiency in at least one programming language (e.g., Python, Go, Java) and experience in developing applications or scripts in a professional setting using one of these languages, showcasing your ability to automate tasks and perform advanced data manipulation.
Hands-on experience designing and implementing ETL processes to extract data from various sources, transform it into the required format, and load it into data warehouses or other destinations.
A strong understanding of data modelling, data warehousing, and database design as well as practical experience designing data models and implementing data warehouses, ensuring efficient data storage, retrieval, and reporting capabilities.
Created reports and dashboards using BI tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau), providing stakeholders with valuable insights and supporting data-driven decision-making.
Experience deploying and managing data solutions on cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, Google Cloud), demonstrating your ability to work in modern, scalable environments.
Demonstrated the ability to identify and solve complex data-related problems, ensuring high data quality and reliability.


It is furthermore a requirement that you have a proven track record of working effectively in team settings, communicating technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders, and collaborating with cross-functional teams to deliver data solutions.

To be successful in this role, we expect you to have excellent problem solving skills, strong communication skills, and always pay attention to the details.

Although not required, we prefer you have:


Experience working with large-scale data processing technologies (e.g., Hadoop, Spark, Iceberg), indicating your ability to handle and analyze large datasets.
Hands-on experience using Trino for querying large datasets and dbt (data build tool) for transforming data, demonstrating proficiency in modern data tools.
Practical experience using Terraform to manage infrastructure as code, demonstrating your ability to automate and scale data infrastructure deployments
Familiarity with DevOps methodologies and tools, such as CI/CD pipelines, version control systems, and infrastructure automation, indicating your ability to contribute to a culture of continuous improvement and operational excellence.


Interested in the Position?

We are looking forward to receiving your resume and a motivational letter of application for this position. Please use the form below.

We hope to see your application before August 31, 2024, but have patience and can wait for the perfect match. Interviews will be held successively.

For more information about the position, contact CTO, Zubair Sabir, at *protected email*. Note that we do not accept applications via e-mail, please use the form below.

About The RiskPoint Group

The RiskPoint Group is one of Europe‚Äôs largest Managing General Underwriters (MGUs), providing best in class insurance solutions to businesses and their advisors globally. The RiskPoint Group operates as RiskPoint in Europe and Asia and RP Underwriting in the rest of the world.

With 250+ employees and 15 locations in Europe, North America, and Asia Pacific, the RiskPoint Group employs expert underwriting and specialized, in-house claims teams within Accident & Health, Transactional Risk, Property & Construction, Renewable Energy, Offshore Upstream, and Liabilities, including Financial Lines, Cyber, and Casualty.

The RiskPoint Group is a Coverholder with Lloyd‚Äôs of London and is backed by a strong panel of well-reputed insurance companies. The RiskPoint Group core values are: trust, openness & honesty, respect & tolerance, drive & dedication as well as being part of a winning team in a competitive environment.

  • Proficiency in at least one programming language (e.g., Python, Go, Java) and experience in developing applications or scripts in a professional setting using one of these languages, showcasing your ability to automate tasks and perform advanced data manipulation.
  • Hands-on experience designing and implementing ETL processes to extract data from various sources, transform it into the required format, and load it into data warehouses or other destinations.
  • A strong understanding of data modelling, data warehousing, and database design as well as practical experience designing data models and implementing data warehouses, ensuring efficient data storage, retrieval, and reporting capabilities.
  • Created reports and dashboards using BI tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau), providing stakeholders with valuable insights and supporting data-driven decision-making.
  • Experience deploying and managing data solutions on cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, Google Cloud), demonstrating your ability to work in modern, scalable environments.
  • Demonstrated the ability to identify and solve complex data-related problems, ensuring high data quality and reliability.

It is furthermore a requirement that you have a proven track record of working effectively in team settings, communicating technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders, and collaborating with cross-functional teams to deliver data solutions.

To be successful in this role, we expect you to have excellent problem solving skills, strong communication skills, and always pay attention to the details.

Although not required, we prefer you have:

  • Experience working with large-scale data processing technologies (e.g., Hadoop, Spark, Iceberg), indicating your ability to handle and analyze large datasets.
  • Hands-on experience using Trino for querying large datasets and dbt (data build tool) for transforming data, demonstrating proficiency in modern data tools.
  • Practical experience using Terraform to manage infrastructure as code, demonstrating your ability to automate and scale data infrastructure deployments
  • Familiarity with DevOps methodologies and tools, such as CI/CD pipelines, version control systems, and infrastructure automation, indicating your ability to contribute to a culture of continuous improvement and operational excellence.

Interested in the Position?

We are looking forward to receiving your resume and a motivational letter of application for this position. Please use the form below.

We hope to see your application before August 31, 2024, but have patience and can wait for the perfect match. Interviews will be held successively.

For more information about the position, contact CTO, Zubair Sabir, at *protected email*. Note that we do not accept applications via e-mail, please use the form below.

About The RiskPoint Group

The RiskPoint Group is one of Europe‚Äôs largest Managing General Underwriters (MGUs), providing best in class insurance solutions to businesses and their advisors globally. The RiskPoint Group operates as RiskPoint in Europe and Asia and RP Underwriting in the rest of the world.

With 250+ employees and 15 locations in Europe, North America, and Asia Pacific, the RiskPoint Group employs expert underwriting and specialized, in-house claims teams within Accident & Health, Transactional Risk, Property & Construction, Renewable Energy, Offshore Upstream, and Liabilities, including Financial Lines, Cyber, and Casualty.

The RiskPoint Group is a Coverholder with Lloyd‚Äôs of London and is backed by a strong panel of well-reputed insurance companies. The RiskPoint Group core values are: trust, openness & honesty, respect & tolerance, drive & dedication as well as being part of a winning team in a competitive environment.

Title: BI-team - POC opgave / BI-platforme
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark

Kunden √∏nsker at transformere nuv√¶rende BI enhed fra et spredt landskab af BI platforme til en platform.

Deraf behovet for at gennemf√∏re en st√∏rre POC med udgangspunkt i Oracle Analytics, Cloud samt Fusion Data Intelligence, samt opbyggelse af knowhow indenfor dette omr√•de.

Efterf√∏lgende en dybdeg√•ende sammenligning (b√•de teknisk, funktionelt og arkitektur) af forskellige BI produkter.

Title: Analytics Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Planday from Xero is a leading digital solution that uncomplicates everyday scheduling and workforce management by making it easier for businesses and shift workers around the world to communicate, collaborate, and get work done.





Powered by a community of local industry experts, Planday provides a best-in-class digital platform that is easy to use, accurate, secure, and compliant with local needs and standards. From payroll to POS and reporting, its open API and tech ecosystem is scalable to fit shifting business needs and to build an engaged, flexible workforce.





Founded in 2004, Planday is headquartered in Copenhagen, Denmark and supports over 400,000 users across Europe and the US. Planday was acquired by Xero in 2021.





How you‚Äôll make an impact


As an Analytics Engineer, you'll revolutionize our data systems, turning raw information into transformative insights that drive innovation and growth. Your expertise will shape data into valuable assets, guiding strategic decision-making and product development. Collaborating closely with cross-functional teams, you'll unveil key metrics and customer insights, empowering us to make data-informed decisions. By activating complex datasets and applying advanced analysis techniques, you'll pave the way for automation and predictive modeling. With your dedication to excellence and problem-solving skills, you'll inspire a culture of data-driven innovation that enables Planday‚Äôs success.







What you‚Äôll do

Design, set up, and maintain technical data infrastructure.
Develop production-ready, scalable data pipelines and lead the life cycle of data-related backend services.
Create and manage data models to transform raw data into valuable assets, ensuring data accuracy and quality.
Utilize Python and SQL for data manipulation, activation, and cleaning, organizing, and ensuring data quality for analytical purposes.
Apply statistical analysis techniques for summarizing, interpreting, and predicting data, alongside basic machine learning concepts to explore predictive modeling techniques.







Success looks like

Seamless technical infrastructure setup and maintenance ensures uninterrupted data flow and accessibility.
Scalable data pipelines and optimized backend services lead to increased efficiency in data processing.
Well-designed and maintained data models that effectively transform raw data into valuable assets, ensuring data accuracy, quality, and lineage.
Consistently delivering accurate and reliable data models through proficient use of programming languages and statistical techniques, facilitating data-driven strategies and initiatives.
Regularly delivering actionable insights and key metrics to commercial and product engineering teams, contributing to informed decision-making and improved business outcomes.
Proactive problem-solving and innovative thinking in addressing data-related challenges, leading to continuous improvement and advancement in analytical capabilities.
Exploration and application of advanced analytical techniques, such as machine learning, to uncover new opportunities and insights for the organization.







What you‚Äôll bring with you

At least three years of experience in software engineering or a technical analytical role.
Ability to design and build data processing, storage, and activation systems for specific projects based on set requirements.
Experienced in SQL for data modeling and analysis.
Experienced in Python for building data pipelines and statistical analyses.
Experience with dbt, GitHub, and data lakehouse solutions (ideally Snowflake).
Able to drive software engineering best practices, such as writing maintainable and testable code.
Efficient execution of data wrangling and cleaning processes for multiple projects.
Ability to activate datasets and insights through reverse ETL jobs to different systems.
Proficiency in descriptive analytics, data visualization, and basic inferential statistics.
Independent problem-solving abilities using analytical reasoning and critical thinking skills.
Understanding of machine learning concepts and predictive modeling techniques.







At Planday, we offer you:





- Benefits like pension, health insurance, inclusive support for new parents and generous vacation


- On top of your annual base salary, you are offered to be part of an Employee Share Plan


- Growth and progression opportunities ‚Äì we want you to grow with us


- Flexible remote work


- Strong social culture with lots of team and company activities


- Meaningful work ‚Äì everyone at Planday contributes to improving the lives of shift workers around the globe


- Healthy work-life balance and autonomous approach to work. We trust in you and your abilities





Finally, our offices are not just workplaces (although they are pretty nice and well-located, we have to say!). Plandayers are open and welcoming and at Planday, everyone has the freedom and support to show their true self at work.





Our tech stack is cutting edge and our engineering work is supported by dedicated in-house scrum masters and agile evangelists.





At Planday, we firmly believe that diversity and inclusion are the cornerstones of innovation and a vibrant workplace culture, and we highly value the strength that diverse backgrounds offer.





As an equal opportunity employer, we strive to create an equitable experience for all our candidates throughout the process. Please let us know if you need reasonable accommodation during the application or interview process.





All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to any personal characteristics.

All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to any personal characteristics.

Title: Data Analyst, Marketing
Description:
Bumble Inc. is seeking an experienced Marketing Analyst to work with our paid marketing stakeholders, take an integrated ecosystem approach and support critical business decisions across all of our apps. This is a unique opportunity for an experienced analyst who enjoys the fast paced environment of a growing company, has experience in marketing and has a passion to contribute to helping the Bumble Inc. mission to foster kind connections.

You would ideally have an extensive background in marketing analytics at an app based tech company, with proven experience of driving commercial impact through applying analytics to critical business problems.¬†

You bring experience of working with complex sources of both Brand and Paid Marketing data and use that knowledge to partner with stakeholders and senior leaders, taking a holistic approach to find answers. You are comfortable challenging priorities and communicating analytical roadmaps.

You understand the high-level business model of the company and the primary drivers and output metrics to efficiently receive a stakeholder request, draft a project/insights brief and proactively ask for additional scope clarity where necessary.

Remaining laser-focused on the "so what" of the findings, and how the insights support business decisions you take an integrated perspective to analytics, considers all the potential drivers to a problem, reviewing existing knowledge and bringing in expertise for advice from other teams.

You enjoy efficiently producing insights that inform decision-making as well as providing support for an extensive experimentation program. Passionate about continual improvement, both personally and for the team around you, you always look for feedback to strive for higher quality of deliverables.




KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES
You will build and deliver analytical roadmaps to support the longer term vision of marketing measurement within the business. This includes reporting, handling of ad-hoc requests and data visibility, experimentation, and ongoing measurement of marketing campaigns
You will provide insights and recommendations which are actionable and relevant to your stakeholders, automating decision-making where necessary, and providing tools and solutions that help enable self-service and scalability.¬†
You will act as a trusted thought partner as the analytical authority in your domain. You will likely be dedicated to a set of specific initiatives and projects, where you will be expected to act as a representative of the Advanced Data Analytics team, demonstrating our values, capabilities, and competencies.¬†
You will develop a deep knowledge on the marketing domain, becoming the authority on its limitations, as well as measurement possibilities. You will proactively educate stakeholder functions to further democratise this understanding
You will contribute to data quality as it relates to the domain, proactively working with Data and Analytics Eng. and other teams to improve data collection and modelling
You will build and manage self-serve data products, a knowledge base of insights, and provide direct support, to empower others to fully understand the value of data in their day-to-day work
You will create an environment of utilising data for planning and execution, always keeping in mind alternative and creative solutions of measurement across a variety of marketing initiatives.¬†





REQUIRED EXPERIENCE & SKILLS
Preference for a graduate degree in Mathematics, Engineering, Information Sciences, Economics, Finance, or STEM. PhD and Masters welcome
Preference for experience working in similar dating/social/gaming tech product industries or else app based product
You will have had experience setting up experimentation, measurement, and data collection in the marketing domain
You keep an eye out on the industry, understanding how the wider dating industry influences our pricing and promotional strategy.¬†
You understand the concept and complexity of marketing measurement and MMM
You will have deep experience of the marketing domain across multiple tactics, including MMM, Churn, LTV and an understanding of the tooling/vendor landscape and opportunities for automation or introduction of genAi.¬†
You have experience working with complex data infrastructures and have experience partnering and guiding the work of data engineering to help facilitate ingestion, warehousing, and optimisation of databases.¬†¬†
3+ years experience in commercial analytics, being able to elaborate on the business impact you have driven in your previous experience.¬†
Strong experience with data engineering and data modelling requirements needed to automate reporting and measurement.¬†





ABOUT YOU
A strong believer in Bumble Inc.‚Äôs brand vision and values
Engaging, inspiring and clear communicator. A proven track record of socialising and embedding analytical findings to drive business outcomes, up to exec level.¬†
Deep commercial understanding and a proven ability of creating impact through the power of customer-led insights
Comfort in operating in ambiguous and complex problem spaces, helping teams you work with to define the questions that help support the business, and confidence in pushing back and saying no when needed.¬†
A love of collaborating with colleagues and stakeholders to arrive at rounded and balanced perspectives in your work, a strong desire to learn from others¬†¬†
Commercially minded, with a keen sense of where insights can fuel growth
Strong experience with python/SQL, visualisation tooling such as Looker/Tableau, and machine learning/data science tooling such as Streamlit/Count/Kubeflow
Strong governance and data quality mindset
Understands and can demonstrate machine learning and advanced analytical marketing impact in an organisation.¬†





Show more

  • Engaging, inspiring and clear communicator. A proven track record of socialising and embedding analytical findings to drive business outcomes, up to exec level. 
  • Deep commercial understanding and a proven ability of creating impact through the power of customer-led insights
  • Comfort in operating in ambiguous and complex problem spaces, helping teams you work with to define the questions that help support the business, and confidence in pushing back and saying no when needed. 
  • A love of collaborating with colleagues and stakeholders to arrive at rounded and balanced perspectives in your work, a strong desire to learn from others  
  • Commercially minded, with a keen sense of where insights can fuel growth
  • Strong experience with python/SQL, visualisation tooling such as Looker/Tableau, and machine learning/data science tooling such as Streamlit/Count/Kubeflow
  • Strong governance and data quality mindset
  • Understands and can demonstrate machine learning and advanced analytical marketing impact in an organisation.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
The Role

At Deliveroo we have an outstanding data science organisation, with a mission to enable the highest quality human and machine decision-making. We work throughout the company - in product, business and platform teams - using analysis, experimentation, causal inference and machine learning techniques. We are uniquely placed to use data to help make better decisions and improve data literacy across Deliveroo.

We are looking for a Data Analyst that is passionate about metrics and telling the stories behind the data. We have several roles open across different teams (grocery, loyalty, restaurants). Data Analysts at Deliveroo report into our data science management team.

You will be a professional in insights storytelling, communication and visualisation and know how to create action from metrics. Crafting effective intelligent benchmarks, understanding performance, caring about data quality, enabling automation and creating phenomenal visualisations and stories are things that drive you.

What you'll be doing



Work closely with commercial stakeholders to create value and business impact through better data availability, visualisation and analysis
Discover, analyse, and interpret trends or patterns in complex datasets to perform ad-hoc analyses and deliver insights to the executive team and senior management
Understand key drivers of the business and provide data driven guidance on key levers
Identify and specify data needs and quality requirements and work closely with Analytics Engineers to ensure data is available, accurate and corresponds to the business needs
Consolidate and distribute best analytical practices from different teams and countries



Requirements



Experience identifying the root cause of problems, assessing risks/impacts and determining and implementing effective solutions.
A good understanding of querying in SQL and understanding of database structure - you'll be expected to be able to extract the data you need for your analysis.
Compelling story-telling skills, and an eye for powerful visualisations - you'll need to translate your findings for all levels of stakeholder (business and technical)
Good knowledge of Excel/GSheets - depending on the task, there is a good chance that this is where some of your exploratory analysis will take place. Being comfortable with pivot tables and functions will be essential.
Developer experience with a data visualisation tool (Looker, Tableau, Periscope)



Why Deliveroo

Our mission is to transform the way you shop and eat, bringing the neighbourhood to your door by connecting consumers, restaurants, shops and riders. . We are transforming the way the world eats and shops by making access to food and products more convenient and enjoyable. We give people the opportunity to buy what they want, as they want it, when and where they want it.

We are a technology-driven company at the forefront of the most rapidly expanding industry in the world. We are still a small team, making a very large impact, looking to answer some of the most interesting questions out there. We move fast, value autonomy and ownership, and we are always looking for new ideas.

Workplace & Benefits

At Deliveroo we know that people are the heart of the business and we prioritise their welfare. Benefits differ by country, but we offer many benefits in areas including healthcare, well-being, parental leave, pensions, and generous annual leave allowances, including time off to support a charitable cause of your choice. Benefits are country-specific, please ask your recruiter for more information. This role in a Hybrid position.

Diversity

At Deliveroo, we believe a great workplace is one that represents the world we live in and how beautifully diverse it can be. That means we have no judgement when it comes to any one of the things that make you who you are - your gender, race, sexuality, religion or a secret aversion to coriander. All you need is a passion for (most) food and a desire to be part of one of the fastest-growing businesses in a rapidly growing industry.

We are committed to diversity, equity and inclusion in all aspects of our hiring process. We recognise that some candidates may require adjustments to apply for a position or fairly participate in the interview process. If you require any adjustments, please don't hesitate to let us know. We will make every effort to provide the necessary adjustments to ensure you have an equitable opportunity to succeed.

Please click here to view our candidate privacy policy.

Please click here to view our candidate privacy policy.

You will be a professional in insights storytelling, communication and visualisation and know how to create action from metrics. Crafting effective intelligent benchmarks, understanding performance, caring about data quality, enabling automation and creating phenomenal visualisations and stories are things that drive you.

What you'll be doing


  • Work closely with commercial stakeholders to create value and business impact through better data availability, visualisation and analysis
  • Discover, analyse, and interpret trends or patterns in complex datasets to perform ad-hoc analyses and deliver insights to the executive team and senior management
  • Understand key drivers of the business and provide data driven guidance on key levers
  • Identify and specify data needs and quality requirements and work closely with Analytics Engineers to ensure data is available, accurate and corresponds to the business needs
  • Consolidate and distribute best analytical practices from different teams and countries


Requirements


  • Experience identifying the root cause of problems, assessing risks/impacts and determining and implementing effective solutions.
  • A good understanding of querying in SQL and understanding of database structure - you'll be expected to be able to extract the data you need for your analysis.
  • Compelling story-telling skills, and an eye for powerful visualisations - you'll need to translate your findings for all levels of stakeholder (business and technical)
  • Good knowledge of Excel/GSheets - depending on the task, there is a good chance that this is where some of your exploratory analysis will take place. Being comfortable with pivot tables and functions will be essential.
  • Developer experience with a data visualisation tool (Looker, Tableau, Periscope)


Why Deliveroo

Our mission is to transform the way you shop and eat, bringing the neighbourhood to your door by connecting consumers, restaurants, shops and riders. . We are transforming the way the world eats and shops by making access to food and products more convenient and enjoyable. We give people the opportunity to buy what they want, as they want it, when and where they want it.

We are a technology-driven company at the forefront of the most rapidly expanding industry in the world. We are still a small team, making a very large impact, looking to answer some of the most interesting questions out there. We move fast, value autonomy and ownership, and we are always looking for new ideas.

Workplace & Benefits

At Deliveroo we know that people are the heart of the business and we prioritise their welfare. Benefits differ by country, but we offer many benefits in areas including healthcare, well-being, parental leave, pensions, and generous annual leave allowances, including time off to support a charitable cause of your choice. Benefits are country-specific, please ask your recruiter for more information. This role in a Hybrid position.

Diversity

At Deliveroo, we believe a great workplace is one that represents the world we live in and how beautifully diverse it can be. That means we have no judgement when it comes to any one of the things that make you who you are - your gender, race, sexuality, religion or a secret aversion to coriander. All you need is a passion for (most) food and a desire to be part of one of the fastest-growing businesses in a rapidly growing industry.

We are committed to diversity, equity and inclusion in all aspects of our hiring process. We recognise that some candidates may require adjustments to apply for a position or fairly participate in the interview process. If you require any adjustments, please don't hesitate to let us know. We will make every effort to provide the necessary adjustments to ensure you have an equitable opportunity to succeed.

Please click here to view our candidate privacy policy.

Please click here to view our candidate privacy policy.

Title: Junior Insight Analyst
Description:
The Insight Analyst will be a junior role; supporting Liberty and the Insights & Analytics team by providing actionable insight to help the business deliver an unparalleled customer experience, as well as driving improvement in key business metrics.




The successful candidate will be someone with excellent communication skills, engaging with stakeholders at all levels of the business. They will play an integral role in influencing both business and customer strategies through quantitative data analysis.




They will work closely with the Insights & Analytics Manager to develop key analytics strategies and approaches to improving processes within the business.




Key Responsibilities:

Communicate with stakeholders to capture requirements and identify key opportunities for improvement
Use analytical and storytelling skills, taking the business owners on a journey to better understand the customer
Ownership of regular and ad-hoc customer insight reports
Work closely with the Insights & Analyst Manager to deliver action orientated insights
Analysis of CRM campaigns across all marketing channels including the post campaign analysis to ensure ROI on activity
Continuously improve existing reporting methods within Liberty
Improve the efficiency of existing reporting methods using data visualisation and techniques in SQL, Microsoft Excel and BI
Help monitor customer data quality and ensure any issues are appropriately resolved or escalated with IT stakeholders.




Acting as a provider of insights and reporting, the successful candidate will show the ability to work with a wide range of stakeholders across the business. They will show an interest in customer insights, product performance and the entire purchasing journey on the Liberty website and in the Flagship store. They will be willing to use new tools and approaches to insights.

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities

Analysing data sets in Excel
Presenting results and key recommendations in Powerpoint (or equivalent tool)
SQL and data interrogation of data sets
Communication with stakeholders
E-commerce analytics experience




Desirables

Data Visualisation and BI (eg Power BI, Tableau, Pyramid Analytics)
Google Analytics
Retail and Customer Experience
Marketing campaign analysis
Show more

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
We are keen to speak with junior data analysts about joining an investment management client of ours, based in Central London. This will be on a 12-month contract with an expectation to be extended or taken on permanently upon completion.




This is a hybrid position with 3 days in the office.




This role offers a unique opportunity for a Junior Data Analyst to grow within a dynamic and challenging environment. You'll be working on a high-profile client project, gaining hands-on experience with large datasets and contributing to data-driven strategies.




You will be responsible for:

Managing and processing large datasets, ensuring accuracy and efficiency.
Developing and maintaining dashboards to support data visualisation and decision-making.
Analysing data to identify trends, patterns, and insights that drive business strategies.
Collaborating with stakeholders and clients to understand their data needs and deliver actionable insights.




Requirements

University Graduates with 0-2 years of experience
A keen interest to work in Investment Management
Keen to identify and embrace new technologies and new ways of working
Experience in Power BI and SQL (Desirable)
Effective prioritisation and organisational skills
Excellent communication skills, both written and oral
Good IT skills, including Microsoft Word, Excel and Outlook




Benefits

¬£30,000 for graduates with less than 1 year of experience, up to ¬£50,000 for graduates with 2+ years of experience.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About Allica bank

Allica is the UK‚Äôs fastest growing company - and the fastest-growing financial technology (fintech) firm ever. Our purpose is to help established SMEs, one of the last major underserved opportunities in fintech. Established SMEs are the backbone of local communities - representing over a third of our economy - yet have been largely neglected both by traditional high street banks and modern fintech providers




Role Description

Data is a key asset to Allica and is deeply embedded in all our teams and products. With data, we assist and work with Finance, Operations, Credit Risk, Product and management. This role will be for the Lending Tribe.




We are looking for ambitious and curious people who can help us understand our data better, contribute to facilitating the discussions between engineering and the data stakeholders and have an impact on the business by telling stories around the insights they generate.




You will be an integral part of the lending data squad, and the initial focus will be scaling up our ability to deliver analytics/insights that shape our understanding of the business and enhancing our foundations for automated reporting




Principal Accountabilities

Understand our products and processes through the data we have or collect
Work with the Lending Tribe and other stakeholders (Ops, risk, etc) to understand their data needs and provide solutions that address the core need (not just the immediate request)
Contribute meaningful insights from our data that proactively drive decisions and new lines of inquiry
Build visualizations and reports that enable the Lending business to service their ongoing data needs and measure KPIs
Develop data knowledge base (definitions, working rhythms etc.) within the team that enables us to become an information hub for the business




Personal Attributes & Experience

Previous experience working as a data analyst (in finance is desirable but not essential)
You like to investigate and challenge narratives using data
The ability to write queries in SQL with logic to combine multiple data sources
You work well with stakeholders across the business.
You communicate effectively and are comfortable with learning how to translate technical detail into business and commercial language.
You have a solid foundation in Python programming OR a strong desire to learn




Don‚Äôt tick every box?

Don‚Äôt worry if you don‚Äôt have all the skills or requirements listed on the job description. If you think you‚Äôll be a good fit, we‚Äôd still love to hear from you!




Flexible working

We know the ‚Äò9-to-5‚Äô isn‚Äôt right for everyone. That‚Äôs why Allica Bank is fully committed to flexible and hybrid working. Please let us know what is best for you and, if we can, we will do our best to accommodate.




Diversity

We‚Äôre a diverse bunch here at Allica, with all kinds of experiences, backgrounds and lifestyles. Our openness and differences make us stronger, and we want everybody to feel comfortable bringing as much of themselves to work with them as they like.




Additional Information

Working at Allica Bank

At Allica Bank we want to ensure our employees have the right tools and environment in which to succeed in their role and in support of our customers.




Our employees are at the heart of everything we do, so our benefits are designed with you in mind:

Full onboarding support and continued development opportunities
Options for flexible working
Regular social activities
25 days holiday ‚Äì with the option to Buy/Sell
Pension contributions
Discretionary bonus scheme
Private health cover (with the option to add family members)
Life assurance
Income Protection
Family friendly policies including enhanced Maternity & Paternity leave
Season ticket loans
Show more
