Title: Data Analyst
Description:
The Opportunity







Analytics is the compass that guides Sephora on its strategic journey, and we are on the lookout for a Data Analyst who can harness the power of data to propel our business forward. As a Data Analyst, you'll play a critical role in analyzing and interpreting customer data to drive business decisions across our digital platforms. Leveraging your strong experience in BigQuery SQL, you'll craft scripts that seamlessly integrate back-end data with Google Analytics 4 for in-depth customer analysis and segmentation.




Your expertise in data modeling will enable you to map out data structures that support the creation and maintenance of dashboards and reports, tracking key performance indicators (KPIs) related to online engagement, traffic, conversion rates, and marketing effectiveness. In this role, you'll work with data visualization tools like Power BI and Google Data Studio to develop compelling visual reports that convey complex insights in a clear and actionable manner. Additionally, you'll ensure the accuracy and quality of data, while effectively communicating your insights to non-technical stakeholders.







You will also be responsible for:

Writing and optimizing BigQuery SQL scripts for GA4 analysis, integrating back-end data to segment and analyze customer data.
Developing and maintaining dashboards and regular weekly/monthly reports to track KPIs related to performance, online engagement, A/B testing, traffic, conversion rates, marketing attribution, and campaign effectiveness.
Using data visualization tools such as Power BI and Google Data Studio to create clear, actionable insights for stakeholders.
Engaging in data modeling to effectively map out data structures that support business goals.
Utilizing digital analytics tools like Google Analytics and Quantum Metric to deliver data-driven recommendations.
Ensuring the accuracy and quality of data while drawing insightful conclusions and making strategic recommendations.







What You'll Bring







Your passion for detail is matched by your logical thinking and curiosity. You not only obsess over details but also possess the agility to communicate improvements rapidly and clearly. You thrive in an ever-evolving landscape, where driving innovation and continuous improvement is paramount. We are looking for a detail-oriented Data Analyst with strong analytical skills, capable of working both independently and collaboratively within a dynamic team environment.

We value ambition paired with a logical mindset‚Äîindividuals who are curious, inquisitive, and able to articulate suggestions with precision. You will utilize your strong foundation in BigQuery SQL, particularly in GA4 analysis, coupled with hands-on experience in data visualization using tools like Power BI. Your deep understanding of digital analytics, especially within Ecommerce and Retail, will enable you to provide actionable insights that drive business success. Your proficiency in digital analytics tools such as Google Analytics and Quantum Metric will be essential in providing recommendations that optimize performance.







Our ideal candidate will also possess:

Proficiency in Google Analytics, Quantum Metric, or similar digital analytics platforms.
Experience with Google Marketing Platform.
Strong communication skills, both written and verbal, for conveying complex data insights to non-technical stakeholders.
An eye for detail and a commitment to data accuracy and quality.
Familiarity with Google Tag Manager, A/B testing tools, competitor research using market share tools, setting up data feed APIs, and UX platforms would be advantageous.







While at Sephora, You‚Äôll Enjoy...







The people. You will be surrounded by some of the most talented leaders and teams ‚Äì people you can be proud to work with.
The learning. We invest in training and developing our teams, and you will continue evolving and building your skills through personalized career plans.
The culture. As a leading beauty retailer within the LVMH family, our reach is broad, and our impact is global. It is in our DNA to innovate and, at Sephora, all 40,000 passionate team members across 35 markets and 3,000 stores, are united by a common goal - to reimagine the future of beauty.
Show more

Title: Insights Analyst
Description:
Job Title: Insights Analyst/Manager

Job Location: Sunbury-on-Thames

Contract Length: 12 Months (possibility of extension)

Industry: Oil and Energy, EV

Working Hours: 8 per day/40 per week




Role Overview:

YOU can help us get there, we‚Äôre searching for experts who are passionate and skilled in Operations and Maintenance to help drive operational excellence within our EV charging network. Come join our team to help the world electrify!




This is an opportunity to join a business with an envious position in a fast-growing sector, and ultimately help enable more people to transition to electric vehicles. You will not just be part of the biggest change in the automotive industry for a century - you will be at the forefront of it as we shape the EV charging market in key regions.




As the Global Maintenance Analytics Manager/ Insights Analyst/ Manager, you will play an integral part in our EV programme across several fronts. We want you to define and implement our Global Performance plan that will underpin operational excellence across our EV installed base and be the face of this within the wider bp business.




What you will do:

Lead the Management Information and Data Analytics Program for bp pule Operations Excellence, providing the analytics toolset and data science capability to support the development of insights from the bp pulse EV charging network data and business improvement recommendations.




Play a key role in operating out the externally committed target of 100,000 EV units by 2030.
Ability to work with and interpret large volumes of data on reliability and performance and derive insights in order to help support critical business decisions.
Own the data and analytics value chain for operations, maintenance, reliability, and project controls dashboards (build and maintain).
Providing real-time access to performance data to support the organizations‚Äô ability to use insights from data.
Lead delivery of operations, maintenance and reliability analytics and be accountable for the execution into the regions.
Support standardized performance management across the regions.
Ensures that the business and operational requirements are clearly defined, working collaboratively across the maintenance and reliability functions so that the analytical tools delivered meet the needs of the asset groups.
Define consistent business metrics and promote their adoption.
Be a member of the Operations Excellence leadership team; providing active support and the development of other reliability driven projects and services across the bp pulse operations function.
Develop and communicate reliability; use central infrastructure to promote knowledge sharing and standardization
Network actively across/with the regional operations leads to promote the value of the performance analysis and the use of this to drive reliability initiatives across the network.
Combine data analysis across all the reliability activities and leading the development of the business cases for developing the systems landscape and the integration of systems within bp pulse.
Active contribution to the EV Operations and Maintenance strategy for bp pulse on our operational performance agenda and define and implement the most optimum solutions in each region ‚Äì this strategy is essential and key to leading a customer focused business in a low margin environment.
Own the global roadmap for business-critical solutions/tools/technologies to drive improvements and efficiencies.




What you will have:

Experience with analysing data to produce well-structured, defendable insights and using these to make recommendations to the business.
Strong SQL experience.
Strong understanding of data visualization principles and tools, hands-on experience preferred (i.e., Power BI, Tableau, MicroStrategy).
Capable of operating at all levels of the organization, with good interpersonal and presentation skills.
The ability to identify gaps within our data and communicate these to the data team by providing detailed requirements.
Experience in working across operating functions, e.g., operations, engineering, maintenance & reliability, logistics etc.
Strong level of assertiveness, influencing, and communication skills.
Strong understanding of business decision-making processes and setting priorities.
An understanding of the EV charging infrastructure is beneficial but not essential.




We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, sex, gender, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst - Central London - Hybrid




Coltech is partnered with an exciting startup organisation based in the heart of Central London. They are focused on digital advertising and work with many leading organisations globally.




They seek a Data Analyst to join their analytics team; the successful candidate will be responsible for driving insights from key products. You will play a vital role in shaping product analytics while working alongside a dynamic team passionate about problem-solving.




Responsibilities

Identify and deliver insights for key products, including Deals, Apps, Experimentation Platforms, and Identity Protection tools.
Collaborate with the product team to support monetisation, product development, and decision-making.
Provide technical expertise to manipulate and transform large datasets, translating analytical findings into actionable stakeholder insights.
Dive into complex datasets to identify opportunities that drive the delivery of initiatives across various product lines.
Leverage a centralised reporting framework to support monetisation and strategic decision-making.
Collaborate with product and data stakeholders to develop and maintain data models and performance measurements for new product experiments.




Required Experience/Skills

Professional experience in data analytics and reporting.
Strong proficiency in SQL for querying and manipulating large datasets.
Experience with BI / Data visualisation tools.
Familiarity with Google Cloud Platform, Big Query, Looker, or similar tools is a plus.
Attention to detail with a focus on accuracy and data integrity.
Bachelor‚Äôs degree in a related field.




Desirable Skills

Any experience with BigQuery is a plus
Any experience with Looker is a plus
Experience working in a GCP environment is a plus




Alongside being a great company to work for, the company also offers a very competitive benefits package.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About SugarCRM

Thank you for taking a look at this career opportunity! This is a direct employment position available only in Romania. If you feel you are a fit, please apply by uploading your CV in English. Thank you!

From the very beginning, SugarCRM had a unique vision: to offer a different kind of Customer Relationship Management (CRM). We pioneered the first commercial open-source CRM platform, and now, more than two decades later, are on a mission to¬†provide products and services that¬†make the hard things easier for sales, marketing and customer service teams. In fact, we help mid-market businesses around the globe reach new levels of performance and predictability¬†by letting our award-winning CRM platform do the work.¬†

¬†

Our diverse group of¬†worldwide¬†employees¬†are¬†united and driven by a shared passion for our mission, culture,¬†and¬†values. We treat our employees like humans not line items and are building a culture where your work at Sugar helps fuel personal, professional and business growth ‚Äì check out our¬†recent¬†‚ÄòGreat Place to Work‚Äô¬†certification that we¬†are¬†so proud of.¬†Work/life fit¬†and flexibility¬†for our team¬†matters¬†and together we pride ourselves on solving for our customers,¬†always.¬†What‚Äôs more, we are a Remote 1st organization, which means we empower everyone to do their best work from home, on the road, or anywhere in between.

¬†

If you're ready to grow your career and help¬†organizations grow better¬†and¬†faster, you've come to the right place. Find out more about our¬†SugarCRM careers¬†and how you can become a part of our journey.¬†




JOB FUNCTION

Provide support for database design, implementation, and maintenance, on MS SQL Server databases for our Software-as-a-Service customers, who range in size from small independent businesses to multi-nationals.

Automate the extraction/receipt of key data from accounting systems and import via a series of flat files in a pre-defined format into our product.




KEY RESULT AREAS:
Create 'customers for life‚Äô by delivering world-class support to our customers and partners
Be responsive, professional, and proactive in all interactions
Troubleshoot and resolve installation, implementation, and production issues and maintain customer database extractions to ensure the Service utilizes up to date customer data.
Continuously learn about Sugar and Sales-I products, core technologies, and troubleshooting methodologies
Share your knowledge, experience, and best practices with the Support department
Work cohesively with other departments to ensure the customer‚Äôs voice is heard throughout the company
Document known solutions for internal collaboration and public consumption
Demonstrate a commitment to and willingness to take ownership of our customer‚Äôs success.





Experience and Skills:
3+ years‚Äô experience with MSSQL SQL Server; concentrations in writing T-SQL and troubleshooting data imports.
Proficient in written and spoken English
Excellent written and verbal communications skills
Work well in a team environment
Good ETL knowledge of different SQL based accounting systems: like Sage, Dynamics, Epicor.¬†
Good MS Office knowledge (Particularly Excel)
Able to work under pressure and prioritize tasks.
Good planning, scheduling and organization skills.
Communicate technical solutions to non-technical people.
An ability to learn new software systems.








We understand that no candidate is perfectly qualified for any job. Experience comes in different forms; many skills are transferable; and passion goes a long way. Even more important than your resume is a clear demonstration of dedication, impact, and the ability to thrive in a fluid and collaborative environment. We want you to learn new things in this role, and we encourage you to apply if your experience is close to what we‚Äôre looking for. We also know that diversity of background and thought makes for better problem solving and more creative thinking, which is why we're dedicated to adding new perspectives to the team.

¬†

Benefits and Perks:

Beyond a stellar work environment, friendly people, and inspiring work, we have some sweet benefits and perks:

¬†

- Private medical insurance including basic check-ups, hospitalization, and vital care

- Vision exam and discounted glasses every year

- Meal tickets 40 RON/working day

- Gift tickets 300 RON/ Easter & Christmas

- Cultural tickets 200 RON/month

- Health & Wellness reimbursement

- Professional development reimbursement program

- Educational Resources - Career & Personal Development Program

- Travel discounts

- Birthday day off

- Extra days off when public holidays fall on weekend days

- Annual Teambuilding

- We are a merit-based company with many opportunities to learn, excel and grow your career!

About SugarCRM

Thank you for taking a look at this career opportunity! This is a direct employment position available only in Romania. If you feel you are a fit, please apply by uploading your CV in English. Thank you!

From the very beginning, SugarCRM had a unique vision: to offer a different kind of Customer Relationship Management (CRM). We pioneered the first commercial open-source CRM platform, and now, more than two decades later, are on a mission to provide products and services that make the hard things easier for sales, marketing and customer service teams. In fact, we help mid-market businesses around the globe reach new levels of performance and predictability by letting our award-winning CRM platform do the work. 

 

Our diverse group of worldwide employees are united and driven by a shared passion for our mission, culture, and values. We treat our employees like humans not line items and are building a culture where your work at Sugar helps fuel personal, professional and business growth ‚Äì check out our recent ‚ÄòGreat Place to Work‚Äô certification that we are so proud of. Work/life fit and flexibility for our team matters and together we pride ourselves on solving for our customers, always. What‚Äôs more, we are a Remote 1st organization, which means we empower everyone to do their best work from home, on the road, or anywhere in between.

 

If you're ready to grow your career and help organizations grow better and faster, you've come to the right place. Find out more about our SugarCRM careers and how you can become a part of our journey. 


JOB FUNCTION

Provide support for database design, implementation, and maintenance, on MS SQL Server databases for our Software-as-a-Service customers, who range in size from small independent businesses to multi-nationals.

Automate the extraction/receipt of key data from accounting systems and import via a series of flat files in a pre-defined format into our product.


KEY RESULT AREAS:
  • Create 'customers for life‚Äô by delivering world-class support to our customers and partners
  • Be responsive, professional, and proactive in all interactions
  • Troubleshoot and resolve installation, implementation, and production issues and maintain customer database extractions to ensure the Service utilizes up to date customer data.
  • Continuously learn about Sugar and Sales-I products, core technologies, and troubleshooting methodologies
  • Share your knowledge, experience, and best practices with the Support department
  • Work cohesively with other departments to ensure the customer‚Äôs voice is heard throughout the company
  • Document known solutions for internal collaboration and public consumption
  • Demonstrate a commitment to and willingness to take ownership of our customer‚Äôs success.


Experience and Skills:
  • 3+ years‚Äô experience with MSSQL SQL Server; concentrations in writing T-SQL and troubleshooting data imports.
  • Proficient in written and spoken English
  • Excellent written and verbal communications skills
  • Work well in a team environment
  • Good ETL knowledge of different SQL based accounting systems: like Sage, Dynamics, Epicor. 
  • Good MS Office knowledge (Particularly Excel)
  • Able to work under pressure and prioritize tasks.
  • Good planning, scheduling and organization skills.
  • Communicate technical solutions to non-technical people.
  • An ability to learn new software systems.



We understand that no candidate is perfectly qualified for any job. Experience comes in different forms; many skills are transferable; and passion goes a long way. Even more important than your resume is a clear demonstration of dedication, impact, and the ability to thrive in a fluid and collaborative environment. We want you to learn new things in this role, and we encourage you to apply if your experience is close to what we‚Äôre looking for. We also know that diversity of background and thought makes for better problem solving and more creative thinking, which is why we're dedicated to adding new perspectives to the team.

 

Benefits and Perks:

Beyond a stellar work environment, friendly people, and inspiring work, we have some sweet benefits and perks:

 

- Private medical insurance including basic check-ups, hospitalization, and vital care

- Vision exam and discounted glasses every year

- Meal tickets 40 RON/working day

- Gift tickets 300 RON/ Easter & Christmas

- Cultural tickets 200 RON/month

- Health & Wellness reimbursement

- Professional development reimbursement program

- Educational Resources - Career & Personal Development Program

- Travel discounts

- Birthday day off

- Extra days off when public holidays fall on weekend days

- Annual Teambuilding

- We are a merit-based company with many opportunities to learn, excel and grow your career!

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Junior Data Analyst




This role is ideal for candidates motivated to build a career and who have graduated from a data, technical, mathematical or scientific background driven by wanting to assist an organisation in achieving its strategic goals and change management

This position also provides a unique opportunity to receive ongoing coaching and support from within the Protein Works with training and development and industry-wide recognised professional qualifications.










This is an incredible opportunity to join a growing and highly talented Business Intelligence team where you will be:







Putting data at the heart of our decision-making process, driving focus, priorities & pace
Using data to better understand and care for our customers
Creating proprietary data solutions that provide a single ‚Äòtruth‚Äô across the business







The uber talented and incredibly driven person selected for this role will play a pivotal part in the delivery and development of our data solution; also, be the single point of contact for data mining, automation and presentation. To ignite this role, you‚Äôll need to think customer first, be commercially aware and adept at spotting and communicating opportunities.










Immediate Responsibilities and Hot Projects







Development of standardised dynamic and static reports for all areas of the business
Establish a reporting benchmark and process across the business
Get under the hood of marketing, ops, tech to understand current reporting needs & opportunities
Align the business using cross functional reports that tie in certain cause and effect elements critical to scaling
Work with the Senior team to design, develop and enhance data capture and reporting tools
Support the Senior team on the generation and maintenance of meaningful management information across every level of the business







Day to day responsibilities







Management of our Data Analytics Warehouse, all automated reports and back end data lake
Engineering and development of our DAW maintaining health and building for the future
You‚Äôll drive performance through analysing in and cross functional data and presenting opportunities
Undertaking data analysis within assigned projects
Delivering data solutions and data lifecycles
Collecting, extracting and analysing data from complex sources
Managing APIs from health and integration points of view
Analysing and providing data on all key operational performance, suggesting improvements and changes where necessary
Make sure quality standards are met and deadlines achieved
Support others throughout the business to improve their use and understanding of data
Maintain ahead of the curve industry knowledge within customer experience
Maintaining strong relationships with the internal team







We are looking for







A creative data ‚Äògeek‚Äô energetic, and passionate about your area of expertise with a love for communication
Passion for impacting change and performance in a commercial, retail setting
Passionate about branding, believing in a brand mission and your part in that journey
A lover of hitting targets
Developing a strategic mindset as you progress through your career
Naturally inquisitive
Avid self-learner & teacher
Able to trade-off short & long-term targets and have a history of making the right calls
You have high standards for quality of delivery from yourself and from others
You are great at building positive, productive relationships
You are great at extracting stories & crafting hypotheses & strategies from data
You have excellent interpersonal skills, and are able to clearly communicate complex topics in simple terms
You are a highly motivated self-starter







Location







Please note this position is to be based out of Runcorn HQ in Cheshire Monday - Thursday with Friday a home working day. Please bare this in mind for submitting an application.







Why Protein Works







Join one of the UK's fastest-growing multi-award-winning food brands
Be part of a movement to revolutionise the way people think about nutrition, protein, and food
Join us in driving innovation and redefining standards in a dynamic industry.
Work with a talented team: Learn from and collaborate with skilled professionals who will guide and support your personal and professional growth journey.
Develop your skills: Take advantage of ample opportunities to expand your skill set and enhance your career trajectory.







Benefits







Exclusive staff discount
Cycle to work scheme
WFH on Fridays
Private Healthcare
25 days holiday* + all bank holidays
Pension scheme
Staff socials and events
Fantastic Bonus Scheme
Enhanced Holiday Scheme

Title: Data Analyst

Description:
Data Analyst - Innovative Ad Tech leader - ¬£35,000 - ¬£40,000

The Company

An Ad Tech leader who powers the premium web - a digital display marketplace for advertisers, delivering high attention solutions with platform scale reach across the UK.

As a platform built for brands by the UK's leading premium publishers, they offer their content partners the tools, services and expertise to take greater control of their highly valued inventory and data assets.

They bring advertisers and publishers closer together in a fully transparent and trusted digital environment. They deliver campaigns across 150+ leading online publisher brands, with highly engaging standard display and rich media formats.

Exciting bits:

Be part of a fast growing team and company
Excellent culture with a 5 out of 5 on Glassdoor!
Unique opportunity to develop/progress quickly and work with a product taking the market by storm!

The Job

Develop monetisation strategies through your in-depth analysis and recommendations
Identify opportunities within publisher audiences to grow monetisation
Collaborate with the Ozone product team to support monetisation, product development and decision making
Dive into complex data sets to identify opportunities that drive delivery of initiatives across our product lines
Develop and maintain data models and performance measurements for new product experiments by collaborating with product and data stakeholders
Focus on diverse data sets across product, digital media, audience and user behaviour


You

Experience with SQL, Python and dashboarding tools (e.g. Looker/Data Studio)
Media broadcaster/owner, publisher or ad tech industry background would be ideal
1-3 years experience in Data & Analytics
Ideally some experience with cloud technologies such as GCP or AWS

Exciting bits:

  • Be part of a fast growing team and company
  • Excellent culture with a 5 out of 5 on Glassdoor!
  • Unique opportunity to develop/progress quickly and work with a product taking the market by storm!

The Job

  • Develop monetisation strategies through your in-depth analysis and recommendations
  • Identify opportunities within publisher audiences to grow monetisation
  • Collaborate with the Ozone product team to support monetisation, product development and decision making
  • Dive into complex data sets to identify opportunities that drive delivery of initiatives across our product lines
  • Develop and maintain data models and performance measurements for new product experiments by collaborating with product and data stakeholders
  • Focus on diverse data sets across product, digital media, audience and user behaviour


You

  • Experience with SQL, Python and dashboarding tools (e.g. Looker/Data Studio)
  • Media broadcaster/owner, publisher or ad tech industry background would be ideal
  • 1-3 years experience in Data & Analytics
  • Ideally some experience with cloud technologies such as GCP or AWS

Apply Now

You can apply for this role now by sending us your CV or by calling us now! Don't forget to look at vacancies on our website and register as a candidate.

Jordan

Executive Consultant

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Position: Data Analyst

Location: Cardiff, Wales

Salary: 35K DOE




About the Role:

Our client is seeking a talented Data Analyst to join their dynamic team. This role offers the chance to work on diverse projects, using your analytical skills to drive strategic decisions and influence key business outcomes.




Key Responsibilities:

Analyse complex data sets to identify trends and patterns
Develop and maintain reports and dashboards to support business operations
Collaborate with stakeholders to understand their data needs and deliver actionable insights
Utilise statistical methods to solve problems and support decision-making processes




Who We're Looking For:

Experience: Minimum of 1 year in a data analyst role preferred, but not essential. Recent graduates with a First-Class degree in a relevant field (e.g., Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science) are also encouraged to apply.
Skills: Proficiency in data analysis tools and software (e.g., Excel, SQL, Python, R). Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a keen attention to detail.
Attributes: Excellent communication skills, the ability to work independently and as part of a team, and a proactive approach to learning and development.




If you‚Äôre ready to take the next step in your career and make a real impact with your analytical skills, we‚Äôd love to hear from you!

Title: Data Analyst
Place: City Of Bristol, England, United Kingdom
Description:
Job Title: Data Analyst (Junior and Senior)

Salary: ¬£30,000 - ¬£55,000 DOE

Location: Bristol (95% remote with some client visits)

This role is within the Consultancy service provision of the company working as part of growing team developing strategic estate planning models.

The analyst will work on gathering, interpreting, analysing and reporting data, often as part of a larger team but also as an individual. The type of data analysed will vary according to the consultancy commission delivery requirements. Part of the analyst's role will be to establish the client deliverables clearly at the start of the project and to further ensure that they are successfully delivered.




Key Tasks and Requirements




The analyst will assist in the following activities:

‚Ä¢ Produce any project initiation documentation, project proposals and appointment terms.

‚Ä¢ Agree and action any technical and quality strategies for gathering the required data or information flows.

‚Ä¢ Help clients make evidence-based decisions to reduce their costs and drive productivity.

‚Ä¢ Be responsible for project administration.

‚Ä¢ Develop and maintain complex data models in SQL Server and PowerBI.

‚Ä¢ Translate raw inputs into meaningful management information.

‚Ä¢ Able to provide clear and succinct briefs to clients and other stakeholders on project requirements/findings.

‚Ä¢ Identify best practice approaches for data modelling to ensure continual improvement.

‚Ä¢ Clearly document key assumptions and processes to enable client and other stakeholders to replicate and understand your data models.

‚Ä¢ Able to direct and motivate others in the project team.

‚Ä¢ Manage project risks and issues including the development of contingency/mitigation plans.




The successful candidate will demonstrate the following capabilities:




‚Ä¢ Able to demonstrate a strong understanding of Microsoft Excel for data transformation, modelling and data analysis.

‚Ä¢ Able to manipulate and restructure data using SQL.

‚Ä¢ Experience in SQL Server or equivalent database platforms.

‚Ä¢ Proficient in Power BI DAX Code and using Power BI to demonstrate complex issues to layman users.

‚Ä¢ Maintains a strong attention to detail and is able to analyse information critically.

‚Ä¢ Maintain self-discipline and focus on the task at hand with minimal supervision.

‚Ä¢ Ability to scrutinise your own work before presenting it to senior management or clients.

‚Ä¢ Able to learn and adapt quickly under strict time constraints.

‚Ä¢ Able to interpret data and put findings into context.

‚Ä¢ Proficient in other Microsoft Office programs.




Additional Tasks




‚Ä¢ Continually update and extend technical and professional expertise.

‚Ä¢ Contribute to training activities both internally and externally where appropriate.

Business development, marketing and sales - promoting the firm positively to staff, clients and potential clients.




Pre-Requisites

‚Ä¢ Full UK Driving Licence.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Arcus Search are proud to support a global London Market Insurance / Reinsurance firm, on searching for an adaptable Data Analyst with strong SQL and Power BI skills.




You will be joining them on a permanent basis, to support the business in requirements analysis, detailed preparation of varying data and informative data visualisation to support decision-making ran by the business teams.




What you'll do:

Design and implement reports using Power BI
Facilitate user-friendly reports and dashboards, improving these at all times
Collaborate with the team and key stakeholders and decision makers.
Error analysis and data testing, ensuring it's of good quality and consistent
Data extraction and enrichment using advanced SQL functions




What experience you'll bring:

3-5 years in a Data-driven role with ability to use Excel and BI tools at an intermediate level
Experience with Power BI and Power BI Stack
Extensive SQL skills
Data quality and exceptions handling
Ability to articulate complex ideas and deliver these to senior users and stakeholders.




This is an incredible opportunity for someone who has a proven track record as a Data Analyst, eager to enter the world of Insurance. This business is growing and expanding globally, seeing a lot of successes across their industry thus far, so a shared value in working for a collaborative and innovative environment is a must.




London Market Insurance

London, UK - hybrid

up to ¬£45K + benefits

Permanent

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst - Marketplace and E-commerce platform




Technology: Python, SQL, Spark and AWS

Salary: Up to ¬£75,000 plus equity and benefits

Location: Hybrid, London (3 days per week onsite)




I am partnered with a rapidly growing marketplace and e-commerce start-up that is revolutionising how consumers shop, invest and operate online. Your role will involve delivering data-driven insights to enhance marketing strategies and compiling comprehensive market reports. You will use both internal and external data services to produce management reports that guide pricing, valuation, and stock management decisions for finance and operations.




They are seeking a talented and motivated Data Analyst with strong stakeholder engagement skills to join their growing engineering team. As a key member of their data and analytics department, you will play a crucial role in unlocking insights from their diverse datasets to drive strategic decisions and optimise performance. Your work will directly influence product development, marketing strategies, customer experience, and overall business growth.




Responsibilities:

Analyse datasets and build predictive models.
Turn data insights into growth strategies with cross-functional teams.
Engaging with key internal stakeholders to understand business requirements.
Develop ETL pipelines based off of business requirements.
Identify and address data quality issues.
Automate data processing tasks to enhance efficiency.
Monitor key performance indicators and recommend improvements.
Stay updated on industry trends and integrate new techniques.




Qualifications:

Proven experience in developing, designing and maintaining ETL processes.
Experience working with Large data sets and numerous data sources.
Proficient in Python, SQL, and data visualisation tools.
Strong problem-solving and communication abilities.
Thrive in a fast-paced, collaborative environment.
Knowledge of cloud platforms like AWS or similar.
Ability to translate complex data into simple business recommendations.
Strong attention to detail and data accuracy.




If you're ready to take your Data Analytics expertise to the next level and help shape the future of how a marketplace can engage their users, this is the opportunity for you!




** Unfortunately due to a high number of applications, not all applicants will receive feedback

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Camino Search are delighted to be partnered with a hyper growth PE backed technology business that are scaling. The business has a solid market foundation, has international presence and has been through multiple rounds of funding. They boast an innovative, market-leading product with multiple revenue streams. They now require advanced CRM analytics to develop and drive strategic initiatives as they continue to grow towards a potential exit.




Responsibilities:

Collect, clean, and process large datasets from multiple sources.
Analyze data trends and patterns to provide actionable insights.
Create and maintain dashboards and reports for key performance indicators.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand data requirements and provide support for data-driven decision-making.
Conduct A/B testing and generate reports on performance metrics.
Monitor data integrity and ensure accurate reporting across various platforms.
Assist in the development and optimization of data collection systems and analytical processes.




Requirements:

Bachelor's degree in Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related field.
2+ years of experience in data analysis or a similar role.
Proficiency in data visualization tools such as Tableau or Power BI.
Strong knowledge of statistical analysis and modeling techniques.
Experience with SQL and database management.
Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
Ability to communicate complex data findings to non-technical stakeholders.

Title: SQL Data Analyst
Description:
SQL Data Analyst




Location: Coventry (on-site)




Salary: ¬£31,000







A rare opportunity to join a growing IT Team located in Coventry as a Business Systems Technician. In this new and exciting role, you will help support the development and delivery of diverse IT systems across the organisation.




Experience working with Applications, SQL and data knowledge is essential to be successful in this opportunity as you will be involved in the management of business systems.




The work that you do will have a meaningful impact on the business. You will also play a vital role in the management and administration of IT Business Systems; this includes identifying improvements, development, support, and assistance to the business.




To be successful in this role our ideal person will have:

An eye for understanding complex design (manufacturing, traceability, integration)
The drive to understand large volumes of data and system patterns.
The confidence to present your products to non-technical audiences.
The ability to adapt your communication style to account for varying levels of seniority and your audiences' requirements
Be able to define requirements, create and maintain documentation and conduct thorough testing of various systems

We will be looking for someone who:




Support design of test script, participating in full regression testing for the key business systems and other associated IT systems ‚Äì ensuring operational impacts are identified and communicated.
Will develop knowledge of the main business systems ‚Äì ERP, MES and be able to support day-today activities, including administration and basic development.
Supporting Business System division to monitor end-user system performance, report issues and maintain communications to ensure appropriate resolution.




Essential skills & experience:

Good IT skills
Ability to prioritise
Experience in supporting business applications
Knowledge of MS SQL Server would be advantageous
Ability to analyse data with attention to detail, identify associated trends and root cause of issues, implementing corrective action, as and when required.
Writing complex SQL queries
Ability to deploy hardware and software configuration
Proven analytical and problem solving ability
Strong written and verbal communication skills




Applying for the opportunity:







If you feel you have the required skills identified for this opportunity and wish to be considered, please forward an up-to-date version of your CV, and someone from Digital Waffle will contact you back within 48 hours if we feel you fit the criteria.

The Company:




A highly innovative AI start-up that uses advanced natural language processing and AI methodologies
Similar to the adaptive nature of ChatGPT, their Large Language Model showcases temporal dynamics honed over five years of research & development
Continuously learning and updating, their model provides real-time information and proactive strategy recommendations, setting a standard for accuracy and responsiveness
The end product is a software platform that captures, refines, and delivers highly intuitive information on demand, precisely where how and when it is needed by the user




The Opportunity:




This company is a start-up with a phenomenal track record of growth since launch. They have already secured relationships with many top tier brands in their field.




They are looking for a Business Analyst to work across all functions of their business, including sales, customer success, and engineering.




As well as providing metrics for internal consumption, the role of the Data Analyst is to provide metrics and data visualization for key enterprise level customers, demonstrating tangible improvements through the use of their product.




This is a vital role, and the Data Analyst will be expected to work with a high degree of autonomy, producing and communicating their findings to internal and external stakeholders at varying levels of knowledge, technology and data literacy.




The Role:




Extract, analyse and visualise key metrics to identify trends, patterns, and insights
Visualise data using common data visualization tools such as PowerBI, Tableau etc
Collaborate with the Customer Success Team to define requirements of our biggest enterprise clients for the analysis into the performance of our products
Perform ad-hoc data analysis and reporting to support strategic initiatives and business planning
Use statistical methods and tools to solve business problems and provide data-driven recommendations
Communicate findings and insights through effective data storytelling, visualizations, and presentations to both technical and non-technical audiences
Ensure data integrity and accuracy by performing data quality checks and validation
Stay updated with industry trends and best practices in data analysis and business intelligence




The Candidate:




Strong proficiency in data analysis tools and languages such as SQL, Excel, Python, or R
Experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or similar platforms
Solid understanding of statistical analysis and data mining techniques
Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to think critically and analytically
Strong communication skills with the ability to convey complex data insights to non-technical stakeholders
Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment and manage multiple projects simultaneously
Experience with business intelligence platforms and tools
Knowledge of database management and data warehousing concepts
Familiarity with machine learning concepts and tools
Understanding of project management principles and methodologies.
Experience in industries such as construction, utilities or infrastructure is a plus




The Culture:




We are a remote friendly organisation open to candidates from across the UK, but at least some time each month will be required in our Wales head office to foster relationships and collaboration.




We can offer flexible hours around family or healthcare commitments as we our primarily outcome based.




We encourage growth and learning at every opportunity with dedicated time for training and professional development, and funding and support available for training and education.




Application Process:




Please email me your CV to stephenr@alexanderrhodes.co.uk along with a 150 word precis explaining why you enjoy using data visualisation to explain technical detail to laypeople. Have a nice day.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
The Opportunity

Analytics is the compass that guides Sephora on its strategic journey, and we are on the lookout for a Data Analyst who can harness the power of data to propel our business forward. As a Data Analyst, you'll play a critical role in analyzing and interpreting customer data to drive business decisions across our digital platforms. Leveraging your strong experience in BigQuery SQL, you'll craft scripts that seamlessly integrate back-end data with Google Analytics 4 for in-depth customer analysis and segmentation.

Your expertise in data modeling will enable you to map out data structures that support the creation and maintenance of dashboards and reports, tracking key performance indicators (KPIs) related to online engagement, traffic, conversion rates, and marketing effectiveness. In this role, you'll work with data visualization tools like Power BI and Google Data Studio to develop compelling visual reports that convey complex insights in a clear and actionable manner. Additionally, you'll ensure the accuracy and quality of data, while effectively communicating your insights to non-technical stakeholders.

You Will Also Be Responsible For


Writing and optimizing BigQuery SQL scripts for GA4 analysis, integrating back-end data to segment and analyze customer data.
Developing and maintaining dashboards and regular weekly/monthly reports to track KPIs related to performance, online engagement, A/B testing, traffic, conversion rates, marketing attribution, and campaign effectiveness.
Using data visualization tools such as Power BI and Google Data Studio to create clear, actionable insights for stakeholders.
Engaging in data modeling to effectively map out data structures that support business goals.
Utilizing digital analytics tools like Google Analytics and Quantum Metric to deliver data-driven recommendations.
Ensuring the accuracy and quality of data while drawing insightful conclusions and making strategic recommendations.


What You'll Bring‚ÄØ

Your passion for detail is matched by your logical thinking and curiosity. You not only obsess over details but also possess the agility to communicate improvements rapidly and clearly. You thrive in an ever-evolving landscape, where driving innovation and continuous improvement is paramount. We are looking for a detail-oriented Data Analyst with strong analytical skills, capable of working both independently and collaboratively within a dynamic team environment.

We value ambition paired with a logical mindset‚Äîindividuals who are curious, inquisitive, and able to articulate suggestions with precision. You will utilize your strong foundation in BigQuery SQL, particularly in GA4 analysis, coupled with hands-on experience in data visualization using tools like Power BI. Your deep understanding of digital analytics, especially within Ecommerce and Retail, will enable you to provide actionable insights that drive business success. Your proficiency in digital analytics tools such as Google Analytics and Quantum Metric will be essential in providing recommendations that optimize performance.

Our Ideal Candidate Will Also Possess


Proficiency in Google Analytics, Quantum Metric, or similar digital analytics platforms.
Experience with Google Marketing Platform.
Strong communication skills, both written and verbal, for conveying complex data insights to non-technical stakeholders.
An eye for detail and a commitment to data accuracy and quality.
Familiarity with Google Tag Manager, A/B testing tools, competitor research using market share tools, setting up data feed APIs, and UX platforms would be advantageous.


While at Sephora, You‚Äôll Enjoy...


The people.‚ÄØYou will be surrounded by some of the most talented leaders and teams ‚Äì people you can be proud to work with.
The learning.‚ÄØWe invest in training and developing our teams, and you will continue evolving and building your skills through personalized career plans.
The culture.‚ÄØAs a leading beauty retailer within the LVMH family, our reach is broad, and our impact is global. It is in our DNA to innovate and, at Sephora, all 40,000 passionate team members across 35 markets and 3,000 stores, are united by a common goal - to reimagine the future of beauty.

This is for Contract Inside IR35 opportunity for Data Analyst for one of our Banking Client based in London/Birmingham. So please go through this and revert me with your updated CV if you are interested.

Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Able to work in high pressure tight deliverable situations to perform statistical analysis for use by senior leadership and audit teams

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
** 12 Month FTC ¬£30,000 - ¬£45,000 **




About the Opportunity

We're working on behalf of a forward-thinking client who is a leader in the retail sector, offering innovative solutions to connect customers and products in a dynamic, fast-paced environment. Our client is at the forefront of their industry, continuously innovating to meet changing consumer needs.

They focus on simplifying complex customer journeys, always staying ahead of trends. At the heart of their success is a culture that values collaboration, diversity, and inclusion. They embrace new ideas and celebrate differences, creating a work environment that is exciting, supportive, and welcoming for the right candidate.




About the Role

Our client is seeking a Business Insight Analyst to join their Finance Systems and BI team on a 12-month fixed-term contract. This is a fantastic opportunity to play a pivotal role in developing insightful reporting and analysis, enabling data-driven business decisions.

In this role, you will be responsible for analysing large data models and translating them into feature-rich business insights. You will utilise the latest tools and techniques available on the company's cutting-edge data platform to deliver results.

Key responsibilities include:

Managing and maintaining the Looker reporting suite
Handling support requests and assisting with data queries and analysis
Providing first-line support for Looker development, maintenance, and query resolution
Managing a support channel and creating/managing tickets in Jira
Identifying trends and outliers in data and contributing to continuous improvement initiatives
Developing data packages, reports, and visualisation dashboards for the BI suite
Training and guiding finance colleagues to improve their understanding of reporting and enable self-service analysis

This role is ideal for someone passionate about data and eager to improve data-driven decision-making across an organisation.




What We're Looking For

To be successful in this role, you should have:

Experience with enterprise-level BI data platforms, SQL, and relational databases such as Oracle or SQL Server
A strong passion for data and collaboration, with the ability to add value through data analytics
Experience partnering with business teams to develop meaningful metrics and insights
Proven ability to create and optimise reports or dashboards that drive performance
A self-driven approach, using data, analysis, and business acumen to identify opportunities
Excellent communication skills, capable of presenting insights to both technical and non-technical audiences

Experience with Google BigQuery, Looker, DBT, GitHub, Tableau, or Qlik would be a plus, but not essential.




Our client values diverse skills and perspectives. If you tick most, but not all, of the boxes, we still encourage you to apply.




If you are interested in this exciting opportunity, please get in touch to learn more about this role and how you can make an impact!

#BusinessInsightAnalyst #DataJobs #Hiring #RobertHalf #BI #SQL #DataAnalysis #ContractRoles

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst required by an educational organisation with offices globally. The Data Analyst will be responsible for creating, compiling and maintaining a variety of reports.




The position requires a high level of accuracy, exceptional attention to detail and the ability to work with complex data sets and sensitive information.




This is a fully remote position and is a fixed term contract until the end of December 2025.




Essential experience:

Crystal reports
Report writing (within an academic/education environment would be advantageous)
Database architecture
Microsoft applications
SQL Server




The company work a 35-hour week and also offer 30 days holiday plus bank holidays. If you are interested in this role, please get in touch for more information.

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Junior Data Analyst




Want to start a career in tech?

Albany Beck are hiring for passionate individuals to join the Pioneer Technology Programme, to learn the skills to become Junior Data Analysts. This will give you the opportunity to channel your enthusiasm and be part of an Agile team who are always working with exciting technologies. At the end of a short training period, you will be placed into your first full-time position as a Data Analyst with a Public Sector client of ours!




Why Choose the Albany Beck Pioneer Technology Programme?

By choosing to join our Pioneer Technology Programme, you‚Äôll be choosing to work with an organisation that‚Äôs passionate about your learning journey and committed to your ongoing professional development. The programme combines a world-class training, with the potential to gain industry standard professional qualifications.




What to expect on the Albany Beck Pioneer Technology Programme

A training course on Data Analysis, where you will learn skills on Python, SQL, PowerBI, AWS and Excel
Deployment to a mainstream Public Sector firm upon completion, allowing you to work with cutting edge technologies.
An Engagement Manager will be assigned to you before your first day who will support you throughout your placement whilst keeping your progression on track, answering any questions about the project and providing upskilling support as required.
A great social environment where you are surrounded by likeminded consultants, you can expect various social events arranged by your Engagement Manager with not just your team but other Pioneers too.




What You Need

Bachelor's degree STEM subject (science, technology, engineering, math) OR, a Non-STEM degree or qualifications provided you have a passion for technology - either through doing online courses, building websites or learning technology in your spare time
British, EEA or Commonwealth Citizen




What You‚Äôll Get

Fully funded training through classes and one on one coaching
Competitive graduate salary, once placed, and half year pay reviews
Ongoing training and support through your designated AB Coach
An inclusive environment, here at AB we believe in increasing representation and making sure everyone can bring their whole self to work. We don't just say the right things, we do the right thing and remove barriers to entry into Technology.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Location: Remote, UK

As a Data Analyst in the Wiley Research & Learning Marketing team, you will play a crucial role developing important datasets that influence strategic decision-making, shed light on campaign performance, and ensure the success of our publishing initiatives. We‚Äôre looking for a creative thinker, someone who can turn disparate data tables into valuable information and use it to develop an insights narrative that is clear and accessible to stakeholders. We have rich data landscape at our fingertips, this role is a key advocate in it‚Äôs practical use and constant exploration to the benefit of marketing effectiveness.

How you will make an impact:


Develop SQL queries to extract and manipulate data from our Snowflake database. Explore data to identify trends, patterns, and opportunities for optimization.
Develop and maintain strategically insightful reporting dashboards, ensuring that key stakeholders have access to actionable data to support decision-making processes.
Evaluate marketing and publishing campaigns. Utilize data analysis to assess the effectiveness of various campaigns, identify areas for improvement, and optimize performance.
Provide strategic recommendations based on data insights to influence business strategies and enhance overall performance.


We are looking for people who:


Experience (2+ years) as a Data Analyst, with demonstrated proficiency in using complex SQL queries to analyze and manipulate large datasets.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to convert data into actionable insights.
Great communication skills, capable of conveying complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
Proficiency in data visualization tools such as Power BI, or similar.
A passion for academic publishing and a keen interest in the latest trends in the publishing industry is advantageous.
Experience with Snowflake or other cloud-based data warehousing technologies is highly desirable.
Familiarity with Python is a plus.


About Wiley

Wiley is a trusted leader in research and learning, our pioneering solutions and services are paving the way for knowledge seekers as they work to solve the world‚Äôs most important challenges. We are advocates of advancement, empowering knowledge-seekers to transform today‚Äôs biggest obstacles into tomorrow‚Äôs brightest opportunities.

With over 200 years of experience in publishing, we continue to evolve knowledge seekers‚Äô steps into strides, illuminating their path forward to personal, educational, and professional success at every stage. Around the globe, we break down barriers for innovators, empowering them to advance discoveries in their fields, adapt their workforces, and shape minds.

We are proud that our workplace promotes continual learning and internal mobility. Our values support courageous teammates, needle movers and learning champions all while striving to support the health and well-being of all employees, for example we offer meeting-free Friday afternoons allowing more time for heads down work and professional development.

We are committed to fair, transparent pay, and we strive to provide competitive compensation in addition to a comprehensive benefits package. The range below represents Wiley‚Äôs good faith and reasonable estimate of the base pay for this role at the time of posting roles either in the UK, Canada or USA. It is anticipated that most qualified candidates will fall within the range, however the ultimate salary offered for this role may be higher or lower and will be set based on a variety of non-discriminatory factors, including but not limited to, geographic location, skills, and competencies. Wiley proactively displays target base pay range for UK, Canada and USA based roles.

Title: Football Data Analyst
Description:
Football Data Analyst (one day a week in the central London office)

‚Äã

This role is a unique opportunity to combine technical challenges with creativity in a collaborative, high-standard work environment. By joining this team, you‚Äôll not only be part of a creative and open work culture focused on innovation and excellence but also have the chance to work with and collaborate with some of the most well-known footballers in the industry.




This position offers significant opportunities for professional growth within sports analytics and the potential to impact sports performance through advanced technology, making it an ideal setting for those passionate about leveraging cutting-edge technology to make meaningful contributions in the world of sports analytics.




Ideal for those eager to blend their passion for sports with cutting-edge technology, aiming to make significant contributions in sports analytics. If you‚Äôre a detail-oriented innovator and team player, we‚Äôre excited to hear from you.




Responsibilities for the role of Football Data Analyst will include:




Collect, clean, and process football-related data from various sources.
Develop and implement statistical models and algorithms to analyze player performance and match outcomes.
Create detailed reports and visualizations to communicate insights and recommendations to technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Collaborate with football analysts, coaches, and other stakeholders to understand their needs and provide actionable insights.
Stay updated with the latest trends and advancements in sports analytics and data science.




As the selected Football Data Analyst, you background should include:




Bachelor's or Master's degree in Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or a related field.
Essential - Proven experience in data science within the sports industry.
Strong programming skills in Python and SQL.
Experience with data visualization tools like Tableau, Power BI, or similar.
Knowledge of football tactics, strategies, and player performance metrics.
Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
Strong communication skills with the ability to explain complex data insights to non-technical stakeholders.




Please note: even if you don't have exactly the background indicated, do contact us now if this type of job is of interest - we may well have similar opportunities that you would be suited to. And of course, we always get your permission before submitting your CV to a company.

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
We are keen to speak with junior data analysts about joining an investment management client of ours, based in Central London. This will be on a 12-month contract with an expectation to be extended or taken on permanently upon completion.

This is a hybrid position with 3 days in the office.

This role offers a unique opportunity for a Junior Data Analyst to grow within a dynamic and challenging environment. You'll be working on a high-profile client project, gaining hands-on experience with large datasets and contributing to data-driven strategies.

You Will Be Responsible For


Managing and processing large datasets, ensuring accuracy and efficiency.
Developing and maintaining dashboards to support data visualisation and decision-making.
Analysing data to identify trends, patterns, and insights that drive business strategies.
Collaborating with stakeholders and clients to understand their data needs and deliver actionable insights.


Requirements


University Graduates with 0-2 years of experience
A keen interest to work in Investment Management
Keen to identify and embrace new technologies and new ways of working
Experience in Power BI and SQL (Desirable)
Effective prioritisation and organisational skills
Excellent communication skills, both written and oral
Good IT skills, including Microsoft Word, Excel and Outlook


Benefits


¬£30,000 for graduates with less than 1 year of experience, up to ¬£50,000 for graduates with 2+ years of experience.

Title: Data Analyst - Alteryx + 10% bonus
Description:
#Salary on this role is tax free#




Overview

Our client is an established, international bank that is involved in progressive policy reform and investment, across multiple continents. They have over 4000 employees globally and are now looking for an experienced Data Analyst to join their team on a 3-year FTC basis, providing support internally on Alteryx and solution design for businesses.




Main Responsibilities

‚óæ Provide support in the use and development of solutions using Alteryx and Tableau internally.

‚óæ Advocate a consistent analysis, design, development and delivery of data solutions using recognized processes and techniques.

‚óæ Educate end-users in data solutions by proactively engaging with product owners, internal and external stakeholders.

‚óæ Create documents and workshops to educate users on data solutions.

‚óæ Document requests, test plans and solution designs.




Skills and Experience

‚óæ Extensive experience of development in Alteryx and Tableau.

‚óæ Proven experience as a Data Analyst or in a similar role

‚óæ Experience in the creation of dataflows, extracts, views, workbooks, deployments, schedules.

‚óæ Working knowledge of SQL (Oracle/SQL Server), data modelling concepts and standards.

‚óæ Familiarity with ETL processes and data warehousing principles.

‚óæ Strong team player with ability to work in a cross-functional team, following Agile principles.

‚óæ Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills.

‚óæ Experience in organising workshops and trainings is desirable.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Uncover your potential within Kantar's Profiles division, which houses the largest audience network worldwide. Our team comprises 600 professionals located across 27 countries. Through the use of advanced technology, we provide our clients with seamless access to authentic individuals and unrivaled insights. Our Profiles Audience Network, reinforced by leading anti-fraud technology, encompasses over 170 million individuals in more than 100 markets across the globe. Join us and play a pivotal role in shaping the future of panel market research while achieving impactful outcomes for brands worldwide!




What you need to know about this job?

Join our Data Science team at Kantar Profiles as a Mid-Level Data Analyst! If you are enthusiastic about transforming data into actionable insights and have a strong programming background (Python and SQL), we encourage you to apply. This role offers a distinctive chance to collaborate with our Senior Data Scientists and contribute significantly to our innovative projects.




What you‚Äôll do...

Lead all aspects of alerts to ensure the ecosystem's functionality, working with existing models for day-to-day operations and performance.
Analyze user acquisition and retention data, identifying weaknesses and bugs in existing models for resolution.
Run analytics to extract statistics, patterns, and design machine learning models to improve existing technologies.
Contribute to data/statistics tasks for improving user engagement, working closely with the development team.
Work together with different team members to offer valuable insights and analyses that contribute to decision-making processes.
Communicate technical information with both technical and non-technical team members and collaborators.
Transform data using ETL tools like DBT to make it more accessible to the broader business.
Build visualizations, monitor trends, and identify patterns using time series graphing services like Grafana.
Define critical metrics to drive improvements in user acquisition and engagement performance.




What you‚Äôll bring...

Experience with database queries, programming, data mining/wrangling, analysis, and reporting.
Strong proficiency in SQL, with the ability to read, write, and query optimally.
A keen curiosity about data, statistics, machine learning, and data science.
Strong problem-solving skills with an emphasis on product development, logical thinking, and critical analysis.
Experience with statistical computer languages such as Python, Scala, R, MATLAB.
Knowledge of statistical techniques and concepts, including regression, properties of distributions, statistical tests, and accurate usage.
Experience using web services and languages, including AWS, EC2, S3, Redshift, DigitalOcean, etc.
Meticulous and committed, with a good work ethic and the capacity to collaborate effectively with diverse teams.
Experience in Excel and Power BI is a plus.




Benefits include 25 days annual leave (increasing with tenure), private medical health cash plan, income protection, life assurance, enhanced employer pension contribution; plus award-winning voluntary flexible benefits (lifestyle, health, wealth, wellbeing). We offer a hybrid working arrangement with an office presence of at least 2 days a week in Reading.




At Kantar Profiles, we are committed to creating an equality of opportunity in a fair and supportive working environment. We value diversity and inclusion and believe that a diverse team brings exceptional talent and perspective. We are an equal opportunity employer and encourage applications from candidates of all backgrounds.




Reasonable Accommodation/Adjustment Statement: We strive to provide a fair and supportive working environment where all individuals feel included, accepted, and are allowed to flourish. If you require reasonable accommodations or adjustments to participate in the recruitment process, please let us know. We will work with you to meet your needs.




Please note that we are not able to offer visa sponsorship or assist with relocation support for this role. Applicants must have the right to work in the country where this role is located before applying.

Title: Data Analyst Trainee
Description:
Are you looking to benefit from a new career in Data Analysis?

If you are detail orientated, perceptive, organised, competent, analytical and can communicate well with those around you; you could have a truly rewarding future as a Data Analyst

We do this using our specialised Data Analyst career programme which looks to assist and place qualified candidates into a career pathway in Data Analysis.

Please note this career program is designed for entry level individuals with limited or no experience, so please do not apply if you are already an experience Data Analyst as we will be looking primarily at entry level roles.

Demand for Data Analysts has grown 20% year on year with experienced analysts easily commanding salaries of ¬£50k+. All business decisions rely on data to ensure correct business decisions are made and therefore the role of the data analyst in the new digital world has become essential for business owners.

Below are current average salaries in the sector for lower-level positions and fully trained Data Analysts:


Junior Data Analyst - ¬£30,000
Data Analyst - ¬£50,000
Business Data Analyst - ¬£67,500
Data Analytics Analyst - ¬£80,000
Business Analysts - ¬£60,000


Using our experience in providing data analysis and business analysis training online and through our expert recruitment consultants, we can provide a seamless journey and often fast-tracked route into a new career in Data Analysis.

The courses in the package have been identified by our recruitment partners as industry standards for the UK/European and International Data Analysis sector.

Skills shortages across all sectors are increasing the demand for qualified, entry-level career seekers and career changers.

Whether you are working full-time, part-time or are unemployed, this job and recruitment package has the flexibility to be completed at a pace that suits you and can be completed in a few weeks. Your job and career goals are completed in 4 easy steps listed below.

Step 1 - CompTIA Data+ Qualification

The first step is completing the CompTIA Data+ Qualification accredited by CompTIA.

This professional international industry-recognised qualification teaches you the essential skills of a Data Analyst. You will cover skills such as data mining, manipulating data, visualising data, and reporting on data.

Study time for the qualification is approximately 30 hours and qualification is achieved by completing a 1-hour multiple choice exam.

The course is provided online and comes complete with exam simulators and revision tools.

You will be provided with access to a tutor and a 1-hour online revision workshop prior to sitting your exam.

This qualification will set you on a route to becoming a data analyst.

Step 2 - Data Administration Training

Data is extracted using various method which are normally IT driven.

Therefore, we will provide you with access to the following additional courses to ensure you are suitably employable as a data analyst.


Microsoft excel - to expert level.
Learn SQL - the programming language used for extracting data from more complex databases.
Learn Python 3 - Python 3 is a simple to use programming language used by many analysts.
Learn Tableau - Tableu is a tool which analysts use to build visually appealing dashboards for complex data making it easier for stakeholders to comprehend.


Study time for these courses is approximately 30-60 hours and qualification is achieved through completion of the course with no exam.

Step 3 - Business Analysis Foundation

Business Analysts and Data Analysts often work very closely together and indeed many Data Analysts become Business Analysts and vice versa.

Adding a Business Analyst Foundation certificate will make you much more employable and enable you to cross over into business analyst roles and hybrid roles. Business Analysis Foundation accredited by the BCS (The British Computer Society also known as the Chartered Institute of IT).

Study time for this course is approximately 15 hours and qualification is achieved through an online BCS exam.

Step 4 - Recruitment Support

Now you are qualified for an entry level data analyst position our recruitment support team will now begin collaborating with you to help you secure your first a suitable role based on your new qualifications and any other experience you may have.

We have been helping candidates start and build careers in the project management industry since 2007 and have a 4.8 Trustscore on Trustpilot.

Our Recruitment Support team will help you work through job applications, interviews and provide you with a full cv review based around your new qualification and written to maximise your chances of obtaining a role in the project management sector.

They will provide you with guidance as to which roles our most suitable for you as an entry level project sector worker aiming to become a project manager. This will include mock job interviews as well as any help you feel you need.

Our money back guarantee

If after 1 year of passing your formal qualifications, we have been unable to help you secure a role, we will refund your study fees minus the cost of the exams.

However, we are normally able to help candidates find their first role within 6 months of qualifying and for locations based close to major cities this is often reduced to less than 3 months.

Check our testimonials from the hundreds of candidates we have already helped.

What Now?

To accommodate candidates, the training element of the package is available on finance terms of up to 1 year. This enables you to get qualified and start in your new role without having to fund all the training costs up front.

Enquire now and one of our experienced Career Consultants will contact you within 4 working hours to answer any questions that you may have and to assist you in taking the first step towards your Data Analyst Career aspirations.
