HTML:
Are you looking to benefit from a new career in Data Analysis?

If you are detail orientated, perceptive, organised, competent, analytical and can communicate well with those around you; you could have a truly rewarding future as a Data Analyst

We do this using our specialised Data Analyst career programme which looks to assist and place qualified candidates into a career pathway in Data Analysis.

Please note this career program is designed for entry level individuals with limited or no experience, so please do not apply if you are already an experience Data Analyst as we will be looking primarily at entry level roles.

Demand for Data Analysts has grown 20% year on year with experienced analysts easily commanding salaries of ¬£50k+. All business decisions rely on data to ensure correct business decisions are made and therefore the role of the data analyst in the new digital world has become essential for business owners.

Below are current average salaries in the sector for lower-level positions and fully trained Data Analysts:

  • Junior Data Analyst - ¬£30,000
  • Data Analyst - ¬£50,000
  • Business Data Analyst - ¬£67,500
  • Data Analytics Analyst - ¬£80,000
  • Business Analysts - ¬£60,000

Using our experience in providing data analysis and business analysis training online and through our expert recruitment consultants, we can provide a seamless journey and often fast-tracked route into a new career in Data Analysis.

The courses in the package have been identified by our recruitment partners as industry standards for the UK/European and International Data Analysis sector.

Skills shortages across all sectors are increasing the demand for qualified, entry-level career seekers and career changers.

Whether you are working full-time, part-time or are unemployed, this job and recruitment package has the flexibility to be completed at a pace that suits you and can be completed in a few weeks. Your job and career goals are completed in 4 easy steps listed below.

Step 1 - CompTIA Data+ Qualification

The first step is completing the CompTIA Data+ Qualification accredited by CompTIA.

This professional international industry-recognised qualification teaches you the essential skills of a Data Analyst. You will cover skills such as data mining, manipulating data, visualising data, and reporting on data.

Study time for the qualification is approximately 30 hours and qualification is achieved by completing a 1-hour multiple choice exam.

The course is provided online and comes complete with exam simulators and revision tools.

You will be provided with access to a tutor and a 1-hour online revision workshop prior to sitting your exam.

This qualification will set you on a route to becoming a data analyst.

Step 2 - Data Administration Training

Data is extracted using various method which are normally IT driven.

Therefore, we will provide you with access to the following additional courses to ensure you are suitably employable as a data analyst.

  • Microsoft excel - to expert level.
  • Learn SQL - the programming language used for extracting data from more complex databases.
  • Learn Python 3 - Python 3 is a simple to use programming language used by many analysts.
  • Learn Tableau - Tableu is a tool which analysts use to build visually appealing dashboards for complex data making it easier for stakeholders to comprehend.

Study time for these courses is approximately 30-60 hours and qualification is achieved through completion of the course with no exam.

Step 3 - Business Analysis Foundation

Business Analysts and Data Analysts often work very closely together and indeed many Data Analysts become Business Analysts and vice versa.

Adding a Business Analyst Foundation certificate will make you much more employable and enable you to cross over into business analyst roles and hybrid roles. Business Analysis Foundation accredited by the BCS (The British Computer Society also known as the Chartered Institute of IT).

Study time for this course is approximately 15 hours and qualification is achieved through an online BCS exam.

Step 4 - Recruitment Support

Now you are qualified for an entry level data analyst position our recruitment support team will now begin collaborating with you to help you secure your first a suitable role based on your new qualifications and any other experience you may have.

We have been helping candidates start and build careers in the project management industry since 2007 and have a 4.8 Trustscore on Trustpilot.

Our Recruitment Support team will help you work through job applications, interviews and provide you with a full cv review based around your new qualification and written to maximise your chances of obtaining a role in the project management sector.

They will provide you with guidance as to which roles our most suitable for you as an entry level project sector worker aiming to become a project manager. This will include mock job interviews as well as any help you feel you need.

Our money back guarantee

If after 1 year of passing your formal qualifications, we have been unable to help you secure a role, we will refund your study fees minus the cost of the exams.

However, we are normally able to help candidates find their first role within 6 months of qualifying and for locations based close to major cities this is often reduced to less than 3 months.

Check our testimonials from the hundreds of candidates we have already helped.

What Now?

To accommodate candidates, the training element of the package is available on finance terms of up to 1 year. This enables you to get qualified and start in your new role without having to fund all the training costs up front.

Enquire now and one of our experienced Career Consultants will contact you within 4 working hours to answer any questions that you may have and to assist you in taking the first step towards your Data Analyst Career aspirations.

Title: Junior BI Analyst
Description:
We are seeking a motivated and detail-oriented Junior Business Intelligence (BI) Analyst with 1 to 2 Years of experience to join our dynamic team. The ideal candidate will support data-driven decision making by analysing business data, creating insightful reports and documenting reporting process. This role requires a strong analytical mindset, Experience with BI Tools and excellent documentation skills.




Key Responsibilities:




Report Documentation:

Create and maintain comprehensive documentation for all BI Reports, including methodologies, data sources, and reporting processes.
Ensure that documentation is accurate, up to date and accessible to relevant team members.
Develop user guides and training materials to help stakeholders understand and utilize BI reports effectively.

Data Analysis and reporting:

Assist in the extraction, transformation and loading (ETL) of data from multiple sources into BI Tools.
Analyse data to identify trends, patterns and insights that support business decisions.
Generate and maintain regular reports and dashboards.

Data Management:

Collaborate with the BI Team to ensure data accuracy and integrity.
Assist in development and maintenance of data sources.
Participate in data cleansing and validation processes to ensure high-quality data.

Tools and system Utilization:

Utilize Power BI to analyse and visualize data.
Support the implementation and optimization of BI solutions.
Provide technical support and training to end-users on Power BI tool and reports.

Continuous Improvement:

Stay updated with the latest trends and best practices in BI and data analytics.
Identify opportunities to improve existing BI Processes and reporting capabilities.




Qualifications:

1 to 2 years of experience in BI, Data Analysis or related role.
Excellent documentation skills, with experience in creating and maintaining Technical Documentation.
Proficiency in BI Tools (e.g. Power BI, Tableau)
Basic Knowledge of database Management.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with attention to detail.
Ability to communicate complex data insights in a clear and understandable manner.
Experience with data visualization and dashboard creation.
Strong organizational skills and ability to manage multiple tasks simultaneously.
Team Player with excellent interpersonal and communication skills.




Alongside a salary of ¬£26,000 - ¬£30,000 dependant upon experience we offer the following benefits package:




Simply Health ‚Äì company funded, providing cashback for prescriptions, optical and dental costs 24/7 virtual GP access plus more for you and up to 4 children*
Benefits platform ‚Äì discounts across multiple retailers (supermarkets, High Street etc), leisure providers, hospitality etc. Online and instore discounts
Vectis Card ‚Äì instant discount card
Pension Scheme with Royal London
Personal car leases via salary sacrifice*/**
25 days holiday plus bank holidays
Holiday Flex ‚Äì purchase additional holiday**
Enhanced Company Maternity, Paternity, Adoption pay, plus ¬£200 new child payment
Flexible working patterns
Cycle to work scheme*/**
Service recognition
Training support and development opportunities
Employee Assistance Programme
Wellbeing support
Discounted gym membership
Eligible for a Blue Light Card
Subsidised BHSF Sick Pay Cover
BHSF, Life Cover, Cancer Cover, Personal Accident Cover
Free The Company Shop membership
Free Will Service
Concerts for Carers




*Benefits require completion of a 12-week probationary period before they can be accessed.

**Benefit subject to deduction not taking colleague below National Living Wage

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Venesky-Brown‚Äôs client, a public sector organisation in Glasgow, is currently looking to recruit a Data Analyst for an initial 3 month contract on a rate of ¬£19.59/hour PAYE ‚Äì working 37 hours per week Monday ‚Äì Friday 08:30 ‚Äì 17:00 (flexible). This roles will be hybrid working.




Responsibilities:




- Support in investigating, documenting and cleansing existing data models and data sets as part of the introduction of a centralised Data Warehouse to support the implementation of Contact Centre (CC) and Customer Relationship Management (CRM) solutions to meet business needs.

- Focus on understanding current data models that are in place within the organisation, documenting these data models in a central location, checking the data models and data for integrity and data cleansing activities. There will be a focus on collaboration with various stakeholders to gather and document detailed data models and documentation regarding current estate.




Essential Skills:




- Experienced Data Analyst

- Data modelling and documentation

- Experience in dealing with highly complex data sets

- Strong understanding of SQL/Database interaction




Desirable Skills:




- Experience with SAP Hana/SAP BO reporting suite

- Experience in CRM and/or Contact Centre environments

- Public Sector experience




If you would like to hear more about these opportunities please get in touch.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Data Engineer - Hybrid (1 day Leeds City Centre) - up to ¬£60k + bonus & benefits




Head Resourcing are recruiting on behalf of this leading financial services client who are a dynamic new company in the financial advice market who have a brilliant range of roles available across the IT space.




An exciting opportunity has arisen to join the growing Data Engineering team, based in Leeds city centre (hybrid, 1 day per week in the office). The role will be critical in delivering the Technology strategy, ensuring data quality, consistency, and reliability. Delivering this strategy will also provide ample development opportunities, in particular progressing our new Data Lakehouse and implementing an iPaaS solution throughout 2024.

Working with Python, SQL, AWS (open to transferable Azure experience & skills) and PowerBI, you will build, rebuild and maintain data pipelines as well as have the opportunity to work with Terraform and shape the role and your progression




Location | Leeds, West Yorkshire

Salary | up to ¬£60,000 + home working, bonus & benefits




Key Responsibilities:

Maintenance of existing data pipelines; pre-empting issues and responding to any incidents in a timely, professional manner.
Development of new pipelines as per business requests or to stabilise the current operating environment.
Liaising with other areas across the business to help define requirements for new projects, including both pipeline and ETL requests.
Implementing and owning the monitoring on key processes.




Core Skills/Competencies

Languages - Expert in SQL (Postgres, Athena Presto SQL) and proficient in using Python to build, maintain and orchestrate data pipelines across the business.
Amazon AWS - Experience using a serverless approach primarily utilising Lambda Functions, Glue (Jobs, Crawlers, Catalogues), Step Functions, SNS (notifications), SQS (queue service) and S3 (object storage).
Data Engineering - Demonstrable experience (> 2 years) working within a Data Engineering function, building data pipelines in a cloud native environment with an in-depth understanding of best practice.
Communication skills - Able to communicate and engage with the business in a non-technical way to gather/replay requirements and ensure successful and timely delivery.
Documentation and deployment - Experience delivering in a controlled manner ensuring changes are tested, approved and deployed in accordance with agreed business protocols (GitHub). Documentation should be clear and easy to understand for all audiences (technical and non-technical).




Preferable but not essential

Infrastructure as Code (IAC) - Experience with Terraform (new/future infrastructure) and experience with CloudFormation (legacy infrastructure).
Integration Platform as a Service (iPaaS) - Any experience working with an iPaaS would be preferable, particularly MuleSoft.




We understand not everyone will meet 100% of the requirements, however we encourage you to apply if you think your skills are a good fit for this role.




As well as an attractive salary, there's bonuses, industry leading pension and further benefits available.




If this opportunity sounds of interest and you would like more information, please apply with an up-to-date CV.




Candidates of all ages and backgrounds will be considered for this role. Head Resourcing is acting as an Employment Agency

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
About Us




We‚Äôre an award-winning innovative tech consultancy - a team of creative problem solvers. Since 1993 we‚Äôve been finding better, more sustainable ways to solve complex technology problems for some of the world‚Äôs leading organisations and delivered solutions that millions of people use every day.




In the last 30 years we won several awards, including a prestigious Queen‚Äôs Award for Enterprise in the Innovation category for our Enterprise Agile delivery approach.




Operating from 26 locations across the world, we bring together teams of creative experts with diverse backgrounds and experiences, who enjoy working and learning in our collaborative and open culture and are committed to world-class delivery.




We want to continue to grow our team with people just like you!




About the Role




We are DataOps advocates and use software engineering best practices to build scalable and re-usable data solutions to help clients use their data to gain insights, drive decisions and deliver business value. Clients don‚Äôt engage BJSS to do the straightforward things, they ask us to help on their biggest challenges which means we get to work with a wide range of tools and technologies and there are always new things to learn.




BJSS data engineers are specialist software engineers that build, optimise and maintain data applications, systems and services. This role combines the discipline of software engineering with the knowledge and experience of building data solutions in order to deliver business value.




As a BJSS data engineer you‚Äôll help our clients deploy data pipelines and processes in a production-safe manner, using the latest technologies and with a DataOps culture.




You‚Äôll work in a fast moving, agile environment, within multi-disciplinary teams of highly skilled consultants, delivering modern data platforms into large organisations.




You can expect to get involved in variety of projects in the cloud (AWS, Azure, GCP), learning about and using data services such as Databricks, Data Factory, Synapse, Kafka, Redshift, Glue, Athena, BigQuery, S3, Cloud Data Fusion etc.




About You




You're an engineer at heart and enjoy the challenge of building reliable, efficient data applications systems, services and platforms.
You have a good understanding of coding best practices and design patterns and experience with code and data versioning, dependency management, code quality and optimisation, error handling, logging, monitoring, validation and alerting.
You have experience in writing well tested object-oriented Python.
You have experience with using CI/CD tooling to analyse, build, test and deploy your code.
You have a good understanding of design choices for data storage and data processing, with a particular focus on cloud data services.
You have experience in using parallel computing to process large datasets and to optimise computationally intensive tasks.
You have experience in programmatically deploying, scheduling and monitoring components in a workflow.
You have experience in writing complex queries against relational and non-relational data stores.




Some of the Perks




Flexible benefits allowance ‚Äì you choose how to spend your allowance (additional pension contributions, healthcare, dental and more)
Industry leading health and wellbeing plan - we partner with several wellbeing support functions to cater to each individual's need, including 24/7 GP services, mental health support, and other
Life Assurance (4 x annual salary)
25 days annual leave plus bank holidays
Hybrid working - Our roles are not fully remote as we take pride in the tight knit communities we have created at our local offices. But we offer plenty of flexibility and you can split your time between the office, client site and WFH
Discounts ‚Äì we have preferred rates from dozens of retail, lifestyle, and utility brands
An industry-leading referral scheme with no limits on the number of referrals
Flexible holiday buy/sell option
Electric vehicle scheme
Training opportunities and incentives ‚Äì we support professional certifications across engineering and non-engineering roles, including unlimited access to O‚ÄôReilly
Giving back ‚Äì the ability to get involved nationally and regionally with partnerships to get people from diverse backgrounds into tech
You will become part of a squad with people from different areas within the business who will help you grow at BJSS
We have a busy social calendar that you can choose to join‚Äì quarterly town halls/squad nights out/weekends away with families included/office get togethers
GymFlex gym membership programme

Title: Senior Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
Senior Business Intelligence Analyst ‚Äì Leeds

Venn Group‚Äôs North East IT team are recruiting for a highly motivated and skilled Senior Business Intelligence Analyst to join a dynamic team in an excellent organisation!

Location: Remote (Hybrid 1 Day per Week Leeds)

Rate: ¬£190-230 Per Day

Duration: Initially until March 2025

Start: Immediate

Person Specification


Master's level degree in science, mathematics or computing discipline, or equivalent experience
Experience in creating and developing SQL server queries, stored procedures and managing SQL server source control
Proficiency in data management, architecture and interpreting complex data sets to produce reports
Advanced understanding of BI architecture, including ETL, SSIS, data warehousing and data modelling
Advanced knowledge of statistics, database design and BI technology, including tools like QlikView, Tableau or Power BI
Experience in writing reports, managing technical publications and developing SQL-based reporting tools such as SSRS
Knowledge of GDPR, information governance, and the importance of reporting standards
Expertise in configuring and managing BI tools and environments, including security, service support and version control
Ability to manage multiple workloads and provide guidance to ensure high-quality outputs


To apply for this role or to find out about other IT opportunities, please contact Nataniel Chiteza on or email Nchiteza@venngroup.comwith an up to date CV. Venn Group is an equal opportunities employment business and employment agency and welcomes applications from all candidates.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
DATA ENGINEER

¬£55,000 + BENEFITS

PRIMARILY REMOTE

A passionate charity looking to build a society for people to have a purpose, a place to live, and a community around them.

THE COMPANY:

This is a well-established charity driven by an ambitious vision. They are currently investing in their data team, and are looking for a Data Engineer to help gather requirements and build solutions.

THE ROLE:

A Data Engineer will need to:

Work closely with stakeholders across the business
Architecture experience
Experience in data cleansing and processing

YOUR SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE:

A successful Data Engineer will have the following skills and experience:

Ability and experience interacting with key stakeholders
Strong experience in SQL/Python
Experience with Azure/ADF
Background in CI/CD
Experience with Data Bricks

THE BENEFITS:

You will receive a salary, dependent on experience. Salary is up to ¬£55,000 On top of the salary there are some fantastic extra benefits.

HOW TO APPLY

Please register your interest by sending your CV to Molly Bird via the apply link on this page.

  • Architecture experience
  • Experience in data cleansing and processing

YOUR SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE:

A successful Data Engineer will have the following skills and experience:

  • Ability and experience interacting with key stakeholders
  • Strong experience in SQL/Python
  • Experience with Azure/ADF
  • Background in CI/CD
  • Experience with Data Bricks

THE BENEFITS:

You will receive a salary, dependent on experience. Salary is up to ¬£55,000 On top of the salary there are some fantastic extra benefits.

HOW TO APPLY

Please register your interest by sending your CV to Molly Bird via the apply link on this page.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Job Title

Data Engineer

Location

Asda House

Employment Type

Full time

Contract Type

Permanent

Hours Per Week

37.5

Salary

Competitive salary plus benefits.

Category

Data Science

Closing Date

19 September 2024

‚ÄúEverything about Asda‚Äù

We are a values-led organisation. As such we encourage everyone to be open and honest. We work creatively and collaboratively, valuing everyone‚Äôs input.

Our collaborative culture, the size of our business and our belief in the empowerment of the individual means opportunities at Asda are abundant.

We conduct ¬£300m worth of transactions every week. Our website handles over 2 million transactions a month. We have more than 145,000 dedicated Asda colleagues ensuring that our customers are at the heart of everything we do.

‚ÄúEverything you‚Äôll love‚Äù


Minimum 24 days annual leave per year plus 8 bank holidays ‚Äì Making sure you take time for your self and switch off
4 weekly pay ‚Äì which means you get an extra payday a year
Digital GP and Wellbeing sessions ‚Äì Asda genuinely cares so we create a culture where our people can perform at their best, the physical health and mental wellbeing of all our people is very important to us
Discount off your shopping at Asda and George - with extra discounts running throughout the year ‚Äì really makes a difference, saving the colleagues an average of ¬£700 a year
Career development and apprenticeship and graduate schemes - we want our colleagues to excel and grow with our business. (Link to grad scheme on Asda page)
Free city centre parking ‚Äì you can also use it outside working hours


Plus, much more!

‚ÄúThat‚Äôs more like it‚Äù

Asda's Data & Analytics team is at the cutting edge of driving transformative, data-driven decisions across the organisation. We cultivate a high-performance, innovative environment where team members are challenged to push the boundaries of technology and data science. We are developing an industry leading data platform as part of the largest retail data transformation in Europe, which we will use to address some of the most complex data challenges in the industry, developing sophisticated solutions that revolutionize our business operations and elevate customer experiences. We seek the best of the best professionals who thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic setting and are driven to deliver groundbreaking insights that propel Asda‚Äôs strategic initiatives and create lasting impact for Colleagues & Customers.

Find your role

Are you a Data Engineer with a good understanding of Databricks and Azure? Ready to elevate your career to the next level? As a vital member of our diverse data function, you'll not only contribute to team projects but also support initiatives across the broader organisation. This role is perfect for those with a collaborative spirit and a passion for building professional networks.

Joining Asda during our digital and data evolution means you're arriving at an exhilarating time. Data and analytics are the bedrock of our transformation strategy, and you'll be positioned at the epicentre of this exciting phase!

In This Role, You Will


Build and optimise data pipelines using PySpark, SparkSQL & Databricks to ingest and enrich data.
Organise data to enable business users, innovate and extract value.
Collaborate with various business units to understand their data needs and deliver impactful solutions.
Engage in cross-functional teamwork, fostering strong relationships within the data team and beyond.
Play a pivotal role in Asda's digital and data transformation journey, leveraging analytics to shape our future.


Let's Find Out About You


Experience acquiring structured, semi-structured and unstructured data from various sources, including databases, blob storage, API‚Äôs and event streams.
Experience with SQL and/or Python data pipelines - Exposure to or expertise in PySpark, SparkSQL or Databricks is advantageous.
A grasp on the concepts around data modelling in an enterprise ‚Äì understanding of Data Vault is a bonus.
An understanding of Cloud technologies and their place in the Data world ‚Äì experience with Azure is a plus.
Any experience with streaming analytics is advantageous.
Excellent communication skills and the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams in a fast-paced environment.
The ability to deal with ambiguity and make sense of complex data landscapes
Bring a diversity of thought to solving problems.


Work Where it Works

Our hybrid way of working gives you the choice to work where it works.‚ÄØ This enables you to‚ÄØchose‚ÄØwhere you‚Äôll be the most effective.‚ÄØ It offers a mix of working from home and in an office environment that works best for you and your team.‚ÄØ

You will also get an excellent benefits package including;-


Discretionary company bonus
Company pension up to 7% matched
10% colleague discount, free parking and many additional rewards.


We want all colleagues to be able to bring their best and true selves to work, every day. Simply put, we want our colleagues to be Proud to be Asda and proud to be themselves

Title: SQL Developer - Remote - GBP50,000
Description:
SQL Developer - Remote - ¬£50,000

I am working with a Microsoft partnered managed service provider who are looking for an experienced SQL Developer to join their team. The organisation are going through a period of significant growth and are working with a number of highly renowned clients to support them with their SQL Server database requirements. You will work collaboratively with a team of like-minded developers with the goal to effectively resolve all client needs within a timely manner.

This organisation are focused on the training and development of each member of the team. You will be given the opportunity to complete funded Microsoft certifications and training courses that can help develop your skill set further. This is a fantastic opportunity to join a dedicated, specialist team with the opportunity to work on interesting projects and further develop your skills.

As part of this role, you will be responsible for some of the following areas.


Create high quality code and queries using SQL for data extraction
Monitor and optimize database performance
Conduct reviews of current code in order to identify where improvements can be made
Developer new SQL Server databases in line with stakeholder/business requirements


This is a salaried role paying up to ¬£50,000 per year depending on experience. This is a fully remote opportunity with the opportunity to work from anywhere across the UK. There is also a company benefits packages which includes a competitive pension scheme, generous holiday allowance, paid training and certifications and mobile/broadband monthly allowance.

To be successful in this role you will have.


Strong SQL/T-SQL proficiency
Experience working with SQL Server and other relational databases
Excellent communication skills and stakeholder management experience
Experience with other coding languages such as C#, Python or PowerShell would be beneficial


This is just a brief overview of the role. For the full information, simply apply to the role with your CV, and I will call you to discuss further. My client is looking to begin the interview process ASAP, so don't miss out, APPLY now!

Nigel Frank International are the go-to recruiter for Power BI and Azure Data Platform roles in the UK offering more opportunities across the country than any other recruitment agency. We're the proud sponsor and supporter of SQLBits, Power Platform World Tour, the London Power BI User Group, Newcastle Power BI User Group and Newcastle Data Platform and Cloud User Group. We are the global leaders in Microsoft recruitment.

Title: Risk Reporting and Data Analyst
Description:
Salary: National ranging from ¬£51,200 to ¬£64,000 and London from ¬£56,400 to ¬£70,000 per annum ‚Äì salary offered will be based on skills and experience

Do you want to work with risk information and data, building tools that help with risk analysis and reporting?

The team/ department

Responsibilities

The Risk and Compliance Oversight Division (R&CO) performs the second line of defence function in the FCA. R&CO helps the FCA identify, assess, and report risks that threaten the FCA's ability to deliver its statutory objectives. The Division is responsible for:


Defining and owning the FCA Risk Management Framework
Providing ongoing guidance and oversight of risk management across the FCA
Enterprise-wide risk reporting
Delivery of Regulatory Investigations and Assurance
Compliance Oversight
Complaints


We are recruiting for a talented individual to work in our Reporting and Data Analysis team. The team is responsible for providing an organisation wide view of the FCA's key own risks and the effectiveness of risk mitigation. This is with the aim of providing second line input and assurance to Executive Committees on the effectiveness of risk management across the FCA.

Reporting is one of five key themes that form R&CO‚Äôs vision and strategy to deliver an effective second line of defence function. This is because effective reporting supports all other R&CO activities.

This is a high-profile role in which you will support R&CO‚Äôs data analysis for some of the key reports the second line develops for executive and board committees. You will lead this work for some of the most exciting projects and pieces of work across the FCA‚Äôs risk landscape.

We are looking for a driven and high calibre associate with potential to develop and grow.

What You Will Be Doing (the Role)

The key responsibilities of the post holder will be to:


Support the reporting team with analytics to drive evidence-based risk reporting to the executive and the board committees, helping shape the second line view on some of the most important risk themes for the FCA
Provide data analysis from the FCA‚Äôs bespoke risk management system to help highlight the most important own risk themes and the mitigation of these activities
Transfer data from excel into word and PowerPoint to present to senior stakeholders
Create compelling data visualisations that add value and insight, exploiting new functionality as it becomes available
Provide excel and tableau support to Risk Operations activities
Partner with the data community across the FCA to continue enhancing knowledge and contributing to the FCA‚Äôs Data strategy agenda


What you will get from the role?

You Will Benefit From


Working on important data projects, shaping the second line view and input into the executive and the board, and shaping the organisational approach to risk management
Having a pivotal role and numerous opportunities where you‚Äôll be empowered to shape the approach and outcomes of reporting projects
Working continuously with colleagues both within R&CO and across the FCA to deliver these projects
The chance to work at the centre of the FCA and gain a unique overview of all the major priorities
Experience of a thought-provoking, interesting, and extremely wide-ranging workload


Our competitive flexible benefits scheme gives you the opportunity to create a personalised benefits package, tailored to suit your lifestyle. You can use this allowance to purchase additional benefits such as dental or cycle to work or you have the option top up your base salary by taking this as cash.‚ÄØ

‚ÄØ

Core benefits that you will receive as standard are:‚ÄØ


25 days holiday per year plus bank holidays
Private healthcare with Bupa‚ÄØ
A non-contributory Pension of at least 8% of basic salary each month (there are several contribution levels that increase depending on your age ‚Äì up to 12% a month once you reach age 35)‚ÄØ
Life assurance of eight times your basic salary‚ÄØ
Income protection‚ÄØ


‚ÄØ

We support hybrid working which means you will be able to work from home up to 60% of the time over a month with the remainder of your time in one of our three office locations.‚ÄØ

The Skills And Experience You Will Have‚ÄØ

Minimum‚ÄØ‚ÄØ

We are a signatory to the Government‚Äôs Disability Confident scheme. This means that we will offer an interview to disabled candidates entering under the scheme, who best meet the minimum criteria for a role.‚ÄØ


Experience in delivering data projects end to end (including managing project timelines etc)
Excellent analytics skills - ‚Äì proven ability to evaluate information, including patterns and trends, in order to inform decisions


Essential


Strong communication skills, and commitment to perform to high standards
Proven ability to consider situations and use problem-solving to make informed recommendations and judgements
Ability to steer projects and be comfortable taking responsibility for actions
A flexible approach to ways of working and the ability to work in a changing environment including delivering at pace to tight deadlines
The professional credibility and gravitas to be able to deal with a broad spectrum of stakeholders
Demonstrable visualisation skills such as tableau desktop and server experience in a business context
Advanced knowledge of data extraction and transformation
Team player who displays strong team spirit and is able to work well with others to achieve goals


About The FCA‚ÄØ‚ÄØ

The FCA regulates the conduct of 50,000 firms in the UK to ensure our financial markets are honest, fair and competitive. We do this to make sure markets work well for individuals, businesses and the economy as a whole. For more information on what we do, our three-year strategy can be found here.‚ÄØ

The FCA's Values & Diversity

Our ambition is to cultivate a culture of inclusion for all employees that respects their individual strengths, views, and experiences. We believe that our differences and similarities enable us to be a better organisation ‚Äì one that makes better decisions, drives innovation, and delivers better regulation.‚ÄØ

The FCA is committed to achieving greater diversity across all levels of the organisations. Given this, we particularly welcome applications from women, disabled and minority ethnic candidates for our Senior Associate role.‚ÄØ‚ÄØ

Flexible working

We welcome applications from candidates who are looking for flexible arrangements.‚ÄØMany of our staff work flexibly including working part-time, staggered hours, and job shares.‚ÄØWe can‚Äôt promise to give you exactly what you want but we won‚Äôt judge you for asking.‚ÄØ

Multi-location

As part of the FCA‚Äôs on-going commitment to develop our national presence, most of our vacancies are now open to working in our Edinburgh, Leeds, or London offices.‚ÄØ This means that as part of the application process you will be able to select your preference of which office location you would like to work from.‚ÄØ‚ÄØ

Useful information


Applications for this role close at 23.59 on 19th September 2024
This role is graded as Senior Associate - Regulatory


Got a question?‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ

If you are interested in learning more about the role, please contact:‚ÄØ

For internal applicants, please contact Louise Nash at Louise.Nash@fca.org.uk

For external applicants, please contact Aaron Ward at Aaron.Ward@fca.org.uk

What To Expect From Our Interview Process

If your application is successful, you will be invited to complete a competency based interview.

Application support

We want to remove any possible barriers and are committed to providing a wide range of reasonable adjustments so that you can keep the focus on your conversations and be at your best.

If you have an accessibility requirement, disability, or condition that means you might require changes to the recruitment process, please contact your recruiter to discuss this further. Our aim is to make your application as easy and comfortable as possible, and your recruiter will be happy to work with you to make any necessary arrangements where possible.

Please note that all applications must be submitted through our online portal, applications sent via email will not be accepted.‚ÄØ
Show more

The FCA is committed to achieving greater diversity across all levels of the organisations. Given this, we particularly welcome applications from women, disabled and minority ethnic candidates for our Senior Associate role.‚ÄØ‚ÄØ

Flexible working

We welcome applications from candidates who are looking for flexible arrangements.‚ÄØMany of our staff work flexibly including working part-time, staggered hours, and job shares.‚ÄØWe can‚Äôt promise to give you exactly what you want but we won‚Äôt judge you for asking.‚ÄØ

Multi-location

As part of the FCA‚Äôs on-going commitment to develop our national presence, most of our vacancies are now open to working in our Edinburgh, Leeds, or London offices.‚ÄØ This means that as part of the application process you will be able to select your preference of which office location you would like to work from.‚ÄØ‚ÄØ

Useful information

  • Applications for this role close at 23.59 on 19th September 2024
  • This role is graded as Senior Associate - Regulatory

Got a question?‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ

If you are interested in learning more about the role, please contact:‚ÄØ

For internal applicants, please contact Louise Nash at Louise.Nash@fca.org.uk

For external applicants, please contact Aaron Ward at Aaron.Ward@fca.org.uk

What To Expect From Our Interview Process

If your application is successful, you will be invited to complete a competency based interview.

Application support

We want to remove any possible barriers and are committed to providing a wide range of reasonable adjustments so that you can keep the focus on your conversations and be at your best.

If you have an accessibility requirement, disability, or condition that means you might require changes to the recruitment process, please contact your recruiter to discuss this further. Our aim is to make your application as easy and comfortable as possible, and your recruiter will be happy to work with you to make any necessary arrangements where possible.

Please note that all applications must be submitted through our online portal, applications sent via email will not be accepted.‚ÄØ

Title: Business Intelligence Developer - Utilities
Description:
Our client, a leading commercial energy supplier in the UK, seeks a Business Intelligence Analyst to join their IT team near Leeds. The successful candidate will champion Power BI use across the business, delivering next-generation reports and insights with cross-functional teams. This role offers a chance to significantly impact business performance and strategic decision-making.




Excellent company with a great name in the market, who are continuously evolving.




Data Integration and Transformation

Develop and manage advanced BI solutions using Power BI and Fabric.
Perform ETL processes to integrate data from various sources.




Report and Dashboard Development

Design and create interactive dashboards and reports in Power BI.
Translate business requirements into technical specifications.




Data Modeling and Analysis

Build efficient data models and schemas.
Conduct complex data analysis to uncover trends and insights.




Collaboration and Communication

Partner with business analysts and stakeholders to understand objectives.
Provide training and support to end-users on Power BI.




Performance Optimization

Optimize dashboards and reports for performance and scalability.
Implement data management and governance best practices.




Technical Documentation

Maintain comprehensive documentation for BI solutions.
Ensure accessibility of documentation for relevant stakeholders.




Troubleshooting and Support

Monitor and troubleshoot BI solutions for accuracy and reliability.
Resolve technical issues and user queries promptly.




Innovation and Improvement

Stay updated on the latest BI technologies and trends.
Continuously enhance BI processes and solutions.




The Individual Should Have Experience in the Following:

Proficiency in Power BI, DAX, and Power Query.
Experience with Fabric or similar platforms.
Strong SQL skills and familiarity with ETL processes.




Analytical Skills

Excellent analytical and problem-solving abilities.
Capable of deriving actionable insights from complex data sets.




Communication and Collaboration

Strong written and verbal communication skills.
Experience translating business requirements into technical solutions.




Project Management

Ability to manage workloads and prioritize tasks effectively.
Experience with Agile methodologies is a plus.




Educational Background

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, IT, Data Science, or related field.
Relevant certifications in Power BI or data analytics are advantageous.




Professional Experience

Minimum of 5 years in a similar BI role.
Proven track record of deploying BI solutions.
Experience in the UK Energy Supply or Utilities industry is a plus.

Title: Data Centre Engineer
Description:
6 months initial contract

Inside IR35

Onsite - Wakefield

We are seeking a skilled and detail-oriented Data Centre Engineer to join our IT Infrastructure team. The successful candidate will be responsible for managing the physical aspects of our data centre, including the decommissioning and removal of unused equipment ("demising kit") to optimize space, power, and cooling. Additionally, this role will involve updating and maintaining documentation, such as asset management records, floor plans, and capacity planning documents.

This is a hands-on role that requires technical expertise, meticulous organizational skills, and a proactive approach to managing data centre resources. All work to be carried out in person on-site (South Yorkshire and Wakefield, UK).

Duties And Responsibilities

Demising and Space Optimization:


Identify and decommission obsolete or unused hardware (servers, network devices, etc.) to free up space, reduce power consumption, and improve cooling efficiency.
Coordinate the safe and efficient removal of decommissioned equipment, ensuring proper disposal or recycling in accordance with company policies and environmental regulations.
Assess and reorganize existing infrastructure to maximize space utilization within the data centre.


Documentation and Inventory Management:


Update and maintain accurate records of all data centre assets, including equipment location, status, and configuration details.
Ensure that all changes to the data centre environment, including equipment additions, removals, and relocations, are accurately reflected in documentation such as floor plans and asset management systems.
Assist in maintaining and improving documentation standards and processes.


Capacity Planning and Monitoring:


Assist in the monitoring of power, cooling, and space utilization to ensure optimal data centre performance and to anticipate future needs.
Collaborate with the IT Infrastructure team to plan for future capacity requirements, including new deployments and upgrades.


Compliance and Best Practices:


Ensure that all work within the data centre adheres to company policies, industry standards, and regulatory requirements.
Implement and follow best practices for data centre operations, including cable management, equipment labeling, and environmental monitoring.


Collaboration and Support:


Work closely with network, server, and storage teams to support their needs within the data centre, including provisioning of space and power.
Provide hands-on support for equipment installations, moves, and troubleshooting as needed.
Assist with audits and inspections to ensure the data centre remains compliant with all relevant standards and regulations.


Experience Requirements


Minimum 5 years of experience in data centre operations role, with hands-on experience in equipment decommissioning, space optimization, and infrastructure documentation.
Familiarity with data centre infrastructure management (DCIM) tools and asset management software.
Experience with physical network and server hardware, including installation, cabling, and troubleshooting.
Experience creating run book documentation.


Skills and Competencies:


Strong organizational skills with a meticulous attention to detail.
Ability to work independently and manage multiple tasks and projects simultaneously.
Proficient in reading and updating technical documentation, including floor plans and network diagrams.
Knowledge of data centre best practices, including power and cooling management, cable management, and environmental monitoring.
Strong communication skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams.
Project Management experience
Good understanding of lab testing best practices
Automation tools experience
Show more

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
DWP. Digital with Purpose.




Do you want to utilise best-in-class technologies to deliver data products?
Are you looking for ongoing professional development while designing and building modern cloud-based data products?




DWP is the UK's largest government department. We help people into work and make payments worth over ¬£195bn a year to support some of the most vulnerable people in our society.




We're carrying out a once-in-a-generation digital transformation of DWP product and services, used by millions of people.




If you are looking to develop your skills, work on some of the most challenging and rewarding IT projects, shape solutions and contribute to new thinking, all with a great work life balance, we would love to hear from you.




Required skills and experience:




Enterprise-level experience of SQL, Shell/BASH, Linux and command line
Enterprise-level experience in developing and enhancing efficient, scalable, automated ETL/ELT pipelines including error handling, re-start and data quality
Experience of translating technical concepts into non-technical language
You understand how to communicate with internal and external stakeholders and can change your style of communication to suit technical and non-technical audiences




Data with Power.




You'll join our Integrated Risk and Intelligence Service (IRIS) team which is a collaboration between DWP Digital, Counter Fraud, Compliance and Debt and Cyber Resilience Centre.




Our agile IRIS team is central to DWP's Fraud and Error Strategy and is radically transforming how we detect and prevent fraud and error in the welfare system.




You'll play a vital role in delivering innovative and insightful data products, and work across the data engineering lifecycle.




Integrating a variety of source data, you'll use your judgement to figure out the best approach, so that appropriate data quality, integrity and alerting is built into all our solutions.




You will conduct proof of concept and discovery work and evaluating proposed changes that might impact data performance, models or reports.




You'll also have chance to pass on your skills. You'll coach and mentor more junior colleagues, helping to build data engineering knowledge and capability within the team.




Working closely with stakeholders to develop and maintain robust data products and services, our team support the continuous improvement of data engineering standards and engage with stakeholders at all stages of the data engineering lifecycle.




Your main responsibilities will include:




Reviewing and transforming business requirements into reusable, production-ready code
Integrating a variety of source data, using judgement and guidance to determine the appropriate approach
Conducting proof of concept and discovery work to provide information and advice
Playing an active role in code development activities for delivery of data transformation products
Developing automated data ingest routines, workflows and mappings for structured and unstructured data
Completing design specifications and technical documentation




Details. Wages. Perks.




Location: You'll join us based at one of our brilliant digital hubs in either Birmingham, Blackpool, Leeds, London, Manchester, Newcastle or Sheffield




Hybrid working: We operate a hybrid working model with a mix of home working and some time in the office.




Pay: In return for your skills, we offer pay up to ¬£58,347. This is comprised of salary up to ¬£43,347 (¬£47,986 in London) and a Digital Allowance of up to ¬£15,000 per annum available for exceptional candidates.




Pension: You'll be eligible for a brilliant civil service pension with employer contributions worth 28.97% (worth up to ¬£12,557 a year).




Holidays: You'll get a generous leave package starting at 26 days, plus all the usual bank holidays, and the option to take extra days off on flexi leave.




We also have a broad benefits package built around your work-life balance which includes:




Flexible working, flexi hours and flexi days
Hybrid working: some time in a hub with the team, some time at home
Family-friendly policies
Time off volunteering and charitable giving
Bring your authentic self to work with 'I Can Be Me in DWP'
Discounts and savings on shopping, fun days out and more
Interest-free loans to buy a bike or a season ticket
Sports and social activities
Working in an award-winning environment and culture
Professional development, coaching, mentoring and career progression opportunities




Click 'Apply' for more information and to start an application on Civil Service Jobs.




Please note, this role requires you to pass Security Check clearance

Title: Staff Data Engineer
Description:
Job Title

Staff Data Engineer

Location

Asda House

Employment Type

Full time

Contract Type

Permanent

Hours Per Week

37.5

Salary

Competitive salary plus benefits

Category

Software Engineering

Closing Date

26 September 2024

‚ÄúEverything about Asda‚Äù

We are a values-led organisation. As such we encourage everyone to be open and honest. We work creatively and collaboratively, valuing everyone‚Äôs input.

Our collaborative culture, the size of our business and our belief in the empowerment of the individual means opportunities at Asda are abundant.

We conduct ¬£300m worth of transactions every week. Our website handles over 2 million transactions a month. We have more than 145,000 dedicated Asda colleagues ensuring that our customers are at the heart of everything we do.

‚ÄúEverything you‚Äôll love‚Äù


Minimum 24 days annual leave per year plus 8 bank holidays ‚Äì Making sure you take time for your self and switch off
4 weekly pay ‚Äì which means you get an extra payday a year
Digital GP and Wellbeing sessions ‚Äì Asda genuinely cares so we create a culture where our people can perform at their best, the physical health and mental wellbeing of all our people is very important to us
Discount off your shopping at Asda and George - with extra discounts running throughout the year ‚Äì really makes a difference, saving the colleagues an average of ¬£700 a year
Career development and apprenticeship and graduate schemes - we want our colleagues to excel and grow with our business. (Link to grad scheme on Asda page)
Free city centre parking ‚Äì you can also use it outside working hours


Plus, much more!

‚ÄúThat‚Äôs more like it‚Äù

LS Eleven is a new Asda division dedicated to the Asda Rewards Digital Loyalty Program, Asda Media Partnerships, Asda Money & Mobile, and Asda Group customer decision science. We are looking for a talented engineer to play a leading role in developing the data products which sit at the heart of Asda‚Äôs commercial and data strategies. Leveraging your hands-on coding skills as well as your leadership skills, you‚Äôll be an expert individual contributor while managing and developing a small squad of BI engineers. Most importantly, working closely with the Data Product Lead, you will shape the technical strategy for engineering in LS Eleven.

As The LS Eleven Staff Data Engineer, You Will


Develop and implement the technical strategy and vision across the engineering squads and beyond (including how to operationalise products created by our data science colleagues)
Design the data architecture for the data products, and collaborate with platform colleagues to design related solution architecture for activation use cases (e.g. integrating products with systems such as the Rewards app CMS)
Collaborate with data science colleagues to turn ML into scaled, customer-impacting, solutions
Ensure consistent standards, patterns, and technical processes across the development squads
Create tools and processes for financial and performance optimisation
Act as Subject Matter Expert for Databricks and Azure, staying on top of new features and trends, implementing them into the data products, and coaching the development teams
Line manage a small team of BI Engineers, ensuring consistent quality
Mentor and develop the lead engineers and data engineers
Find and implement technical ways to increase simplicity and efficiency, including by creating common data models
Develop strong relationships with upstream technology teams and downstream data science and business consumers, ensuring that our data products are developed according to the needs of the business


About You

We want all colleagues to be able to bring their best and true selves to work, every day. Simply put, we want our colleagues to be Proud to be Asda and proud to be themselves.

Essential


Educated to degree level, ideally in a relevant STEM discipline.
Passion for all corners of data engineering: whether it‚Äôs designing a data model, creating a CI/CD pipeline, optimising code, serving a model, or connecting our products to customer-impacting systems, you‚Äôre interested in getting the job done.
Desire to be a hands-on contributor, a people manager, and a strategic thinker.
You know what you don‚Äôt know, and you‚Äôre able to become an expert in something quickly.
Experience leading or mentoring a high performing team.
Significant experience as a data engineer, building productionised big data products in the cloud.
Excellent PySpark, Databricks, and SQL skills.
Ability to influence cross-functional, geographically distributed teams.
Experience working in an agile product development environment.
Excellent problem-solving, communication, and interpersonal skills.
Strategic and analytical thinker .
Excellent initiative and ability to flourish in an open-ended role.


Desirable


Experience with ML-related data products such as feature stores, and experience operationalising ML.
Significant experience with data modeling.
Extensive Microsoft Azure experience.
Experience with Databricks Asset Bundles.
Experience in, and understanding of, retail, data-driven personalisation, retail media, and loyalty programs.
Strong understanding of data science concepts.
Experience with infrastructure as code.
Experience with AI tooling such as Databricks Genie Rooms.


Work Where it Works

Our hybrid way of working gives you the choice to work where it works.‚ÄØ This enables you to‚ÄØchose‚ÄØwhere you‚Äôll be the most effective.‚ÄØ It offers a mix of working from home and in an office environment that works best for you and your team.‚ÄØ

You will also get an excellent benefits package including; -


Discretionary company bonus
¬£5,700 company car or car allowance
Company pension up to 7% matched
10% colleague discount, free parking and many additional rewards.


We want all colleagues to be able to bring their best and true selves to work, every day. Simply put, we want our colleagues to be Proud to be Asda and proud to be themselves

  • Line manage a small team of BI Engineers, ensuring consistent quality
  • Mentor and develop the lead engineers and data engineers
  • Find and implement technical ways to increase simplicity and efficiency, including by creating common data models
  • Develop strong relationships with upstream technology teams and downstream data science and business consumers, ensuring that our data products are developed according to the needs of the business

About You

We want all colleagues to be able to bring their best and true selves to work, every day. Simply put, we want our colleagues to be Proud to be Asda and proud to be themselves.

Essential

  • Educated to degree level, ideally in a relevant STEM discipline.
  • Passion for all corners of data engineering: whether it‚Äôs designing a data model, creating a CI/CD pipeline, optimising code, serving a model, or connecting our products to customer-impacting systems, you‚Äôre interested in getting the job done.
  • Desire to be a hands-on contributor, a people manager, and a strategic thinker.
  • You know what you don‚Äôt know, and you‚Äôre able to become an expert in something quickly.
  • Experience leading or mentoring a high performing team.
  • Significant experience as a data engineer, building productionised big data products in the cloud.
  • Excellent PySpark, Databricks, and SQL skills.
  • Ability to influence cross-functional, geographically distributed teams.
  • Experience working in an agile product development environment.
  • Excellent problem-solving, communication, and interpersonal skills.
  • Strategic and analytical thinker .
  • Excellent initiative and ability to flourish in an open-ended role.

Desirable

  • Experience with ML-related data products such as feature stores, and experience operationalising ML.
  • Significant experience with data modeling.
  • Extensive Microsoft Azure experience.
  • Experience with Databricks Asset Bundles.
  • Experience in, and understanding of, retail, data-driven personalisation, retail media, and loyalty programs.
  • Strong understanding of data science concepts.
  • Experience with infrastructure as code.
  • Experience with AI tooling such as Databricks Genie Rooms.

Work Where it Works

Our hybrid way of working gives you the choice to work where it works.‚ÄØ This enables you to‚ÄØchose‚ÄØwhere you‚Äôll be the most effective.‚ÄØ It offers a mix of working from home and in an office environment that works best for you and your team.‚ÄØ

You will also get an excellent benefits package including; -

  • Discretionary company bonus
  • ¬£5,700 company car or car allowance
  • Company pension up to 7% matched
  • 10% colleague discount, free parking and many additional rewards.

We want all colleagues to be able to bring their best and true selves to work, every day. Simply put, we want our colleagues to be Proud to be Asda and proud to be themselves

Title: Trainee Web Developer - No Experience Required
Description:
Are you looking to kick-start a new career as a web developer?

We are recruiting for companies who are looking to employ our Coding Traineeship graduates to keep up with their growth. The best part is you will not need any previous experience as full training will be provided. You will also have the reassurance of a job guarantee (¬£25K-¬£45K) within 20 miles of your location upon completion.

Whether you are working full time, part-time or unemployed, this package has the flexibility to be completed at a pace that suits you.

The traineeship is completed in 3 easy steps.

Step 1 - Front End Coding

Complete a selection of professional and industry-recognised coding courses covering HTML, CSS and Javascript.

Step 2 - Back End Coding + Practical Projects

You will be studying all the relevant back end coding languages and gaining skills that will qualify you as a fully-fledged web developer. Step 2 is heavily focused on the practical element of learning.

Step 3 - Building your portfolio

The final step will be to build your own portfolio website. The portfolio plays a key part in the hiring process as it gives the employer a real insight into your level of ability, creativity and personality.

Your Web Developer Role

Once you have completed all of the mandatory training, we will place you into a Web Development/Software Development role, where you will be guaranteed a 25k-40k salary. We have partnered with a number of large organisations strategically located throughout the UK, providing a nationwide reach of jobs for our candidates.

At a one off cost of ¬£1499, or a deposit of ¬£212 followed by 10 interest free monthly instalments of ¬£148, this represents a great opportunity to start a rewarding career in IT and have a real career ladder to start climbing. If you are not offered a role at the end of the training we will refund 100% of your course fees.

Apply now and one of our friendly advisors will be in touch.
Show more

Title: Solution Deployment Team Lead
Description:
Company Description

Rotork is a globally recognised market-leading company specialising in flow control and instrumentation. We help our customers manage the flow of liquids, gases, and powders across various industries worldwide.

Our purpose is Keeping the World Flowing for Future Generations.

For over sixty years, the world has relied on us to create the innovative solutions that keep everything moving. From oil and gas to water and shipping, pharmaceuticals and food- our products and services underpin the essential flows that drive our modern world.

Today we're respected and admired for our people, performance and products. Our success flows from our unwavering commitment to engineering excellence, which we pursue, safely and sustainably.

Rotork is currently undergoing an exciting period of change and growth, building on our existing market success. Joining us now means becoming a part of shaping the future of our business and making a tangible impact.

Job Description

Solution Deployment Team Lead - 18 month Fixed Term Contract

Join our dynamic and specialized team in a key role that will truly make a difference. As part of this team, you will be at the forefront of implementing one of the largest MS Dynamics 365 ERP and CRM rollouts globally. You and your team will be responsible for all Engineering aspects of the rollout to each global site.

Working closely with the Engineering teams globally, you will be giving guidance and assisting them through each phase of the project, through assessment, preparation and ultimately going live with the new system. You will be reporting project progress upstream and downstream to ensure alignment between the Program and site-based teams.

In this influential role you will lead the way by overseeing day-to-day team management, setting clear objectives, allocating tasks and providing technical guidance. Your expertise will be instrumental in supporting the development of project plans to influence timescales and meet stakeholder specifications. You will have ownership over site requirements, ensuring our solutions make a lasting impact on our organisation.

This role is perfect for an enthusiastic individual who relishes the opportunity of mentoring and coaching others and can balance between the short-term focus on results with long term interests aligning business goals seamlessly.

Join us in this exhilarating opportunity, where you can make a difference, inspire others, and contribute to the overall success of our business.

Responsibilities


Technical leadership for your specific domain of competence ensuring best practice is set and adhered to
Day to day team management responsibility including setting objectives, task allocation and technical guidance
Support development of project plans to influence project timescales
Present analysis results and project solutions to key stakeholders such as senior leaders and internal customers as necessary
Development and preparation of technical records and reports as may be necessary to demonstrate compliance with associated specification and any relevant standards
Provision of technical support to key internal and external stakeholders as required
Communicating project status to key stakeholders on a frequent basis
Collecting and reviewing project risks and issues and creating action and mitigation plans accordingly
Reviewing RAID logs and escalating as required
Coordinate project activities across multiple sites at different stages of deployment within your team
Continuous improvement of internal processes and procedures


Qualifications


Essential experience working as a Data Analyst or Business Data Analyst.
Essential experience in Microsoft Office platforms.
Preferable experience in Microsoft Dynamics 365 and PLM system(s).
Preferable higher level education or relevant experience, in an engineering or science discipline preferable.
Willingness to travel
Show more

Title: SAP Production Planner (Super User ECC 6.0 / HANA)
Description:
Due to continued business growth, we are looking to recruit an experienced SAP Superuser for a leading client based near Keighley.

As part of this role, the successful candidate will split their time equally between supporting the planning function within SAP and ongoing development of the SAP Systems and Master Data.

Suited candidates must have in depth experience using SAP ECC 6.0 with a strong interest in developing systems for the benefit of the wider business. You must also have demonstrable experience working within a Manufacturing/ Engineering environment.

This role presents the opportunity to join a leading global business who are in a continued period of growth.

Hours -Monday to Thursday- 07:45-16:00/ Friday- 07:45-15:30 (Flexitime available)

Scope Of The Role

The SAP (Super User) Production Planner will be responsible for the following:

The Production Planner will play a pivotal role in enhancing production efficiency, minimizing delays, and ensuring effective collaboration with machine shop planning.

Planning and scheduling all manufactured parts through SAP, to fulfil machine assembly, aftermarket, spares and subcontract requirements to satisfy the needs of the business

Provide critical planning and scheduling support to the frontline Production team

Main Duties And Responsibilities


Utilise SAP to extract and analyse live data, developing & continually improving the Sales & Operations Planning (S&OP) reports that drive crucial operational KPIs, ensuring alignment with business objectives to facilitate key stakeholder decision making.
Leverage advanced Excel skills to analyse complex datasets and create clear, comprehensive reports and dashboards, ensuring data is presented in an accessible format for stakeholders across the business.
Continually monitor SAP (work in progress) transactional data to ensure aligns with company schedule requirements and production commitments.
Generating Production plans using SAP/EXCEL on a rolling weekly cycle
Support day to day planning activities of materials, conversion of planned orders, processing resources, kitting to optimise operational efficiencies.
Manage, maintain & develop Master Data and the SAP Planning module collaborating with the FLL SAP Analyst to continually drive improvements.
Assist in achieving accurate finite capacity planning by machine in collaboration with the Machine Shop.
Coordinate multiple actions to Production order variances to maintain cost control
Provide up to date completion dates to key stakeholders for all orders
Coordinate overcapacity (bottlenecks) through rephasing requirements in conjunction with all stakeholders
Organise Production orders and manage the system exception messages to prioritise and monitor orders from creation to completion
Support the wider business needs in conjunction with the FLL SAP Analyst as a SAP Super User to continue critical development ahead of SAP improvement projects. Further career development opportunities available to the successful candidate.
Interpret resource/manning plans to use as an input into the Production schedule
Interrogating material masters, engineering change process, routing, production planning tools and stores transactions
Understand, and work at all times in line with Fives Values and Directives; specifically following the highest standards of health and safety.


Key Skills Requirements


Super User of SAP ECC 6.0 and/or HANA, specialising in Production Planning (PP), with ideally some experience in Project Systems (PS).
Advanced Excel Skills: Expertise in using Excel for data analysis, including proficiency with formulas, pivot tables, VLOOKUP, and data visualization tools such as charts and graphs.
Data Analysis: Strong analytical skills to interpret complex data, identify trends, that allow operational stakeholders to make successful data-driven decisions.
Attention to Detail: Precision in managing and analysing data to ensure accuracy and reliability of reports.
Communication Skills: Ability to clearly and effectively communicate complex data insights and reports to various stakeholders in an understandable format.
Problem-Solving Skills: Aptitude for identifying issues and developing effective solutions within the planning and reporting processes.
Organisational Skills: Strong ability to manage multiple tasks and projects simultaneously, ensuring timely and accurate delivery of reports.
Knowledge of S&OP Processes: Understanding of Sales & Operations Planning processes and how they can be effectively & efficiently reported to the wider business.
Critical Thinking: Ability to evaluate and improve current processes and systems for better efficiency and effectiveness.
Collaboration: Capability to work collaboratively with cross-functional teams to gather necessary data and insights for reporting.
Ability to work alone or part of a team
Show more

Title: Digital Business Analyst
Description:
Our purpose is to positively impact people‚Äôs lives every day in every home around the world! We work very hard to provide our consumers with high-quality, exciting 5-star products that make life easier. We thrive on passion and innovation and are looking for great people, with great ideas, who want to build the next big thing and develop while they do.

The Digital Business Analyst is an exciting role that will help to shape the digital future for our D2C customers.

You are pivotal in gathering and owning project requirements from end to end. You will be part of the Digital Delivery team and work closely with other professionals to build and contribute to an aggressive digital transformation across a wide-range of large-scale ecommerce systems.

A strong eye on innovation and detail -- always looking for the latest & greatest technical solutions available -- will serve you well in this role. As will your top-notch documentation and client facing skills.

Here are some of the exciting things you will get to do:


Evaluate and document business requirements from idea inception through to launch and beyond
Review and understand customer journeys and processes in order to recommend efficiencies.
Work with all stakeholders to generate and action in-depth Discovery Programmes, from the initial research, conducting the sessions, and drafting the output from them.
Work with technical third parties to ensure most effective ways of working ‚Äì including prioritisation of requirements, sprint planning, NFRs, DoR / DoD
Own the relationship with clients & internal stakeholders.
Understand the wider customer, business, and stakeholder priorities.
Be the link, the bridge, the translator! between tech and business stakeholders
Develop and execute data-driven strategies to drive growth and improve customer experience.
Analyse work delivered by technical teams for accuracy and effectiveness to ensure continuous improvement of development pipeline
Conduct research and analysis to gather insights into industry trends, customer behaviour, and competition.
Own and maintain backlog of small change which will include new requests, improvements, and tech debt.
Support the growth of the Delivery Team and BA function within that team


A bit about you:


A self-starter who is passionate about doing a good job
You are inquisitive in nature ‚Äì always asking ‚Äúwhy‚Äù and challenging the status quo
Obsessed about the details while simultaneously considering bigger picture
Able to work under a certain level of ambiguity at times
You‚Äôre an excellent communicator, both verbal and written, and are able to tailor your style to suit a diverse audience
Your analytic mindset supports your ability to critically assess complex problems
You are relentless, and rarely satisfied ‚Äì always striving for better!
Able to keep a cool head under pressure when deadlines are approaching


Here are some of the things your will bring:


5+ years experience as Business Analyst or Product Owner specialising in eCommerce
Expert level writing of Functional Specification (FSD / FRD)/ Business Requirement (BRD) Documents or user stories
Demonstrable experience of workshop facilitation
Experience supporting the full delivery lifecycle as a Business Analyst including business case support, project initiation, requirement capture, scope and change management, development support, UAT, hypercare and benefit realisation
CMS solutions
Comfortable comprehension of complex enterprise System Architecture diagrams
Comfortable with Technical Roadmap creation and maintenance
Comfortable with Process Modelling creation
Practical experience with Agile Methodologies and large-scale Delivery Management
3rd Party management

Review and understand customer journeys and processes in order to recommend efficiencies.
Work with all stakeholders to generate and action in-depth Discovery Programmes, from the initial research, conducting the sessions, and drafting the output from them.
Work with technical third parties to ensure most effective ways of working ‚Äì including prioritisation of requirements, sprint planning, NFRs, DoR / DoD
Own the relationship with clients & internal stakeholders.
Understand the wider customer, business, and stakeholder priorities.

Support the growth of the Delivery Team and BA function within that team

We support ALL associates in bringing their authentic selves to work, making an impact, and having the opportunity for career acceleration. With help from our leadership, associates, and our community, we aim to have equity be a key component of the SharkNinja DNA.

Lead us to be ‚ÄúRARELY SATISFIED‚Äù
Make things better each day; ‚ÄúPROGRESS OVER PERFECTION‚Äù
